Title: Director of HRIS & Analytics
Description: The Director of HRIS & Analytics will build upon our current use of Workday by understanding company and People team objectives to develop a roadmap that builds…
Descriptions:
The Director of HRIS & Analytics is a vital member of the People team, leading the development and implementation of our HRIS and Analytics strategy. The Director of HRIS & Analytics will build upon our current use of Workday by understanding company and People team objectives to develop a roadmap that builds out the features needed for effective and efficient people processes. The person in this role will lead the HRIS team to execute on the strategy and roadmap while setting up their stakeholders for success. The ideal candidate loves to build, thrives in ambiguity, is flexible and adaptable to change, moves quickly, and can demonstrate strong communication skills to deliver messages across a range of stakeholders. This is an opportunity to join an HR organization in expansion and to meaningfully grow the impact of HR technology at Collectors.
This role reports to the Head of Total Rewards, HRIS & Analytics and can be located at our Headquarters in Santa Ana, California, in Jersey City, New Jersey, or remote.
What You'll Do
Develop and implement a comprehensive HR technology strategy that aligns with Collectors' objectives
Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of Workday modules as well as any new HR technologies that may be needed, ensuring data integrity, security, and accessibility
Ensure that HRIS systems support People processes and enable efficient and effective People operations
Develop and maintain reporting capabilities to support data-driven decision making
Develop and maintain People dashboards that provide visibility into People metrics
Provide guidance and support to People team leaders on People data
Partner with corporate IT and other stakeholders to ensure that HR technology is integrated with other systems and applications
Lead and manage the HRIS team, providing direction, coaching, and feedback to ensure high quality work and continuous improvement
Who You Are
10+ years of experience focused on HRIS
Strong experience building and managing HRIS project roadmaps
Excellent understanding of Workday with a point of view on how to leverage the system to meet organizational goals
Experience effectively managing teams. Plays to win while bringing out the best in everyone.
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and multitask or re-prioritize as needed in a fast-paced environment
Nice to have global experience
Salary Range: The salary range for this position is $170,000 - $230,000. Actual compensation on this range varies based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including location, job level, experience, and skill set.

Collectors may use e-verify to validate your ability to work legally in the United States.
We are aware that there are instances where individuals are receiving job offers that fraudulently allege to be from Collectors or one of our business units. This type of fraud can be carried out through false websites, through fake e-mails claiming to be from the company or through social media. We never ask for personal information such as your bank account, Social Security numbers or National IDs, nor do we send or request payments for the purchase of business-related equipment. If you suspect fraud, please reach out to jobs@collectors.com.
About Collectors
Collectors is the leading provider of value-added services to the collectible's markets. We authenticate and grade collectible coins, trading cards, video games, event tickets, autographs, and memorabilia through our subsidiaries, which include Professional Sports Authenticators (PSA), Professional Coin Grading Services (PCGS), Certified Coin Exchange (CCE), Wata, Card Ladder, Collectors Corner, Set Registry, Collectors.com, and the Long Beach Expo collectibles trade show. Since our founding in 1986, we have graded and authenticated more than 80 million items. We employ over 1,000 people across our Santa Ana, CA headquarters, New Jersey, Seattle, Hong Kong, Paris, Shanghai and Tokyo. For more information, visit http://www.collectors.com.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We believe that a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills will better service the diverse community of collectors we support.
If you require an accommodation to apply or interview with us due to a disability or special need, please email people@collectors.com.
If you are based in California, you can read information for California residents by viewing the following link: https://www.collectorsuniverse.com/ccpa

Title: Director of Observability
Description:
Paramount+ seeks a director of engineering in observability for online television and media focused web properties.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Descriptions:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.
Overview & Responsibilities
Brand Overview
Are you an engineer interested in new media, social activities and television? Paramount+ is developing the next generation of multimedia and cross-platform entertainment! The team at Paramount+ values software which exemplifies simplicity of design, maintainability and foundational robustness. Role Details

Paramount+ seeks a director of engineering in observability for online television and media focused web properties. In this role, you will support our diverse infrastructure and kubernetes platform that serves our streaming products within the cloud. This is a great opportunity for a seasoned leader to manage a wide range of existing technology with an opportunity to improve observability, scalability and reliability of our systems. You thrive on dashboards, observability, automation, self healing, performance, high availability & uptime. You love systems that are well run and enjoy creating systems that are reliable, documented and monitored across multiple metrics. You have experience with being on-call and thrive on ownership and systems Your Day-to-Day
Lead the design & implementation of our public Cloud infrastructure including observability,, provisioning, performance, capacity planning, sizing, and Infrastructure as code
Focus on leading performance technology stack
Build a sustainable and scalable monitoring and alerting process
Support our development teams across multiple environments in an AGILE environment
Build and manage infrastructure at large scale
Additional other duties and responsibilities, as assigned
Key Projects
Lead the build out of observability best-practices
Give the organization insight into as much as possible
Evaluate upcoming technologies and help decide build vs buy
Enhance existing monitoring, logging and alerting systems
Work with the executive staff and development teams to provide key insights
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
9+ years running logging, monitoring and alerting systems
5+ years of building, retaining and leading observability or engineering teams
3+ years using tools like Grafana, Prometheus, NewRelic, Datadog and similar tools
3+ years’ using logging tools like ELK, StackDriver etc.
Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects
Demonstrated ability to work with 3rd parties and collaborate on solutions
Additional Qualifications
Past experience working on public clouds like AWS or GCP
Scripting or Programming experience

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Hiring Salary Range: $156,000.00 - 220,000.00.

Other responsibilities include assisting in developing reports on alumni and volunteer demographics and working closely with colleagues working with the schools and colleges in capturing, tracking, and reporting alumni engagement and volunteer information.

Title: Director of Business Intelligence
Description:
The duties include the management of clinical integration, reporting and analytics.
The clinical program will continue to grow in the coming years through the…
Descriptions:
The Department of Medicine has 11 divisions, more than 300 employees and more than $68 million in expenditures annually. The mission of the Department of Medicine is to deliver accessible, patient-centered healthcare of the highest caliber while training compassionate, visionary and innovative clinicians and researchers. We develop, teach and practice state-of-the-art, evidenced-based medicine that holds the promise of a better future for the people of California and beyond. The Department has a diverse clinical operation with 11 subspecialties and clinic sites in Orange, Yorba Linda, Laguna Hills and Tustin. The clinical program will continue to grow in the coming years through the addition of the Center for Ambulatory Care and the Irvine Hospital.
Under the general direction of the Chief Administrative Officer in the Department of Medicine the Director of Business Intelligence is responsible for development and implementation of reporting tools to provide analytical support for the daily operations for the clinical operations unit in the Department of Medicine. The duties include the management of clinical integration, reporting and analytics. The Director of Business Intelligence plays a key role in the Department Senior Management team, which includes the Department Chair, CAO, CFO and Division Administrators and directly with CAO and CFO to develop and implement strategies to ensure efficient and effective clinical operations across a large department. The incumbent develops and recommends changes to departmental policies, procedures and guidelines for clinical operations and analytical support for strategic planning for the clinical operations in Orange and the new Hospital in Irvine as well as the Center for Ambulatory Care. Works with business and / or clinical units to understand and prioritize data and information requirements. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required / available data elements. Optimizes the performance of enterprise business intelligence tools by defining data to filter and index that add value to the user. Develops business cases to support department-wide business intelligence solutions. Supervises professionals providing direction and guidance on business intelligence solutions. Coordinates department workflow, sets priorities, and assesses processes. Provides input on personnel matters and recommends improvements to department practices.
Total Compensation:

In addition to the salary range listed below, we offer a wealth of benefits to make working at UCI even more rewarding. These benefits may include medical insurance, sick and vacation time, retirement savings plans, and access to a number of discounts and perks. Please utilize the links listed here to learn more about our compensation practices and benefits.
$95,300.00 - $185,500.00 (Annual Salary)

Required:
Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training.
Demonstrated ability to supervise professional staff, assign work and manage competing priorities. Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, concepts and methodologies. Knowledge of human resources practices and policies. Ability to monitor, address and document personnel and performance issues. Ability to analyze information, think conceptually and formulate effective solutions. Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to convey technical information in a clear, concise manner. Advanced interpersonal skills to collaborate with clinical and technical professionals and business leaders. Demonstrated ability to work effectively with senior management on operational and policy issues. Ability to deliver presentations to large and / or diverse audiences. Ability to train staff. Proficient in all MS Office applications, BI / database applications and reporting tools.

Title: Director, Business Intelligence
Description:
Deep expertise in various analytics and data engineering tools (Snowflake, Looker, Tableau etc.).
Evangelize, articulate, and enhance enterprise-wide analytics…
Descriptions:
Checkr's mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.
A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.
The Director, Business Intelligence is a technical and business leader that can demonstrate an ability to build relationships with the different business units across the organization and will thoroughly understand the business needs and opportunities required to achieve business goals in alignment with the corporate goals and priorities.
This key leadership role is within our Corporate Engineering organization and will report to the 'Head of Business Applications and Business Intelligence'. In addition, this role will partner very closely with Checkr's Financial Planning & Strategy, Data Engineering and cross-functional business teams to enable their success through technology and insights.
In this role, you will:
Evangelize, articulate, and enhance enterprise-wide analytics competency to help accelerate the use of data and insights to drive differentiated business value
Drive continuous improvement of data governance and management across the organization
Foster a data-driven culture of innovation throughout the company in partnership with the data organization in our R&D and other cross-functional groups.
Establish a culture of collaboration and excellence across business data, insights, and integration teams, ensuring both quality and velocity
Coach and mentor leaders and cross-functionally to grow and take on bigger responsibilities as the company scales
Ensure that the company's data foundation is scalable, performant, and secure, and can scale with the company's needs
Help create a thriving data community at Checkr of business intelligence and data team members
Serve as a role model for the company in representing Checkr's values and engineering values
Always Be Recruiting - attract the best leaders, data engineers, and architects in the world, grow our diverse team, and help it thrive by allowing everyone to bring their unique strengths to bear on the problems we solve
What you bring:
Successful track record of leading an impactful business intelligence and data organization
Experience engaging and communicating with executives / leadership
Ability to develop leaders and teams, to effectively partner and build thought leadership
Role model of cross-functional collaboration between business and technology teams to drive effective outcomes and business needs
Experience nurturing a work environment that allows everyone to bring their whole selves to work, and values diversity and inclusion, because that is where we know teams perform at their best
Deep expertise in various analytics and data engineering tools (Snowflake, Looker, Tableau etc.)
Experience identifying, defining, baselining, and tracking KPIs
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate
Ability to function well in a high-paced, dynamic and high growth environment
Bachelor's/Master's degree in engineering, management or related studies
What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend
One of Checkr's core values is Transparency. To live by that value, we've made the decision to disclose salary ranges in all of our job postings. We use geographic cost of labor as an input to develop ranges for our roles and as such, each location where we hire may have a different range. If this role is remote, we have listed the top to the bottom of the possible range, but we will specify the target range for an exact location when you are selected for a recruiting discussion. The salary range for this role is $146,136 to $304,175.
Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr
Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.
Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance.

The Director of Customer Experience will direct and oversee the organizations customer experience operations while managing and implementing customer experience policies to ensure that all staff strictly adhere to reach the highest customer satisfaction. Title: Senior Director of Business Intelligence
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA
Description: In this role, you will work closely with other members of the product and analytics leadership team, as well as with business units and departments across the…
Descriptions:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

Our Values

Member Safety: Our top priority is to build an authentic, equitable, and respectful community
Diversity: We strive to build a workplace that reflects the rich diversity of our members
Authenticity + Collaboration: We encourage authenticity to nurture a trustworthy, collaborative environment
Big Ideas: We champion and rally behind big ideas, empowering people to to think and act differently and to be unafraid of having a strong point of view
Innovation: We never stand still; we’re inspired to build for what’s next, and we must constantly innovate, experiment, and learn

This position can be located in Los Angeles or San Francisco, CA.

Tinder empowers users around the world to create new connections that otherwise might never have been possible! We build products that bring people together and are a small team focusing on individual responsibility and rapid development. We are looking for a Sr Director of BI to join our team. As a qualified candidate, you will be responsible for leading and coordinating the business intelligence efforts of Tinder. You have experience developing and implementing strategies for strategic and business performance, analysis, reporting, and translating business metrics to actions and strategy.

In this role, you will work closely with other members of the product and analytics leadership team, as well as with business units and departments across the organization, to ensure that BI is aligned with the overall goals and objectives of Tinder. Your key partners will be the analytics and finance team, but as need arises you may be required to hire BI specialists to support the business.
In this role, you will:
Understand and analyze the current business performance and trends daily.
Inform Tinder Exec and Product Leadership on current ecosystem health and subsequent business performance.
Lead ad hoc investigations as performance issues arise, coordinating multiple teams and departments to determine root causes and solutions.
Lead Product Strategic Planning by partnering with Strategic Insights, Finance, and Analytics to recommend strategic focus areas based on consumer engagement data and business performance insights.
Develop and implement strategies for data collection, analysis, and reporting on business and ecosystem health.
Work closely with the executive team and other stakeholders to ensure that BI is aligned with the overall goals and objectives of Tinder.
Automate reports and provide custom reporting and metrics according to key audiences within the business.
Grow and develop a small team, investing in career development through ongoing coaching, feedback, and training (future state).

You Have:

WORKING WITH AEVEX
Becoming part of the AEVEX Aerospace family means joining a highly qualified and dedicated team that appreciates the opportunities and rewards that come with supporting critical, no-fail missions. At AEVEX, you'll find expertly credentialed, innovative team players who are the best at what they do and constantly strive to meet high expectations in an ever-changing environment.

AEVEX Aerospace, headquartered in Solana Beach, California, supports the U.S. national security mission around the world by providing full-spectrum airborne intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance solutions. Title: Director, Analyst Relations
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA
Description: By connecting every business system to one source of truth for employee data, businesses can automate all of the manual work they normally need to do to make…
Descriptions:
About Rippling
Rippling is the first way for businesses to manage all of their HR & IT—payroll, benefits, computers, apps, and more—in one unified workforce platform.

By connecting every business system to one source of truth for employee data, businesses can automate all of the manual work they normally need to do to make employee changes. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can just click a button and set up a new employees’ payroll, health insurance, work computer, and third-party apps—like Slack, Zoom, and Office 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $700M from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, and Bedrock—and was named one of America’s best startup employers by Forbes (#12 out of 500).
About the role

At Rippling, Analyst Relations is critical to the success of the business. Rippling has a unique and important story to tell, and it’s critical we effectively communicate this to the analysts covering Rippling.

As Director, Analyst Relations, you will lead our engagement and expand our current efforts with key industry analysts.

What you will do
Lead the Analyst Relations function at Rippling. Establish and maintain regular communication with analysts on the company’s strategy and product roadmap.
Create a process for building a two-way dialogue with key analysts through ongoing inquiries, briefings, and strategy days.
Host analyst briefings and inquiries with team members with key executives and team members from product & product marketing.
Prepare and host on-site analyst strategy days, including end-to-end planning and execution.
Monitor analyst report calendars for upcoming research reports and coverage.
Work cross functionally to create best-in-class report submissions, presentations, and demos.
Manage and support Rippling’s attendance or sponsorship of key analyst events and summits
Proactively find blockers, then work with the rest of the team to remove them. We place a high premium on taking the initiative to solve problems to run an effective and efficient Analyst Relations program.
What you will need
10+ years experience in analyst relations, advisory, and industry analysis/research.
Previous experience with HR and HCM analysts is a plus.
Successfully led or built an Analyst Relations function and can hit the ground running on day 1.
Additional Information (IE Pay Transparency)

This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here.

Tier 1: $164,000 - $247,000/year

A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above.

Title: Director of Bioinformatics
Description:
A minimum of three days in office, preferred.
You will lead, manage, mentor, and grow several teams of bioinformaticists across a wide range of experience…
Descriptions:
At Nautilus, we have a big and important mission: improve the health of millions by unleashing the potential of the proteome to accelerate drug development and enable a new world of precision and personalized medicine. We are developing a single-molecule protein analysis platform of unprecedented sensitivity, scale, and ease of use that we believe will democratize access to the proteome – one of the most dynamic and valuable sources of biological insight. To accomplish this, we are pursuing hard scientific problems with an entrepreneurial mindset and creating a world-class team of builders, innovators, and dreamers across a wide range of disciplines.
We are looking for a Director of Bioinformatics to join our growing company. Being successful in our goal of delivering novel proteomic insights to the world hinges on our ability to analyze and understand large, complex, and diverse data sets that result from our experimental efforts, surfacing any key insights that might be hidden within. A candidate stepping into this highly visible role will provide both technical and people leadership for diverse bioinformatics teams, contribute their voice to the ongoing conversation around data analysis at Nautilus, and be responsible for the design and implementation of data processing solutions that provide actionable conclusions to our scientists. Some of the teams that this candidate will be directly leading are focused on supporting the discovery and characterization of our affinity reagents, the ongoing optimization of the Nautilus platform, and its current & future application to novel, impactful use-cases. Our novel proteomic technology is still in its formative stages, which means that anyone in this role will be able to have a meaningful, outsized impact on our technology and on the company’s path to future success.
This position will report to the Senior Director of Bioinformatics & Software Engineering and is located in San Carlos, CA, San Diego, CA, or Seattle, WA. A minimum of three days in office, preferred.
Responsibilities
You will lead, manage, mentor, and grow several teams of bioinformaticists across a wide range of experience levels, areas of expertise, and scopes of responsibility
You will be responsible for the successful delivery of data analyses and data processing solutions critical to the overall Nautilus platform
You will work cross-functionally with representatives of many other disciplines –suchas software engineering, biology, and biochemistry – to set your teams’ direction, strategy, and priorities
You will lead multi-disciplinary bioinformatics projects to successfully provide actionable data analysis results to our scientists
You will provide hands-on technical contributions as appropriate to your teams’ strengths and gaps
As a member of our leadership team, you will be expected to contribute to corporate strategy & initiatives, be a positive cultural role model, and be one of Nautilus’s ambassadors to the world!
Requirements
You have 15+ years of relevant experience in a high performing biotechnology organization, including 10+ years of experience in a leadership role
You have a PhD in Bioinformatics or a similar related field
You have a proven track record of leading many bioinformatics teams to success on very complex projects that bring together a wide variety of disciplines and skill sets
You know how to create and nurture highly performing bioinformatics teams through a combination of coaching, hiring, performance reviews, technical mentorship, and other management techniques
You are fluent in a wide variety of statistical analysis skills, data processing and visualization approaches, programming languages and environments, biological experimental techniques, and the ability to quickly acquire expertise in new topics on the fly
You are a creative thinker who is capable of developing new foundational approaches for extracting value from entirely novel data sets and generating actionable conclusions from imperfect data (e.g. missing values, batch effects, highly-skewed distributions, outliers, etc.)
You have strong organization, communication, problem solving, and project management skills, and a willingness to jump in to help wherever it is needed
You are a leader who is trusted by everyone within the organization and are able to lead directly as well as through collaboration & influence
You have fun when building complex systems that solve large, novel problems while working side-by-side with experts from a variety of disciplines
Nautilus Team Culture
We are curious go-getters: this is a team of life-long learners who aren’t afraid to tackle the big challenges while continuously pushing ourselves forward
We are detail oriented: we do great science by working smart and with diligence, and by learning from our mistakes
We are easy to work with: we want our workplace to be one where everyone can share their perspective and be treated with respect and kindness
$185,625 - $248,737.50 a year
The hiring pay range for this position is based on skills, education and experience relevant to the role; title may be assessed one level lower or higher, accordingly. Other components of total compensation include a competitive options grant at the time of hire (with potential for additional grants), and an annual bonus.
Benefits include medical, vision, and dental insurance, group and supplemental life insurance, 401k retirement plan, responsible (unlimited) paid time off, parental leave, and more.

Title: Director of Talent
Description: In this impactful position you will be responsible for playing a critical role in developing and executing the Company's system-wide strategies in support of…
Descriptions:
About Lilac Solutions, Inc.
Lilac Solutions is a lithium extraction technology company focused on scaling lithium production for the electric vehicle era. Lilac solves the critical technology problems which today prevent development of the world's largest lithium resources: low yields, high costs, slow start-up, poor reliability, and massive environmental impacts. Lilac's technology represents such a step-change in performance and cost that it also unlocks the development of new unconventional lithium deposits with low lithium grades and high impurities, which have historically been impossible to produce. In 2021, Lilac raised $150M in Series B financing from investors including T. Rowe Price, Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Sumitomo, BMW and SK Materials. Lilac is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.
Job Description
Lilac Solutions is looking for a Director of Talent to join our People team. In this impactful position you will be responsible for playing a critical role in developing and executing the Company's system-wide strategies in support of the full life cycle talent acquisition. You will lead our Talent team in sourcing, recruiting, and retaining top talent for our global hiring needs. We will also look to you to lead recruiting best practices and creative sourcing strategies by leveraging data, partnering with stakeholders, and driving towards our DE&I initiatives.
The Director of Talent will report to the VP of People and will work onsite in our Oakland, CA office. Occasional work from home flexibility will be available.
Responsibilities
Manage Talent Team, including having direct reports
Successfully delivers on all deadlines and flawlessly executes in a fast-paced environment
Work with leadership to create recruitment benchmarks, goals, and KPIs
Lead our global talent acquisition efforts by partnering with leadership and internal stakeholders for short and long term talent needs
Partner with leadership to forecast headcount and talent strategy
Lead the execution of an innovative, cost-effective talent plan and the creation and monitoring of associated programs, processes, and measurements to achieve strategic goals and talent objectives.
Partner with finance teams to analyze market rates for talent and project ranges for short and long term needs
Help scale Lilac Solutions globally
Partnering with outside recruitment agencies for specific hiring needs
Be lead point of contact for talent support vendors such as LinkedIn, Greenhouse, etc for contract negations, testing and implementation
Candidate Qualifications
7+ years of experience working in talent acquisition with 3+ years in a leadership capacity
Experience managing talent teams towards ambitious hiring goals
Proven record of leveraging data to reach recruiting, DE&I goals, KPIs and benchmarks
Understanding of workforce planning, talent mapping, and headcount forecasting
Talent acquisition subject matter expert with experience developing and scaling talent teams
Demonstrated ability to lead strategy for hiring demands, organizational planning, and strategic talent programs for international hiring needs
Experience leveraging an ATS for candidate tracking, communication, and data analysis.
Experience building recruitment team strategy and vision including:
Passive candidate sourcing
Referrals programs
Internships, early career, and university engagement programs
DE&I innovative
Preferred Skills
Experience scaling global talent recruitment and operations
Experience working with finance and compensation to create salary range recommendations for new and forecasted roles
Working knowledge of Greenhouse, Rippling, or Gusto a plus
Executive (C-Suite) recruitment experience

Compensation
Salary range: $175K-$225K annually (commensurate with experience)
Stock options
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Long-term disability insurance
401k with pre- and post-tax investing options
Flexible Paid Time Off Policy
Eight weeks of Paid Parental Leave
Onsite Gym and Catered Lunch for Oakland Employees
Monthly phone stipend

Title: Director, Healthcare Products
Description:
Significant experience in analytics, AI/ML and related data science is a plus.
Drive use case problem solving through both a comprehensive understanding of user…
Descriptions:
C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. The proven C3 AI Platform provides comprehensive services to build enterprise-scale AI applications more efficiently and cost-effectively than alternative approaches. The core of the C3 AI offering is an open, data-driven AI architecture that dramatically simplifies data science and application development. Learn more at: www.c3.ai
As a Director, Healthcare Products, you will serve as the primary focal point for C3 AI product efforts in AI-based healthcare provider networks, payers, biopharmaceuticals, and related sectors. You will leverage your prior healthcare experience and gain deep expertise in our products to develop enterprise AI applications that deliver meaningful business value for our customers.
As a Director, Healthcare Products, you will be building SaaS products that provide value to solve important and complex problems across healthcare: disease progression prediction, point of care forecasting, risk stratification, workforce allocation, generative drug discovery modeling, medical supply management, payment prediction, etc.
Responsibilities:
Prepare, maintain, and own of all aspects of your SaaS product, including a vision for a comprehensive feature roadmap, detailed product specification documentation, user experience, market positioning, customer targeting and segmentation, and differentiated collateral to support sales.
Engage with customers to hone value propositions and refine product roadmap.
Support pre-sales activities – workshops, demonstrations, pilots – to build credibility with prospective customers and ensure use cases are aligned to product roadmap.
Drive use case problem solving through both a comprehensive understanding of user/business needs and a strong foundation in analytics and AI/ML.
Develop a thorough understanding of C3 AI Applications to clearly communicate technical capabilities and business impact to customers.
Positively influence sales, engineering, and customers to ensure success of your product.
Collaborate with the C3 AI Customer Services team to ensure our customers achieve significant and demonstrable economic benefit.
Effectively and proactively communicate with customers and build a trusted advisor relationship.

10+ years of work experience in healthcare, preferably within or supporting provider networks or payers. The ideal candidate will fluently understand advanced healthcare concepts (payment integrity, for example) and Provider / Payer user persona requirements.
Strong candidates may also include 4+ years in management consulting or similar.
Significant experience in analytics, AI/ML and related data science is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, including strong executive presence.
Strong problem-solving skills and bias for action – you have the ability to navigate both business and technical domains and will provide guidance to internal and external implementation teams.
Time-management and prioritization – you are comfortable simultaneously working across many projects, both collaboratively across diverse teams (including customer-facing and internal teams) and self-starting initiatives.
Value self-learning – you habitually further your understanding of relevant areas of interest, such as AI, cloud computing, and software development.
C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include:
Generous equity plan.

Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future company sponsorship.

Title: Director of Marketing
Description:
Experience in a Law Firm Marketing setting is a must.
As Marketing Director, you'll oversee all of our company's marketing operations.
Descriptions:
About the Marketing Director Position
Amazing opportunity delivered. We're looking for an experienced Marketing Director to join our marketing team. Experience in a Law Firm Marketing setting is a must. As Marketing Director, you'll oversee all of our company's marketing operations. The person in this position wears many hats, from leading our marketing team in day-to-day operations to meeting with the COO to discuss revenue. This fast-paced position is perfect for someone with superb organizational and multitasking skills. We need someone who can help us get to the next level.
Read more about the responsibilities and requirements to see if this position is a good fit for you. We hope to hear from you!
Marketing Director Responsibilities
Set short-term and long-term marketing objectives for the company
Facilitate growth and sales to drive revenue
Manage the marketing budget to ensure gains and minimize loss
Research and analyze marketing trends

Title: FVP/SVP, Director of Project Management
Location: El Monte, CA 91731 (Park El Monte area)
Description:
The Director of Project Management (“DPM”) leads the Bank’s Project Management Office (“PMO”) function.
Accordingly, the DPM develops and implements policies,…
Descriptions:
People Drive Our Success

Are you enthusiastic, highly motivated, and have a strong work ethic? If yes, come join our team! At Cathay Bank – we strive to provide a caring culture that supports your aspirations and success. We believe people are our most valuable asset and we proudly foster growth and development empowering you to achieve your professional goals. We have thrived for 60 years and persevered through many economic cycles due to our team members’ drive and optimism. Together we can make a difference in the financial future of our communities.

Apply today!

What our team members are saying:
Video Clip 1

Video Clip 2

Video Clip 3

Learn more about us at cathaybank.com

GENERAL SUMMARY

The Director of Project Management (“DPM”) leads the Bank’s Project Management Office (“PMO”) function. Accordingly, the DPM develops and implements policies, procedures and other activities required to provide effective control of significant projects to enhance Bank products, services, and capabilities. These activities include but are not limited to oversight of the PMO and the project portfolio process; ensuring compliance with project management policies and standards; and monitoring and reporting of key performance indicators related to project management. Ongoing responsibilities include enhancing the maturity of the program at the enterprise level.

DIRECT REPORTS

Incumbent will have direct reports.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The DPM bears primary responsibility and accountability for the performance of the PMO, oversight over individual projects subject to the PMO process, and periodic reporting of Project Management performance at the project and enterprise levels.

Oversees the project portfolio processes including project planning, portfolio governance, project methodology framework, and resource capacity management.
Ensures project management standards are being executed across the project portfolio.
Performs critical analysis of project proposals to determine the time frame, funding limitations, and appropriate process for accomplishing projects.
Establishes a reliable and visible cadence for program reviews, decision-making, prioritization, and resource allocation, whereby efficiency gains and impact are measurable.
Creates and leverages KPIs to drive traction and visibility and to understand project progress and identify potential roadblocks across teams and projects.
Documents the project scope, budget, and justification and monitors project development, and execution.
Evaluates projects to ensure they are meeting company standards, adhering to budgets, and meeting deadlines.
Identifies and manages project risks and issues and implements appropriate mitigation plans.
Provides financial reports, project dashboards and budget outlines to senior management.
Drives improvements into the PMO program to enhance program maturity.
Creates and maintains staffing plans. Ensures the team is properly trained and staffed to handle the projected workload, both from internal staffing and external staffing support.
Implements project communications including project steering committee meetings and status reports.
Provides organizational and cultural change leadership and change management.
Periodically reviews and updates PMO policies and processes.
Hires PMO staff as necessary and appropriate to fulfill the essential functions of the PMO.
QUALIFICATIONS

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related discipline preferred.
Experience:
7-10 years of leadership experience and a track record of success in program management, product management, management consulting, strategy, or a related field with particular focus on banking products and technology.
Skills/Ability:
Skilled at project planning, forecasting, and tracking.
Experience with data analysis, presentation and creating dashboards.
Systematic and analytical problem-solving ability.
Experience collaborating cross-functionally to prioritize needs and build productive working relationships while also holding teams and individuals accountable to deliverables.
Demonstrates critical thinking capabilities with strong attention to detail.
Experience concurrently managing teams, workstreams or projects.
People management experience, including building a strong team.
Demonstrated skills in collaboration, teamwork, and problem-solving to achieve goals.
Demonstrated skills in verbal communication and listening, writing, and providing excellent service to customers.
A high level of integrity and trust.
Proven ability to initiate and manage projects that will affect other departments and functions, as well as the corporate environment.
OTHER DETAILS

$165,000.00 - $225,000.00 / year

Pay determined based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

Title: Director of Marketing Analytics & Insight (Remote)
Description:
10+ years of experience in marketing analytics, digital analytics, or a related field.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in marketing, analytics, or a related field…
Descriptions:
Ignite Visibility, an award-winning digital marketing agency in San Diego, is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Director of Marketing Effectiveness and Analytics to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading and managing all aspects of marketing effectiveness and digital analytics programs to ensure our marketing efforts are delivering maximum ROI to our clients. You will work closely with the marketing, sales, and product teams to provide insights and recommendations that will drive business growth.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and lead the marketing effectiveness and digital analytics strategy and roadmap to support the company's business objectives
Build and manage a team of analysts and data scientists to execute on the analytics strategy and deliver actionable insights
Define and implement data-driven attribution models to measure the impact of marketing campaigns across all channels
Establish and maintain a measurement framework to track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing effectiveness
Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize campaigns, channels, and messaging based on insights derived from data analysis
Conduct regular analysis of customer behavior and identify opportunities for upsell/cross-sell and retention
Develop dashboards and reporting to communicate insights to stakeholders across the organization, including senior leadership
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to marketing effectiveness and digital analytics

Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in marketing, analytics, or a related field
10+ years of experience in marketing analytics, digital analytics, or a related field
Strong understanding of marketing channels, tactics, and attribution models
Experience managing and mentoring a team of analysts and data scientists
Proven track record of delivering insights that drive business growth
Strong analytical skills and the ability to derive insights from complex data sets
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with marketing automation and analytics platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Marketo, Salesforce, etc.)
Experience working in a B2B technology or SaaS company is a plus

If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for data-driven decision-making and have a proven track record of delivering results, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to lead our marketing effectiveness and digital analytics programs.

Why Ignite Visibility?
A collaborative environment focused on client success and career development
Fully remote workforce with optional San Diego office
Two-time Landy Award Winner (Search Marketer of the Year & Best Paid Search Initiative)
Named Fastest-Growing Private Companies in San Diego (2016-2020)
Named Best Places to Work in San Diego 2017, 2020
Named Inc 5000 Fastest Growing Companies 2017-2020

Benefits

Remote first work culture
Full health and dental coverage
Remote first work setting
Generous paid vacation including your birthday & extra time off around major holidays
401k-retirement plan with employer match
Employee advancement and growth potential
Company-sponsored professional development opportunities

Title: Director of Supply Chain
Description: The Head of Supply Chain is a strategic, yet hands-on leader capable of implementing the organization, systems and processes for supply chain management,…
Descriptions:
We're a well-funded early-stage start-up. You'll get a chance to wear many hats, be a part of a growing team, and have the potential for exciting financial and career growth.
Here's what sets us apart. We've set our sights on some of the biggest challenges facing biology today. We're amassing a world class team of engineers, scientists, team builders and problem solvers to tackle these challenges heads-on. We're passionate about developing the next generation technologies that will unravel the complexities of biology.
This is a unique opportunity to build, be part of an early-stage start-up and be surrounded by good humans who are super capable, humble and down-to- earth.
The Head of Supply Chain is a strategic, yet hands-on leader capable of implementing the organization, systems and processes for supply chain management, material control and logistics functions. The job duties include:
Own the supply chain and logistics strategy and relationships, building successful internal and external partnerships
Partner with finance to provide current and projected inventory levels and costed finished product information
Partner with development team and other operations area to identify, select, and manage strategic partners
Manage partnerships with key suppliers through supply agreement negotiation, provision of forecasts and performance monitoring
Manage outsourced distribution activities and maintain strong relationships with 3PLs, CMOs, freight forwarders and transportation partners
Create and lead the S&OP process.
Manage import/export processes for international logistics
Create and report on supply chain & logistics performance through appropriate reports and metrics (KPI's)
Collaborate with company leadership on strategic planning
Role Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in supply chain, business administration, operations, or a related field
10 years of experience in supply chain management and logistics in a ISO/GMP environment
Deep knowledge of all materials- related processes for supply chain management, materials management, and logistics
Solid working knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements (ISO, FDA, QMS, Customs, etc.)
Expert at implementing and utilizing ERP systems and MRP process
Experience leading the S&OP process for an organization, including guiding the executives and stakeholders
Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills with a proven ability to create and maintain positive working relationships with suppliers, shippers, and customers
ASCM/APICS CPIM and/or CSCP certifications preferred
Experience in both domestic and international transportation and logistics required
Experienced with ERP Systems data analysis, KPI management of metrics and associated corrective action planning
Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Director of Technical Program Management
Description: As a Director of Technical Program Management, you will serve as a key thought partner to the Affirm Technology leadership team, responsible for leading…
Descriptions:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm proudly includes Returnly.
As a Director of Technical Program Management, you will serve as a key thought partner to the Affirm Technology leadership team, responsible for leading multiple technical program management teams and drive strategic programs in partnership with Engineering, Product, Infrastructure, InfoSec and User Experience leadership, as well as often coordinating more broadly with partner product areas, including Consumer, Merchant and Foundations product leadership. You will like working with large amounts of data, have the capacity to understand and work with complex systems, and enjoy the challenge of solving/simplifying problems. Finally, you will actively develop and grow our key talent as well as evolve the overall organization to set it up for success as it faces new challenges. You will bring expertise in technical/program management to help us deliver on great Affirm products.
What you'll do:
Lead and inspire a distributed team of Technical Program Managers (TPM) drawn from several parts of the business, with a goal of driving alignment amongst key stakeholders.
Partner closely with Engineering VPs/Directors, Product Managers, and leadership to ensure TPM alignment with engineering and product priorities. Forecast resourcing requirements for TPM, while driving sublinear scaling.
Build a healthy, scalable, and growth-oriented TPM organization across multiple business units, geos and disciplines.
Lead TPM groups to streamline product and engineering planning processes, simplify execution, manage objective key results (OKRs), release on time, bring tooling efficiencies, and help teams in overall execution.
Manage communication of progress/status within the core team and with our XFN partners.

What we look for:
10 years of experience managing technical projects in a software engineering domain
5 years of experience leading teams within technical program management or equivalent roles
Experience creating, executing, and delivering against a product roadmap and driving business impact
Experience collaborating across organizational boundaries, building relationships, and importing and exporting talent and ideas to achieve broader organizational goals
Experience with cross-functional stakeholder management and leadership through influence
Organizational leadership, with ability to collaborate with and influence teams across boundaries
Committed to building inclusive teams and team culture, with outstanding business judgment, and excellent project management, problem solving, and analysis skills
Comfort with changing specifications or standards, creating the conditions in which the team feels comfortable and capable of working through in response to ambiguity
Nice to have- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience
USA Pacific base pay range (CA, WA, NY, NJ, CT): $222,300 - $277,800
USA Sapphire base pay range (all other U.S. states): $200,000 - $250,000

Title: Head of Trust & Safety
Description: The ideal candidate will have a technical background and be able to bridge the gap between Engineering and Community Management to create a safe environment for…
Descriptions:
Who we are
Fizz is a private and authenticated platform designed to revolutionize the social fabric of communities, starting with colleges. After verifying a university email address, students use Fizz to post questions, memes, polls, and chat directly with other verified students, all while maintaining full control of their identity and privacy. Fizz communities are safe, authentic, and inclusive, made possible through community-based moderation.

Launched by two Stanford dropouts, Fizz is currently expanding into colleges all across the US. In a time when social media is plagued by curated highlight reels and lack of authenticity, Fizz is on a mission to redefine the definition of a true social network.

What we’ve done
We first launched Fizz at Stanford in July 2021 and have since seen >95% of undergraduates join the app, half of which use Fizz every day. Since then, we have raised over 16M from NEA, Owl Ventures, and Lightspeed, built a rock-solid engineering team with decades of experience at top tech companies, and expanded Fizz to be the dominant community platform at 70+ colleges.

Where we’re going
Our near term goal is to expand to all US universities by the end of the 2023-2024 academic school year. To get there, we are seeking a Head of Trust and Safety to lead the development and implementation of policies, procedures, and practices that ensure the safety and security of our users. The ideal candidate will have a technical background and be able to bridge the gap between Engineering and Community Management to create a safe environment for our users.
Responsibilities
Develop and implement trust and safety policies and procedures for Fizz
Work closely with the engineering team to develop scalable human in the loop AI community moderation systems
Work closely with community management to address user concerns and complaints related to trust and safety
Design systems to track the health of Fizz communities and performance of community moderators
Conduct regular audits and assessments of Fizz’s Trust and Safety measures
Identify emerging threats and risks to Fizz’s users and develop proactive strategies to address them
Qualifications
Strong technical skills, with the ability to work closely with engineering teams and not be afraid to get your hands dirty
Experience with data analysis and risk assessment
Extremely strong grasp on product and ability to understand the content and dialogue college students use
Passion for building intelligent systems that can improve the user experience and safety of our platform
Bonus Points
Experience with SwiftUI, TypeScript, Firebase, or Google Cloud Platform
$140,000 - $200,000 a year
Fizz is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant, candidate, or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military or veteran status, genetic information or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.

Title: CapCut - Head of US Operations

2.Familiar with the digital content eco-system,strong understanding of data analytics and systematic.
In addition to its basic features, such as video editing,…
Descriptions:
Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

About CapCut
CapCut is an all-in-one video editing app that empowers creators to express themselves and transform videos into creative masterpieces. In addition to its basic features, such as video editing, text, stickers, filters, colors and music, CapCut offers free advanced features, including keyframe animation, smooth slow-motion effects, chroma key, Picture-in-Picture (PIP), and stabilization to help you capture and snip moments.

Why Join Us
At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.

Our Team
CapCut team's mission is to inspire video creation by providing users with a wide range of video editing functions and easy-to-use video templates. We aim to build the best and most localized editing experience, to help users catch up with the trend and express themselves.

Responsibilities
1. Grow US template creator base, oversee creator recruitment from all channels, new creator onboarding and education, top creator management and incentive settings.
2. Grow US DAU by diversified, high-quality template content, oversee trending content production, in-app template categorization
3. Regional content and operations calendar management.
4. US creator operations and content programming team management.
Qualifications
Qualifications
1.8+ years of working in content related operations role and have team management experience.
2.Familiar with the digital content eco-system,strong understanding of data analytics and systematic.
3.Fluent in English and familiar with US culture. Passion for video content.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodation, please reach out to us at erin.cai@bytedance.com.
Job Information
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $150000 - $250000 annually.



Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.



At ByteDance/TikTok our benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support ByteDancers to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:



We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.



Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off(PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.



We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

Title: Head of Analytics, Shopping Strategy
Description:
Define and cultivate best practices in analytics instrumentation and experimentation.
Prior work experience in a product analytics space would be highly valued.
Descriptions:
At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: In this role, you will lead a high-performing team of data scientists, and bring the analytical rigor required to solve complex, ambiguous, and high-visibility business challenges to drive consumer growth and engagement. You and your team will work cross-functionally with senior leaders from product, engineering, design, and marketing teams to build world-class products by making strategic recommendations via investigative deep-dives and hypothesis-driven experiments.
Job Description:
About You

We are seeking an exceptional data science leader with a passion for data insights and relentless focus on execution:
You are curious and inquisitive: love digging into data and uncovering insights
You are hyper-analytical and intellectually honest, truly believing in data-driven decisions and communicating your ideas through storytelling
You are a highly motivated, result-oriented self-starter, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, and can deliver successful results with minimal guidance
You are a player-coach, and are not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and jumping into details
You are passionate about mentoring, developing, and motivating a high-performing team to drive impact

Your day to day:

Challenge the status quo, and drive data backed decision making
Partner closely with product leaders to understand new product offerings being built and recommend the right metrics to measure the performance of those features
Identify key metrics, conduct rigorous explorative data analysis, create executive facing dashboards and build business cases that drive decision making and business prioritization
Analyze consumer product performance and health, triage issues, and provide recommendation on the best course solution and optimization.
Synthesizing large volumes of data with attention to granular details and present findings and recommendations to senior-level stakeholders
Collaborate with engineering and data engineering to enable feature tracking, resolve complex data and tracking issues, and build necessary data pipelines
Define and cultivate best practices in analytics instrumentation and experimentation
Support multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
Coach and mentor a small group of team members on day-to-day delivery

What do you need to bring:
At least 7 years of experience analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable solutions
At least 2 years of experience in managing data science and analytics teams
B.S. in a quantitative field, advanced degrees preferred
Familiarity with SQL and at least one scripting language such as Python or R, comfortable working with large, complex, and potentially messy datasets
Understanding of statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, statistical inference, regression) and experience designing and evaluating complex experiments
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, to influence cross-functional teams
Strong interpersonal skills and experience leading cross-functional teams
Prior work experience in a product analytics space would be highly valued
A passion for problem-solving and comfort with ambiguity
PayPal is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

Actual Compensation is based on various factors including but not limited to work location, and relevant skills and experience.

The total compensation for this practice may include an annual performance bonus (or other incentive compensation, as applicable), equity, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information, visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com.

The U.S. national annual pay range for this role is $96900 to $234300
Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution for more than 20 years. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. For more information, visit paypal.com.
PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Title: Assistant Director of Analytics and Communication
Description:
Oversight of data analytics efforts across cross-functional ATS Teams.
Experience using data analytic tools such as Tableau, Qualtrics, or Power BI.
Descriptions:
Campus:
Long Beach

Job Title:
Assistant Director of Analytics and Communication

Appointment Type:
Temporary

Time Base:
Full-Time

Date Posted:
March 2, 2023

April 10, 2023

Description:
Job Summary
Under the direction of the Associate Vice President for Academic Technology Services, the Assistant Director will oversee the daily and long-term operations of the Multimedia, Analytics & Assessment and Communications Teams. As a project manager, the Assistant Director will integrate predictive, agile, and hybrid approaches into the processes and procedures of the teams they supervise. The Assistant Director will assist the leadership team in preparing project documents, identifying, and recommending the best project management methods for ATS initiatives, and assisting in projects as needed.
Key Responsibilities
Oversee and support the SPOT & Assessment team for data analytics and services associated with teaching and course evaluations/assessments (SPOT-Student Perceptions of Teaching).
Oversee and support the Multimedia team’s projects and initiatives.
Oversee and support ATS Communications initiatives.
Oversight of data analytics efforts across cross-functional ATS Teams.
Knowledge Skills and Abilities
Demonstrated exceptional verbal skills and presentation skills in communicating complex information processes and client requirements. Excellent writing skills that demonstrate fluency and ability to showcase main ideas through organization and word choice. Possess general knowledge of videography, course assessment, advertising communications, and statistical analysis. Outstanding listening skills to gather requirements from clients and provide feedback to improve outcomes. Knowledge in usability, accessibility, web development and outstanding leadership skills to influence clients to integrate best practices in areas of web content, multimedia, and communications. Strong organization and planning skills regarding prioritization, workforce time allotment and project management, along with a history of leading and supporting successful projects. Able to communicate to a diverse audience with considerable variance in technological aptitudes, with a proven ability to treat the entire campus-community with dignity and respect, empathy, fairness, and professionalism, consistent with the university mission, values, and strategic vision. Consideration of university programs, policies, and procedures including curricular programs, faculty affairs, and undergraduate programs. Managerial experience in leading creative and technical teams. Knowledge of web content management tools, such as Drupal, to supervise website management for ATS, and Academic Affairs.
Ability to communicate with an ethnically and culturally diverse campus community. Ability to follow all university policies, procedures, and guidelines including but not limited to safety, civility, information security, and non-discrimination policies and procedures. Ability to contribute to a positive university experience for each and every student, and assist in achieving the university's commitment to a "vision of excellence."
Education and Experience
Required Qualifications:
Equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in Educational Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, Communications or related technical field and five (5) years of related experience required.
At least three (3) years of experience in Project Management/ leading projects.
Three (3) years of experience in complex problem solving on a strict timeline.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Educational Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, Communications, or equivalent experience in related field.
Project Management experience with complex technology projects, ideally in a higher education environment.
Project Management experience with managing video production projects.
Demonstrated experience managing, and manipulating complex datasets, conducting data analytics, and producing complex reports.
Experience using data analytic tools such as Tableau, Qualtrics, or Power BI

PMP Certification

Academic Technology Services

Analyst/Programmer - Expert
