Title: Director of Affiliate and Performance Marketing
Description: Partner with the head of growth and director of offline marketing to create the most optimized marketing mix that drives efficient volumes at a reasonable CAC.
Descriptions:
About Figure
Figure is transforming the trillion dollar financial services industry using blockchain technology.
In five short years, Figure has unveiled a series of fintech firsts using the Provenance blockchain for loan origination, equity management, private fund services, banking and payments sectors - bringing speed, efficiency and savings to both consumers and institutions. Today, Figure is one of less than a thousand companies considered a unicorn, globally.
Our mission requires us to have a creative, team-oriented, and supportive environment where everyone can do their absolute best. The team is composed of driven, innovative, collaborative, and curious people who love architecting ground-breaking technologies. We value individuals who bring an entrepreneurial mindset to every task and will embrace our culture of innovation.
Every day at Figure is a journey in continuous learning yet a daily focus on getting work done that makes a difference. Join a team of proven leaders who have already created billions of dollars in value in the FinTech space!
What You'll Do
Own the affiliate partnership channel (comparison sites, fintech apps and marketplaces), across strategy, execution, and performance
Lead all negotiations and agreements (recruitment and existing partners)
Illustrate the Figure value proposition with partners, scaling the channel
Monitor and evaluate partner programs using Impact Radius and other internal tools
Measure and understand the performance of the channel, on an aggregate and per-partner basis; and manage to portfolio CAC goals
Collaborate closely with internal teams - creative, product, legal, analytics, compliance, engineering, etc. to achieve growth goals
Oversee all performance marketing and manage senior manager of paid acquisition
Manage both the affiliate and performance marketing budget with a focus on driving the lowest CAC and best business performance
Figure out how to scale and improve channel performance. Investigate new performance channels that could create new opportunities for Figure to expand our reach and build a performance marketing portfolio that maximizes our reach and minimizes CAC
Partner with the head of growth and director of offline marketing to create the most optimized marketing mix that drives efficient volumes at a reasonable CAC
What We Look For
10+ years of experience in an affiliate marketing or partnership marketing role with performance marketing and channel management experience at the Director Level
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Prior experience with Impact Radius or other relevant affiliate platforms is preferred
Prior experience managing a search agency and using agency tools at the Director level
Prior experience with paid search tools and other marketing tools at the Director level
Natural relationship orientation with excellent partner recruitment and account management skills
Strong analytical and financial acumen
Strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills
Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, agile marketing environment
Benefits and Perks
Competitive salary and growth opportunities
Company quarterly performance based bonus
Equity stock options package
Employer funded comprehensive health, vision, dental insurance and wellness program for employees and their dependents
Employer funded life and disability insurance coverage
Company HSA, FSA, Dependent Care, 401k, and commuter benefits
Up to 12 weeks paid family leave
Home office and technology stipend for those working outside of a traditional office more than 75% of the time
Flexible time-off plan to empower employees to take the time off that they want and need
Continuing education reimbursement
Routine Team swag deliveries!
For CO, NY, CA and WA residents, the salary range for this position is $132,000 - $165,000/year with a 25% Bonus and Equity. Actual compensation may vary based on individual candidate experience and location.
Depending on your residential location certain laws might regulate the way Figure manages applicant data. California Residents, please review our California Employee and Prospective Employee Privacy Notice for further information. By submitting your application, you are agreeing and acknowledging that you have read and understand the above notice.
Figure will not sponsor work visas for this position. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Title: Director - Technology, Data Platforms
Description: Lead the design, development and implementation of data and analytics solutions in support of the DPEP data strategy and roadmap, leveraging cloud-native…
Descriptions:
Director - Technology, Data Platforms
Job ID
10042398
Location
Glendale, California, United States / United States
Business
Disney Parks, Experiences and Products
Date posted
Feb. 28, 2023
This role is considered remote, which means the employee will work remotely on an ongoing basis and will not have an assigned workspace at a Company designated location.
Job Summary:
Director, Technology – Data Platforms
Job ID: 10042398
Location: Remote and CA or FL
The Data Products and Platforms organization at Disney Parks, Experiences, and Products (DPEP) has end-to-end responsibility for building, enhancing, and maintaining the data, analytics, BI and machine learning ecosystem used by a large community of users (analysts, data scientists, technology partners, business/operations teams, etc.) within DPEP and across The Walt Disney Company (TWDC).
The Director, Technology – Data Platforms will be responsible for both the development and operations of the next generation data platform and toolsets. This highly technical role will require critical thinking and business acumen to make decisions that align to the strategic goals of the organization, navigating an environment with ambiguity and minimal direction. This role is expected to drive a data platform vision, leading a team of managers, architects, engineers and product managers with a span of influence across the portfolio.
Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development and implementation of data and analytics solutions in support of the DPEP data strategy and roadmap, leveraging cloud-native technology, in order to enable data and insights self-service and agile data management across the segment
Oversee the day-to-day operation of the platform, ensuring high availability, scalability and performance and a data-driven approach to continuous measurement and optimization
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders to ensure the platform and tools meet their requirements
Conduct market research and evaluation of COTS products in the big data ecosystem, and foster key industry and academic partnerships, to continuously evolve the data platform architecture to support the growing needs of the business
Prototype new technologies and implement innovative solutions that enable teams to consume and understand data faster, including best in class BI tooling
Pioneer technical solutions that advance data security, privacy, and access governance
Architect extensible technical architectures to deliver the latest in machine learning, AI, and other emerging technology solutions
Required Qualifications:
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, or related fields
10 years of relevant experience in Data Engineering and Data Platforms
Advanced knowledge of Data Architecture, Data Warehousing, Advanced Analytics, and Data Science implementations, including the latest research and industry trends
Experience across Data Warehouse platforms such as Snowflake and BigQuery, with expert level knowledge in the Snowflake Platform
Expertise with Data Lakehouse architectures and formats/standards, such as Parquet and Iceberg
Experience designing automated, highly available ETL/ELT big data pipelines at scale, leveraging technologies such as Kinesis, Kafka and Google Pub/Sub
Experience with data transformation leveraging tooling, specifically DBT
Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience with Query Federation solutions like Starburst Presto
Knowledge of data quality practice and tooling such as SODA, Datadog, Anomalo
Familiarity with data security and privacy regulations, including tooling such as Privacera and Apache Ranger
Experience with Enterprise Data Governance practice, and tools, specifically Alation
Experience with BI (Business Intelligence) consumption tools like Tableau, Business Objects, SAS, and MicroStrategy
Expert knowledge of big data architecture for AI/ML integration patterns
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions at scale
Deep experience with data science tools such as SageMaker, Jupyter Notebooks, StreamLit, Dataiku
Understanding of MLOps practice and tooling, including feature cache and model management, such as SageMaker, mlflow, Google Colab, Google Data Studio, etc.
Knowledge of trends and tools in data and ML version management
Knowledge of trends and tools in ML observability
Comfortable with both technical and business responsibilities, you will be working with engineers, data scientists, operations managers, and business masterminds to build products and solve complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication. Compelling storytelling and presentation skills.
A team player with vision, passion, discipline, and integrity
Demonstrated inclusive leadership that embraces diversity; ability to develop geographically and otherwise diverse highly technical teams
Proven ability to successfully operate in a highly matrix organizational system where partnership and influence are key drivers of success
Ability to work rapidly and efficiently in a fast paced and changing environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or related quantitative field
Proven leadership within a complex organization holding a high-profile global brand
This role can be fully remote or onsite in CA or FL.
The hiring range for this remote position is $198,932 to $266,860 per year, which factors in various geographic regions. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

Title: Director of Financial Planning & Analysis
Description:
Assisting with the selection and implementation of forecasting and business analytics software to supplement our ERP system.
MBA, Masters in finance, or CPA.
Descriptions:
At Elroy Air, we build autonomous vertical takeoff and landing (VTOL) cargo aircraft systems to change the way the world moves goods. Transporting cargo by air is faster and more efficient than by land or sea, but before recent technological and regulatory developments, it was prohibitively expensive. Today, we’re able to expand middle-mile logistics possibilities across multiple sectors. The commercial express shipping industry spends $140B annually on the middle-mile and needs faster, better solutions - while the armed forces are increasingly prioritizing unmanned aerial cargo delivery systems.

These partners and customers are already responding enthusiastically to the technologies we are pioneering. As we develop and deploy these systems, we are looking for people like you: motivated collaborators, excited by our mission and by the rare opportunity to improve how logistics works around the world. You will play an important role in establishing Elroy Air as the industry standard in this massive market.

Diverse perspectives at all levels are critical to innovation and employee development. We encourage our team to bring their whole selves to Elroy. This includes but is not limited to gender identity, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender expression, religion, age, ability, parenthood status, veteran status, educational background, citizenship status, or any combination of these characteristics.

As our Director of Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A)you will report directly to the CFO and will lead all of Elroy Air’s budgeting and forecasting activities. You will work closely with the executive team, as well as our commercial, engineering, and operations groups to support major business initiatives and drive financial results. You will assist with customer and vendor negotiations using pricing and cost analytics to pursue optimal business outcomes. You will also coordinate the activities of the corporate finance team, lead strategic planning processes, and create visibility into and monitor performance against our company’s various financial goals and operating metrics.

This is an on-site, full-time, exempt role based at our headquarters in South San Francisco, CA.
What you’ll own:
Driving and overseeing a rigorous budgeting and forecasting process including all periodic, annual, and long term financial planning activities
Partnering with cross functional leaders to develop and translate financial forecasts and operational metrics into actionable guidance for decision making
Proactively identifying areas for business improvement and producing persuasive, data-driven arguments to support good decisions and drive financial results
Applying judgment and experience to weigh the trade-offs of competing business priorities, make decisions, deploy resources, and know when to escalate
Supporting customer, vendor, and partner contract negotiations
Coordinating the preparation of presentations for leadership, the BoD, customers, and investors
Projecting resources required for new product designs, long-term system upgrades, establishing and supporting international operations, and other major investments
Leading special projects and ad hoc tasks as needed
Assisting with the selection and implementation of forecasting and business analytics software to supplement our ERP system
Leading, recruiting, and building a strong corporate finance team in accordance with Elroy Air’s values, business needs, and pace of growth
Our ideal candidate has:
10+ years of experience in FP&A and corporate finance in aerospace, industrial manufacturing, or other hardware industries
Previous financial oversight responsibility for multiple geographic locations and product lines
Experience managing a finance team with multiple direct reports as well as recruiting and cultivating talent
Strong financial literacy, analytical skills, and business acumen in order to understand all aspects of the business
A partner mentality to help guide the company’s strategic decisions
A focus on increasing the resilience of financial systems, adding automation, reducing errors, and continuously improving business processes
Experience with various ERP and financial reporting software tools and the ability to quickly learn others
The ability to be strategically focused and thoughtful while being detail oriented and comfortable with hands-on responsibilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate data into narratives
Bonus points for:
Commercial or project finance experience
Experience working with DoD and government agencies as customers
Supporting teams creating a product with both hardware and software components
Experience at a growth oriented startup or rapidly scaling business
MBA, Masters in finance, or CPA

Elroy Air's compensation package includes market competitive salary, equity for all full time roles, and great benefits. If you are located in the San Francisco Bay Area, our expected cash compensation for this role is $180,000 - $225,000. We are hiring for multiple levels and backgrounds so final offers may vary from the amounts listed based on experience, expertise, and other factors.

We encourage you to apply even if you aren't an exact match for our open role as many of our team members come from nontraditional backgrounds.

All employees will be screened through E-Verify.

This position will require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws and regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Please note that any offer for employment will be conditioned on any required authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export control laws and regulations necessary to perform the responsibilities of the position.

Title: Director of Hardware
Description: At least six years of professional experience managing high-performance, technical teams, in a director-level role or similar (e.g. managing managers).
Descriptions:
We are a well-funded Series A startup on a mission to make e-commerce logistics more human-friendly and efficient with AI-powered robotics.

Founded by leading robotics researchers, we are growing our team of dynamic and compassionate tech enthusiasts to deploy robots at scale. Join us in building the most dexterous robots on the planet!

We seek a Director of Hardware to manage a world-class team of hardware engineers, drive alignment towards critical objectives, prioritize and sequence team efforts, and provide direction and mentorship to team members. In this role, you will work closely with the CTO, VP of Hardware, VP of Software, Product Lead, and VP of Manufacturing.
In this role, you will:
Prioritize team tasks and help remove blockers
Define, implement, and maintain streamlined and transparent development processes
Run team meetings and development cycles (e.g. sprints, standups).
Grow the team through hiring initiatives, direct mentorship, and coaching.
Foster an optimistic, accountable, and collaborative culture.
You are a good fit if you have:
Eagerness to learn, solve challenging problems, and lead with curiosity.
A desire for career growth and ownership of your work.
Excitement about amplifying human potential with state-of-the-art robotics.
At least six years of professional experience managing high-performance, technical teams, in a director-level role or similar (e.g. managing managers).
Excellent communication skills.
A deep understanding of what roles are needed and how to organize the team to service different phases of the product lifecycle (POC, Prototype, Scaling) and different phases of product development (design, build, test, manufacture)A passion for effective prioritization / coordination of work phases and driving process improvements.
Strong mechanical intuition for faster decision making: be able to guide designs without FEA, decisions without extensive analysis.
BONUS: Experience with Asana, Waterfall/Agile, PDM/PLM, and/or AI robotic hardware systems.
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer benefits such as:
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401k with 5% matching by Ambi
Unlimited PTO
Access to a full gym at HQ
Free parking on site at HQ
Free lunches 2x per week
Equity ownership

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: SVP, Director of IT Operations

Descriptions:
JOB SUMMARY

The position of Director of IT Operations is established to oversee, direct daily activities, plan, organize IT operations and infrastructure services and ensure the effective, efficient, and secure operations and regulatory compliance.

The position has potential for a Hybrid work opportunities.

PRIMARY FUNCTIONS

Collaborate with executive and senior management level stakeholders to oversee the implementation and operation of strategic and tactical IT initiatives.

Report and advise the Chief Information Officer on the Strategic plan and progress towards implementation of that plan.

Oversee daily activities of the Infrastructure Engineering Team, Service Desk, Contracted Vendor Services and any other IT related functions as needed.

Participate in IT Steering committee and other supporting management level committees such as Change Advisory Board and Project Management Committee as established by the Bank’s governance program.

Develop the tactical IT project roadmap to meet strategic goals, establish Key Performance Indicators, track and report to appropriate committees.

Participate in vendor contract negotiations for all IT related hardware, software and cloud services on behalf of the bank.

Create a cost-benefit analysis as well as supporting a detailed definition of data requirements and departmental workflows.

Oversee implementation of IT components of Information Security Program, IT Risk Management Program, IT Vendor Management Program and Incident Response

Provide bank employees with top quality, consistently available computer service, support training and maintenance of all computer systems used throughout the bank.
Responsible for oversight of procurement installation and maintenance of all computer hardware and software and all other products and supplies necessary to keep computer systems operable and to fulfill managements requests for computer support.
Create, maintain and enforce written policies and procedures regarding all computer operations in the IT Department and throughout the bank.
Compile and review records to determine department productivity, quality of output and cost of service. Develop methods to continually improve results.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Cloud computing
Data Management

Information security

People management
Establish and maintain effective relationships with management, staff, regulators, underwriters, vendors, contractors, consultants, customers, and the general public
Maintain confidentiality of company and customer information
Communicate clearly, orally and in writing

None

Title: Head of Product Analytics
Description: 8+ years experience in product analytics roles, business operations / strategy & operations, or equivalent analytical business functions.
Descriptions:
At Instawork, we’re driven by our vision to create economic opportunity for local businesses and skilled hourly professionals in communities around the world. With a growing number of hub cities across the world in the U.S., Canada, India, and beyond, we’re looking for top talent to help rapidly scale our high-tech and high-touch labor marketplace. Our accomplished and dedicated team is passionate about our mission and committed to crafting revolutionary products, all with the backing of our world-class investors, including Benchmark, Spark Capital, Craft Ventures, Greylock Capital, Y Combinator, and more!
The mission of the Business Operations team is to create strategic clarity and alignment to accelerate Instawork’s growth, and we tackle company-critical work in three areas:
Business health & day-to-day operations. Define critical KPIs/metrics, stay on top of key trends in the business, perform analyses to unearth new insights and support important decisions, and design/own the "operating systems" that help run the business effectively.
Strategic planning & goal-setting. Manage the processes that enable teams to produce clear strategic plans connected back to broader company strategy, and translate these plans into forecasts and ambitious goals/OKRs.
Special projects & initiatives. Answer critical questions about our market and growth opportunities, drive complex projects that help us run/scale better as a business, and incubate 0->1 initiatives that lack clear owners.
As a Head of Product Analytics, you will partner closely with our Product team to answer critical questions about our marketplace and drive initiatives that help us run better as a business and reach new levels of scale, leading analyses ranging from growth to product performance to marketplace health. Your actionable and data-driven recommendations will range from the strategic to tactical, ultimately influencing how Instawork executes every day and invests in growth. This role will report to the Director of Business Operations.
What You’ll Do
Define key metrics, dashboards, and weekly operating rhythms with our Product teams with particular focus on supply-side growth and marketplace health
Instrument and closely monitor our end-to-end supply lifecycle metrics (from acquisition to conversion to retention) across all of our supply acquisition channels
Identify growth opportunities and propose data-driven recommendations to improve our product and the marketplace
Lead the ideation and execution of product and business changes that drive growth, partnering with Product, Engineering, Design, and Machine Learning/Data Science
Establish a shared vision across the company on product goals and product optimizations by driving consensus on priorities leading to major product improvements
Who You Are
8+ years experience in product analytics roles, business operations / strategy & operations, or equivalent analytical business functions
Obsession with the “craft” of growth: you combine a deep understanding of the hard business math underlying sound growth unit economics with the creativity to propose experiments with novel tactics across different channels
Exceptional data and analytics skills, including advanced fluency in SQL, Python (preferred), BI / data visualization tools, and Excel/Google Sheets
Strong cross-functional and executive communication skills, including a proven ability to influence without authority and build strong working relationships with business partners
Entrepreneurial self-starter that thrives in a fast-moving environment and is capable of independently seeking information, marshaling resources, and delivering results without waiting for direction
For CA based applicants:
The base salary for this position is $180,000 - $200,000
This position is eligible for equity in the form of stock options
This position is eligible for Instawork benefits, including:
A variety of medical, dental, and vision plans with coverage beginning on the date of hire
Flexible paid time off
At least 8 paid company holidays annually
Home office stipend
Phone stipend
Commuter stipend
Supplemental pay on qualified leaves
Employee health savings accounts (HSA) contribution
Flexible spending plans
401K plan
Perkspot - discount program through Lumity
A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above.
Instawork Values
Bias for Action - We are a growing team and an evolving product. We want a team of do’ers to drive the company forward, even if it means making decisions with incomplete information or being wrong.
Act Like an Owner - Treat this company as though it is your own. Execute on the fundamentals, and act creatively to drive growth. Your ability to drive impact in any part of our company is only limited by your courage and conviction, not your job title.
Always Be Learning - We are changing an entire industry. We strive to learn from each other and get better each day, week, and month, so that our team’s learnings can compound and we can all improve, together.
Empathy, Trust, Candor - Empathy for our business partners and professionals means we put ourselves in their shoes. Empathy for our colleagues means we are always upfront and honest with each other, which comes from trust.
#LI-GP6
About Instawork
Founded in 2016, Instawork is the leading flexible work app for local, hourly professionals. Its digital marketplace connects thousands of businesses and more than three million workers, filling a critical role in local economies. Instawork has been featured on CBS News, the Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, Associated Press, and more. In 2022, Instawork was ranked among the country’s top 10% of fastest-growing companies by Inc. 5000 and was included in the Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup list. Instawork was also named the 2022 ACE Award recipient for “Best Innovation” and one of the “Best Business Apps” by Business Insider. Instawork helps businesses in the food & beverage, hospitality, and warehouse/logistics industries fill temporary and permanent job opportunities in more than 25 markets across the U.S. and Canada.
For more information visit www.instawork.com
We value diversity on our team and firmly believe Instawork is stronger when we hire people who make their own unique contributions to our culture. We welcome all applicants and encourage candidates from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Title: Director of Customer Experience
Description: The Director of Customer Experience will direct and oversee the organizations customer experience operations while managing and implementing customer experience…
Descriptions:
Position Summary:
The Director of Customer Experience will direct and oversee the organizations customer experience operations while managing and implementing customer experience policies to ensure that all staff strictly adhere to reach the highest customer satisfaction. The Director of Customer Experience is responsible for identifying business opportunities to improve customers experience, monitoring the performance of the customer service team, developing strategic procedures on service delivery, creating offers and services, and coaching the team to increase business productivity. The Director of Customer Experience must have excellent leadership and communication skills, as well as extensive knowledge of the customer service industry to lead the team and overall customer satisfaction.
Essential Job Functions:
Lead the development and execution of customer experience strategies to support customer service, marketing and revenue goals associated with Athens Services
Provide effective leadership to direct reports incorporating performance management practices through individual performance plans, periodic reviews and feedback sessions, coaching and development, oversee and advise direct reports on the performance management process for associate level employees within their group
Ability to effectively partner with key leaders across the organization to align customer service strategies with broader business priorities and consumer communications
Identifies and recommends or acquires updates and expansions to technology, equipment, and policies that may improve customer experience and retention.
Acts as a liaison between the customer service department and other divisions in the company.
Drafts, implements, and executes policies and procedures to facilitate a quality customer service experience.
Develops and implements methods to record, assess, and analyze customer feedback.
Reviews expense process and oversees budgets and constraints to assure expense goals are met
Evaluates root cause analysis to eliminate reoccurring customer issues
Provides oversight and thought leadership in proposing process changes and documenting and prioritizing business requirements to streamline processes through the development, enhancement, integration, and rollout of new and existing systems
Establishes performance metrics for customer service representatives.
Outstanding presentation skills, including experience creating and delivering presentations to executive teams and driving to desired decision or outcome
Agile and flexible with regards to changing priorities and business needs and in working with diverse teams and people
Strong multi-tasking skills, ability to balance meeting critical deadlines while maintaining strong relationships with business teams, internal technical teams and vendor partners.
Required Qualifications:
10+ years of customer experience/ service leadership experience.
Strong customer service and organizational skills required
Valid driver’s license required
Proficiency with computers including Microsoft Office applications and web-based applications
Able to effectively manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Ability to perform physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field
Waste industry experience
Lean management and Six Sigma background
Bilingual (English/Spanish)

401K, Profit Sharing, Company Match
Employee Assistance Program

Paid Vacation and Sick Time
Recognition programs
Professional development learning

Title: Sr Director, Global Data & Analytics Technology - Remote
Description: Work closely with the company’s Global Data & Analytics Data Scientists and Data Architects to identify and resolve data challenges impacting reporting and…
Descriptions:
The Senior Director, Global Data & Analytics Technology, leads Harbor Freight Tools Data, Analytics and Reporting Technology organization.

Working hand in hand with the Executive Leadership, the Analytics COEs in the divisions and the ETL team in IT, you will define and execute on the roadmap for Harbor Freight’s next generation data platforms. You will own the delivery of the technology supporting all Global Data and Analytics roadmap, with direct and matrixed reports, the management of the D&A technology budgets, resources, and project estimates.

The Senior Director will design, architect, build, and deploy best in class capabilities such as data ingestion, data storages, cloud data technologies, consumptions patterns, data catalogs and master data management solutions needed for the easy consumption of data across the organization.

You will also help setup a modern data governance structure. This role also owns Enterprise Reporting and will also lead a rationalization effort across our enterprise reporting tools and improve the end to end visibility of the business.

As a team leader, you will constantly drive towards excellence in delivery and transition the team to DataOps, Agile and modern ways of working. They will create tight coordination across all IT tech teams supporting Data & Analytics to execute and deliver on the Enterprise Data Strategy and the next generation of Data Products. They will attract, groom, and elevate key talent and partners within the D&A tech space.
As a senior member of the organization, this leader plays a very important role ensuring that the Global Data and Analytics strategies and technology needs are well understood and acted upon across the entire organization. You will create and lead communities of practice across all the D&A and Data Science Resources and bring pristine communication, lateral influencing skills and strong business acumen.

This is a full remote position, reporting to the Chief Technology Officer with approximately 10% travel, a little more during the onboarding phase and key projects phases.

Duties and Responsibilities
As a technology strategist, the Senior Director, Global Data & Analytics, defines the Data Platform strategy and works hand in hand with the Analytics and Data Science Leads in the divisions to define the Global Data and Analytics and associated budget planning.
Leveraging a broad experience, you will develop a deep understanding of Harbor Freight Tools’ operations, to prioritize appropriately and influence the activities and roadmaps across the IT organization and deliver business value.
Partner with other Information Technology leaders to ensure support and alignment of Global Data and Analytics solutions and infrastructure.
Work closely with the company’s Global Data & Analytics Data Scientists and Data Architects to identify and resolve data challenges impacting reporting and analytics.
Collaborate proactively with their business partners to bring innovative and cost-effective solutions that drive differentiation and competitive advantage through new data technologies for the long term.
Designs and executes the Tech strategy for Enterprise Reporting technology solutions across the organization, including capital and resources investments.
Work with the relevant business leaders to understand their critical needs and guide them through the development and deployment process: Solution Architecture, tech stack rationalization, economy of scale, transition planning, Data Engineering, and project delivery, including operations and support.
In partnership with Enterprise & Data Architecture team in IT, define and build the data ingestion and storage or virtualization structure needed to support our next generation of data products, self-service analytics, and data democratization initiatives.
Define, deploy, and support the operational tools required for Master Data Management activities. Collaborate across the organization to setup Data Governance processes and tools.
Ensure technology solutions are properly supported, with optimal performance, security, and uptime for our business users.
Keep a pulse on the D&A new tech innovations, vendors and solutions market, and lead POCs and solutions selection to support the strategy execution.
The Senior Director, Global Data & Analytics Technology, inspires, leads, and directs the Data & Analytics team to promote the capabilities and adoption of Business Intelligence and analytics solutions throughout the company.
Manage and coach a team of direct and matrixed reports, including tech product owners, IT business analysts, data engineers, solution architects, and application/report developers.
Coordinate the activities of Data & Analytics Tech delivery teams across the organization.
Transition the team to operate in a true products and platforms model, drive for high performance, leveraging the frameworks available across IT for Agile and DevOps / DataOps ways of working.
Solicit and provide perspectives on project delivery, including project costs and resourcing, data readiness, application development and change management.
Compile status and progress updates to operational and executive committees.
Scope (Required)
Staff supervision and development — Yes
Decision making-
Drafts policy and resolves problems.
Provide data for decision support.
Negotiate on behalf of management.
Provide consultation or expert advice.
Participate in planning business objectives.
Represents the company in handling complaints, disputes or resolving grievances.
Travel – 10%
Location— Remote
Flex Designation – Anywhere
Requirements
Education (Preferred)
College Degree BS. MBA Preferred.
Skills – Competencies (Required)
High proficiency in problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities.
Strategic thinking: Taking a broad view of the business, industry, and consumer environment to anticipate
and plan for the future. Identifies the focus and defines where to play, how to win and what capabilities and
management systems are required.
Aligns and Engages the Team in the Organization’s Vision: Provides clarity to each team member on their role in achieving
the vision, strategy, and goals.
Embraces and Initiates Change: Distinguishes what to preserve and what to change. Has the courage to
initiate and lead the changes that drive success.
Develops Talent and Capabilities: Identifies and cultivates essential skills and attributes to maximize
individual contribution and engagement.
Energizes and Enables Others: Ignites passion and releases potential to drive success.
Builds Collaborative Relationships: Builds relationships based on trust and respect. Promotes the inclusion
of diverse knowledge, skills, and experiences to achieve results.
Strives for Excellence in Execution: Proactively seeks ways to improve personal and organizational
effectiveness to meet current and future business needs. Learns equally from successes and failures.
Experience (Required)
15 years’ experience leading Data Analytics teams including the design, development and delivery of data technologies and solutions across an entire organization.
The anticipated salary range for this position is $181,900 - $272,900 depending on location, knowledge, skills, education and experience. This position is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition, we offer comprehensive and competitive benefits to Associates (and their families) such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability. Eligible Associates are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan. Associates will accrue paid time off up to 236 hours per year (inclusive of PTO, floating holidays, and paid holidays). Paid sick time up to 80 hours per year unless otherwise required by law.

About Harbor Freight Tools
We're a 45 year-old, $6.5 billion national tool retailer with the energy, enthusiasm, and growth potential of a start-up. We have over 1,300 stores in 48 states across the country and are opening several new locations every week. We offer our customers more than 7,000 tools and accessories, from hand tools and generators to air and power tools, from shop equipment to automotive tools. We provide our customers with the right tool for the right job at the right price, always delivering quality and value.

Title: Director of Workplace Services
Description:
In this role you will oversee and manage all aspects of workplace technology and user support within the organization.
MS Teams, Outlook and MS Office.
Descriptions:
Company Description

Vuori is re-defining what athletic apparel looks like: built to move and sweat in but designed with a casual aesthetic to transition into everyday life. We draw inspiration from an active coastal California lifestyle; an integration of fitness, creative expression and life. Our high energy fast paced retail environment is reflected in the clothes we make. We aim to inspire others to take on all aspects of their lives with clarity, enthusiasm and purpose…while having a lot of fun along the way. We are proud to be an outlet for opportunity and for personal growth and success.

Job Description

In this role you will oversee and manage all aspects of workplace technology and user support within the organization. You will be responsible for ensuring that all employees have access to the necessary tools and resources to perform their jobs efficiently and effectively. This role requires someone who is highly skilled in managing people, technology, and processes to ensure a high level of support to all end-users.
You will define, implement, measure and optimizes processes, policies, service levels and service agreements in alignment with business goals and objectives. You will manage a team of internal staff, as well as external vendors. You will ITSM processes including, Incident & Request Management, Asset Management, Problem Management & workplace IT Procurement.
You will be responsible for delivering change, innovation and problem management in Workplace technology. Workplace technology includes anything end user facing. Core workplace topics include Windows/Mac client, mobile devices, enterprise device management, Exchange mail, unified communications, messaging, file sharing, client security and identity management topics. You will work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to ensure business requirements and quality standards are met when new solutions are delivered.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators for measuring and steering the user support function on a day to day basis.
Define and implement management dashboards showing the performance of the user support function based on management’s information needs, agreed SLAs, and other relevant benchmarks (e.g. industry standards, period-over-period comparisons).
Maintain a high standard of service quality for our users.
Ensure clear and consistent communications on standards and processes to our end users.
Get management buy-in for improving the support function by providing relevant insights and demonstrating transparency.
Implement methodologies to improve ticket resolution, manage user perceptions, and build strong internal relationships.
Choose appropriate technology and other resources to maximize effectiveness.
Market the quality focus of the whole IT department by demonstrating responsiveness & quality focus to the users.
Establishing & maintaining an open dialogue with local, remote and regional users regarding Workplace Services.
Establishing & maintaining healthy working relationships with the IT Infrastructure team, as well as with colleagues in the Software Engineering, Enterprise Solutions and Project Management groups.
Advocating & promoting usage of Workplace Services tools to local and remote.
Transitioning & supporting new Workplace Services’ solutions to the User Service Desk.
Enhancing & improving the quality/usability of Workplace Services’ solutions through coordination with our Subject Matter Experts.
Workplace Services escalation point in our request, incident, problem & change management processes.
Active & ongoing awareness & training for the Workplace Services solutions we deliver.
Continuous enhancement & improvement of Workplace Services solutions.
Ability to prioritize against a fast-paced changing environment.

Qualifications
8+ years of experience with workplace technology and user support in a managerial role with responsibility for budgets and staff.
Detailed knowledge and practical experience with Request & Incident Management, Asset Management and Problem Management processes & procedures.
Experience with ITIL and other related standards and industry best practices.
Proven experience in participating in small to large projects.
Possess strong analytical and organizational skills.
Willingness to work beyond core business hours if necessary.
Experience in deploying, managing, securing. optimizing & supporting the following technologies:
Microsoft Windows, MacOS, iOS & M365 administration
Enterprise device management of Windows, Mac, iOS & Android platforms. Experience with InTune and JAMF Pro is ideal
AV technology
Adobe Creative Cloud
List of Tools Currently in Use that you should be well versed in:
Zendesk
MS Teams, Outlook and MS Office
Slack
Experience working within fast paced rapidly growing company.
Demonstrated strong attention to detail with the ability to balance multiple projects at once and maintain documentation and reporting.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, as well as strong verbal and written communication skills.
Who you are:
A change agent who challenges the status quo.
Results-oriented, detailed, energetic, and focused with a strong desire to learn and succeed.
Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
Builds partnerships and works collaboratively across the organization with others to meet shared objectives.
Relies on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment when making decisions.

Additional Information

Pay Range: From $150,000 - $175,000 annually
Benefits:
Health Insurance
Paid Time Off
Employee Discount
401(k)
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Director, Business Strategy
Description: Business analytics & insights: Proactively identify, track and share business insights to inform the business direction by using both data analysis and business…
Descriptions:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our Team
Do you aspire to become a COO or GM someday? If yes, we would love to talk to you. We are the central Business Strategy and Operations team reporting to the Digital Media BU President. Our scope is across all functions, all customer segments and all product categories with the goal of building the business for the next decade and beyond. We operate around 3 pillars: Business Strategy & Insights, Business Operations and Operations Excellence.
What you'll Do
Business Growth: You will drive strategic projects that move the needle for the business such as enabling our Market intelligence, evaluating key M&A targets, finding opportunities for organic growth across the portfolio.
Business Strategy: Ensure clarity across the portfolio on business priorities. Partner with the business leaders to assess different business models and commercial initiatives.
Business analytics & insights: Proactively identify, track and share business insights to inform the business direction by using both data analysis and business judgment.
Thought leadership : Influence senior collaborators and the business strategy by providing key insights. Drive alignment across leadership.
Be a change agent: Challenge the status quo by finding new, better ways to run the business and lead the charge in setting up DME’s strategy and operations for the next decade. What you'll need to succeed
Background : 10+ years of experience in business strategy or management consulting
Strategic Problem Solver: You are a strong strategic problem solver that can zoom out to see the big picture and then zoom in to deep dive into the details. You can quickly identify the problem to solve, create a framework around it and then set it in motion. You have enough product depth to understand our customer journeys, and are “dangerous” enough on the business side to glean insight from our Sales outlook and financial metrics.
Analytical: You are comfortable building / being in financial models. You are not afraid to dive into a data set and can tease apart MAUs, funnel metrics or churn rates equally.
Storytelling: you can easily take strategy and insights and craft a narrative around it that brings others along for the ride.
Get stuff done: You don’t stop at framing up the problem and the data. You know that ideas are worth nothing without execution, so you create aggressive, yet realistic plans. You collaborate with key partners to ensure we are considering all the right inputs.
Communications and influence: You create crisp, clear and concise communication - both written and verbal. You can influence without direct authority
Leadership: Ability to work with Sr. leaders. You build relationships, set a roadmap and shepherd others to follow it, and while making it a fun journey.
Thrive in ambiguity: You are flexible and agile. You welcome ambiguity as an opportunity to give shape and scope to problems. Get to know the team

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hard working individuals, regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here .

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $138,600 -- $291,900 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Title: Director of Production Audit
Description: In this role, you will be responsible for performing internal production audits, as well as managing 3rd party Guild, MPIPHP, and Union-related audits and…
Descriptions:
We are looking for a talented individual to join our team as Production Auditor. In this role, you will be responsible for performing internal production audits, as well as managing 3rd party Guild, MPIPHP, and Union-related audits and grievances. You will also be a key stakeholder in the development and management of accounting policies and procedures related to the production of original content.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in financial accounting and reporting, and will work closely with our company's finance leadership, production teams, and executives. The successful candidate must be highly motivated, innovative, and passionate about content creation and physical production. They must possess exceptional critical thinking and analytical skills, as well as a deep understanding of tax credits, financial systems, and labor/union requirements.
The ability to multitask and manage diverse projects with exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail is critical. This individual must be able to think on their feet, pivot quickly when necessary, and be non-political with impeccable ethics.
A key component of this role is the development of a world-class production finance operations team, which will require the candidate to be hands-on, entrepreneurial, and systematic. The successful candidate will be a strategic partner to management teams enterprise-wide, offering sound advice and influencing decisions that have a significant business impact.
If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and have a deep passion for content creation and production, we encourage you to apply for this unique opportunity to work with our dynamic and creative SPT Production Finance team.
Essential Responsibilities:
Manage guild, tri-guild and other production related audits performed by guild, unions and plans across the industry.
Review payroll and financial records to ensure proper payment of wages, benefits, and contributions to union health and pension funds.
Investigate and resolve audit disputes related to union rules and agreements
Advise production teams on union rules and regulations, providing guidance and support as needed.
Analyze and interpret union contracts to ensure compliance with all relevant terms and provisions as it relates to audit findings.
Prepare internal production audit reports and communicate findings to management.
Attend union meetings and conferences to stay up-to-date on changes to union regulations and agreements.
Build and maintain positive relationships with union representatives, labor relations, 3rd party production auditors, production teams, and other stakeholders.
Contribute to the development and implementation of policies and procedures related compliance, policies and procedures and auditing processes.
Ensure that the SPT financial controllership and production policies and procedures are uniformly implemented operationally and that Payroll/AP/Reporting are in accordance with standards established by SPT. Perform on-site production audit as needed.
Liaise with Labor Relations, Production Finance, Internal Audit, Finance Ops, Treasury, and IT to ensure policies are current and effectively implemented.
Approve and authorize various accounting procedures.
Assist in the training and mentoring of production finance staff the goal of developing stellar talent.
Candidate will consult on deal structure for contracts.
Travel to production locations to perform on-site compliance reviews, organizational abilities and effectiveness of accounting staff.
Maintain knowledge of current industry trends pertaining to union MOA updates, rate increases and compliance issues.
Technical Skills:
Knowledge of union contracts and regulations, including those of SAG-AFTRA, IATSE, WGA and DGA.
Strong understanding of payroll and accounting practices, including production accounting software such as Entertainment Partners or Cast and Crew.
Familiarity with tax incentives and credits related to film and TV production.
Experience with auditing and financial reporting, including the ability to identify errors and discrepancies.
Familiarity with accounting principles and financial statements.
Ability to use various software applications for data analysis, reporting, and communication, including Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of union health and pension funds, including how they operate and how to calculate contributions.
Understanding of production processes and workflows.
Familiarity with labor laws and regulations related to the entertainment industry.
Ability to interpret and understand legal documents, such as union contracts and agreements.
Basic Qualifications:
Education: BA/BS degree; MBA, CPA, JD or equivalent graduate degree preferred.
Candidate must have 7+ years of film and/or television industry production accounting experience
Eligibility Requirements:
Willingness to travel (domestic and international) and work extended hours if needed.
Must be willing to submit to background check.
Must have work authorization to work in the United States.
Must be 18 years or older.
Must be willing to work in Culver City, CA.
Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV online to be considered.
Desired Characteristics:
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization, including upper management.
Passionate about original programming and dedicated to building and refining new business models.
Strong understanding of payroll processes, union and non-union labor practices, and tax requirements.
Proven ability to lead and manage teams.
Highly analytical with excellent communication skills.
Enthusiastic about complex problem solving and analysis using financial applications, with a particular focus on advanced Excel skills.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, with a high level of academic curiosity, and a focus on generating results.
Exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
The anticipated base salary for this position is $128,100 to $171,300. This role may also qualify for annual incentive and/or comprehensive benefits. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and if applicable, the location of the position.

Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

As part of our commitment to health and safety, all U.S. non-union and O.P.E.I.U. Local 174 applicants and employees must submit proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or request and obtain approval of a reasonable accommodation based on disability or a sincerely held religious belief, practice or observance. To request an accommodation for purposes of participating in the hiring process, you may contact us at SPE_Accommodation_Assistance@spe.sony.com.

Title: CapCut - Head of US Operations
Description:
2.Familiar with the digital content eco-system,strong understanding of data analytics and systematic.
In addition to its basic features, such as video editing,…
Descriptions:
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

About CapCut
CapCut is an all-in-one video editing app that empowers creators to express themselves and transform videos into creative masterpieces. In addition to its basic features, such as video editing, text, stickers, filters, colors and music, CapCut offers free advanced features, including keyframe animation, smooth slow-motion effects, chroma key, Picture-in-Picture (PIP), and stabilization to help you capture and snip moments.

Why Join Us
At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.

Our Team
CapCut team's mission is to inspire video creation by providing users with a wide range of video editing functions and easy-to-use video templates. We aim to build the best and most localized editing experience, to help users catch up with the trend and express themselves.

Responsibilities
1. Grow US template creator base, oversee creator recruitment from all channels, new creator onboarding and education, top creator management and incentive settings.
2. Grow US DAU by diversified, high-quality template content, oversee trending content production, in-app template categorization
3. Regional content and operations calendar management.
4. US creator operations and content programming team management.
Qualifications
1.8+ years of working in content related operations role and have team management experience.
2.Familiar with the digital content eco-system,strong understanding of data analytics and systematic.
3.Fluent in English and familiar with US culture. Passion for video content.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodation, please reach out to us at erin.cai@bytedance.com.

Title: Director, Technical Program Management/Chief of Staff
Description: Intuit’s Consumer Group is seeking a Director of Technical Program Management/Chief of Staff to lead the successful delivery of the portfolio of technical…
Descriptions:
Overview
At Intuit, we believe in using technology to power prosperity around the world. We solve complex problems at the heart of economic opportunity for millions of customers by leveraging the power of many within our ecosystem to help our customers realize their own unique prosperity. The Consumer Group’s products and services including TurboTax, Mint and Turbo do just that for tens of millions of consumers.

Intuit’s Consumer Group is seeking a Director of Technical Program Management/Chief of Staff to lead the successful delivery of the portfolio of technical programs and capabilities across the Product Development organization. The Director of Technical Program Management will report directly to the leader of the Consumer Group Program Office.

As a member of the Program Office and Product Development leadership teams, this individual will leverage their broad experience to solve problems and implement new program efficiencies to deliver successfully. This individual will collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders, cross-functional teams, and external vendors.

The ideal candidate will have a strong program and project management leadership track record, and will draw upon solid analytical, critical thinking, and problem solving skills to effectively manage the key programs most vital to the team. It is essential that the individual be able to quickly establish rapport, credibility, trust and respect throughout the organization at all levels, and be viewed as a team player. The individual must have deep experience managing programs within a constantly evolving organization to support our rapid growth. As the Chief of Staff, you will support a Senior Vice President with an organization of 1600 FTE.
What you'll bring
15+ years of solid experience in program management within a fast moving technology driven organization
Strong technology background, preferably direct software development experience
Strong program management skills, including demonstrated ability to think end-to-end, lead long-term programs, and manage multiple programs simultaneously
Strong track record of program delivery for large cross-functional, cross-organizational programs
Experience attracting, hiring and maintaining top talent
Strong business management ability
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to executives and non-technical leaders
Demonstrated experience developing and coaching team members
Bachelors degree required
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree
Experience working within a high-growth, SaaS technology company
Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly
How you will lead
Facilitate the creation of the product development portfolio including breaking down the portfolio into work that can be owned and managed by program or delivery teams
Develop and manage the reporting structure to provide senior leadership with an independent analysis of the overall portfolio health and visibility into individual program status including a focus on risk mitigation and issue resolution
Collaborate with the product delivery teams to manage dependencies across the Consumer Group and Intuit to effectively deliver business results and programs
Drive tradeoffs, discussions, and decisions across the portfolio by providing senior leadership with options, data, recommendations, and principles behind the decision making process
Adjust the portfolio as needed to changes ensuring continuous speedy delivery against business outcomes
Lead and develop a team of high caliber managers and program managers to drive delivery and create an environment where program managers are doing the best work of their lives
Create a collaborative environment that fosters creativity, innovation, and learning to mature the Program Management craft and build a strong community of Program Managers
Be a catalyst within the organization, someone who can help advance our Product & Technology strategy globally and drive others in the organization to change

Title: Associate Director, Analytics
Description:
30% Structuring and running analytics projects.
Site and app analytics (i.e. Google Analytics, Kochava).
Self-serve analytics platforms (e.g. Alteryx, Datorama)…
Descriptions:
Job Description
Who We Are:
Horizon Media, founded in 1989 by Bill Koenigsberg, is recognized as one of the most innovative marketing and advertising firms. We are headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles and Toronto. A leader in driving business solutions for marketers, Horizon is known for its highly personal approach to client service. Renowned for its incredible culture, Horizon is consistently named to all the prestigious annual Best Places to Work lists published by Fortune, AdAge, Crain’s New York Business and Los Angeles Business Journal. Together we are building a place of belonging.

At Horizon, we understand the value that different perspectives can bring to our clients and culture, so we strive for an environment where our employees feel welcomed, safe and empowered. We value YOU and believe that your authentic voice and unique perspective allows us to create a more rewarding culture, and experience, together.
Our simple recipe for success? We hire talented people (thinkers, doers, dreamers, makers), challenge them and give them every opportunity to grow.
Job Summary:
We are currently seeking an Associate Director, Digital Analytics to help develop and lead our Digital Analytics Department. The ideal candidate will have a thorough understanding of digital metrics; both from a brand and direct response perspective as well as a track record of successfully building analytic approaches across a broad mix of digital clients. A major responsibility of this role will be to build the Horizon Media approach and infrastructure for digital analytics on existing clients as well as provide measurement guidance on all new business pitches. This is a unique opportunity for motivated individuals to help drive innovation and thought leadership throughout a vibrant and dynamic organization.
What You'll Do:
30% Structuring and running analytics projects
20% Leading and mentoring analytics team members
25% Being curious to find better ways to help our clients through applied data science
25% Partnering with internal teams, external partners and our clients
Supervisory Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor Analysts, Senior Analysts and Analytics Managers on the Analytics team
Knowledge and Skills Required:
You should have 5 to 6 years experience with:
Working in a client services environment and helping clients succeed
Building strong relationships across teams in a matrixed organization
Creating frameworks to structure, execute and evaluate marketing measurement initiatives
Efficiently working with data and applying statistical methods in a marketing environment
Telling compelling stories and tailoring your message to specific audiences
Leading and mentoring analytics team members
Creating a positive team culture that rewards curiosity and encourages risk taking
Continuous learning and suggesting better ways of servicing our clients
We know that there are a lot of tools out there and ideally you know how to use these:
Ad-servers and verification tools (i.e. Google Marketing Cloud, DoubleVerify)
Demand Side Platforms (e.g. The Trade Desk)
Site and app analytics (i.e. Google Analytics, Kochava)
Social listening (e.g. Netbase)
Data Management Platforms (e.g. Neustar)
Research Vendors (i.e. Kantar, YouGov)
Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Self-serve analytics platforms (e.g. Alteryx, Datorama)
Scripting languages and relevant packages (e.g. R & tidyr)
Integrated development environments (e.g. RStudio)
SQL to query relational databases
Bonus points if you:
Passionately argue against the use of pie charts
Certificates, licenses and registrations
N/A
Physical Activity and Work Environment
N/A
