Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.
Horizon Media is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
Compensation Range
$125,000.00 - $145,000.00
A successful applicant’s actual base salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure/certifications, and equity. As an organization, we take an aptitude and competency-based hiring approach and offer a competitive total rewards package to our employees.

Title: Director of Audit - Digital Enablement
Description:
Minimum of 10 experience in end to end analytic development and in a big data environment.
Accountable for the delivery of business value for the data products…
Descriptions:
DIRECTOR OF AUDIT

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
The Director, Internal Audit Digital Enablement supports the US audit teams, including the CNB audit team. This role is accountable for the development of data products and services that spans across US audit department and works in conjunction with and under the direction of the Senior Director, US IA Digital Enablement. The role defines, supports and informs business strategies through the breakdown, analysis and understanding of vast amounts of data, both internal and external to RBC and CNB. Provides engagement and leadership to a development team so they can deliver big data solutions for critical applications and regulatory requirements. Interacts with senior leaders to ensure that business value is being generated from the set of enterprise data services that the director is responsible for.
This role’s mandate is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day leadership, direction, and execution of development initiatives of varying size, complexity and type:
Provide leadership to the analytics solution development team on process and technical aspects, fostering a strong collaborative approach to designing and delivering new solutions
Lead the support and maintenance of Internal Audit’s data ecosystem and data governance
Lead and approve the development of solutions executed by the team including user acceptance and production readiness
Lead the development and ongoing maintenance of project proposals, business cases, roadmap and intake to support the implementation of application development solutions
Collaborate closely with other development groups across RBC and CNB to utilize established best practices, processes and methodologies and to leverage and build organizational experience
Coach and develop skills and knowledge of team members, provide constructive feedback and create development opportunities



WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Data Solutions
Partner with Internal Audit teams to thoroughly understand business objectives and technology requirements in order to best support and recommend technology and analytic solutions, both current and future
Lead initiatives to help Internal Audit become a data driven organization
Support build and deployment of data products which span web applications, desktop and data science solutions
Support tooling and automation for the DevOps pipeline and various Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) activities
Accountable for multiple projects/teams that work across Internal Audit platforms
Determine optimal solutions based on project requirements, identify new solutions not present or build on existing solutions already existing within RBC and Internal Audit
Create and identify innovation and automation opportunities
Accountable for the delivery of business value for the data products and services that the director oversees
Prepare for Promotion to Production: Maintain an outlook on performance and user acceptance testing, understand operational risks and mitigations, account for consistency and contingencies, identify and address concerns and challenges
Create and run Proof of Concept (POC) for new technologies and provide feedback, recommendation and/or final decisions
Lead Audit Data Domain automation for data catalogue, data lineage and data quality integration with CDO data governance platform

Analytics Ecosystem, Solution development and Implementation Initiatives
Develop testing methods for user acceptance and quality assurance as applicable, assist in the implementation of automation to realize intended benefits.
Collaborate with change management owners to identify change impact, risks, and mitigation strategies. Ensure that the approved plan is supported within the team, with stakeholders, and affected employees, and ensure that escalations are handled appropriately according to the approved plan.
Provide ongoing support for processes in production to promote operational safety and soundness and maintain end user satisfaction.
Support and guide IA Analysts and Data Leads in building end to end data pipelines as per IA standards
Innovation
Innovate and automate to simplify support model and enable process efficiencies
Actively pursue innovation and ideation. Present opportunities and proposed architecture to senior leadership and lead the build out of those opportunities.
Actively pursue and lead automation opportunities to drive Audit efficiencies
Manage external vendors, assessing feasibility of potential new vendors, current vendors and sourcing potential vendors based on industry knowledge and existing/emerging technology to support Internal Audit projects.
Continuously look to industry products and trends to assess feasibility within CNB and RBC by determining potential use of new products/technology, in part or in whole, to support Internal Audit’s digital road map.
Leverage and build relationships with external product owners to understand potential fit or synergies with RBC’s existing or potential future technologies
Leadership & People Development
Demonstrate leadership presence: Establish credibility by demonstrating subject matter expertise and knowledge in Process Excellence, be confident, authentic and effective, respect diversity and be of service to others, connect and engage stakeholders, build rapport, build strong relationships subject matter experts.
Coach team members - Assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
Provide constructive feedback and coaching to team members in areas of success, opportunities and improvement.
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration, professionalism, and cooperation to meet timing and budget of projects and ongoing maintenance and improvement of production processes.
Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.


Must-Have*
Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Minimum of 10 experience in end to end analytic development and in a big data environment

Skills and Knowledge
Extensive experience in a big data environment with a focus on end to end medium/large project development
Exceptional development expertise using Python/APIs/JS/HTML/DAO
Exceptional experience and knowledge of Database technologies (e.g. SQL, Snowflake, Hadoop) and Data Engineering tools (e.g. Informatica Cloud, Dataiku), Data stage and Data Visualization tools e.g. Tableau
Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).
Familiarity with tools, such as GitHub and Jenkins, as well as software development processes to manage implementation of centralized code and software releases
Strong knowledge and experience with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL) and a strong understanding of data flow and handling
Experience with Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python)
High level of general management skills, including leading, negotiating, communication and team building
Effective interaction/dealing with senior management and ability to maintain a strong relationship with IA staff, partners and external stakeholders
Strong analytical, communication, computer, and interpersonal skills
Leadership by example in teamwork, cross-unit cooperation and information sharing
Compensation
Starting base salary: $127,626 - $237,014 per year. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. This job is eligible for bonus and/or commissions.


To be considered for this position you must meet at least these basic qualifications

Title: Executive Director, HR Reporting and Analytics Services
Description:
Develop strategy to develop next generation of people analytics leaders.
Collaborate with Learning & Development to define HR data analytic skills critical to…
Descriptions:
This position will provide strategic management, and operational leadership to support enterprise HR analytics service delivery. Areas of responsibility include oversight, planning, performance, and delivery of existing and emerging technologies supporting enterprise HR analytics capabilities. This position is expected to support Market/Function HR Leaders, COEs and KP business leaders as it relates to setting enterprise strategic priorities, delivery execution and productivity for People Analytics & Insights (PA&I). Responsibilities include transformation & innovation, operational excellence, program and project management, partnership development with key stakeholders inside and outside HR (e.g., workforce development, EBS, IT, Finance etc.), vendor management, product management, service delivery, governance and adherence to KP policies and committee approvals. This position is expected to competently manage growth and change; and exhibit high aptitude for financial stewardship and people development.




Essential Responsibilities:
Drive enterprise alignment across PA&I strategic priorities and strategies and objectives to orchestrate and accelerate a consistent people analytics strategy for HR and the enterprise
Set PA&I strategic direction and future bodies of work based on the collection and development of internal and external use cases relevant to the core elements of the talent lifecycle and how they influence business outcomes
Define exceptional service delivery and excellence to continuously improve core services with an emphasis on efficiency, agility and precision
Create strategic vendor alliances and continuously scan ecosystem of vendors to ensure an understanding of available people analytics technologies
Drive the development of criteria and business case requirements for moving new work into the PA&I organization
Develop strategy to develop next generation of people analytics leaders
Continuously develop relationships with key partners in IT, Finance, HR COEs, and other analytic HR groups for analytical development (e.g., learning from failures, adopting best practices, etc.)
Collaborate with Learning & Development to define HR data analytic skills critical to business evolution
Serve as chief spokesperson for promoting the value of PA&I to internal and external constituents
Drive the development of aspirational/transformational use cases and continuously implement new ways of thinking and innovative solutions
Anticipate emerging demands by utilizing data and metrics, customer feedback & survey results, and external research
Set direction and monitor key process transformation within PA&I (e.g., intake, service delivery)
Revitalize and maintain an ongoing community of PA&I practitioners to ensure a level of consistency across the enterprise
Lead the efforts to identify root causes of performance, document and implement actions for continuous improvement. Develop and implement a user satisfaction process.
Lead the evaluation and recommend process to update data security configurations and ensure compliance.
Drive the development of SLAs based on work prioritization and accountable to ensure the team meets SLA commitments
Accountable to ensure resources are allocated to highest priority work and match individual team members’ skills to appropriate work
Accountable to develop governance structure to provide regular reports regarding key PA&I performance metrics (e.g., cases handled, case aging, reports run, self-service usage); track metrics related to the quality of PA&I services
Develop communication strategy to ensure key accomplishments, success stories, product releases and other areas of interest to key stakeholders.
Responsible to manage budget to deliver on agreed upon commitments and deliver agreed upon financial commitments within allocated budget.

Basic Qualifications:

Experience
Minimum of fifteen (15) years of progressive analytics experience in roles of increasing responsibility; expertise in complex, large project implementations across various business units and geographic locations.


Education
Bachelors degree in engineering, computer science or related technical field is required.


License, Certification, Registration
N/A


Additional Requirements:
Proven experience in multi-disciplinary leadership capacity, ability to grow and develop high performance teams that are geographically dispersed within a matrixed organization.
This position requires a strong and proven analytics leader who understands and leads technology solutions to drive real business value.
A track record of solid leadership experience and background in negotiating commitments to achieve long-term partnerships including extensive system integrator/vendor experience, a broad understanding of the software delivery lifecycle, including financial planning and budgeting experience, and understanding of the healthcare industry. Experience in these areas are needed to chart the long term architectural and investment roadmap for Enterprise Analytics.
A proven solution-oriented leader who leads by example through demonstrated leadership, possesses consensus building skills, a true team orientation, and presents expected leadership behaviors.


Preferred Qualifications:
Recent experience in the area of large data warehouse initiatives is preferred.

This position has a target base salary of $225,000 to $281,250 and is eligible for incentive compensation, comprehensive health, wellness, time off, savings, and retirement benefits, as well as relocation support, as applicable.

Title: Director of Applications (1070)
Description: Strong analytic and deep systems-thinking necessary to interpret data to inform goals and strategy, as well as build infrastructure and systems where none exist…
Descriptions:
About
Job Class: 1070, IS Project Director
Salary Range: $120,095 - $163,453/annually
Appointment Type: Permanent Exempt (what does this mean?)
Hours: Full Time
Who We Are
The San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, serving more than 52,000 students who speak more than 44 documented languages across 136 schools in the city of San Francisco every year. We aim for every student who attends SFUSD schools to discover his or her spark, along with a strong sense of self and purpose, and that all students graduate from high school ready for college and career, and equipped with the skills, capacities and dispositions outlined in SFUSD’s Graduate Profile. Every day in our quest to achieve this mission we provide each and every student the quality instruction and equitable support required to thrive in the 21st century.
What It Means to Work Here
The SFUSD community is unified by our Core Values:

Student-centered: We put students’ needs first
Fearless: We persist through challenges
United: We celebrate and build on each other’s strengths
Social Justice: We stand with those most vulnerable in our community
Diversity-driven: We respect and seek to understand each person

We are also inspired by Vision 2025, which captures our aspirations and vision for the future of public education in San Francisco. Alongside the District’s strategic plan, Transform Learning. Transform Lives. SFUSD is reimagining how public education will change over the next decade to meet the dynamic future of San Francisco. As a CORE district, SFUSD is also a leader in critical systems change for more comprehensive school accountability and innovations that help strengthen the instructional core, which is the foundation of our strategic plan and Vision 2025.
Who We Want
We want talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission steeped in equity, and who are motivated to unleash our children’s potential. We want people who are strong collaborators, skilled communicators, problem solvers and who are comfortable in a community of continuous learning.

As the 1070 Director, Business Applications, you will report to the 0994 Executive Director, Enterprise Systems in the Department of Technology (DoT). You will lead a dedicated team of software engineers, functional architects, and business analysts to ensure that the district’s business applications, specifically our employee and financial systems, are accessible, reliable, flexible, and secure to meet the diverse business and operational needs of the SFUSD community. We want a collaborative leader who can provide direction, structure, and support focused on operational excellence, data accuracy, system integration, technical innovation, and high-quality service aligned to SFUSD’s Service Standards.

We expect our 1070 Director, Business Applications to:
Lead and project manage the technical delivery of business-focused technology tools and systems for SFUSD, inclusive of overseeing the system development and management lifecycle and ongoing system administration and data management functions
Serve as the technical lead for SFUSD’s implementation of its new human capital and payroll management system, SAP SuccessFactors called EMPowerSF and successfully guide SFUSD through the technical transition from its legacy system to a new, cloud-based platform
Create infrastructure to support the management and operations of SFUSD’s business systems, inclusive of process design and improvement, automation, data/analytics, issue resolution and escalation, training resources, tracking tools and communication templates
Supervise, coach, and support staff within the Business Applications team, taking a service leadership approach to supervision and ensuring that team members understand the interdependency of delivering and managing technology systems in service of a coherent technology experience
Builds strong working relationships with SFUSD school leaders, division chiefs, and business teams, particularly human resources, budget and business services, and labor, to help ensure that district’s business systems meet the needs of the SFUSD community
Manage relationships with vendors and partners that provide application and technology services for SFUSD to ensure products, systems, and tools effectively integrate with and support the business functions of the district
Effectively communicate and manage change efforts for SFUSD business applications, collaborating with business partners and DoT teams to help ensure effective system/tool adoption by users and sustainable management for DoT and district teams
The Strongest Candidate Will Have
The strongest candidates will have:

Knowledge of public/urban schools and a passionate belief in SFUSD’s commitment to equity
Experience working and leading in the K12 education field
Success leading diverse and effective teams and individuals
A proven record of effectively planning, organizing, and allocating resources to take action and achieve goals
Strong analytic and deep systems-thinking necessary to interpret data to inform goals and strategy, as well as build infrastructure and systems where none exist
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build effective working relationships with senior level district staff and colleagues
Experience and success with effective written and verbal communication, facilitation and presentations to large groups and a variety of audiences (e.g., staff meetings, executive briefings, public board meetings, memos, district-wide messaging)
Ability to work effectively across multiple functions, roles, and differences within a complex organization
Experience managing employee information systems, particularly PeopleSoft and SAP SuccessFactors
Master’s degree in computer science, information systems management or related field
Minimum Qualifications
Education: An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field].

Experience: Seven (7) years of experience in system administration, information systems development, maintenance and support, or information technology project management, including two (2) years of supervisory experience

Substitution: Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION: Essential duties require the following physical skills and work requirements: May require sufficient strength and coordination for lifting, pushing, pulling and/or carrying the weight of computer equipment. Requires bending, stooping and/or crawling in order to install or repair computer or printer cables. Requires hand/eye coordination for semi-skilled movements, such as taking apart casings, installing parts and reconnecting computers, and keyboard use. Involves extensive VDT exposure.
What We Offer
SFUSD offers a competitive salary of $127,301 - $173,261/annually commensurate with experience in a similar position. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan including dental and vision plans, a defined benefit pension plan, disability, life insurance, flexible spending account options and vacation time. We also offer an inclusive and equity-centered environment where we encourage staff to bring their whole selves to work.
How to Apply
If you have previously applied to a job on JobAps, you will be prompted to “select an application to copy;” please select any previous application: you will have the opportunity to update the application and your resume; if you have not previously applied you will be prompted to create a new account
You will be prompted to electronically attach a letter of interest, resume, list of professional references and any applicable credentials or licenses
Our Human Resources team will then review your entire application to determine your eligibility status and contact you directly should you move forward in the process

Applicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at

Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification from this and future job opportunities with the San Francisco Unified School District.

Non-Discrimination Policy
San Francisco Unified School District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; or on the basis of a person’s association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This policy extends to San Francisco County Office of Education, including community school programs and activities.

Title: Director of Revenue Operations
Description: We are looking for an experienced Director of Revenue Operations who will be responsible for overseeing our revenue forecasting, reporting and analytics, and…
Descriptions:
C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading provider of Enterprise AI software for accelerating digital transformation. The proven C3 AI Platform provides comprehensive services to build enterprise-scale AI applications more efficiently and cost-effectively than alternative approaches. The core of the C3 AI offering is an open, data-driven AI architecture that dramatically simplifies data science and application development. Learn more at: www.c3.ai
We are looking for an experienced Director of Revenue Operations who will be responsible for overseeing our revenue forecasting, reporting and analytics, and supporting automated systems and tools. The ideal candidate will have a master's degree in a related field and a strong background in revenue operations and management.
Responsibilities:
Focus on managing the consolidated revenue model, driving regular forecast updates, and producing weekly/monthly reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Finance, Pre-Sales, Services, and Operations to review and report business performance.
Analyze and interpret revenue data to provide strategic recommendations to senior leadership to drive revenue growth.
Become a subject matter expert for all revenue metrics, with a focus toward understanding customer-level detail and our key growth drivers to provide actionable insights to leadership.
Develop and maintain revenue metrics and KPls to track performance against business objectives. Develop and maintain internal management reporting, dashboards, and ad, hoc analysis.
Develop and implement revenue forecasting models and methodologies that accurately predict revenue trends and identify opportunities for growth.
Manage the design, implementation, and maintenance of automated revenue management systems to streamline our revenue processes.
Collaborate with Sales and Finance on the quarterly planning process.
Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends and best practices in revenue operations and management.
Qualifications:
A master's degree in a relevant field such as Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.
8+ years of experience in revenue operations, revenue management, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and experience in revenue forecasting and data analysis.
Expert-level financial modeling skills, with strong attention to detail and high standards for quality
Experience managing automated revenue management systems, such as Microsoft Dynamics, C3 Al CRM, or similar CRM tools. NetSuite knowledge is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Ability to operate independently and manage ambiguity in a fast-moving environment. Strong understanding of both product-led growth and sales-led growth B2B SaaS businesses, metrics, and customer lifecycle.
Knowledge of ASC 606 accounting standards is a must.
C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include:
Generous equity plan.
Salary range: $170,000 - $225,000 USD.

Title: Director, Biomarker Sciences
Description: This individual will contribute to the strategic direction of IDEAYA by leading one to several biomarker programs with an aim of identifying and developing…
Descriptions:
IDEAYA Biosciences (NASDAQ: IDYA) is a public, clinical-stage synthetic lethality-focused precision medicine oncology company committed to the discovery and development of targeted therapeutics for patient populations selected using DNA sequencing and other molecular diagnostics. Our approach integrates extensive capabilities in identifying and validating translational biomarkers with small molecule drug discovery to select patient populations most likely to benefit from the therapies we are developing. We are applying these capabilities across multiple classes of precision medicine, including direct targeting of oncogenic pathways and synthetic lethality – which represents an emerging class of precision medicine targets. We believe this diversified approach will enable us to deliver the right medicine to the right patient to drive a more robust clinical response.
IDEAYA has an industry leading platform and pipeline in Synthetic Lethality. IDEAYA has established strategic collaborations with Amgen and Pfizer supporting its pipeline programs, and also has wholly-owned or controlled clinical and preclinical programs.
When you're at IDEAYA, you will be in the midst of brilliant minds working on precision medicine therapies to help cancer patients. We are passionate and committed about being on the forefront of oncology medicine, which means we all have a high internal drive that is at the very core of every person at IDEAYA. We are inquisitive, ask deep questions, and are data-driven innovators who like to collaborate and use team work to move science forward. For more information, please see www.ideayabio.com.

Position Summary:
This individual will contribute to the strategic direction of IDEAYA by leading one to several biomarker programs with an aim of identifying and developing assays required to evaluate pharmacodynamics (PD) as well as to implement clinically relevant predictive biomarkers that enrich for patients responsive to IDEAYA therapeutics. Linked to this, leading companion diagnostic strategies where appropriate will also be required. Importantly, bench to bedside back to bench activities will be coordinated by this individual via collaboration with discovery colleagues. In the context of pediatric planning, participation in the pre-clinical activities supportive of the initial pediatric study plans (iPSP) for individual programs will also be necessary.

This role will require you to work from our office in San Diego, California or South San Francisco, California.
What you'll do:
Develop and implement a biomarker plan for individual programs that includes assay development, timelines, budget, and data output and analysis plans
Lead all proof of mechanism activities
Interrogate biomarker hypotheses using an array of techniques, including cell proliferation and viability assays, Western blotting, CRISPR/Cas9, Nanostring/RNASeq, siRNA/shRNA knockdown, immunofluorescence and other methods either coordinated with discovery research or through CRO outsourcing
Identify patient selection biomarkers and strategies
Establish and execute a companion diagnostic plan
Coordinate time appropriate pediatric study planning
Present data and report on project status at team, departmental, and governance meetings
A team player with strong interpersonal skills who establishes & nurtures highly effective relationships with colleagues and key stakeholders to support and advance project goals and objectives
Self-motivated to work effectively and collaboratively in a dynamic environment with an openness to learn new skills
Possess strong organizational skills and be able to multi-task, to meet timelines efficiently and productively
Ability to work independently in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Requirements:
PhD degree in cell and molecular biology or related discipline with 5+ years of biomarker related experience in industry
Comprehensive knowledge of cancer biology and drug development
Experience with molecular and cell biology techniques and advance data analysis tools.
Experience with the analysis and interpretation of genomic and other datasets from preclinical and clinical samples
Broad experience with diverse biomarker technologies including but not limited to IHC, gene expression, NGS and other genomic technologies, along with demonstrated ability to implement such technologies in the clinical setting
Experience working in close concert with research scientists and bioinformaticians to translate hypotheses generated from preclinical and clinical samples or data sets
Experience working on drug development teams and broad familiarity with biomarkers in early and later stage clinical development
Ability to work closely with clinical operations to ensure implementation and collection of relevant clinical biomarker data; including contributions to clinical protocols, other regulatory documents and oversight of CRO/vendor quality.
$224,370 - $265,128 a year
The salary range is an estimate and may vary based on the Company’s compensation practices.
The Company complies with all laws respecting equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against applicants with regard to any protected characteristic as defined by federal, state, and local law. This position requires you to work onsite at the Company’s facilities, with partial work-from-home flexibility, and the Company requires that all employees working in its facilities be fully vaccinated (except as required by applicable law). Therefore, this position requires you to be fully vaccinated from COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for medical or religious reasons, and/or as otherwise required by applicable law. The Company considers you fully vaccinated once 14 days have passed since you received either the second dose in a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine series or a single-dose COVID-19 vaccine. The vaccine must have been FDA approved, have emergency use authorization from the FDA, or, for persons fully vaccinated outside of the U.S., be listed for emergency use by the World Health Organization.

Benefits
Along with our highly collaborative and inclusive environment, IDEAYA offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that includes (but is not limited to) medical/dental/vision coverage (100% company paid for employees and 90% company paid for dependents), retirement benefits, ESPP and wellness programs. All full-time employees will also be eligible for an annual bonus and equity refresh.

IDEAYA is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with applicable law, IDEAYA does not discriminate in hiring or otherwise in employment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. EOE/AA/Vets.

Title: Head of TS Online Banking and User Experience, Director
Company: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
Description:
This role is located in NYC, PGH, LA, or Remote.
Sets strategy and leads team for Digital (Online/Mobile) banking experience optimization, including research,…
Descriptions:
Head of TS Online Banking and User Experience, Director
Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 238 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.
We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Head of TS Online Banking and User Experience to join our Treasury Services team . This role is located in NYC, PGH, LA, or Remote.
In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:
Sets strategy and leads team for Digital (Online/Mobile) banking experience optimization, including research, functionality and process reengineering, user journey and UI design etc. Works closely with engineers, UX teams, core Product owners, and clients, as well as use data and KPIs to continuously iterate on solutions to drive adoption and usage.
Owns business prioritization of change requests through weighing business and technical prioritization.
Leads Commercialization efforts and rollouts with delivery teams to ensure adoption and commercial success.
Perform competitive analysis to ensure we are creating a differentiate market leading experience
To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Minimum 7-15 years of total work experience preferred. At least 5 years of Product experience in developing financial digital experiences and proven track record of driving adoption.
Passionate about client experience, open to new ideas and new ways to doing things. Strategic thinker and proficient problem solver with minimum involvement from seniors.
Proven experience in product design/human center design, use cases, flow diagrams, prototypes , scenarios etc,. And excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to simplify complex concepts and the ability to influence others.
Recruit, motivate and develop staff, maximizing their individual contribution, and their professional growth. Guide staff in building the business case for firm offerings and ensures that the team stays on top of the competitive landscape and the industry environment.
At BNY Mellon, our inclusive culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:
Fortune World’s Most Admired Companies & Top 20 for Diversity and Inclusion
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI)
Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion , Disability: IN – 100% score
100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, Fast Company
Human Rights Campaign Foundation, 100% score Corporate Equality Index
CDP’s Climate Change ‘A List’
Our Benefits:
BNY Mellon offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves that can support you and your family through moments that matter.
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. Title: Director of Operations - GPU
Location: San Jose, CA 95134 (North San Jose area)
Description:
The ideal candidate will have senior management experience in a dynamic setting.
The role requires outstanding organizational, communication, and leadership…
Descriptions:
Position Summary
Samsung is founded on a simple philosophy – the endless pursuit of excellence will create a better world for all. At Samsung Austin Research and Development Center (SARC) and Advanced Computing Lab (ACL), we are building a center of excellence for Intellectual Property (IP) that is applied to high-performance computing devices (mobile, AR/VR, automotive) consumed by millions of people around the world. Come build with us!

To help us continue growing, we’re seeking an experienced Director of Operations to join a highly skilled team. The ideal candidate will have senior management experience in a dynamic setting. The role requires outstanding organizational, communication, and leadership skills and an ability to develop innovative solutions that push boundaries. The Director of Operations will interface and influence executives on strategies and long-term plans that usher in new levels of productivity and success for SARC/ACL.
Role and Responsibilities
As the Director of Operations at SARC/ACL, you will be responsible for key areas that drive significate impact for our overall business.
Software Tools Licensing Agreements: You will define, lead, and manage a portfolio of EDA tools and licenses for SARC/ACL. You will be collaborating with and influence engineering, procurement, finance, and EDA vendors to ensure we are executing to our strategies.
Budget Planning: You will develop, present and oversee budgets including capital and expenses – projections, multi-year forecasting; and gain buy-in from executive leadership at our headquarters.
Export Compliance and Security: You will lead the categorization of our products to ensure it adheres to export standards, verify documents, produce progress reports, and liaise with internal and external partners.
Purchasing and Procurement: You will be in charge of locating and maintaining key vendors, negotiating purchasing agreements and building partnerships to meet our demands and align with our goals.
Managing IT: You will be responsible for planning, designing, and directing all operational activities for SARC/ACL, as well as provide direction and support for IT solutions that enhance mission-critical business operations and ensure our engineering teams compute cluster is running with high availability.
Facilities: Overseeing our facilities including maintenance to ensure we are creating an accommodating work environment for all SARC/ACL employees.
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or related; or equivalent experience.
At least 10 years of relevant experience
Superior negotiation skills for both internal and external purposes
Business process oriented to drive documented and repeatable processes to enable, manage, and measure results
Influence and presentation skills – ability to influence partner groups and to develop/present strategic data to executives
Strong working knowledge of data analysis and performance metrics
Proven experience in managing multiple tasks simultaneously with a rigid determination to meet deadlines. Undaunted by challenges with a problem-solving positive attitude.
Experience in developing budgets and business plans
Strong data analytics capability
EDA license or software license management experience strongly preferred
Some programming knowledge preferred to recognize and drive efficiency
Compensation for this role will vary among specific regions due to geographic differentials in the labor market, actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparisons to other employees in the role. However, compensation in the following regions is expected to be as follows:
Colorado: Compensation is expected to be between $214,916 and $333,119
NYC: Compensation is expected to be between $231,953 and $359,527
Washington State: Compensation is expected to be between $214,916 and $333,119
California: Compensation is expected to be between $231,953 and $359,527
Regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) have access to benefits including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), free onsite lunch, employee purchase program, tuition assistance (after 6 months), paid time off, student loan program, wellness incentives, and many more. In addition, regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) are eligible for MBO bonus compensation, based on company, division, and individual performance.
#SARC
#ACL
This position requires the ability to access information subject to U.S. export control restrictions. Applicants must have the ability to access export controlled information or be eligible to receive a government authorization to access export-controlled information

Title: Head of Product Growth
Description:
Run an analytics and insights function.
The Head of Product Growth for an O Positiv product line will run the P&L and engine of growth for one of O Positiv's…
Descriptions:
Who We Are
O Positiv is a Los Angeles-based health & wellness brand built on the idea that small acts of self-care produce positive outcomes. We've created the first-ever PMS gummy vitamin, FLO Vitamins, designed to make periods and the symptoms that come with them more tolerable. Our team is small-yet-mighty, with big ambitions and an entrepreneurial spirit. We are an early-stage startup gaining serious traction (check us out in Forbes' top trends in women's health), with a strong brand presence and some amazing advisors. We're growing quickly, and we'll give you the opportunity to do the same.
Your Role
The Head of Product Growth for an O Positiv product line will run the P&L and engine of growth for one of O Positiv's women's wellness product lines. This is a highly strategic and analytical role for someone interested in understanding how companies can scale their revenue by orders of magnitude.
This role owns performance marketing and sales activities which drive customer demand to acquire new customers, as well as activities that increase retention and customer satisfaction. This includes owning strategy, development, testing frameworks, execution, and analysis of performance marketing plans, including organic and paid campaigns.
We are looking for someone who is hyper-analytical and data-obsessed, with a positive, entrepreneurial spirit. The ideal candidate can manage and own the performance of multiple acquisition channels, is able to work with multiple stakeholders, and can ensure all projects are executed within deadlines. As the Head of Growth for that product line, you'll be responsible for staying on top of industry trends and making data-informed decisions to deliver against sharp KPIs. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment and startup culture, and is excited to set and meet aggressive goals.
The Head of Growth sits on the Growth team and will work cross-functionally within the organization to further expand marketing efforts and develop our product and brand.
Responsibilities and Duties

Own the acquisition strategy
Determine where potential customers spend their time and design strategies to reach and acquire them
Deploy large budgets in performance media campaigns
Iterate and test messaging and tactics to better optimize costs to acquire customers

Own the retention strategy
Design customer journeys across CX and email to retain and delight customers
Collect insights and design campaigns to improve experience
Work to reduce subscription churn

Run an analytics and insights function
Design processes and dashboards to understand performance across a diverse set of channels
Figure out how to look for signs of successful campaigns and actions to take to scale
Evolve the organization's knowledge of performance and how to predict success
Qualifications and Skills

Experience:
Interest in scaling the revenue of start ups for successful exit
Experience with data analysis (e.g. Excel)
Bachelor's Degree


Interpersonal:
Strong leadership & communication skills: listen, mentor, and teach by example
Ability to manage multiple moving pieces
Strong time management and prioritization skills
Adaptable to new social platforms and advertising technologies
Thoughtful and self-reflective, willingness to learn
Team-player, hard-working, organized, and goal-oriented
Excitement for startups and building from the ground up
Additional Preferred Experience and Skills:
2+ years experience at a top tier management consultancy or investment bank

Hours and Compensation
The anticipated base compensation range for this role will be $110,000 - $205,000. Compensation will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and local market rates.
Job Type: Full-time preferred
Pay based on prior experience
Benefits & Perks
Flexible PTO, Sick Days, and Wellness Days
Monthly Social Hours
Medical, Vision, and Dental Coverage
An environment of collaboration, high performance, & respect amongst all employees and managers

Position will be based in our office in Santa Monica, Los Angeles County, CA
O Positiv is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
O Positiv believes in the power of building a diverse and culturally inclusive team. We seek candidates from all backgrounds to join our teams. We're driven to build a workplace based on inclusive behaviors and equitable systems, where all employees can bring their authentic selves, feel engaged, and share their perspectives as a valued member of O Positiv.

Title: Senior Manager/Associate Director, Trade Operations, Analytics, and Reporting
Description: The Sr. Manager/Associate Director of Trade Operations, Analytics and Reporting is responsible for supporting all trade operation activities, analytics, and…
Descriptions:
Title: Sr. Manager/Associate Director, Trade Operations, Analytics, and Reporting
Reports To: Senior Director, Trade Operations, Distribution and Channel Strategy
Location: Field Based
Classification: Exempt

Overview:
The Sr. Manager/Associate Director of Trade Operations, Analytics and Reporting is responsible for supporting all trade operation activities, analytics, and reporting. The individual will provide technical expertise to manage customer order flow, perform inventory analytics, provide customer service support to key trading partners and support financial accounts receivable processes. The successful candidate will display an ability to work with multiple vendor partners and assess data to inform organization of trade-related activities and provide actionable updates to senior management. The person will collaborate with the Sr. Director of Trade Operations, Distribution and Channel Strategy on industry communication, customer interaction, and forecasting, and will collaborate with internal teams to provide the support needed for commercial operations. This function is critical to effective operations of the Trade group and the achievement of sales and margin targets.
Relationships: The Sr. Manager/Associate Director of Trade Operations, Analytics and Reporting reports to the Sr. Director of Trade Operations, Distribution and Channel Strategy. The position works closely with pricing, commercial analytics, finance, legal, supply chain, market access, quality, sales, account teams and marketing. The position will provide the Sr. Director of Trade Operations, Distribution and Channel Strategy with account-level analytics and insights, operation support, and representation of the Trade Department with cross-functional business partners.
Responsibilities:
Primary responsibilities include 3PL management, return management, PAP stocking, wholesaler ordering, inventory management, distributor communication and channel analysis and reporting.
Trade Operations
Coordinate product shipment logistics including PAP, inventory levels, and other related outbound activity issues relating to distribution; act as the point person with buyers and customer service; drive effective operations with wholesaler stocking, identifying areas of opportunities and efficiencies; provide smooth logistics, positive customer experiences and effective issue resolution.
Directs 3PL and other partners to ensure products are warehoused within quality, regulatory and supply chain standards and customer and distribution services are executed in an accurate and timely manner.
Manage ordering patterns and shipping changes due to holidays, end of quarter and end of year; monitor policy updates; optimize allocation of inventory to appropriate inventory levels across the wholesale channel.
Manage the return process, review RAs, minimize over crediting and track return credits.
Forecast and manage wholesaler/distributor inventory levels to meet product demand while minimizing returns and meeting company goals.
Reduce the risk of product disruptions by working closely with Sales and Account teams and account buyers to ensure adequate supply at forward DC's and distributors in order to avoid distribution operational issues.
Institute and measure key performance indicators to improve process efficiencies, costs, and performance; work cross-functionally to optimize processes and develop and execute continuous improvement initiatives against established budget and performance goals.
Develop and lead performance monitoring, business rules and contracting activities for 3PL and Distribution services from Order to Cash.
Establish key metrics for the 3PL and hold them accountable through regular business review meetings.
Drive and manage cross functional alignment of demand and supply planning, processes, requirements, and assumptions, for forecasting alignment and management of inventory targets.
Work closely with Pricing and Contracting and Finance to manage price increases, including wholesaler notifications and ensure that subsequent purchase orders are appropriate.
In collaboration with Marketing and Pricing and Contracting, develop and implement trade marketing programs including development of Trade deal sheets and other launch and promotional material.
Leverage wholesaler and retail pharmacy manufacturer services and marketing programs to increase reach and frequency with hospital, pharmacy, and health care professionals.
Analytics and Reporting
Develop financial models, analytical tools, and business presentations as needed to support Trade related projects.
Effectively execute the monitoring of trade account level data and provide internal teams with insight to shape overall business strategies.
Build and leverage data and IT solutions to be able to track entire supply chain to ensure timely and accurate collection and dissemination of distribution and dispensing data to Finance, Market Access, Sales and Commercial Analytics.
Ensure data feed from trade customers allow for real time analysis of ex-factory and ex-distributor sales
Monitor trends and provide timely demand vs. supply analysis for areas of concern with customer and/or product inquiries. Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, analyze market trends, monitor competitive intelligence, customer trends and recent business activities in an effort to maximize sales and profitability.
Qualifications
7 - 10 years' experience in the pharmaceutical industry including 3-5+ years in U.S. Trade distribution experience.
Strong analytical skills with ability to complete quantitative and qualitative analysis of complex strategic initiatives.
Knowledge of the business models, influence/impact, and decision drivers of U.S. commercial and government payers and PBM's as well as channel customers (i.e. pharmacy and distribution, etc.).
Experience leading a cross-functional team of colleagues without a direct reporting relationship.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex business challenges and data-driven recommendations to senior leaders.
Experience reviewing marketing materials with medical, legal, and regulatory review committees.
Undergraduate degree required; advanced degree preferred.
Knowledge and experience in and/or working across brand marketing, sales and sales management in the pharmaceutical, biotech industry.
Extensive knowledge and experience across pharmaceutical product life cycle.
Proven results in US Trade and product launches.
Proven ability of successfully managing complexity, solving problems, and building strong relationships.
Proven track record in U.S. distribution for retail and specialty products.
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams, strong written and oral communication skills.
Must be willing to travel - 10%-30%
The Base Salary Range for this position is $130,000 to $180,000. Coherus considers various factors, including professional background and work experience, when determining base pay. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary.
Beginning July 19, 2021, Coherus BioSciences requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date. This requirement is a condition of employment at Coherus BioSciences, and it applies regardless of whether the position is located at a Coherus BioSciences facility or is fully remote. If you are unable to receive the vaccine due to a disability or serious medical condition, or because it is prohibited as a result of your sincerely held religious beliefs, you will have an opportunity to request a reasonable accommodation.

Title: Head of Revenue Operations
Description:
Identify revenue expansion opportunities and work across teams on strategic planning, business analytics, and sales operations.
New hire stock option grant.
Descriptions:
Want to revolutionize Healthcare?
To create a healthcare system with effective health information exchange, healthcare organizations need more than a series of connections between each other. They need assurance that the data being exchanged is meaningful and to know it will be delivered when and where they need it.
Founded in 2014, Health Gorilla provides access to actionable patient data, supporting a diverse set of clinical use cases and improving outcomes across the country. We work with some of the leading companies in digital health, including Oscar Health, TruePill, Virta Health, and many others.

As the Head of Revenue Operations at Health Gorilla, you will report to the SVP of Finance on the G&A Team. You will bring industry-leading expertise in process development, business development, Goal implementation and management, and business operations. You will manage internal KPIs, internal Projects, Revenue Operations, Sales Enablement, Market Operations, and Data Reporting.
What you will do at Health Gorilla
Identify revenue expansion opportunities and work across teams on strategic planning, business analytics, and sales operations
Collaborate with executive-level management in the development of performance goals and long-term business operational plans
Analyze current operational processes and performance, recommending solutions for improvement to ensure overall productivity
Lead change throughout the organization, including improving our performance, operational, organizational, and financial metrics
What you bring to the role
7+ years of experience leading dynamic organizations and with experience building and coaching diverse teams
Domain expertise in enterprise B2B SaaS technology in Healthcare or other niche markets
Understanding of practices, theories, technologies, and policies involved in operations management, business, and finance
Fluency in systems and sales tools, including CPQ, prospecting and data tools (RevOps.io, Apollo, Pardot), Sales Intelligence tools (Kluster), and other tools that improve Sales/CS productivity (Docusign, Everstage)
Experience with deal structure and revenue optimization
Affinity for data analysis and performance metrics
Knack for sharing findings in a clear manner that improves outcomes
Experience with financial and strategic modeling
Excellent commercial, deal execution, strategy planning and sales operational skills

What You Will Love About Us!
Health Gorilla takes a market-based approach to pay, and the base salary range for this role is $195,000 to $240,000, based on experience and geography. Please note that ranges may be modified at any time, and there is no guarantee offers will be at the top of a posted range.
Discretionary bonus eligibility
New hire stock option grant
401(k) plan with 3% matching
Unlimited PTO plus 12 Holidays
Medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
Short-, long-term disability, and life insurance
Optional: Pet Insurance, Legal Services, and Credit Monitoring
Mental health and wellness support
Paid parental leave (up to 12 weeks)
Monthly stipend for phone and internet
Use of an Apple Laptop plus a $400 stipend for additional equipment
Annual learning & development reimbursement (up to $1,200 per year)
Flexibility to work remotely from anywhere in the US #LI-Remote
Beware of job scams:
We will only contact you from our @healthgorilla.COM email address and communicate via phone or zoom
We will never ask you for money or to purchase items such as a laptop to work with us
If your resume has your home address listed, we recommend replacing with just a city, state
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels as we know the more inclusive we are, the better our product will be.
Health Gorilla is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, genetic information, or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

Title: Director of Quality
Description: Plans and directs activities of team members concerned with the quality control and quality assurance of manufacturing processes, materials, and the production…
Descriptions:
Pay Range: $150,000/yr - $170,000/yr

Together for a cleaner, healthier world.
Johnson Matthey, a FTSE 100 company, is a global leader in sustainable technologies specialising in catalysis, precious metal products, chemicals and process technology. With operations in over 30 countries, we employ more than 14,000 people. Johnson Matthey uses science to make the world cleaner and healthier. Over the past two centuries we have built our reputation and place as a global leader through quality, integrity, and innovation. Today, more than 93% of the group's sales come from products and services which provide sustainability benefits through the positive impact they have on the environment, resource efficiency and human health, but that’s not enough. We have ambitious plans for growth and need talented individuals to help shape and lead us into our next century.
Plans and directs activities of team members concerned with the quality control and quality assurance of manufacturing processes, materials, and the production of precision parts for Medical Device Components. Will be responsible to maintain the Quality Management System (QMS) to ensure business objectives, quality objectives, and key performance indicators are met in an efficient and effective manner.
Your responsibilities:
Oversees all aspects of the Quality Management Systems for the San Diego, CA and Mexicali, MX operations.
Leads the quality department by overseeing staffing requirements, development, and performance management.
Oversees all quality audit programs and corrective and preventive action systems.
Manages internal and external complaint handling system, adverse incident reporting, and review of trends.
Manages non-conformances involving product or the quality system.
Develops quality assurance goals and systems, including prioritization, resourcing, selection and development of Quality department staff; ensures that proper quality skill sets consistent with new technologies are developed.
Establishes a quality plan to achieve site goals and objectives. Develops executive level reports on each location’s QMS performance.
Works with Development, Manufacturing Engineering, Production, Customer Service, and Sales to integrate quality controls into the production process.
Implements a comprehensive supplier assessment and monitoring program.
Provides a robust Quality Assurance system that emphasizes prevention over inspection.
Develops effective quality training programs in conjunction with other operational departments.
Develops and implements site policies and procedures on quality systems.
Directs employees engaged in measuring and testing product and tabulating data concerning materials, precision parts, or process quality, and reliability.
Reviews and coordinates review of quality agreements.
Manages department risks and communicates concerns.
Other duties may be assigned.
Requirements for the role:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field
Minimum 10 years’ experience in medical manufacturing
ASQE certification and advanced degree preferred
8-10 years of leadership/supervisory experience in a quality management role.
Strong working knowledge of ISO:9001, 13485, 21 CFR 820
Excellent math abilities and working knowledge of data analysis/statistical methods
Ability to communicate effectively with impact and/or authority to a range of audiences both internally and externally.
Expertise in a broad range of quality systems and tools.
Experience leading projects.
Solid understanding of customer specifications and standards.
How you will be rewarded:
We offer a competitive compensation and JM Elements benefits package including bonus, excellent pension contributions and 20 days annual leave (varies for shift- based roles). Our JM Elements Benefits programme helps our employees understand and manage the JM benefits, as well as helping you focus on your overall wellbeing – for you and your family.
We use our inspiring science and technology to enhance lives. For those who are passionate about sustainable solutions and shaping our markets, we offer stretch and a wealth of diverse opportunities.
We’ll give you freedom to bring your whole self to work and be part of a team where difference matters and all voices are heard, that genuinely cares for you and where your contribution is appreciated. We’ll empower you to lean in and make things happen, to create solutions and value for our customers. United by our values and vision, we’re self-starters sharing the same values and accountability and always with a shared commitment to doing the right thing. We’re passionate about making a difference and delivering a better tomorrow for us and for you – a cleaner and healthier world, today and for future generations.
Johnson Matthey is open for discussion on part time, job share and flexible working patterns.
How to apply:
If you have the necessary skills and experience to join our team, please apply online. For any queries or should you require any reasonable adjustments to support your application please let your recruiter know when they contact you.
