Title: Head of Audience and Marketing Analytics
Description:
Experience building and managing teams responsible for using analytics to drive significant scale.
You will be the catalyst for driving the adoption of advanced…
Descriptions:
Job Title:
Head of Audience and Marketing Analytics
Location:
Menlo Park
CA
United States
Department:
Marketing
Job Requisition Number:
1009-23
Job Summary:
Quicken is committed to helping people lead healthy financial lives. We have been the #1 personal financial management software for over 40 years and are fueling our growth with new business models and products to become the most used, most loved personal finance brand.
This is a transformation role within Quicken marketing. You will be the catalyst for driving the adoption of advanced analytics and building an audience-first approach across marketing to drive growth. This role will report to the CMO.
Responsibilities:
Play a big part in identifying opportunities to help the marketing function scale through acquisition, onboarding, engagement and renewal strategies. You will not only work with data, but you will help define the way marketing performance is calibrated and what questions should be asked.
Help address the complex challenges of experimental design, budget allocation, marketing effectiveness, contact strategy, return on investment, user behavior, and channel effectiveness using state-of-the-art machine learning models.
Work closely with the paid and CRM marketing teams and be responsible for campaign pre and post-analysis, cohorting, experiment design, segmentation, KPI measurement, and so much more.
Drive the audience roadmap:
Determine what 3rd party data sources Quicken should leverage to build audience segments.
Explore the possibility of overlaps, segmentation, and data appends in developing audiences to produce richer more relevant segments.
Improve suppression matching (anti-targeting) by improving the match rate of our 1st party data.
Develop media optimization models such as media mix, channel attribution and audience based channel attribution modeling. Measure the impact of media for better ROAS. Measure the incremental effectiveness of media spend and model future spend.
Build and implement incrementality measurement, understand customer journey to fulfill funnel gaps, optimize channel investments, and etc.
And importantly, hire, build, manage and develop a team of amazing audience and marketing analysts and you and your team will be the catalyst for change.
Qualifications:
Fully conversant in using advanced analytic techniques, machine learning, and data-driven strategies to build audiences and solve an array of business challenges across the prospect and customer journey.
12+ years industry experience and advanced degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics) or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with building audiences using 1st party and 3rd party data
Experience with Growth Marketing, Attribution Systems, Customer LTV
Deep knowledge of experiment design and causal inference, strong analytical and causal reasoning mindset
Fluency in core set of Data Science SQL/Hive, R/Python and ETL
Developing funnels & decomposing metrics variation
Demonstrated track record of leadership and ability to lead and influence team
Proven ability to succeed in an innovative and fast-paced environment
Experience building and managing teams responsible for using analytics to drive significant scale
Intellectually curious and a creative thinker, not bound by "the way things have always been done."
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Quicken is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The actual salary offered is determined by factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to years and depth of experience, relevant skills, and work location. This position's expected base pay range is $170,000 - $215,000.
Our compensation package includes a competitive salary, annual target bonus, equity, 401(k) match, health benefits, and other supplemental benefits and programs. In addition to eleven paid holidays, we offer vacation, sick, and paid parental leave.
Quicken is excited to be building a team of innovative and talented people dedicated to helping people improve their financial lives. We believe in giving our employees the benefits and perks to keep them happy and healthy. Whether it’s generous healthcare benefits, a 5% matching 401(k) Plan, a gym subsidy, or unlimited snacks, we believe happy employees are successful employees. (Benefits and perks may vary based on location.) Come join our Quicken team!
Quicken is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.

Title: Director, Data Science & Analytics
Description:
Help teach and explain techniques and tools used to business-intelligence, data, and analytics professionals with varied backgrounds.
Work-out time during work.
Descriptions:
Business Unit Description:
Here's what all the hype is about Premier Nutrition Company, LLC (PNC) is a clear leader in the convenient nutrition category and makes great-tasting food products under the brand names Premier Protein, Dymatize, and PowerBar, and is part of publicly-traded BellRing Brands (NYSE:BRBR). With its people-first culture, PNC empowers its people to create the best work of their lives alongside some truly astounding colleagues.

PNC treats its people like adults with respect and trust. One of our five core values is to Connect & Belong because we bring our diverse backgrounds, life experiences, and ways of thinking to each challenge grounded in our belief that everyone should have a seat at the table and be listened to deeply. Whever makes you, you - you belong here.

We strive to avoid many of the outdated processes of conventional workplaces. We don't have performance reviews we have quarterly conversations. We don't have management we have inspiring leaders to coach and mentor. We don't have a casual dress code we simply don't have a dress code; wear what you like. And we have a lot of fun.

Bringing dogs to work, company-wide give-days days, philanthropy and sustainability programs, in-office massages, walking meetings, and free daily exercise classes on-site and at the adjacent gym are just a few ways we make work feel less like work. And the results of our great culture speak for itself: we were certified as a Great Place to Work™ for the sixth year-running in 2022 and ranked in the top 12 on Fortune Magazine’s Best Workplaces in our category for the past four years.

So, what's it like to work here? If you're local, you'll walk into our Emeryville office each Monday morning and find 100 of your colleagues sitting on sofas, beanbag chairs, or the floor excitedly talking through the week ahead and watching one of their colleagues tell their personal life and career journey. Picture a casual and collaborative environment of a start-up, the innovative mindset of a tech company, and the stability of a company with revenue last year of over $1.3 billion, and you'll find us in the sweet spot where world-class culture meets robust business results.

PNC seeks individuals who will thrive in this work environment and will help us build our culture and this high-growth company for the next phase in our amazing journey. Does this sound like you? Then read on.
Responsibilities:
The Role…
This individual will be the leader of this practice and manage directly a talented yet small team. The goal of this position is for the hands-on director to extract and tell the story from the data to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of all things possible. The goal is to use data to positively impact the bottom line of the company.

The Director, Data Science & Analytics position is responsible for executing the full-scope of advanced analytic techniques with the objectives of creating causal inferences, predictions, and recommendations for improvements to business processes, and the metrics to monitor those improvements. This position requires a strong command of techniques and algorithms as well as a demonstrated practical ability to determine where to invest time, synthesize actionable findings across diverse assignments, and present these findings to an audience with varying levels of background in analytics. This leadership position is responsible for recruiting and supervising a small staff, formulating and managing projects, and working with key stakeholders to establish roadmaps, present results, and resolve issues.

This position can be based remotely, but the individual MUST live in California. If the incumbent lives outside of the Bay Area, monthly trips to our Emeryville, California office will be required. The expected pay scale this role is $190k to $210k, which may vary based on relevant experience, qualifications, geographic area (if applicable), and internal equity for the role.

You’re excited about this opportunity because your time will be filled with…
Platform Management: 35% of Time
Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with driving data platform architectures, tools, & technologies including data acquisition, master data management, data quality & governance, compliance, data access layer, and analytics tools.
Plan and lead the execution of the analytics life-cycle, leveraging significant experience in leading this type of work in previous roles.
Perform problem formulation, requirements analysis, and planning, including selection of appropriate algorithms and execution.
In conjunction with IT Team, injest and normalize new data sources, including data from customers, co-manufacturers and general market data.
Responsible for data integrity at all stages, including pre-processing and creation / maintenance of data sources. Working with cross-functional teams, align on master data across the organization.
Partner with the User Experience & Design organization to ensure reports and dashboards are usable, elegant and industry leading.

Roadmap Development & Execution: 35% of Time
Develop and maintain project intake, roadmap, staffing plans, and budget with support from CIO.
Provides leadership on current and emerging developments/trends for assigned area(s) of responsibility, assesses the impact, and collaborates with senior management to incorporate new trends and developments in current and future strategies.
Develop advanced forecasting models in collaboration with cross-functional partners. Responsible for interpretation of results - for both causal inferences and predictive effectiveness.
Exercise thought leadership and discretion in tailoring the tools, approaches, and data used to meet the needs of the particular problem. Present findings, suggested actions and changes to a broad audience, and manage follow-ups and execution.
Work with the technical and leadership team to ensure that all individual projects are appropriately supported and fully completed on time.
Manage internal relationships, including planning, budgeting, roadmap, issue resolution, and overall accountability for results and satisfaction.

Team Management & Development: 30% of Time
Manage a small staff in support of the above activities. Provide coaching and mentoring to achieve a high-performing team.
Help teach and explain techniques and tools used to business-intelligence, data, and analytics professionals with varied backgrounds.
Other administrative duties as required for team management.
Qualifications:
What are we looking for?

Education:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
Data related certifications desirable.

Experience:
10+ years of relevant Data Science experience.
5+ years of people management experience.
Consumer Product Goods-research background, focused on standard processes including Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-cash, Plan-to-Make, and Revenue Growth Management.

Skills:
Expert-level skills and experience with the Tableau, Snowflake, DBT, ETL tools or similar technologies.
Advanced-level skills with relational databases, including SQL and utilizing data stored in complex schemas.
Expert ability to analyze, interpret and present data.
Data profiling, distributions, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing.
Ability to communicate results and recommendations to a wide variety of audiences.
Advanced understanding of data architecture, data warehouse, data lake and data marts.
Demonstrated ability and desire to continually expand skill set, and learn from and teach others.
Experience with Roadmap development and prioritization with cross-functional teams.
Effective business acumen and sense of urgency to achieve business results.
Must be willing to travel up to 25% of the time, if you’re not local to the Bay Area.

So, if after reading through this long list you’re thinking—I’m not sure I meet 100% of these requirements, should I still apply? YES—if you embody a growth mindset, see challenges as opportunities to develop, and find innovative ways to get the real work that matters done, you sound like our kind of candidate!

Select 5 Key Capabilities & Traits Important to Add to and Diversify your Current Team:
Thrive in ambiguity amid competing priorities
Enterprise-wide savvy and view
Drive and own results
Be a builder
Challenge ideas respectfully

You will thrive here and may just do the best work of your life if…
You want to be an integral part of shaping and nurturing an amazing work culture
You like trying out novel minimum viable product people-related ideas
You can be flexible in your approach to people challenges and abandon past practices if they don’t make sense or would lead to a poor outcome
You are comfortable being natural, casual, open, and even a bit playful at work
You don’t have a big ego and hate siloed thinking
You like to get sh*t, I mean—stuff done
You can be friendly, vulnerable, and self-deprecating in one moment, and deal with a challenging, delicate people-related matter as a professional in the next
You can do periods of focused, deep work on projects that drive the needle

This may not be your ideal next career move if…
You like a lot of structure, rules, and uniformity
You like hierarchy, command and control management
You want to build lots of processes, systems, governance, or policies and make a beautiful bureaucracy
Dealing with ambiguity or experimentation is not your jam
You try to resolve challenging interpersonal situations over instant messaging or passive aggression
You tend to chase whatever shiny object presents itself during the day instead of real results

If we haven’t convinced you to apply already, here are some of our favorite perks and benefits:
Friday afternoons off year-round (and of course a hefty PTO package plus 11 holidays)
6% 401K match. Literally free money
Hybrid work with an average of 2-3 days a week in the office for local folks
All jobs are bonus-eligible
Work-out time during work
Free custom lunch twice a week. Plus, plenty of snacks and shakes.
2 weeks of work from anywhere time to move your Big Rocks
Quarterly team building events/happy hours (city-wide scavenger hunt, bowling, ropes course, putt-putt)
Bring your dog to work (3 days/week)
Extended paid parental leave regardless of gender or familial make-up

We strive to create an equitable and inclusive environment to contribute to the success of our organization. Premier Nutrition provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, status as a covered veteran and any other category protected under applicable federal, state, provincial and local laws.

Title: Director, Revenue Operations
Description:
Lead the generation of data and analytics dashboards that will support business leaders in strategic decision making.
MBA preferred, but not required.
Descriptions:
Job Description:
At Rakuten Advertising, the Revenue Operations team is responsible for developing intelligence across the revenue funnel, delivering insights to leadership, and improving processes that support our strategic commercial objectives and growth targets. As part of the Commercial Organization, this team measures and optimizes performance at every stage of the customer journey. Revenue Operations works closely and collaboratively with global sales and client services, finance, marketing, and commercial leadership.
We are hiring a Director of Revenue Operations to lead this organization and partner with executive and commercial leadership to drive a data-driven decision-making culture. You will work closely with our commercial sales and client services teams to measure the health of our business, provide analytical insights, streamline processes, and share learnings and best practices while recognizing that Rakuten Advertising’s business units operate in a unique market environment.
You are the right fit for this role if you are strategic, analytical, consultative, and tactical, with an eye towards critical thinking and problem solving. Your experience should include partnering with sales/client services leadership, leveraging data to help organizational leadership make decisions, developing and delivering executive insights and presentations, and enhancing processes in a large, global, client-oriented organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Leadership & Cross-Functional Alignment
Develop a high-performing RevOps team who supports a global, multi-faceted commercial organization and utilizes data and insights to drive revenue growth
Understand commercial priorities and challenges, refine processes, communicate gaps with data and potential revenue reporting challenges, as well as develop short and long-term solutions
Break down internal barriers to success by driving alignment across global commercial and executive leadership teams
Revenue Analytics & Insights
Align leadership on key metrics to measure the health and performance of Rakuten Advertising’s commercial business
Turn commercial data into insights that inform revenue priorities, maximize growth, and lead to decisions and actions, providing information in a proactive way
Lead the generation of data and analytics dashboards that will support business leaders in strategic decision making
Identify triggers that put clients at risk and work with commercial leadership to develop strategic plans to proactively address those triggers
Develop process that drive improvement in data quality so that we can confidently use data to inform business decisions & planning
Revenue Planning & Alignment
Drive the design and implementation of measurable, scalable processes to boost business performance and improve efficiency and effectiveness
Create and maintain the commercial operating cadence with a focus on building a quarterly calendar of planning milestones like forecasting, quota and target planning, pipeline management, territory development, etc.
Lead the commission plan and quota setting design process, communication, and implementation, in partnership with global commercial leadership and finance
Lead short-term and long-term headcount planning for revenue generating teams to maximize client experience, performance, and profitability
Minimum Requirements
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
Exceptional written and verbal presentation skills with a proven track record of building relationships with senior leaders and c-suite
Strong interpersonal and team-building skills; ability to work with a diverse team and influence/drive change across all levels and functions of the organization
Experience setting org wide KPIs, analyzing revenue data, and translating results into actionable insights, plans, deliverables, and presentations
Strong financial skills and business acumen to understand revenue profitability and growth opportunities
Proven proficiency in identifying, diagnosing, and resolving problems of all levels of complexity, prioritizing critical client issues, and identifying department needs
Detail oriented and willingness to personally implement and execute against a plan
Excellent organization skills: experience managing project plans with large stakeholder groups, meeting deadlines, and proactively raising blockers or risks
Qualifications Requirements
7-10+ years of relevant work experience, including supporting sales and client services organizations
MBA preferred, but not required
Experience with data analysis, Excel; comfort with BI tools (e.g., Tableau) as well as Salesforce
Rakuten provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at
hr-wdhglobalhris@mail.rakuten.com
.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizen status, uniform service member and veteran status, marital status, age, pregnancy status, protected medical condition, genetic information, disability, or any other protected status.
At the time of posting, Rakuten expects the base salary for this role will be betwee n $ 113,184 - $211,032. Individual compensation will vary based on job-related factors, including the skills, qualifications, and experience of the successful candidate as well as business need and geographic location. The successful applicant for this role will be eligible for discretionary bonus, health, vision, dental insurance, 401k matching, PTO, Volunteer Time Off (VTO), and other employee benefits as the company implements.
Five Principles for Success
Rakuten Group has an unswerving commitment to building an egalitarian society by empowering individuals and companies to be successful in business and in life. The Five Principles for Success are designed to keep each of us on track, to ensure we make continuous progress toward our ultimate goals.
Always Improve, Always Advance
There are only two kinds of people in the world:
Best Effort people are satisfied with the status quo; when they fail, they console themselves by saying "I did my best."
Get Things Done people are absolutely committed to reaching their goals.
With enough determination and effort—by being a Get Things Done person—you can achieve anything.
Passionately Professional
Rakuten is an organization composed of true professionals.
Real professionals in any field—whether in sports, the arts, science, business, or anything else—only reach the top because they have the self-discipline to develop and improve themselves continuously.
Only by consistently working many times harder than our competitors can we consistently win.
Hypothesize Practice Validate Shikumika
Success in business depends on making and executing concrete specific action plans.
Maximize Customer Satisfaction
Rakuten is first and foremost a service company. We're proud to serve our customers and we ceaselessly seek to improve their experience.
Speed!! Speed!! Speed!!
The internet makes the window of opportunity for every small business. Accomplish in one month what it takes other companies a year to do, because we can only win by being many times faster than our competitors.

Title: Executive Director, Enterprise Data and Analytics
Description:
Knowledge of predictive and advanced analytics technologies.
The Enterprise Data & Analytics Department oversees campus-wide enterprise data and analytics…
Descriptions:
The Executive Director of Enterprise Data & Analytics works directly with senior leadership to define enterprise information strategy and governance to optimize the business intelligence and analytics value delivered to customers. The Executive Director of Enterprise Data & Analytics enables business insights to support the growth and operational effectiveness of a best-in-class, leading edge organization that enables data-driven decision making. As part of the leadership team, the Executive Director of Enterprise Data & Analytics works with university and organization leaders to build data governance standards and practices across the enterprise. The Executive Director of Enterprise and Analytics will also work closely with the Senior Data Architect to define and outline the enterprise data strategy and architecture. The Executive Director of Enterprise Data and Analytics is expected to model and cultivate the organization's culture, values, and behaviors.

The Enterprise Data & Analytics Department oversees campus-wide enterprise data and analytics including data governance, architecture, integration, storage, services, and analytics. This team sets the tone for UCLA's data culture, further ingraining data usage into the university's ways of working and making it possible for the enterprise to do so by managing the technology, processes, and support needed.

Situated on 419 acres, five miles from the Pacific Ocean, the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) is enriched by the cultural diversity of the dynamic greater Los Angeles area, as well as the geographic advantages of Southern California. One of the world's preeminent public research universities, UCLA is an international leader in breadth and quality of academic, research, health care, wellness, cultural, continuing education and athletic programs, with more than 5,200 faculty members who teach approximately 47,500 students in the UCLA College and 12 professional schools. UCLA is consistently ranked among the top institutions nationally for research funding, having generated $1.7 billion in research grants and contracts in the last fiscal year alone.

The Information Technology Services (ITS) department at UCLA is a vital part of the university community, providing essential technology services and support to ensure the campus can effectively pursue its mission. It is UCLA's spirited tradition of thought leadership and commitment to excellence that enables an ambitious and resourceful approach to transforming our networked, ever-changing campus environment. To meet the needs of today's campus and tomorrow's leaders, ITS has identified a set of strategic priorities entitled the Digital Campus Roadmap.

Title: Head of Digital Medical, US Medical Affairs (Executive Director)
Description: Collaborate across deep and broad experts in medical, customer experience, data & advanced analytics, information technology & customer engagement.
Descriptions:
The Position
Background:
US Medical Affairs (USMA) is part of Genentech’s CMG (commercial, medical, government) organization, and is focused on leading the healthcare industry by delivering better patient outcomes and making care more accessible and affordable for all. USMA collaborates across the enterprise with Product Development (PD), Global Product Strategy (GPS), Commercial, Government Affairs, US Informatics (USIX), Squads and Ecosystems. Genentech CMG has identified that establishing world-class digital medical capabilities is a key priority to enable delivery of better patient outcomes, more equitable care, and reduced cost to society.
Position Overview:
The Head of Digital Medical will have domain expertise and leadership experience in both Medical Affairs and Digital and lead digital transformation within USMA. The Head of Digital Medical will be a key partner and counterpart to the Head of Digital Marketing role in the US commercial organization and will partner with Experience Operations (XO) within the Genentech Business Operations (GBO) organization and USIX on integrated customer experience (ICX) related initiatives. The position will also partner with GPS Digital Personalized Healthcare (PHC) to provide expert input into Global Digital PHC strategy regarding digital patient monitoring, telemedicine, and other similar initiatives.
The Head of Digital Medical will report to the Vice President Scientific Operations and will be a member of the Scientific Operations Leadership Team. The position will lead the Digital Medical team within Scientific Operations comprising of 5-10 individuals including full time, contractors, rotational staff, and talent flows that will bring together and scale capabilities in digital health (telemedicine, digital patient monitoring, software as a medical device, wearables, biosensors, etc.), digital medical engagement (digital clinical trials training, interactive medical content, etc.), and digital medical insights (predictive pharmacovigilance and medical compliance, data-driven identification and tracking of health equity and inclusive research gaps, etc.) to help advance a US Leadership Team (USLT) identified priority area of future capability for the organization. For initiatives such medical social media or omnichannel medical engagement, the Head of Digital Medical will partner closely within CMG to ensure clarity of responsibilities and technology implementation for these initiatives will be handled by GBO and USIX to avoid duplication of efforts within the organization.
Role Accountabilities:
Strategy: Lead development and execution of USMA Digital Medical Strategy
Act as a senior, strategic counselor/architect for USMA to deeply connect and closely partner with USMA stakeholders to develop the USMA Digital Medical Strategy and shape the digital roadmap and portfolio to quickly deliver highest value outcomes
Enable consistent, personalized, and impactful communications and engagement to customers (patients, caregivers, healthcare providers, payers, and policymakers), enhance clinical practice through digital tools/technologies, and advance clinical care through digital health technologies to enhance the customer experience, improve patient outcomes, and foster/incubate new methodologies and innovations to future-proof the healthcare system at large.
Balance long term vision with short term delivery, make wise decisions to invest/build/sustain, identify barriers and enablers, catalyze the organization to develop, connect, and drive tactics that deliver on our vision
Executive Presence: Inspire, Influence and Represent Genentech on a National Stage
Possess Medical Affairs and digital expertise to represent Genentech on a national stage with credibility and build our reputation while collaborating externally
Demonstrated capabilities to present at the highest levels of leadership, including Roche and Genentech Board members, Executive Committee and other C Suite management.
Network Leadership: Collaborate and lead in USMA, CMG, and across enterprise
Collaborate across deep and broad experts in medical, customer experience, data & advanced analytics, information technology & customer engagement.
Partner closely with medical teams, IT, and vendors, forming strategic partnerships, build, pilot and scale digital initiatives and capabilities into our disease areas
Lead and serve as single point of contact for USMA integrated customer experience efforts and ensure capabilities are connected, optimized and effectively leveraged across USMA, Experience Operations, Data & Analytics (AI/ML) and Information Technology groups
Domain Expertise: Strong understanding of Medical Affairs and Digital Landscape
Strong understanding of Medical Affairs accountabilities including data generation (trials, real-world data, etc.), data communication (publications, medical education, medical information, field medical), and license to operate (pharmacovigilance, medical compliance) to enable effective partnerships with key USMA stakeholders
Develop, manage and optimize digital medical content across all digital platforms in support of USMA strategic priorities.
Serve as a cross-channel digital medical expert, leading digital medical strategies and customer experiences that enable positive patient outcomes and business transformation.
Execution: Data and stakeholder feedback-driven rapid iteration and decision making
Inspire solutions, action, and execution to enable data-driven closed loop execution
Set clear expectations and guardrails for department and individual compliance accountability using sound judgment and compliance knowledge
Approach implementation with an agile mindset: focus on the patient; prioritize where to focus finite organizational energy; deliver, test, and nimbly adjust priorities and design.
People: VACC Leadership (Visionary, Architect, Catalyst, Coach)
Inspire people to learn and adopt new data & digital tools in line with strategic priorities
Build the ‘digital skills’ curriculum for the medical community
Shape our digital capabilities and “reimagine digital” mindset. Help to shape the attitudes and behaviors that enable us to foresee the possibilities to incorporate and extract value from digital solutions
Build a cohesive team culture that values empowered decision making. Serve as a visionary, architect, catalyst and coach to teams (direct or matrix-managed) and peers.
Create an environment of strong team spirit, timely and effective communications, highly motivated teams, and skills attracting and developing a diverse talent pool through constructive feedback, encouragement talent flow and stretch assignments.
Qualifications:
Fifteen (15+) or more years relevant healthcare experience
Advanced Degree Required (Masters’ or higher in technology-related field, MBA, Pharm D, PhD or MD)
Preference for experience in both medical affairs and digital leadership roles
Deep and extensive management experience and leadership roles in pharma and/or technology/digital companies or start-up companies
Demonstrates an executive presence, strong business acumen, ability to navigate ambiguity, and manages complexity
Manages risks progressively and in a way that leads to opportunity
Enterprise mindset that can break down silos. Focus on delivery through collaboration, and bringing people together to work towards the same purpose
Ability to empower teams and individuals and hold them accountable
Exhibits intellectual curiosity and integrity and has a strong passion for innovation
Ability to navigate complex situations and thrive in an ambiguous environment
Experience with budget and consultant management
Outstanding written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Experience working effectively in ambiguous, rapidly changing environments
May require some business travel by air or car
Strong digital and omnichannel technology and operations system knowledge
Occasional business travel may be required
Relocation assistance is being provided
Location for the role is South San Francisco
The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of South San Francisco, CA is $268K - $331K. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Title: Associate Director, Advanced Analytics
Location: Remote in Santa Monica, CA+2 locations
Description: Collaborate and influence both internally and externally with vendors to coordinate cross-functional analytics projects and ensure advanced analytics is part of…
Descriptions:
Job Description
Kite, a Gilead Sciences company, has entered a co-development and co-commercialization partnership with Arcellx on a transformative CAR T cell therapy for Multiple Myeloma (MM). We are seeking an Associate Director, Advanced Analytics to become a key member of the Marketing Science team and be accountable for developing and delivering data driven insights to support omnichannel marketing strategic planning and implementation for Multiple Myeloma disease area. In this role, you will collaborate closely with Marketing, Sales, and Business Operations leaders to optimize the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and proactively identify opportunities to enhance Commercial effectiveness. This opportunity is based at Kite’s HQ in Santa Monica, CA but a remote arrangement may be considered and include travel to HQ (2-3X per quarter).
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development, implementation, coordination, and communication of Marketing Mix Models for recommending optimal resource based on channel, cadence and content
Provide strategic recommendations to brand and marketing leads for optimizing key conversion points across sales and marketing channels based on quantitative testing and insight
Operationalize digital omni-channel strategies with the goal of solving complex unmet needs for our HCPs and patient journeys, improving relevance and personalization, uncovering and driving share growth, and advancing our commercial model
Lead the development and improvement of marketing analytics reporting and dashboards
Manage day-to-day relationships and advanced analytics projects with sales and marketing stakeholders, brand teams and other commercial stakeholders
Act as an internal consultant, proactively developing strategies to uncover business opportunities and actionable insights
Collaborate and influence both internally and externally with vendors to coordinate cross-functional analytics projects and ensure advanced analytics is part of front-line thinking
Develop first-hand knowledge of Commercial data sets and act as a subject matter expert to navigate emerging business needs and the evolving data landscape
Assist in budget management, and facilitate project prioritization and project management
Develop story development and presentation of analytical solutions to ensure stakeholder buy-in
Basic Qualifications:
Doctorate and 2+ years of experience OR
Master’s and 8+ years of experience OR
Bachelor’s and 10+ years of experience OR
Associate and 12+ years of experience OR
High School Diploma/GED and 14+ years of experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Graduate degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) or MBA with a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field
9+ years of experience with advanced data modeling and business intelligence techniques
6+ years of pharmaceutical or life sciences experience
Experience working in digital and emerging technologies, preferably in oncology and rare disease
Possess a deep working knowledge of advanced analytical tools and approaches, a deep customer orientation and focus, and the ability to thrive in a transformational environment
Deep programming experience in Python, R, or a similar language (ability to independently develop, test, and implement data programs)
Deep understanding of database structures, data wrangling, cleansing, and manipulation
Ability to independently conduct various statistical tests such as correlation, decision tree, regression, random forest to predict and assess customer behavior in the disease treatment journey (HCPs, patients, etc.)
Significant experience conducting analysis with large healthcare data sets (claims, EMR, etc.)
High level initiative, ability to multi-task, and passion for asking and answering questions in large datasets

Title: Director, Consumer Insights
Description: Proficiency in quantitative and qualitative primary research methods and analytic approaches required; Strong analysis and interpretive skills preferred.
Descriptions:
ABOUT DSC:
We disrupted the shaving industry in 2011 by delivering great blades at an awesome price, right to your door. From razors, we quickly grew into a men's self-care brand offering oral care, hair styling, deodorant, skincare, and fine fragrance along with services and content designed to help guys take care of their minds and bodies so they can be their best selves.
We spend our days working to eliminate the stigma around being a man and wanting to take care of yourself. In turn, we hope that you will come to us in your most vulnerable moments. Here, you will find answers to your questions, from Club Pros who know what it takes to make you look, feel, and smell your best. You got a problem? We've got a solution. Welcome to the Club.
ROLE SUMMARY:
We are looking for a key leader within the marketing & broader organization, representing the voice of the consumer and instrumental in leading consumer understanding from Early Developmental work through Go-to-Market strategies. This role has a direct impact on our product development directions, the strategic business roadmap, and marketing strategies. This leader provides inspiration and provocation to drive transformational growth. This means delivering insights, ideas, and impact that pushes us to evolve how we innovate as a business and be a future fit insights team to partner with marketing. This leader knows why consumers act and feel the way they do and can transform these insights into recommendations that will drive and support strategic decision making.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Be the voice of the consumer to inform key business decisions:
Lead consumer for understanding to identify unmet consumer needs, market whitespace, and growth opportunities in wet and drive shave
Deliver strategic insights and recommendation for new products, new consumers, and/or new marketing positioning and communication.
Lead Brand Health and Brand Perception understanding including awareness funnel, sales, brand equity and media results.
Be the authority on data driven marketing eg audience segmentation and help land/deliver audience specific insights for content creation and media activation
Deliver measurement, insights, and actions that grow DSC brand power:
Make recommendations grounded in consumer knowledge and informed by a broader understanding of the business.
Develop a collaborative framework for collecting and sharing consumer learnings & insights across the business
Lead the CI/Research team:
Lead your team to work effectively and enjoy the interplay across cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product development, and user experience.
Develop your Insights team. Guide them as they execute from study design through analysis, and coach them to go beyond data to deliver strategic recommendations and act as business partners.
Lead CI Council to prioritize key research requirements/needs and deliverables across the business
Contribute to the Marketing Leadership Team:
Contribute to the joint leadership of the Marketing department, working against common goals and creating strong interdependencies with your peers
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Market Research, Marketing, or related field; Masters preferred
Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in Consumer & Market Insights/Consumer Research; preferably 10+ with progressive management experience
Experience with and/ or passion for purposeful brands and driving/translating purpose in a way that is meaningful and motivating for the consumer
Depth and breadth of experience across all brand communications channels – TV, Social, PR, Influencer, Digital
Ability to help the team uncover powerful emotional consumer & cultural insights, and translate these into successful communication
Thought leadership on understanding and driving Brand Equity
Strong drive to generate new initiatives and see them through to action – land new pioneering CMI and marketing initiatives into the business.
High levels of leadership in influencing senior stakeholders, brand teams, peers
Develop high impact actions in collaboration/ partnership within CMI, CTI, Marketing, Finance and external partners/ agencies/ experts
Proficiency in quantitative and qualitative primary research methods and analytic approaches required; Strong analysis and interpretive skills preferred
POSITION TYPE:
This is a full-time exempt position.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
This position is a hybrid role at our Headquarters in Marina Del Rey.
SALARY:
$145,000 - $168,000 with bonus eligibility
-

Title: Director of Enterprise Applications
Description: We are seeking a Director of Enterprise Applications to spearhead our Enterprise Application strategy and execution, including oversight, growth and continuous…
Descriptions:
Rexford Industrial Realty, Inc. (NYSE: REXR) is a leading, publicly traded industrial real estate investment and management company operating over a $13 Billion industrial real estate portfolio throughout Southern California. Never has the mission and vision of Rexford Industrial been more exciting. Cement your place among a team of entrepreneurs and join passionate team members in the industry.
We are seeking a Director of Enterprise Applications to spearhead our Enterprise Application strategy and execution, including oversight, growth and continuous improvement of our portfolio of applications supporting marketing, deal sourcing, deal execution workflows, accounting, lease management, property management, construction management, HR, FP&A, Marketing, and more. This role will report to the SVP, Head of Technology.

This is an extraordinary opportunity for a highly motivated candidate with demonstrated applications leadership experience to help us take our portfolio of enterprise applications to the next level, while building a team that can both support and continuously improve Rexford's business processes by leveraging technology solutions.

The Director of Enterprise Applications will immerse themselves in Rexford's business processes to drive innovation and adoption of business applications in partnership with executives, department heads, and other key business stakeholders throughout all levels of the business, as well as with other teams within the technology department. This role is tasked with identifying and championing opportunities to leverage new and existing business applications to support business development, growth objectives, and improved information flow and business process efficiencies. The successful candidate will be capable of determining interdependencies between processes and data within and across departments and will architect solutions that are both integrated and extensible to support ongoing growth. The role will own technology and vendor discovery, evaluations and recommendations, estimating, and resource management (both internal team members and vendor partners), and provide oversight of solution design, project execution, user support and continuous improvement efforts related to Rexford business applications.

The Director of Enterprise Applications Responsibilities include but may not be limited to:
Analyze current platforms and make recommendations to further increase value and adoption
Optimize our platforms for mobile usage as may be appropriate
Oversee implementation and continuous improvement of a new SaaS Acquisitions platform, driving adoption and data quality
Improve or replace current marketing platform and achieve tighter integration with Acquisitions processes
Implement corporate financial planning and sensitivity analysis platform (e.g. Anaplan, Radley Proms or similar)
Implement centralized "one-stop-shop" data access for all of our Rexford-owned properties; very likely to require an application "build approach" rather than a "buy approach"
Implement and maintain a robust company intranet
Deliver process automation and cross-platform integrations
Expand user training offerings and grow application portfolio adoption across the organization
Interface with analysts and technical staff to deliver complete work products
Oversee maintenance and troubleshooting of applications
Oversee expansion and further adoption of the Yardi platform
Oversee continuous improvement of environmental data management platform and analysis; investigate potential for rolling out sub-metering to our buildings to optimize utility usage and drive down our carbon footprint
Director of Enterprise Applications Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in information systems, computer science, or related field, or equivalent relevant work experience
10+ years working on implementation and improvement of packaged and/or SaaS software deployments; 5+ years in leadership roles; capable of leading and building a small team while being hands-on with oversight of requirements discovery, solution design and project execution:
CRM systems
Accounting systems
Marketing platforms
Document Management platforms
Workflow tools
Application integrations
Data conversions from old platforms to new
Oversight of in-house application development or enhancements to packaged software
Project Management experience leading complex application implementation projects from planning to completion is required
Understanding of SDLC methodologies highly desired, in particular how these methodologies pertain to enhancements to packaged or SaaS software solutions
Application data conversion and application integration experience highly desired
Experience with Yardi or other CRE ERP software desired; will accept experience with other ERP platforms
Experience supporting the technology needs of Acquisitions teams in the CRE industry or other Private Market companies (e.g. Private Equity, M&A, Venture Capital) desired; will accept experience supporting the business applications needs of marketing and sales teams in other industries
Experience with FP&A applications (e.g. Hyperion, Anaplan, Radley Proms, or comparable) desired
Demonstrated organizational skills, attention to detail, analytical/problem solving abilities, time management and the ability to multi-task
Strong mentorship and team building skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain complex solutions to non-technical stakeholders
Preferred Certifications:
PMI or comparable project management certification desired
ADA Requirements: The physical demands, work environment factors, and mental functions described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit for extended periods of time; use hands to feel, handle, or type; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move or carry up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus. Additionally, employee may be required to drive to a property, walk on uneven ground, walk through a construction site, be exposed to dust or fumes and work around machinery or equipment.

Rexford Industrial's reward plan includes great compensation packages, bonus eligibility and long- term stock incentives. The expected annual base salary range for this role is $160,000 to $240,000, with a 30% discretionary annual bonus target and stock grant eligibility.* The actual base salary and total compensation offered depend on a variety of factors, which include, without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location where the job will be performed. The final base salary and total compensation will be described in any offer letters.
Rexford Industrials' reward plan includes; great compensation packages, bonus eligibility, and long-term incentives for many positions, comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; 401k with match, vacation, unlimited PTO, and paid holidays, and regular company events, food, snacks, coffee, TVs and beautiful offices with 360-degree views of the ocean, mountains, and city.
We celebrate diversity and are committed to promoting an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the bases of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Rexford does not sell personal information. To learn more about Rexford's privacy policy, please visit https://www.rexfordindustrial.com/privacy-policy

You must remain employed through the payment date of any such bonus and/or vesting to be eligible for payment/vesting.

Title: Senior Director, BI and Data Strategy
Description: Responsible for developing and implementing an enterprise-wide data strategy to support, optimize, and integrate the Alliant network of data source systems into…
Descriptions:
Alliant Insurance Services is one of the nation’s largest and fastest-growing insurance brokerage and consulting firms. We operate through a network of specialized national platforms and local offices to offer our clients a comprehensive portfolio of solutions built on innovative thinking and personal service. Alliant is changing the way our clients approach risk management and benefits, so they can capitalize on new opportunities to grow and protect their organizations.
More information is available on the company's website at: www.alliant.com.

SUMMARY

Responsible for developing and implementing an enterprise-wide data strategy to support, optimize, and integrate the Alliant network of data source systems into a database solution(s) that offers the end user simplified real-time access to business data that helps drive strategy, business decisions, growth, and shareholder value. Oversees operational Business Intelligence and data teams. Performs all duties in accordance with all company policies and procedures, and all federal, state and local laws, wherein the Company operates.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Develops/augments a data infrastructure and solution that derives maximum value from the data available to the organization through automated, streamlined data systems and innovation.
Communicates the overall data vision, objectives, goals and value to the organization.
Establishes data procedures and policies that align with, and meet, industry best practices, to collect, prepare, organize, protect, and store data assets.
Partners with the business to analyze complex business problems and drive solutions that add value and meet business requirements and strategies.
Serves as a liaison to IT to remedy identified systemic data challenges.
Leads change management and adoption efforts with key stakeholders.
Partners with cross-functional teams to build, prioritize and define workflows and requirements.
Identifies opportunities for process optimization and redesign.
Oversees the management and flow of data throughout its lifecycle.
Defines and manages the Data Governance Solution roadmap including data governance strategies, practices and requirements.
Ensures business intelligence systems meet organizational requirements.
Prioritizes data quality initiatives that ensure accurate business outcomes.
Improves user access to data while ensuring data protection and privacy.
Supports the development and marketing of new products, services and innovation.
Manages, coaches and develops team members to foster career growth.
Performs other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree in a data related field or comparable experience

Fifteen (15) years or more of experience in business intelligence, master data management, data governance, and data quality

Ten (10) or more years in a senior-level data management role

Experience with MDM/Data Governance/Analytics Tools (e.g., Profisee, Informatica MDM or Tibco)

Experience with working on large, complex projects within an Agile framework

SKILLS

Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills with both technology-minded and business-minded people

Ability to work effectively across all levels of the organization

Positive leadership style with the ability to lead through influence

Solid business acumen including ability to think strategically and apply sound business judgement

Passion for excellence with a demonstrated strong drive-for-results attitude and style

Desire to work within a team, lead a team, and foster a collaborative team environment

Proven track record in data management, leadership, and information technology systems and tools

A strong background in IT and business is advantageous

#LI-DD1
