Title: Senior Director, Cybersecurity Risk Management
Description: T&O builds, implements, and maintains the business systems and technology that are critical for delivering WBD products and content while articulating the long…
Descriptions:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are…
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…
From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
Our Team
As Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) portfolio continues to grow – around the world and across platforms – the Global Technology & Operations team is building media technology and IT systems that meet the world class standard for which WBD is known. T&O builds, implements, and maintains the business systems and technology that are critical for delivering WBD products and content while articulating the long-term technology strategy that will enable WBD’s growth.

Your New Role...
Reporting directly to the Global SVP of IT Risk and Compliance, the Senior Director Cybersecurity Risk Management will own and manage developing the cybersecurity risk management program, including developing, implementing, and maintaining an information and content security risk management strategy, enterprise cybersecurity policies and metrics associated with key risk and performance indicators (KRI/KPI’s) that informs and facilitates risk-based decisions, and ensuring overall adherence to information security policy and standards.
This role will lead a team of technical risk and policy leaders, data experts and analysts in support of a 24x7x365 Information and Content Security organization.
Your Role Accountabilities...
Act as WBD’s global leader on Information and Content Cybersecurity Risk, by providing the overall direction and strategy of the enterprise cybersecurity Risk Management function, in collaboration with senior leadership.
Assist in developing Board of Director (BoD) and Audit Committee communications
Maintain strong relationships, partnership, execution focus, and mutual support with other
corporate/business lines, working to understand business processes, applications, projects, and technologies to ensure information security risk management objectives are delivered, and drive a cohesive view of information security risk throughout WBD.
Development, oversight, management of security metrics program, involving governance, risk, operational security, etc., metrics across global WBD Develop, manage, and drive positive trending for KRIs and KPIs for BoD and across WBD relevant stakeholders.
Lead development and implementation of formal processes and procedures to support WBD’s information security risk management strategy and advise on activities and financial investment to accomplish strategic objectives.
Create/develop, communicate, manage WBD IT Security Policies, Standards, and baselines and drive compliance across global WBD employee and technologies environments.
Understand the “voice of the customer” and work with the IT and Business lines to ensure that
policies are consistent with business needs and usage while minimizing risk.
Drive Merger & Acquisition due diligence and integration activities to identify and develop risk mitigation strategies.
Proactive management and understanding emerging security threats, vulnerabilities, and control techniques and communicating this information to leadership.
Qualifications & Experiences
The best candidate for this role will possess:
Bachelor’s degree in related field, such as Business, IT, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.
10-15+ years of management experience working in an enterprise risk management, IT audit, or information security environment.
10+ years of experience in one or more of the following risk dimensions:
Development of internal risk assessments
Enterprise IT/cyber risk aggregation
Policy development
IT/Cyber risk reporting
Risk mitigation methodologies
Able to interact, communicate and partner with C-level executives. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills and proven ability to work effectively at all organizational levels
Financial management and ROI analytical skills
Ability to provide vision, strategy, and leadership
Proven experience to successfully, drive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment comprised of high-achievers, to meet management and customer expectations.
Functional knowledge of CISSP security domains, governance frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001,NIST, PCI) and information security industry standard and best practices
Strong performance management skills, leading, motivating, engaging, and mentoring junior team members
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex topics in clear, non-technical language; outstanding analytical, writing, and oral presentation skills.
Demonstrated ability to be proactive, take ownership of and solve problems, and to deliver work products which are consistent with sound and ethical business practices, and common sense.
Outstanding strategic planning and management skills, ability to think creatively, and strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skills.
Active learner-able to enhance personal, professional, and business growth through new knowledge and experiences.
Experience working in an international business environment, supervising a geographically disperse team.
How We Get Things Done…
This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
The Legal Bits…
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $167,020.00 - $310,180.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Title: Director of Operations
Description:
Generate reports and give presentations to simPRO leadership and/or board of directors.
ClockShark is the industry's #1 Time-Tracking App.
Descriptions:
ClockShark Summary
ClockShark is the industry's #1 Time-Tracking App. Running a field service or construction business takes coordination and a great team. With ClockShark you get everything you need to finish jobs quickly and accurately while getting paid faster. ClockShark is trusted by more than 8,000 field service and construction teams worldwide.
About the Role
The ClockShark Director of Operations will be responsible for the overall management of the ClockShark business, overall sales volume, market share, profitability, and client satisfaction.
As a member of the simPRO family of products, this role will report directly to simPRO's Chief Operating Officer but have primary responsibility for the ClockShark divisions' results.
Pay rage:$170k - $225k
What You'll Do
Oversee the daily ClockShark business operations based in Chico, California.
Actively work with the ClockShark leadership team to develop company strategy
Meet Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) & quarterly budgets
Research, develop and implement growth strategies for current and future ClockShark technologies
Lead, train and provide mentorship to managers and staff
Work with simPRO's Finance team to create and manage budgets
Undergo strategic exercises to continually improve revenue
Direct the hiring of employees across the various teams at ClockShark
Evaluate individual and team performance and productivity
Analyze accounting and financial data
Generate reports and give presentations to simPRO leadership and/or board of directors
While actively promoting and representing ClockShark, identify opportunities, develop and maintain client relationships
What You'll Bring
Five+ years of proven experience as Director of Operations of a business, division, or similar role
Five+ years managing a SaaS or technology-driven organization, or division of a similar organization is a strong plus
Understanding of business functions such as sales, finance, marketing, etc.
Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development
Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or similar required
High-level understanding and application of role-related learning and technology awareness
Comfort working with Google Suite or Microsoft Office required
Willingness to work full-time from the Chico, California ClockShark headquarters

Why Work With Us
At ClockShark, you'll enjoy competitive compensation, generous benefits, and a professional yet fun atmosphere. Expect a collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals with a strong aptitude, attitude, and appetite for learning will have an opportunity to grow their careers quickly.
We're fully supported by simPRO Group, a leading provider of field service management in enterprise markets, and we have big aspirations for our teams.
ClockShark embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate based on sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Associate Director, Revenue Cycle Management
Description: The RCM Associate Director manages all functions of the organization's billing and revenue cycle to maximize cash flow while maintaining and improving internal…
Descriptions:
ACES is a rapidly growing autism services company dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for individuals and families impacted with autism or other special needs. We provide comprehensive, professional services to maximize individuals' potential in the home, school and community, throughout their lifespan.
ACES' distinguished care is grounded in an industry-leading model of behavioral artistry – which combines the best clinical practice of traditional Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) with humanistic elements that help our clients generalize their skills and gain independence. At 30+ locations, we are motivated to grow both so that we can serve more clients and close the significant supply gap that currently exists across the United States. We are committed to attracting and cultivating the very best team members who embody ACES' values and culture and are passionate about our work. For more information, visit http://www.acesaba.com.
Position Summary:
At ACES, we are committed to elevating the standards in the treatment of autism. This means elevating the client's experience, elevating clinical outcomes and elevating the team member experience and contribution, all while finding new, better and more efficient ways to provide care. Ensuring ACES does this in a standardized, scalable way is critical for our rapidly growing company in this stage of our development.
The RCM Associate Director manages all functions of the organization's billing and revenue cycle to maximize cash flow while maintaining and improving internal and external customer relations. In conjunction with ACES' staff, the RCM Associate Director will contribute to the day-to-day operations on all issues related to the revenue cycle function, provide analysis, create written processes, and train others as necessary. They are equally solution and detail-oriented with a calm ability to make progress. They ask hard questions and seek clarity in situations of ambiguity. The RCM Associate Director is considered by others to be "buttoned up" and always "on top of it".
Location: Remote
Salary: $95,000-$115,000 annually with bonus opportunities
Essential Responsibilities:
Manages RCM operations including all aspects of coding, charge-entry, claims submission, collections and payment posting.
Serves as the resident expert and "go to" person for all coding, billing and collections processes.
Develops, reviews and enhances operating policies and procedures to improve quality and efficiency.
Ensures compliance with coding and billing regulations, relevant healthcare regulations and data privacy issues (e.g., HIPAA).
Actively partners with the operations and finance teams by developing and implementing monthly reporting and analyzing actionable claims data, including revenue and volume, by region, payor
Actively collaborates with the Central Reach Manager on billing/authorization/provider issues
Design, operationalize, and monitor key revenue cycle reports to track key performance metrics
Conducts internal monitoring and auditing and leads efforts to remediate and enhance the process
Other duties as assigned
The foregoing job responsibilities are illustrative only and are not meant to be exhaustive. ACES reserves the right to change, amend or modify the job description/responsibilities at any time and in its sole discretion.
Requirements:
5-10 years previous experience in a similar or related position
Knowledge of professional fee billing, reimbursement, and third-party payer regulation
Working knowledge of regulatory requirements pertaining to health care operations
Strong problem-solve skills and ability to make timely decisions
Ability to work cross-functionally to proactively communicate and to resolve issues with the highest sense of urgency
Effective planning and priority setting. Ability to manage several complex projects simultaneously while working under pressure to meet deadline
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Physical requirements:
Ability to exert up to 10 pounds of force and lift/move up to 10 pounds
May include, without limitation, the following physical demands: sitting, typing and viewing a screen(s) for long periods of time
Why ACES?
Join the ACES movement. Twenty-five years ago, a teacher in her classroom had a vision, that she could not only uniquely improve the quality of life for her students - that she could also build an organization to help others do the same. And that they together could elevate the standards in the treatment of autism, discover new and better ways of providing care and create, ripples of positive impact across millions of lives. We aim to be the standard setter and a household name for autism services in America whose growth will solve the current gap in the supply of quality care.
What does an 'ACE-ified' leader look like?
Mission-driven; embodies our core values: Accountability, Collaboration, Education, Flexibility, Fun, Innovation, Passion, Respect, Results, Service
Growth Mindset: Says "yes" to appropriate, new opportunities and ideas for ACES
Positive & Perseverant: Charismatic, self-starter with strong personal initiative
Servant-Leader: Humble, caring, and empathetic
Displays grit and scrappiness, roll-up-your-sleeves work ethic
Mature and self-aware, with a professional presence
Quick learner: Intellectually curious, comfortable with a high level of ambiguity
Reflective: Lives "above the line" – with an intention to be one's best self
Benefits & Perks
ACES knows what it takes to deliver the highest level of care for our clients, and we believe our team deserves to experience that care as well. We offer a robust benefit package, including health, vision and dental benefits, paid vacation/sick time, retirement options, pet insurance, and more, including:
The opportunity to be part of a hyper-growth company focused on changing the future of behavioral therapy
Collaborative, supportive, agile, and fun culture
1:1 executive mentorship and opportunities for advancement
Access to weekly, company-sponsored peak performance trainings
Additional Information
ACES is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, disability, age or covered veteran status. We embrace diversity and encourage you to apply!
To find out more about how ACES uses employee data for business purposes, see our Employee Privacy Policy. (https://www.acesaba.com/employees-privacy-policy/)
If you are having any issues with submitting your application, please reach out to us directly at careers@acesaba.com.

Title: Director of Digital Transformation & Automation
Description: In this role, you will evangelize and be the champion of Celigo on Celigo, identify and influence business process improvements, digitize and automate them by…
Descriptions:
We're looking for a Director of Digital Transformation & Automation who has a deep passion and experience in creating a culture of and executing digital transformation programs across an enterprise. In this role, you will evangelize and be the champion of Celigo on Celigo, identify and influence business process improvements, digitize and automate them by leveraging Celigo's iPaas and other automation products and applications. This role will report to the CIO and will work closely with executive leadership and business leaders to shape and deliver initiatives, and will be responsible for ensuring that the initiatives are aligned with the company's overall strategy.
This role will be a key leader on the Global Technology Operations(GTO) team as well as the company. The GTO team is responsible for digitally transforming & scaling Celigo's business, unlocking productivity and operational efficiency for the organization, and helping Celigo achieve its mission. To do this, we collaborate deeply with the best minds and teams at Celigo that run our business and build our product. An ideal candidate for the Director of Digital Transformation & Automation, will be an industry thought leader, an influencer of all things automation and has relevant knowledge of industry trends on automation technologies.

What would you do, if hired?
Responsible for visioning and driving Celigo's digital transformation journey and our internal automation mission
Identify areas of improvement across the company's business processes, develop and implement strategies to drive change and lead a team of analysts and engineers to execute on those strategies.
Combine best-in-class digital process and automation technologies (incl. Process design/modeling and mining, intelligent/robotic process automation, Low-code/No-Code,) to deliver optimized and digitized end-to-end processes
Partner with Business and Functional owners globally and across the company to drive process re-engineering and automation initiatives
Drive process and automation community enablement across Celigo to democratize process re-engineering and automation efforts, to enable productivity improvements
Share industry automation trends and bring relevant tooling to unlock new operating paradigms.
Manage automation project portfolio including: Track and report on progress against tasks, activities, costs and benefits
Who are we looking for?
10+ years leading global, cross-functional end-to-end process maturity assessment, redesign, transformation, improvement, and automation
Extensive experience with Business Systems, Automation Platforms such as iPaaS, Robotic Process Automation, Business Process Management, Process Mining tools is a must to be successful in this role
Diverse background through exposure to different functions and businesses - possibly through consulting, biz-ops, or similar roles driving x-company transformation programs.
Executive presence - demonstrated ability to engage with C-suite executives in companies of similar scale.
Business acumen - demonstrated ability to step beyond the function to look at the overall business from a commercial/strategic perspective.
Ability to take transformation initiatives to market evangelizing how Celigo uses Celigo to automate business processes - be a industry thought leader
Advanced data analysis skills required for root cause analysis, process design and business optimization to create a data driven environment
Conceptual thinking - ability to analyze theoretical ideas, connect the bigger picture at hand to develop alternate approaches to solving problems and create new insights.
Strong communication skills, especially around breaking down complex processes into digestible and relevant points (business process management notation) for diverse set of clients and colleagues at all levels
Hands-on leader who can dig into details when needed
'Self-starter', 'independent thinker' with the ability to conceptualize, communicate (written and verbal) effectively and solicit alignment and buy-in at multiple levels across the organization
Experience to engage, develop mutually beneficial partnership with technology partners / vendors for joint value creation
Experience in Agile concepts, tools, and methodology to deliver projects
About Us
Celigo is the leading integration platform (iPaaS) that is pushing the boundaries of what an iPaaS can be. Celigo's unique approach to integration enables IT and business users alike to automate and optimize every business process, allowing organizations to accelerate growth and drive innovation at scale.

Pay Scale Information :
Celigo reasonably expects to pay a base salary between $175,000 and $200,000 per year for this position. Actual starting base pay will be determined by skills, experience, geographic location, and other non-discriminatory factors permitted by law. Total compensation may also include variable incentives, benefits, or other perks as outlined in any formal employment offer made.

Benefits
Starting your first year, we offer 3-weeks of vacation, wellness days, and holidays to recharge and spend time with family and friends. Additionally, we provide a strong benefits package, a tech stipend, recognition opportunities, and many other cool perks.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility
As a company, one of the values we hold most dear is fostering a safe, collaborative environment to bring out the best in us, so we created our Taking a Stand Initiative. Our TAS initiative is a volunteer committee open to all Celigans, with strong representation from underrepresented voices within our company. We believe, unequivocally, that everyone deserves to be in a place where they feel welcome as they are. Learn more about Taking a Stand.

Celigo is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age (40 and over), disability (physical or mental), sex, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, condition (associated with cancer, a history of cancer, or genetic characteristics)military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Employees and applicants are also protected against retaliation. Consistent with federal and applicable state laws, acts of retaliation against an employee or applicant who engages in protected activity, such as reporting discrimination or harassment or participating in the EEO process, whistleblowing, or the exercise of any appeal or grievance right provided by law will not be tolerated by Celigo.

Title: Director of Operations
Description: In this role, you will lead all operations and logistics at Collectors, from before collectibles arrive to our facility, to how they are inventoried, processed,…
Descriptions:
Collectors is building the future of how collectors find, buy, authenticate, track & research collectibles - from sports cards, coins, and video games to Pokemon cards. With industry leading services as our foundation and the creativity of our employees, Collectors is leading the way to a tech-forward and modern collectibles industry. The Collectors family of companies includes leaders in third-party authentication and grading services such as PSA (sports and trading cards), PCGS (coins), WATA (video games), and CardLadder, a comprehensive analytics and financial tracking of sports cards. If you're a collectibles enthusiast, or if you want to help us in leading the global expansion of the collectibles market through our values of integrity, teamwork, and innovation, we'd love to hear from you.
We are looking for a Director of Operations to lead our Operations teams at our Santa Ana, CA headquarters. In this role, you will lead all operations and logistics at Collectors, from before collectibles arrive to our facility, to how they are inventoried, processed, stored and ultimately shipped. Each step of this process (except graders) will report into your org. This is a unique opportunity to lead the Operations teams for three lines of product: PCGS, PSA, PSA-DNA, and WATA. Along the journey you will contribute to building a world class Operations organization, delighting collectors every step of the way. As a key leader in our operations team, you will partner with other leaders across Collectors including operations, product, engineering, real estate & facilities, customer support and sales teams.
Our ideal candidate is a collaborative, change management leader with the ability to drive an organization towards ambitious Key Performance Indicator (KPI) measurements by setting priorities and resourcing plans that support an integrated business strategy, in close partnership with the Vice President of Operations. In this role you will be tasked with building, motivating and developing cross-functional operational teams across multiple sites across the east coast. This specifically includes optimizing for secure storage and compliant facility space utilization, and automation initiatives to achieve significant logistics and services efficiency.
This position will report into the Vice President of Operations and will be required to work out of our Santa Ana, CA headquarters.
What You'll Do:
Lead from the front, owning all aspects of on site operations, logistics, and processing of products without reduction in quality while balancing throughput and cost
Scale operation from processing thousands of unique SKUs/year to tens of thousands of unique SKUs/year
Own/deliver on Safety, Quality, Productivity, Throughput, and service KPI's
Provide production planning, coordination, and goals to establish an effective work plan for the operation
Drive additional improvement in throughput, efficiency, and quality by establishing and maintaining a CPI mindset and approach
Instill a sense of urgency, a pride of workplace and an ownership mindset within the team from how the workspace looks to how it functions
Work cross-functionally with the people team (site lead) to enhance staff skills and create a rewarding, fulfilling work environment
Work cross-functionally to mitigate risk from a site safety, security, and insurance perspective
Work closely with the tech organization (product and engineering) to implement new and improve upon existing tech solutions
Lead by example and be a champion of all company policies, including safety, attendance & security

Who You Are:
10+ years of proven operational and leadership experience with a record of delivering results in Operations as GM/Director of operations in light manufacturing, warehousing, or fulfillment center type roles
Demonstrated ability to drive business performance in process, logistics, quality,, and customer service excellence
Proven track record of designing and implementing processes to drive consistency, increased speed and quality of customer care delivery at scale
Ability to translate annual priorities and objectives into a local operating plan with specific focus on streamlining product delivery and turnaround times, as well as increasing product quality standards
Collaborative and reliable leader that takes a data driven approach to problem-solving with a strong process focus for continuous improvement
Experience with change management, inheriting teams and bringing them along for the journey, moving with urgency and empowering those around you to do the same

Salary Range: The salary range for this position is $150,682 - $234,443. Actual compensation on this range varies based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including location, job level, prior experience, and skill set.

Reasons To Join Us:
Health Insurance: All full-time employees are eligible to enroll in Medical, Dental, and Vision
401(K) Matching Plan: We are proud to offer a competitive 401k matching plan to our employees to support their future financial goals
Vacation: All salaried employees are eligible for flexible time-off.
Holiday Pay: All regular, full-time employees are eligible for ten company paid holidays
Employee Discounts: Employees receive discounts on select grading services for approved submissions
Flexible Hours: Many of our teams offer flexible schedules with varying shifts and will work with you to accommodate your needs
Fun Working Environment: Our team members are invited to participate in celebrations, holiday events, and team building activities
Collectors may use e-verify to validate your ability to work legally in the United States.
We are aware that there are instances where individuals are receiving job offers that fraudulently allege to be from Collectors or one of our business units. This type of fraud can be carried out through false websites, through fake e-mails claiming to be from the company or through social media. We never ask for personal information such as your bank account, Social Security numbers or National IDs, nor do we send or request payments for the purchase of business-related equipment. If you suspect fraud, please reach out to jobs@collectors.com.
About Collectors
Collectors is the leading provider of value-added services to the collectible's markets. We authenticate and grade collectible coins, trading cards, video games, event tickets, autographs, and memorabilia through our subsidiaries, which include Professional Sports Authenticators (PSA), Professional Coin Grading Services (PCGS), Certified Coin Exchange (CCE), Wata, Card Ladder, Collectors Corner, Set Registry, Collectors.com, and the Long Beach Expo collectibles trade show. Since our founding in 1986, we have graded and authenticated more than 80 million items. We employ over 1,000 people across our Santa Ana, CA headquarters, New Jersey, Seattle, Hong Kong, Paris, Shanghai and Tokyo. For more information, visit http://www.collectors.com.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We believe that a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills will better service the diverse community of collectors we support.
If you require an accommodation to apply or interview with us due to a disability or special need, please email people@collectors.com.
If you are based in California, you can read information for California residents by viewing the following link: https://www.collectorsuniverse.com/ccpa

Title: Senior Director, HR Technology and Innovation
Description: Drive enterprise alignment across HR Technology strategic priorities and strategies and objectives to define and accelerate a consistent people analytics…
Descriptions:
The Opportunity

QuidelOrtho unites the strengths of Quidel Corporation and Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, creating a world-leading in vitro diagnostics company with award-winning expertise in immunoassay and molecular testing, clinical chemistry and transfusion medicine. We are more than 6,000 strong and do business in over 130 countries, providing answers with fast, accurate and consistent testing where and when they are needed most – home to hospital, lab to clinic.
Our culture puts our team members first and prioritizes actions that support happiness, inspiration and engagement. We strive to build meaningful connections with each other as we believe that employee happiness and business success are linked. Join us in our mission to transform the power of diagnostics into a healthier future for all.
The Role
As we continue to grow as QuidelOrtho, we are seeking a Senior Director, Human Resources Technology and Innovation who is an innovative thought leader that provides strategic leadership and innovative solutions to maximize Human Resources (HR) technology, data-based decision-making, analytics, and service delivery. The position is part of the Global HR Leadership Team and reports to the Global Head of HR. This position will bring value to the organization through inventive and influential thought leadership, effective organizational design, and execution of strategic HR business initiatives in alignment with QuidelOrtho vision, purpose, and business strategy. This leader must be well-versed in HR and Technology stakeholder management. This position can be based in San Diego, CA, or Raritan, NJ. Remote work options will also be considered.
The Responsibilities
Drive enterprise alignment across HR Technology strategic priorities and strategies and objectives to define and accelerate a consistent people analytics strategy for HR and the enterprise in alignment with overall business plans.
Translate business needs into technology enablement with associated business, and change management implications.
Partner with HR leadership and other stakeholders to develop a roadmap to:
Evolve from traditional HR employee experience to a dynamic, data-driven, personalized experience.
Identify improvement areas across people, process, technology, and systems. Prioritize, plan, and implement enhancements and solutions while effectively collaborating to influence adoption.
Envision, define, and implement new HR data-enabled strategies and capabilities.
Implement end-to-end process improvement, scalability, and automation to support operational excellence.
Develop and maintain HR metrics and dashboards for leadership and HR to deliver key talent and organizational insights and enable data-driven decisions.
Drive change management efforts needed to affect operational excellence including adoption of new systems, programs, and process changes.
Develop a high-performing team by increasing the high-potential employee mix, ensuring solid succession planning, and maintaining long-term organizational strategic designs.
Ensure appropriate training is available to enable self-service utilization of all HR technology and data.
Continuously develop relationships with key partners in IT, Finance, HR COEs, and other analytic HR groups for analytical development (e.g., learning from failures, adopting best practices, etc.).
Ensure the execution of appropriate data governance for HR systems/platforms and associated people services and financial data.
Make certain people services-related information being fed into the various enterprise financial/information technology systems is accurate and in compliance with management guidelines and applicable regulatory agencies.
Lead and oversee the management of all relevant agency and vendor relationships including vendor selection, renewals, and licensure.
Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
The Individual
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is required, a Master’s degree is preferred.
Minimum of 10 years of progressively responsible experience in Human Resources with a Technology or Systems focus.
Minimum of 5 years in a leadership role.
Knowledge/Skills
Ability to work collegially across functions and levels with a demonstrated sense of urgency.
Flexibility in adapting to a rapidly changing environment to work with others in a professional and effective manner.
Strong experience in HR Technology (HRIS, ATS, LMS, etc.) and application in a Global, complex business environment. Workday is required.
Ability to measure ROI of Technology investments and suggest new areas of exploration.
Drive adoption and usage of HR Technology tools.
Manage vendors and Technology implementations.
Broad knowledge of HR Systems, models, and infrastructure.
Ability to understand objectives, roadblocks, and organizational needs and translate to effective HR System efficiencies and enhancements.
Ability to extrapolate data into meaningful, digestible reporting and actionable dashboards for various leadership levels.
Strong understanding of HR Processes.
Must excel at analyzing complex problems, issues, and data to provide innovative human resources solutions.
Must convey a strong sense of direction and have the ability to motivate others to perform at their highest level, demonstrating high levels of accountability in completing assignments.
The Key Working Relationships
Collaborates with senior leadership across functions and locations. Informs and interacts with management company-wide to set expectations and support the achievement of corporate goals. This position interacts with all levels of the organization worldwide regularly to listen, inform, persuade, instruct, direct, and coach.
Work Environment
Typical corporate or home office environment.
Physical Demands
No strenuous physical activity, though occasional light lifting of files and related materials (up to 10 lbs.) is required. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this job, regularly required to use my hands to finger, handle, feel, and talk or hear. Frequently required to stand, walk, and sit. Occasionally required to reach, climb, or balance. On a typical day, 80% of the time is spent at the desk, on the phone, or working at the computer; 20% in meetings or interacting with team members. May require significant domestic and/or international travel.
Salary Transparency
The salary range for this position takes into account a wide range of factors including education, experience, knowledge, skills, geography, and abilities of the candidate, in addition to internal equity and alignment with market data. At QuidelOrtho, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The salary range for this position is $167,900 to $308,000 and is bonus eligible. QuidelOrtho offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, along with a 401(k) plan, employee assistance program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, paid time off (including sick time), and paid Holidays. All benefits are non-contractual, and QuidelOrtho may amend, terminate, or enhance the benefits provided, as it deems appropriate.
Equal Opportunity

Title: Managing Director, Head of UX Design, Content, and Research
Description: The Head of UX Design, Content, and Research will lead our critical user experience capability supporting our digital and other experiences across the firm.
Descriptions:
Your Opportunity

The Head of UX Design, Content, and Research will lead our critical user experience capability supporting our digital and other experiences across the firm. This leader will lead a large team across several areas – driving design innovation, simplicity and consistency for clients, and discovery in new areas for the firm. These areas are tremendously important given our mandate to deliver innovative, delightful experiences in a scalable and consistent way. To lead us, this leader must have a passion for design and innovation, creating strong relationships with our internal clients on the digital, business, and technology sides, and be a strong systems thinker in creating the right structures to best manage the team and drive scale. This leader will need to manage complex work and be effective at driving change across the organization.

The Managing Director will work across a wide range of stakeholders to optimize how we manage design, content, and research across our experiences. The MD will support cross-functional partners in leading product design, client experience, development, and risk management. This role will be responsible for articulating the vision for this team, building scalable practices, and innovating to drive optimized experiences. This is an extremely high-profile, cross-enterprise role within Schwab.
What you are good at

The successful MD will create the strategy for this team to create delightful, innovative, and consistent experiences, while driving scale and efficiencies as we support Schwab’s rapid growth. The scope ranges from defining and executing the vision for the overall team, and then partnering closely with digital, business, technology, and risk partners to both deliver the day-to-day work and identify areas of opportunity to further optimize the team and product development processes. This includes, but is not limited to:

Providing a strategy and vision for the broader UX team, including how we most effectively structure our teams and work to drive delightful experiences in efficient and scalable ways
Building engaged, high-functioning teams across both within the UX team and with partners in product, technology, and other areas of the firm
Comprehensive understanding of the product development lifecycle and agile practices
A curiosity and fluency around technical development, with a desire to and plan to deeply engage our technology partners on optimizing our product development processes
Establishing and obtaining commitment to business goals, while constructively motivating people and implementing strategies to achieve superior business results, including quality and productivity
Strong client focus and the ability to effectively build relationships, establish trust, respect, competence with both the UX and partner teams
Support for teams and partners in defining best-in-class client experience – built on a scalable foundation
Strong attention to detail as it relates to risk management, governance, and institutionalizing processes

What you have

A minimum of 15 years of experience in design and digital product leadership roles with demonstrated increasing scope / impact -
Experience providing end-to-end design direction and digital product leadership for technology solutions in the financial services industry.

Exceptional communication, relationship management, and influencing skills -
Experience managing multiple priorities and overseeing distinct teams with varied strengths. Proven ability to navigate complex and nuanced interpersonal issues, balance priorities of different stakeholders, and build trust among business partners. Strong emotional intelligence/maturity and senior level executive presence. Thrives on initiating, building, and cultivating strong authentic relationships inside and outside the group.

Experience driving transformation, change and process improvement through people, process, and technology -
Able to take a broad view of continuous process improvement and operational discipline to identify and maximize what we do and how we do it across the Enterprise.

Leadership -
Able to articulate a complex task or analysis to individuals at all levels of the company. An exceptional manager and motivator of people and teams who can build organizational capacity through a combination of proper organizational structure, hiring, training, and recruiting the best talent available.

Education and Professional Qualifications -
Bachelor's degree required. Post graduate degree is a plus.
12+ years’ experience in people management; consistent record of building and inspiring hard-working teams.
Demonstrated experience of having directly led a team of 50 or more.

Base compensation: $300,000 - $330,000. Your compensation may be different. Speak with your Talent Advisor to learn more. In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities.
Why work for us?
Own Your Tomorrow embodies everything we do! We are committed to helping our employees ignite their potential and achieve their dreams. Our employees get to play a central role in reinventing a multi-trillion-dollar industry, creating a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth.
Benefits: A competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future.
TD Ameritrade, a subsidiary of Charles Schwab, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At TD Ameritrade we believe People Matter. We value diversity and believe that it goes beyond all protected classes, thoughts, ideas, and perspectives.

Descriptions:
Upwork ($UPWK) is the world's work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.
Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.
Despite our success, we believe we can do better, which is why we've assembled a world-class team from around the world in fields ranging from computer science and electrical engineering to economics and statistics. If you're passionate about solving hard problems at scale, knowing that your contribution to Upwork is enabling massive economic value and creating social value globally, then please read on.
The CX & Trust Engineering team is responsible for protecting our users from harmful actors and abusive behaviors. With the continuous efforts of our CX & Trust Engineering team, Upwork can provide the best user experience and create economic opportunities for people around the world.
Your Responsibilities:
Manage multiple engineering projects and priorities, scale teams, and ensure your org is effective, healthy, and set up for success by establishing clear and measurable goals
Aligning with CX & Trust business objectives, collaborating with business partners and cross-functional teams on delivering key result
Lead a multi-disciplinary team of frontend and backend engineers responsible for detecting and remediating policy violations, bad actors, and building proactive safety features
Establish, track, and report strategic and operating metrics
Balances long-term R&D investments with near-term execution and product delivery
Attract top talent, build, lead and mentor members of your team to reach their full potential
Cultivate a team culture of high performance, engagement, and operational excellence at scale
Improve system design and architecture to ensure high stability and performance of the services
What it takes to catch our eye:
Extensive software engineering leadership experience, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects, preferably in the Trust and Safety discipline
Hands-on large-scale micro-services, backend systems, and project delivery experience
Expert knowledge of modern web application design, development, security, monitoring, analysis, SDLC, and CI/CD tools.
Strong experience with data structures, ML models
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Experience in moderation or risk control system design and implementation
Experience managing large org comprising of Directors, Senior Managers, architects, and IC reporting under those leaders
Proven track record of influencing across the organization and leading others cross-functionally to deliver on projects and goals
Comfort working in a high-growth environment and balancing various priorities
The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $196,000.00 - $398,000.00. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program.
Come change how the world works.
At Upwork, you'll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees.
Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. And oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits - including medical insurance for you and your family, unlimited PTO, 401(k) with matching, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and a generous Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Title: I.T. Director, Sonoma Valley Hospital – UCSF
Description: This role will be dedicated to SVH until such time that the IT environment is stabilized, and major IT programs (e.g. electronic health record implementation,…
Descriptions:
The Sonoma Valley Hospital (SVH) IT Director is the primary leader of information technology (IT) services and functions at SVH. As an embedded member of the local operations teams at SVH, the incumbent provides day to day leadership of IT resources, services, and projects. This role will be dedicated to SVH until such time that the IT environment is stabilized, and major IT programs (e.g. electronic health record implementation, security remediation) are completed. At the appropriate time, this role may expand to include support of other UCSF Affiliate IT leadership needs as the circumstances require.

The incumbent is required to understand, interpret, and communicate SVH operational objectives, develop strategies and policies, and ensure human, financial, and physical resources of SVH IT are properly aligned with the operational and clinical needs of SVH in a secured environment. This includes the establishment of operational processes, tools, controls and skill sets required to deliver stable, secure and predictable IT environments as well as high quality and timely delivery of IT services to SVH. The incumbent, operating with a high degree of autonomy, oversees through peer and subordinate Managers the accountability and stewardship of department resources and the development of systems and procedures to protect organizational assets. Additionally, the incumbent is responsible to bring forward and apply the UCSF IT standards of IT operations, security, governance, external IT partner services, and technology where appropriate. Finding opportunities to leverage the UCSF IT contracts and pricing for the benefit of SVH is also an expectation of this role.

The incumbent will also collaborate closely with the SVH Chief Medical Officer (CMO) and the UCSF Associate CIO of Enterprise Systems for purposes of attaining advice, direction, priority setting and budget planning. This may include advocating with the CMO of IT investment needs and advising on the risks within the IT environment such that SVH executives have the information necessary to make informed and pragmatic decisions about which IT investments to prioritize.

As part of this, the incumbent is expected to exemplify UCSF and SVH core values of judgment, communication, innovation, and impact and continue to build and strengthen departmental culture, employee engagement, and strong customer service to all business partners and colleagues.

Duties and Essential Job Functions:
Makes day to day decisions on IT-related matters, prioritize the focus of the SVH IT team and ensures achievements of objectives
Manage the performance and skillset of the SVH IT team to establish and maintain high performance which may include coaching, developing and transitioning staff as appropriate
Reviews status of information technology operations and projects and prepares recommendations for new systems or improvements
Coordinates agendas and preparation of materials for local IT-related governance or decision-making meetings.
Participates in appropriate UCSF Health IT governance forums to promote coordination
Evaluate ongoing user needs and identify gaps in client training or information technology (IT) service delivery
Establish and assign responsibilities for the administrative processes required to support selection, contracting, acquisition, payment and management of IT vendors and partners
Leverage UCSF information technology practices and procedures for operational excellence in IT areas where appropriate, e.g. end user security awareness training/communication
Provides responsive advice, counsel, education, and service to SVH leaders concerning IT matters, engaging other SVH and UCSF team members for support as appropriate
Keep senior leaders at SVH informed and involved in major IT operational issues
In conjunction with CMO and Associate CIO UCSF, develop annual operating and capital budgets for IT
Act as a key point of coordination for projects and services provided by UCSF
Establish and maintain a culture of teamwork and effective collaboration
Assign and delegate activities across the SVH IT team
Develop and support culture of Service Excellence
Perform other duties as assigned

To see the salary range for this position (we recommend that you make a note of the job code and use that to look up): TCS Non-Academic Titles Search (ucop.edu)

Please note: The compensation ranges listed online for roles not covered by a bargaining unit agreement are very wide, however a job offer will typically fall in the range of 80% - 120% of the established mid-point. An offer will take into consideration the experience of the final candidate AND the current salary level of individuals working at UCSF in a similar role.

For roles covered by a bargaining unit agreement, there will be specific rules about where a new hire would be placed on the range.

To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html

Department Description
Central IT provides infrastructure, network, security, analytics, integration, and application support services and is essential to the organization’s ability to support growth, mitigate security risk, and manage, store and share sensitive information.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training
5-10 years of experience managing an information technology organization
Demonstrated ability to manage and coordinate individuals with different professional training, skill sets and personalities, across teams, and regardless of relative rank or status, in order to execute complex, impactful projects and initiatives in a collaborative manner
Demonstrated proficiency with the design of workflow processes integrated with automated systems
Demonstrated ability to promote and maintain good interpersonal relationships, and a proficiency in team building, conflict resolution, group interaction, and customer service
General knowledge of information technology components especially in the areas of infrastructure, security, and applications support
This position requires flexibility to orient and work at UCSF Health and affiliate partner locations
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of healthcare related experience
Experience working within health systems, large academic centers, and community hospitals
At least one prior implementation of IT systems in a hospital and clinic environment
Advanced degree preferred
About UCSF
UCSF opportunity located at our Sonoma location:

At Sonoma Valley Hospital, we take great pride in the care we provide. Our staff and physicians are deeply committed to the health and wellbeing of our community. Year after year, our team provides high quality patient care that meets and frequently exceeds national benchmarks.
We continually focus on how we can provide a safer environment through our “Culture of Safety” Program that continuously works to improve services and procedures. Sonoma Valley Hospital has received national recognition for its excellent safety practices. The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services has given us 4 stars which ranks us among the top 25 percent of hospitals nationally for quality.
We actively seek out new medical and surgical best practices to ensure that community members have state-of-the-art care and the best outcomes possible. We have an Emergency Department and Surgery Center that are among the most modern in the North Bay.
We are pleased to share our nationally benchmarked quality outcomes which demonstrate the effectiveness of the care we provide and explain why our patient satisfaction is very high.
We are proud to be an affiliate of UCSF Health. At UCSF, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.

Consistently ranked among the top 10 hospitals nationwide by U.S. News & World Report – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Descriptions:
Live Your Passion. Add Your Magic.
At Montage International, we are doing something different, something exciting and it takes passionate people to bring our vision to life. We have built a culture that leads with the important notion we live by every day; do what you love. If this resonates with you, we look forward to receiving your application.

Director of Information Technology
SUMMARY
The Director of Information Technology will be responsible for the successful management and performance of all IT operations on the property, and for performance of all IT requirements as assigned by Corporate IT.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Major areas of responsibility/ management include, but are not limited to:
Develop, schedule, staff and lead the property IT Department to successfully provide around the clock technology support
Implement efficient processes and procedures to effectively handle property level requests for support, and follow approved MHR procedures for escalating and coordinating with corporate IT and vendors
Provision and resolve technology problems as requested or reported
Implement, maintain, backup and administer all installed technology to meet vendor requirements, industry standard practices, the requirements of the property, and policies and procedures as developed by corporate IT

Perform fault isolation, problem determination and problem resolution of standard set network and serve problems to ensure proper integration of software and hardware components

Budgetary analysis capabilities required
PREFERRED
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Luxury hotel experience strongly preferred
Two years’ experience at a hotel/resort preferred
Customer service background preferred
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Must be able to exert well-paced ability to maneuver between functions occurring simultaneously. Must be able to lift up to 15 lbs. on a regular basis. Requires grasping, writing, standing, sitting, walking, bending, stooping, squatting, stretching, repetitive motions, listening and hearing ability and visual acuity to fulfill tasks. Must have finger dexterity to be able to operate office equipment.

Descriptions:
At Expa we're dedicated to being the best place for entrepreneurs to create and build companies. Expa was founded in 2013 by Uber co-founder Garrett Camp to help bring great ideas to life. We're builders, founders, and operators ourselves, know the struggles that come with starting a new company, and what it takes to succeed. We support entrepreneurs with more than just funding — we offer a valuable network, office space, and our advice and expertise.
Expa Studio combines technical and design expertise, operational support, and capital to turn bold ideas into category-defining companies. We are continually ideating on new studio company ideas and are looking for a great Director of Product Management to help drive an upcoming project from tiny seed to sapling. The ideal candidate must love creating and growing products from the very early stages. You are always coming up with new ideas and thinking of ways to integrate them into products to make them better. You will help build the right features for users by planning and driving the roadmap, and helping to iterate and learn quickly from users and data.
The ideal candidate has a technical background and is data-driven. They have prior experience working with products that are trying to present big data in useful and specific ways to the end user, creating and exploring different user experiences (via wireframing and UX work), and implementing analytics.
Responsibilities
Lead the research, design, development and launch of user-centric products
Define goals and success with clearly measurable objectives and key results
Understand user needs; identify and define product requirements
Create wireframes and collaborate heavily with design
Organize and drive the product roadmap and development with a strong team of engineers, designers, and operations
Prioritize and build alignment across partners, founders, operations and marketing teams
Implement an analytics system that will scale
Communicate concisely and influence outcomes
Requirements
5+ years in technical product roles working in enterprise B2B SaaS
Prior experience working collaboratively with designers and engineers, and mentoring and developing talent
Track record of working cross-functionally to build and ship products that users love
You know how to dig into data and user interviews to uncover critical insights
Capable of building a bridge between the grand vision and what the team needs to do week after week
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, to be flexible, and to quickly adapt to new information
Outstanding team leadership and communication skills
Positive attitude and willing to roll up your sleeves to get anything done for your team
Preference for having worked in data heavy environments, such as adtech, cybersecurity, AL/ML
Location: preference for Los Angeles or Vancouver, CA; remote in the US is OK
The budgeted salary range for this role is between $180,000 to $250,000 annual, and is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.

Title: Director of Product Operations
Description: As a Director of Product Operations at Reltio, you are responsible for creating alignment and optimizing operations between product management, engineering and…
Descriptions:
Reltio, Trusted Data Foundation for Your Business Outcomes
About Reltio
At Reltio, we're on a mission to enable digital transformation by delivering a single source of truth for enterprise data designed for the digital experience economy. We are disrupting the master data management (MDM) software market when we launched the first cloud-native MDM software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform. The Reltio Connected Data Platform leverages a cloud-native multi-tenant architecture and our ecosystem to enable speed, agility and flexibility at scale. Companies across industries rely on Reltio to deliver mission-critical, secure, trusted real-time data at scale to create connected omnichannel experiences for their customers, partners and employees.
We've earned numerous awards and top rankings for our technology, our culture and our people. Reltio was founded on a distributed workforce and offers flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives. So if you're ready to work on unrivalled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to enable digital transformation with connected data, let's talk.
Reltio's Focus:
At Reltio, you can take part in our mission to enable digital transformation by delivering a single source of truth for enterprise data designed for the digital experience economy. We contribute to more fulfilling and happier lives for people everywhere by delivering single source of truth for data enabling digital transformation. We leverage a cloud-native multi-tenant architecture and our ecosystem to enable speed, agility and flexibility at scale. We pride ourselves in our transparent, leadership, and meritocratic company culture and have achieved the Fortune 100 best companies to work for.
Reltio's values:
Customer First
Better Together
Simplify & Share
Own It
Always Better Than Yesterday
As a Director of Product Operations at Reltio, you are responsible for creating alignment and optimizing operations between product management, engineering and customer-facing teams so that Reltio can deliver products with higher quality and drive faster customer adoption. As a Director of Product Operations , you'll work directly with product management and engineering teams on Reltio's top priority initiatives and support and coordinate release management and roll-out activities. You'll be responsible for building strong connections with customer-facing teams (customer success, sales, support, etc), ensuring a tight product feedback loop, and coordinating high-quality releases and feature launches. You will also enable data collection and management of the various supporting systems used for managing product roadmap and customer feedback. This is a highly cross-functional role and critical for the success of Reltio's Product-Led Growth initiatives.
You will regularly report to the leadership team to review the status of key initiatives, data regarding customer feedback and adoption of products, as well as other key business metrics.
You should bring an enthusiastic, team-player attitude, foster cooperation with other departments, and drive collaboration across different teams and departments to ultimately drive successful outcomes for the various initiatives supporting Reltio's product strategy.

Responsibilities
Business & Product strategy and Portfolio Planning – Support in creating a comprehensive vision & strategy and identifying key initiatives to support Retio's growth priorities. Define and execute data driven product strategy and portfolio planning, and provide data and insights to measure performance against objectives and key results.


Product Adoption and Value Realization Analytics – Uplevel the understanding of how the product is being used in the real world. Develop, facilitate and drive cross-functional initiatives & alignment with key partner organizations, including Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Services, Support, and Partners to drive product adoption and value realization.

Release and Launch Readiness – Own product release and launch readiness to ensure that customer-facing teams are ready with the information and processes required to support new releases and products. This includes managing agile processes for early access products, customer validations, and partner and sales enablement
Operating Mechanisms – Lead and support the operating mechanisms and operational meetings and reviews at Reltio. Help define short-term and long-term outcomes at the company and product organization level and drive success by enabling cross-functional teams.

Tools and Processes: Own and manage the product tech stack and processes for product planning, roadmap, release planning, customer adoption and feedback.
Required Skills
10+ years of total experience with 5+ years in Product Operations, Product Management or Program Management in an Enterprise Software-as-a-Service company.

Excellent project and program management skills with a track record of leading and proactively managing end-to-end execution of projects/programs.

Great written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex topics for audiences of varying technical / business acumen

Experience with Project Management, Agile development methodologies, and Design Thinking is a plus

Familiarity with Product Analytics tools, roadmap and SDLC tools to build and communicate vision, business plans, roadmaps. Experience with GTM strategy and pricing is a plus.
Bachelor's degree or higher.
Reltio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Reltio is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.
