:
The Intuit Customer Success Operations organization is looking to hire a world class leader as Director, Expert Planning reporting into the VP, Customer Success Operations. This leader will drive planning as a platform approach leveraging data and technology for our customer to expert match making. This leader must have skills to influence at an executive level, the ability to articulate end-to-end platform planning strategy while navigating continuous business changes and priorities. The leader must have experience leading planning in a fast past, growing and service oriented organization. This leader is expected to transform the way we plan across all of our lines of businesses and staffing models to enable scale and business growth, by making planning significantly simpler and more granular for our team, leveraging data and technology.
You'll be accountable for establishing demand and capacity models, and processes that support business units and leaders’ efforts to achieve consistent service performance, accommodate new initiatives, deliver budget goals, and make operational decisions based on timely relevant information. In addition, be a strategic thought partner when it comes to identifying continuous improvement opportunities to drive efficiency and effectiveness. This leader will have accountability for growing a high-performing team across demand and capacity planning for our expert population.
Customer Success at Intuit has entered a new stage of growth, and over the next 3 years we will introduce multiple new services offerings and expand globally. As we grow, the scale and speed in how we leverage data driven innovation and technology will be paramount to our source of competitive advantage…our flexible and AI driven operations. It is critical to ensure we accurately and efficiently connect our customers with our experts in our growing live business services.
What you'll bring
A seasoned leader with at least 10 years of experience with a proven record of transforming workforce planning processes to a data and tech led organization. Track record of setting clear and actionable strategy on leveraging technology and AI at scale and an end-to-end system thinker in a service industry.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter with deep customer success and live services oriented organization experience. Strong data analytics experience, strong leadership skills, and the ability to lead across multiple stakeholders. Additionally, strong analytical skills are required to perform real-time analysis as well as optimization and predictive analytics that helps drive business decisions and planning.
Proven track record of driving new technology development and adoption for the team to plan as a platform.
Experience in predictive modeling and forecast model development using multiple business intelligence inputs.
Expected to operate with a continual improvement mindset, focused on inquiry forecasting, delivering reporting and metrics to frontline leadership, and driving a workforce scheduling process that drives efficiency and improves effectiveness across all business units.
Team Leadership: Build and lead strong teams. Ability to evaluate teams, develop, and reshape them as necessary while mentoring and inspiring them to drive continually improving results through strong leadership.
Cross functional and executive influence: Working cross-functionally with Finance, Business Units, Product, Technology and Operations to ensure customer success.
Accountability: Quantifying business needs and developing metrics. Proven track record of delivering performance against goals consistently and predictably. Ability to distill complex issues into structured frameworks and concrete action plan.
Organizationally savvy, with good interpersonal effectiveness, influence, and ability to get things done through both formal and informal means. Exceptional ability to collaborate, influence, mobilize and energize key stakeholders and complex cross-org and cross-functional teams to implement creative, innovative, best in class solutions.
How you will lead
Design and implement a winning strategy on how we plan as a platform.
Own designing an optimized forecasting & scheduling model for all business areas, leveraging AI -Data driven approach.
Lead the team that supports demand forecasting and capacity planning, including scheduling to cover short, medium, and long-term strategy to meet service level and saturation goals supporting various levels of leadership and stakeholders.
Facilitate and lead functional and cross-functional, end-to-end process mapping and analysis sessions to identify areas for process improvement, simplification, and automation.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the employee, internal/external customer experience.
Drive resolution and/or mitigation of current and anticipated capacity planning and workforce challenges, analyzing and identifying critical workforce requirements vital to execute strategic business plans.
Manage a process with internal stakeholders to ensure current forecasts and supporting reports are meeting business needs.
Help business leaders identify volume trends and proactively plan for resource needs; collaborate to project future volume expectations for all upcoming monthly and annual call patterns (Monthly Updates, Marketing Information, New Hire Classes, Shrinkage Calculations, AHT and ADH patterns, Day of Week patterns, Seasonality trends).
Operate at multiple altitudes with a focus on execution and the day-to-day tactics to drive velocity, balancing pace of delivery with the long term needs of an expanding business, all the while bringing a people first leadership style to a flexible and collaborative environment.

Title: Director IT Operations
Location: San Jose, CA 95131 (North Valley area)+1 location
Description: In this role, you will serve as a strong operational leader within the IT organization, collaborating cross-functionally and with senior leadership to drive…
Descriptions:
Overview:
Millions of people experience Synaptics every day. Our technology impacts how people see, hear, touch, and engage with a wide range of IoT applications - at home, at work, in the car or on the go.

We solve complex challenges alongside the most influential companies in the industry, using the most advanced algorithms in areas such as machine learning, biometrics and video processing, combined with world class software and silicon development.

Synaptics is seeking a Director to oversee IT Infrastructure Operations throughout AMER, EMEA & APAC. In this role, you will serve as a strong operational leader within the IT organization, collaborating cross-functionally and with senior leadership to drive performance and employee efficiency.
You will be responsible for leading a team of professionals with many different skills to provide our employees and site locations with innovative operational support. The successful candidate would be able to demonstrate an execution approach to facilitate the effective translation of strategic plans to incremental delivery of impact to the business. Structured thinking, problem-solving skills, and outstanding communication and project management abilities will be crucial for success in this role as you build strong teams that partner with engineering teams across the organization.

The typical base pay range for this position is USD $157,000.00 - $247,500 per year. Individual pay is determined by many factors including work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. This position is also eligible for a discretionary annual performance bonus, equity and other benefits. Note that compensation listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or benefits.
Responsibilities:
What you’ll be doing:
Managing multi-location teams of technical resources to provide remote and on-site support for employees and services ( SysAdmins, Backup, Storage )
Engages with all levels of management and key stakeholders to develop, implement, and manage support and operational objectives
Identify and incorporate future service management needs into a well-considered multi-year roadmap across the organization.
Contribute to Operational Reviews of IT services covering SLA performance, and Operational metrics for your regions
Lead and contribute to IT projects in order to implement solutions and strategies
Providing leadership, direction, and strategy for a growing organization
Building the organizational capacity necessary to implement the strategy
Qualifications:
What we need to see:
Experience as a team leader in similar on-site and hybrid working environment
Broad knowledge and understanding of different IT applications and infrastructure
Strong experience in Data Insights and IT Metrics driving outcome
Experience ITSM and Workflow Automation
Consistent track record leading a successful data analysis team, with outcome
Collaborative approach and strong problem-solving skills to work with leaders across organizational and technical domains.
Demonstrate ability to access business needs, creatively approach solutions, decide and implement appropriate course of actions.
Excellent written and verbal social skills to run effectively across cultures and geographies
BS in CS or Engineering and/or equivalent experience
10+ years of experience in Information Technology Enterprise and Infrastructure with 8+ years Leadership
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Having excellent interpersonal and leadership skills will be critical for success: success depends on building rapport and credibility with multiple stakeholders across the organization
Track record with delivering high availability in complex, global environments
Have a wide degree of creativity and latitude to adjust to rapidly changing plans and circumstances
Experience working in a hybrid on-prem and public cloud environment
Experience working in semiconductor industry a plus.

Title: Associate Director, Sales Analytics
Description:
Computer Skills: Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, SQL for data analytics.
8+ years progressive experience in consulting and commercial analytics and/or sales…
Descriptions:
BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer.
The Associate Director, Sales Analytics will predominantly be focused on secondary data analytics to inform business strategy and field optimization strategies to ensure successful commercialization of BeiGene’s products. This role may also evolve to take on global (ex-China) activities as well. This individual must work effectively with sales teams and home office personnel to provide insights and recommendations on a variety of issues and imperatives impacting sales team success. Specific examples of key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Development of the targeting / call plan for sales personnel, sales force alignment, sales force effectiveness, and ad hoc analytics. Driving these deliverables effectively and optimally requires extensive collaborative efforts with Commercial Management, Commercial Operations, Marketing, Market Access, Sales, and other functions within Analytics. Being part of the Commercial Analytics team signifies close ties with secondary data like claims while leveraging insights from primary market research and forecasting. It is imperative that all Commercial Operations and Business Analytics (COBA) team members work together closely and openly, often picking up functional expertise from each other, to advance market understanding and to optimize approaches.
Essential Functions of the job:
Collaborate with key internal stakeholders to develop data driven targeting of entities including, accounts, health systems, and physicians. Collaborate with the advance analytics team on data-driven behavior segmentation of physicians, accounts, payers, and patients.
Conduct and manage all field force targeting, sizing, and structural analyses.
Drive development of field force call plan. Work with marketing on customer segmentation and sales operations on integrating the call plan into the CRM/SFA systems
Partner cross-functionally to establish benchmarks and key performance indicators, as well as success metrics for product and marketing initiatives.
Determine territory alignments to assure adequate coverage of key accounts; provide on-going analysis to determine need for additional territories
Support the development and administration of the field incentive compensation program. Ensure that plans motivate field personnel and support commercial objectives.
Provide ad hoc analyses as necessary to support senior management and internal stakeholders
Provide insights into business performance and recommendations to internal customers at all levels
Design and enhance Sales Operations Systems: (CRM, executive dashboard, and sales business intelligence tools)
Update salesforce reports and dashboards when necessary; weekly / monthly / quarterly reporting to senior management
Identify and frame key business issues needing further research and align relevant team members on the objectives, approaches, and recommendations
Identify appropriate external partners while considering resources, timing, and overall project goals
Actively integrate secondary research findings with other analytical insights (primary research, forecasting) developed by team members within the Commercial Operations and Business Analytics (COBA) team
Create and implement comprehensive communication plans to optimize the organizational impact of competitive and environmental insights on product strategies and plans
Ensure key multi-stakeholder insights and recommendations are quickly and appropriately shared with cross-functional partners, including colleagues in corporate functions and ex-US affiliates
Apply basic consulting skills, including consultative listening, problem definition, hypothesis generation, data analysis, translation to value, and oral and written presentation for impact
Demonstrate leadership courage with regard to setting boundaries and ensuring time is spent on the most critical/ high value projects
Act with speed, agility, and accountability, while adapting to evolving business needs
Cultivate meaningful internal and external partnerships, adding value and insights for the organization
Qualifications:
BA or BS with concentration in Life Sciences, Marketing, or Business
8+ years progressive experience in consulting and commercial analytics and/or sales operations
Biotech or pharmaceutical required
Oncology experience preferred, with hematology strongly preferred
Hands on, in-depth understanding of secondary data sources (e.g., syndicated sales, longitudinal patient-level data, payer data)
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to translate the data and learning into actionable recommendations for business growth
Demonstrated attention to detail and excellence in project management, including effectively managing multiple projects/priorities
Experience managing vendors and consultants
Ability to adapt plans and strategies as new market findings arise
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, including ability to synthesize findings and deliver a clear overview of recommendations
Supervisory Responsibilities:
No
Computer Skills: Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, SQL for data analytics
Other Qualifications: Experience working with mapping software for territory alignment, experience working on reporting tools with SQL as the backend preferred.
Travel: 15-20%
Competencies:
Ethics - Treats people with respect; Inspires the trust of others; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.
Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently. Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time. Follows instructions and responds to management direction.
Communication - Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations. Writes clearly and informatively. Able to read and interpret written information.
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed. Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Shares expertise with others.
Adaptability – Able to adapt to changes in the work environment. Manages competing demands. Changes approach or method to best fit the situation. Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and development areas; Pursues training and opportunities for growth; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.
Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully.
Project Management - Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget.
Salary Range: $143,900.00 - $193,900.00 annually
BeiGene is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. Actual compensation packages are determined by several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, certifications, relevant education or training, and specific work location. Packages may vary by location due to differences in the cost of labor. The recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for a preferred location during the hiring process. Please note that the listed range reflects the base salary or hourly range only. Non-Commercial roles are eligible to participate in the annual bonus plan, and Commercial roles are eligible to participate in an incentive compensation plan. All Company employees have the opportunity to own shares of BeiGene Ltd. stock because all employees are eligible for discretionary equity awards and to voluntarily participate in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan. The Company has a comprehensive benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. BeiGene does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Director of Product Management
Description: Orchestrate and facilitate the delivery of the product roadmap to market: writing user stories and acceptance criteria, backlog grooming, triage and…
Descriptions:
Responsibilities:
Orchestrate and facilitate the delivery of the product roadmap to market: writing user stories and acceptance criteria, backlog grooming, triage and prioritization, internal demos, end-to-end product execution, and cross-functional project management
Communicate product direction, priorities, progress, and risk mitigation plans to all relevant team members and stakeholders
Work across the team, including engineering, customer support, and marketing, to validate product strategy and map the product strategy to a prioritized, executable product roadmap
Manage the product development lifecycle from inception through launch of key product features
Continuously perform customer research through data analysis, surveys, and customer interviews in collaboration with the product designer to assess product success and to inform business and product strategy
Capture business requirements from internal stakeholders
Write release notes and train internal stakeholders on new features
About You:

5-8 years in a product role at a high growth tech company. Fintech background is a big plus.
Strong agile practitioner well versed in agile routines and product development lifecycle. You have experience working with or leading agile teams and know the difference between “doing agile” and “being agile".
Highly analytical and structured thinking with strong problem-solving skills and bias for data-driven decision making
Natural curiosity for technology and instincts for what makes a great digital experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Passion for creating great customer experiences
Experience with Jira, Confluence or other task management tools
You thrive in the ambiguities, constraints, and opportunities involved in delighting users in a fast-moving startup environment
You’re obsessed with data and understand how to define, collect, and analyze it
You’re adept at facilitating cross-functional teams to make evidence-based decisions and commit to plans of action
You’re organized and pay attention to details without losing sight of the big picture
You have experience building an end-user product (B2B preferred)
• Direct product management experience with an Invoice Automation software application • Track record of driving growth as a product manager • Leadership mentality with a bias for action • Eagerness to share recognition and partner across functional areas • Strong collaboration skills to effectively work across the organization • Possess an analytical nature with the ability to make trade off decisions without perfect data • Proven record of leading multiple workstreams across multiple scrum teams • Deep experience with Agile development methodologies, Scrum preferre
Education and Experience • 5-7 years’ experience in technical product management for a B2B SaaS product offerings • Bachelor’s degree and MBA preferred • Financial industry and expense management experience preferred • Credit card payment experience preferred

Title: Assistant Director of Information Technology
Description: You will lead the efficient operation and maintenance of all computer systems, data and voice communications activities at the Four Seasons San Francisco at…
Descriptions:
You will lead the efficient operation and maintenance of all computer systems, data and voice communications activities at the Four Seasons San Francisco at Embarcadero.
People Functions
Maintain harmonious and professional relationships with all departments and Home Office.
Comply with and enforce Four Seasons’ Category One and Category Two Work Rules and Standards of Conduct as set forth in EmPact.
Must have strong interpersonal skills and be able to relate to all levels of staff.
Must be able to assist hotel guests with technical requirements and issues.
Must be able to provide high levels of service and support to admin users as per contracted Service Level Agreement.
Product Functions
Ensure critical systems, specifically Property Management System (Opera), JAZZ Call Accounting, HSIA, Network (Cisco), PABX and Point of Sales (Micros) systems are available twenty-four (24) hours per day.
Establish and maintain user procedures and hardware familiarization for all systems.
Provide administration services, including contribution to the creation of technology capital and operating budgets.
Provide Systems Administration, including maintaining user/group accounts, user configuration, trouble-shooting access problems and completion of on-site documentation.
Assist in Server infrastructure management, performance monitoring, Operating System upgrades and troubleshooting.
Provide system support services, including service outage diagnosis, troubleshooting and restoration of service, virus protection management.
Maintain and promote Four Seasons core technology standards as outlined in the Four Seasons IT Core Standards.
Assist in the co-ordination of new acquisitions and major projects as required.
Participate in property-level, corporate-initiated technology implementations.
Good knowledge and support for Windows/Mac/Android/iOS operating systems.
Provide direct guest support and quality support to function rooms and conference services.
Administer Office 365, Active Directory, Azure, global VPN and other communication tools.
Assist in the process of systems backup and recovery procedures.
Assist in management of third-party vendors.
Assist with network support and security of Hotel systems (Bit9/Trendmicro/Websense) and network (Lantronix/Palo Alto/Trustwave), Active Directory, Server Infrastructure, and Network Infrastructure maintenance – wired & wireless, Network protection and failover tools implementation.
Perform any additional duties as assigned by the Director of Finance/Assistant Director of Finance or Senior Director of IT.
Profit Functions
Recommend new applications as requested by hotels to streamline business processes.
Implement technology “best practices”.
Provide HSIA Guest and Customer support when no contract with third parties exists.
Negotiate with vendors and suppliers for best pricing and savings
You will be a great addition to the team by demonstrating the following competencies:
Highest level of integrity and transparency.
Good interpersonal and relationship-building skills and a team player with high energy levels to work with cross-functional teams.
Pro-active and inquisitive mind set to develop problem solving, decision making, conflict resolution and strategic thinking skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Work in a safe, prudent and organized manner.
Reasonable cost analysis, cost management and budgeting skills.
Clear understanding of the purpose and reasons for internal controls.
Understand and familiar with hotel quality standards and service standards.
Strong commitment to service.
Technical background, MCSE or strong networking skills
Prior education and/or experience supporting complex networks
Quick grasp of Four Seasons IT core standards, key controls, policies and procedures.
Knowledge of basic accounting principles.
Visa Requirements:
Visa sponsorship is not available. You must already be legally permitted to work in the United States. Without valid work authorization for the United States you will not be considered. US work authorization is required unless candidate is currently in a managerial position at a Four Seasons location. Current Four Seasons managers may qualify for L-1 visa sponsorship.
If you nurture connections, deliver best-in-class results and lead with inspiration then join us and enjoy the benefits of being a Four Season Employee:
Salary Range: $92,000 - $96,000
Experience Four Seasons as a guest through the complimentary room program
Complimentary Employee Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
401(k) Retirement Matching Plan
Highly competitive salaries and incentives
Educational assistance programs, as well as in-house training workshops for all employees.
Complimentary Life insurance
Vacation & Paid Sick Time Off
And much more!
Four Seasons is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Title: Director, Quality Analytics - Hybrid/Remote
Location: Hybrid remote in San Diego, CA 92103
Description: Professional level experience working with clinical information systems and developing deep analytics and interpretation with associated data visualization.
Descriptions:
Payroll Title:
BUS INTEL SUPV 2
Department:
Quality & Patient Safety
Hiring Pay Scale
$105,000 - $145,000 / Year
Worksite:
Towne Centre Drive
Appointment Type:
Career
Appointment Percent:
100%
Union:
Uncovered
Total Openings:
1
Work Schedule:
Days, 8 hrs/day, Monday-Friday
#118423 Director, Quality Analytics - Hybrid/Remote
Extended Review Date: Fri 3/17/2023

UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.

For the safety and well-being of the entire university community, the University of California requires, with few exceptions, that all students, faculty and staff be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus and influenza before they will be allowed on campus or in a facility or office. For more information visit: Flu Vaccine Mandate / COVID Vaccine Policy
UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 8/23/22 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor.
Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 9/2/22. Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.
This position will remain open until filled.
This position will work a hybrid schedule that includes working both on-site at Towne Centre Drive and remote.
DESCRIPTION
While not required, a cover letter is strongly encouraged.
The Director of Quality Analytics helps shape the priority focus areas for our Department and Organization through the development of analytics and visualization that will ensure the best possible outcomes for our patients. This role also plays a pivotal role in ensuring we meet all our Quality Public Profile data elements for Leapfrog, Vizient, CMS, and US News and World Report. This leader ensures that we provide the necessary analytics prepared to support our physician partners in each of our 17 clinical services and our nursing partners.
Involves analysis of complex business problems using data to provide insight to decision-makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Develops forecasts, recommendations, and strategic / tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge. Works with business and / or clinical units to understand and prioritize data and information requirements. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required / available data elements. Optimizes the performance of enterprise business intelligence tools by defining data to filter and index that adds value to the user. Develops business cases to support enterprise-wide business intelligence solutions.
Supervises professionals and serves as a data scientist providing direction and guidance on business intelligence solutions. Coordinates department workflow, sets priorities and assesses processes. Provides input on Oversees personnel matters and recommends improvements to department practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Coordinates daily operations and provides guidance to professionals on performance standards and BI procedures. Trains staff and assigns work.
Partner with key stakeholders across the organization including physician leaders, nursing, and quality and patient safety teammates to identify data needs and collaborate to produce, validate, and publish key metrics to drive the organization towards high reliability.
Serves as a resource on the development of complex analytics, forecasts, data modeling, and reporting to meet desired business outcomes.
Supervises implementation of business intelligence tools and processes. Ensures prioritization of projects and achievement of goals, objectives, and deliverables. Assists with developing / modifying project plans and timelines.
Collaborates with technical teams identifying opportunities to leverage technology to facilitate information delivery and expand business capability.
Monitors data sources, identifies issues, and coordinates solutions to data collection / management challenges.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Nine (9) years of related experience, education/training, OR a Bachelor’s degree in health care information technology, computer science, or related area; plus five (5) years of related experience/training.
Professional level experience working with clinical information systems and developing deep analytics and interpretation with associated data visualization.
Professional level experience and proven success performing clinical workflows, user interface optimization, clinical decision support, rules development, data integration and mining, clinical ontologies, and adoption of technology.
Advanced level capabilities with Tableau, data modeling, MS Excel, MS Access and MSSQL server and related technologies.
Knowledge and advanced level experience working with Transact SQL, Crystal Reports 11, OLAP structures and/or other related technologies.
Advanced knowledge and experience in database management technologies.
Extensive experience and working knowledge of all MS office products.
Strong project management skills. Ability to work in a group setting and lead projects.
Excellent verbal, written communication skills, presentation, and report writing.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge, experience, and/or certification working with Epic data and Epic Clarity.
Advanced level experience working with Transact SQL, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Crystal Reports 11, OLAP structures, and/or other related technologies.
Experience in a large, academic healthcare environment.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Must be able to work various hours and locations based on business needs.
Employment is subject to a criminal background check, pre-employment physical and drug screen.
Pay Transparency Act
Annual Full Pay Range: $78,900 - $179,900 (will be prorated if the appointment percentage is less than 100%)
Hourly Equivalent: $37.79 - $86.16
Factors in determining the appropriate compensation for a role include experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The Hiring Pay Scale referenced in the job posting is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position. The Annual Full Pay Range may be broader than what the University anticipates to pay for this position, based on internal equity, budget, and collective bargaining agreements (when applicable).


Job offer is contingent on successful engagement in the UC COVID-19 Vaccination program (fully vaccinated with documented proof or approved exception/deferral).

If applicable, life-support certifications (BLS, NRP, ACLS, etc.) must include hands-on practice and in-person skills assessment; online-only certification is not acceptable.

UC San Diego Health is the only academic health system in the San Diego region, providing leading-edge care in patient care, biomedical research, education, and community service. Our facilities include two university hospitals, a National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center, Shiley Eye Institute, Sulpizio Cardiovascular Center, the only Burn Center in the county, and and dozens of outpatient clinics. We invite you to join our team!
Applications/Resumes are accepted for current job openings only. For full consideration on any job, applications must be received prior to the initial closing date. If a job has an extended deadline, applications/resumes will be considered during the extension period; however, a job may be filled before the extended date is reached.
To foster the best possible working and learning environment, UC San Diego strives to cultivate a rich and diverse environment, inclusive and supportive of all students, faculty, staff and visitors. For more information, please visit UC San Diego Principles of Community.
UC San Diego Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation. For the complete University of California nondiscrimination and affirmative action policy see: http://www-hr.ucsd.edu/saa/nondiscr.html
UC San Diego is a smoke and tobacco free environment. Please visit smokefree.ucsd.edu for more information.
UC San Diego Health maintains a marijuana and drug free environment. Employees may be subject to drug screening.

Title: Buying Director, RTW
Description:
Knowledgeable in the RTW, Shoes, Accessories and Home space.
Set the seasonal buying strategy for REVOLVE Women’s to continue to grow the business.
Descriptions:
Meet REVOLVE:
REVOLVE is the next-generation fashion retailer for Millennial and Generation Z consumers. As a trusted, premium lifestyle brand, and a go-to online source for discovery and inspiration, we deliver an engaging customer experience from a vast yet curated offering totaling over 45,000 apparel, footwear, accessories and beauty styles. Our dynamic platform connects a deeply engaged community of millions of consumers, thousands of global fashion influencers, and more than 500 emerging, established and owned brands. Through 16 years of continued investment in technology, data analytics, and innovative marketing and merchandising strategies, we have built a powerful platform and brand that we believe is connecting with the next generation of consumers and is redefining fashion retail for the 21st century. For more information please visit www.revolve.com.
At REVOLVE the most successful team members have a thirst and the creativity to make this the top e-commerce brand in the world. With a team of 1,000+ based out of Cerritos, California we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level. It’s our goal to hire high-energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast-paced work environment. In return, we promise to keep REVOLVE a company where inspired people will always thrive.

To take a behind the scenes look at the REVOLVE “corporate” lifestyle check out our Instagram @REVOLVEcareers or #lifeatrevolve.
Are you ready to set the standard for Premium apparel?

Major Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Knowledgeable in the RTW, Shoes, Accessories and Home space.
Set the seasonal buying strategy for REVOLVE Women’s to continue to grow the business.
Develop and manage relevant vendor relationships, as well as relationships across the company channels.
Analyze business metrics and industry trends to find opportunities for future assortments.
Actively build out the vendor matrix.
Manage sales and profitability, gross-margins, financial projections and merchandise plans.
Manage the buy of a variety of brands and products for REVOLVE.com
Identify opportunities and risks in-season through analyzing sales performance.
Partner with planning and exec team to set and drive financial goals.
Lead new brand and category onboarding.
Manage information across functions (planning, marketing and e-commerce merchandising) and across channels to execute profit, sales and inventory targets, in addition to defining and developing assortment growth opportunities that align with strategic initiatives.
Partner with planning to continuously improve and create reporting and visibility to category, subcategory and brand performance.
Partner with Admin & Assistant Manager on junior level development and growth across the department.
Find opportunities with existing brands to identify areas in which we can continue to expand, either through exclusives, category expansion or general depth.
Create and share seasonal trend guides across the organization to support the overall merchandising calendar.
Facilitate and lead various projects, as assigned.
Partner with Brand Marketing to align messaging and product placement through social.
Oversee contracts in partnership with legal and upper management.
Mentor, train and develop Buyers of all levels while leading and innovating our Buyer Development Program.
Leads high level business discussions with vendors on an as needed basis.
Work on special projects as assigned.
Must be able to work flexible hours.
Some travel required.

Required Competencies:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Motivated self-starter with a strong desire to work in the contemporary and advanced contemporary space.
Ability to innovate processes, organizational teams and continuously challenge the way we do things.
Ability to work accurately and efficiently, managing multiple assignments under strict and often competing deadlines.
Ability to demonstrate critical thinking.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and written with multiple departments and personalities.
Innovate and expand our processes and procedures, whether it be to automate or to find efficiencies/holes within.
Ability to develop strong, synergistic relationships with a multitude of teams and personnel.
Ability to work in a fast paced, growing environment displaying strong prioritization, multitasking, and organization skills.
Ability to swiftly identify areas of opportunities within the business and pivot accordingly.
Ability to be a team player, taking on any task needed to support the broader team/organization.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Fashion or Business preferred.
8+ years buying experience required.
Experience in digital and/or multi-brand setting preferred.
Strong knowledge of and the ability to apply retail math concepts, including markup, margin planning, open to buy, and inventory productivity measures.
Proficient in Email (preferably Gmail), Microsoft Office.

A successful candidate works well in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision. At REVOLVE we all roll up our sleeves to pitch-in and do whatever it takes to get the job done. Each day is a little different, it’s what keeps us on our toes and excited to come to work every day.

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in California, Revolve includes a reasonable estimate of the salary or hourly rate range for this role. This takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions; including but not limited to business or organizational needs, skill sets, experience and training, licensure, and certifications.
A reasonable estimate of the current base hourly/salary range is $150,000 per year to $200,000 per year.

Title: Director, Product - Consumer(Remote)
Location: Remote in Los Angeles, CA+1 location
Description:
You will help build and lead a team of product managers who will serve on multiple cross-functional Scrum teams.
10+ years as a Product Manager.
Descriptions:
Allergan Data Labs is on a mission to transform the Allergan Aesthetics beauty business at AbbVie, one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world. Our iconic brands include Botox, CoolSculpting, Juvéderm, and more.
Our team has successfully launched a new and innovative technology platform, Allē, which serves millions of consumers, tens of thousands of aesthetics providers and thousands of colleagues throughout the US. Since its launch in November 2020, Allē has delivered curated promotions, personalized experiences, and had millions of consumers use it as part of their beauty journey.

We're looking for a Director of Product as we prepare to launch a new array of game-changing technologies on our successfully adopted platform. If you're interested in working within a startup-oriented environment, while having the backing of a very large company, please read on.

As the Director of Product, you will drive the vision and execution of the product roadmap. You will help build and lead a team of product managers who will serve on multiple cross-functional Scrum teams. The ideal candidate will comfortably steer tactical process, prioritization and resourcing tasks while being a strategic visionary employing the art of the possible. You will report to the Head of Product and continuously collaborate with key stakeholders across the business to solve the most important technical problems.

You Will
Deeply understand consumers and their needs in the aesthetics space and build consumer experiences in web and mobile products to cater to those needs through qualitative and quantitative customer feedback, analysis and business need evaluation.
Set our product strategy for the consumers in the aesthetics space, define new opportunities, and establish a shared vision across the business in an effort to drive consensus on priority and approach of product features.
Own the overall product roadmap for the consumer, delivering visibility for senior stakeholders.
Contribute to the cultivation of a culture centered on Objectives and Key Results (OKRs), keeping the team focused on delivering incremental value each sprint while sizing contributions against defined objectives.
Lead a talented team of product leaders and product managers while supporting their leadership development and career growth.
Build out a talent pipeline of candidates who are enthusiastic about building delightful, functional products.
Engage with our Engineering leadership to understand the feasibility of product features and alternative options when necessary.
Work with Product Marketing in support of positioning and promoting our product to aesthetic consumers.
Inspire a design culture where user research and feedback are interwoven through the product development lifecycle.
Care about who you work with and how work is done.
Relate to our core values (see below) and have a desire to contribute to and foster a positive working environment and culture.
Required Experience & Skills
10+ years as a Product Manager.
5+ years of experience leading teams
BS or MS in Computer Science or related field; or comparable experience.
You've built and scaled product functionality that serves as the foundation for applications.
You've built D2C, B2C, and B2B2C product solutions.
You have experience leading a team of strong-minded individuals and enabling them to reach their potentials by leading, not managing them.
You're adept at building structure, process, and action items out of vague or complex problems.
Strong ownership mindset with the ability to think big and move fast when presented with necessary data points.
You've worked in cross-functional Agile Scrum teams and drive continuity across Engineering, Product Marketing, and business teams.
Self-motivated, willing to take ownership, show follow through, solve tough problems and deliver on promised solutions.
Excellent communication, presentation, and white-boarding skills.
Preference for those who have worked on large scale B2C products with millions of consumers.
Preference for those who have worked on a product in support of beauty service providers or savvy, modern healthcare providers.
Core Values
Be Humble: You're smart yet always interested in learning from others.
Work Transparently: You always deal in an honest, direct and transparent way.
Take Ownership: You embrace responsibility and find joy in having the answers.
Learn More: Through blog posts, newsletters, podcasts, video tutorials and meetups you regularly self educate and improve your skill set.
Show Gratitude: You show appreciation and return kindness to those you work with.

Title: Director of Information Technology
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:* The Director of Information Technology will manage and direct the company’s information technology (IT) operations, ensuring the department…
Descriptions:
POSITION SUMMARY: The Director of Information Technology will manage and direct the company’s information technology (IT) operations, ensuring the department provides efficient and effective technical support services and data solutions.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESinclude the following. Other duties may be assigned.
· Oversees IT operations and all large IT projects including monitoring and managing scope, schedules, budgets, and quality from conception to delivery
· Develops and delivers overall IT strategy
· Sets company security posture
· Creates and manages department operational and capital expenditure budgets
· Communicates within the department, across departments, and to the entire company as necessary
· Leads development and implementation processes for the organization’s IT systems and department.
· Oversee development team in being a partner to the organization for technological needs
· Oversee development and maintenance of key data systems of the company including its ERP
· Develops and implements business continuity protocols to minimize disruption to business operations in the event of emergency situations or data loss.
· Establishes efficiency and efficacy standards, providing recommendations for improvement of IT infrastructure.
· Analyzes IT infrastructure and systems performance to assess operating costs, productivity levels, upgrade requirements, and other metrics and needs.
· Oversees security of systems, networks, and enterprise information.
· Facilitates IT security audits or investigations.
· Develops and maintains relationships with external IT vendors and service providers.
· Coordinates multisite IT systems via enterprise resource planning (ERP).
· Manages company help desk
· Performs other related duties as assigned.
COMPETENCIES
Project management- Lead group to implement changes and projects in the in organization while tracking and meeting deadlines and holding all stakeholders accountable.
Analytical-Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs workflows and procedures
Equipment and Program Knowledge-Understanding how specific equipment and programs can benefit the business and its customers.Ability to use existing knowledge to diagnose technical issues.
Creative & Innovative Thinking- Connects seemingly unrelated ideas, events, and circumstances to find global solutions to individual problems.
Researching Information- Screens out irrelevant and vague information, keeping the high-quality data. Questions the limits, quality, and accuracy of data; digs for details and confirms suspect data.
Problem Solving-Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem-solving situation. Identifies, collects, and organizes data for analysis and decision making
Teamwork-Exhibits objectivity and openness to others’ views; gives and welcomes feedback; contributes to building a positive team spirit; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objects
Change Management-Develops workable implementation plans; communicates changes effectively; builds commitment and overcomes resistance; prepares and supports those affected by change; monitors transition and evaluates results
Strategic Thinking-Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals
Judgment- Displays willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound and accurate judgement; supports and explains reasoning for decisions; includes appropriate people in decision-making process; makes timely decisions.
Consulting-Partners with clients to identify and resolve complex or sensitive issues
Decision Making-Makes timely, informed decisions that take into account the facts, constraints, and risks
QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience
· Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
· Five or more years of professional success with building and leading multi-site IT teams and working with data management systems.
· Experience, and other training or certification may be substituted for education.
Language
· English with bilingual in English and Spanish preferred
Skills
· Knowledge of IT infrastructure and security systems
· Ability to manage and prioritize tasks and projects
· A working knowledge of VMware, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, Office 365, Enterprise Applications, ERP (Enterprise Resource Planner), Business Intelligence software (e.g., IBM Cognos), and Support Desk Systems.
· Ability to create and maintain effective documentation of policies, processes, and procedures.
· Strong people management and interpersonal skills
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
· Demonstrated organizational and time management skills
· Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software
Supervisory Responsibilities
· Hires and trains IT staff. Schedules, organizes, and assigns projects to members of the IT team.
· Manages responses to requests from company team members for assistance in various data and IT needs
· Oversee projects and implementations as needed and dictated by leaders of the company.
· Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
· Handles discipline and termination of employees as needed and in accordance with company policy.
Miscellaneous:
Reports to: CFO
Status: Exempt
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be exposed to a typical office environment — prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. However, the employee is expected to travel to the different locations (within 50 miles radius distance from primary location) to interact with employees in multiple processes (e.g., onboarding, training, etc.).
Must be willing to work a flexible schedule that includes nights, weekends, and holidays; this is critical to support the needs of the business and is subject to change.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $160,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Vision insurance
Experience level:
5 years
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Weekend availability
Ability to commute/relocate:
Fresno, CA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Experience:
Management: 5 years (Required)
Work Location: One location

Health insurance

Title: Director, Data Science and Analytics
Location: Hybrid remote in San Diego, CA 92121
Description: Working within an AWS-hosted secure data platform established by WHI, you will lead the execution of analytical plans, generate data sets, and provide timely…
Descriptions:
Solely funded by philanthropists Gary and Mary West, West Health includes the nonprofit and nonpartisan Gary and Mary West Health Institute and Gary and Mary West Foundation in San Diego, and the Gary and Mary West Health Policy Center in Washington, D.C. These organizations are working together toward a shared mission dedicated to enabling seniors to successfully age in place with access to high-quality, affordable health and support services that preserve and protect their dignity, quality of life and independence. Through a combination of medical research and policy initiatives, collaborations, education, and advocacy, West Health is committed to supporting and creating healthcare delivery models that improve care and access for our fast-growing, diverse population of seniors. Data/Data Science is an important engine that powers our work. For more information, visit westhealth.org and follow @westhealth.
Position Overview
West Health Institute (WHI) is looking for a Director, Data Science and Analytics. The successful candidate will work closely with teams of health care researchers, clinicians, business leaders, and policy researchers to support a portfolio of initiatives related to advancing successful aging and lowering healthcare costs. As a hands-on leader of our Data Science team, you will be called on to lead a group of engineers, informatics and data scientist engaged in planning, design, and execution of data related projects that are developed by West Health Institute, Policy Center, and Leadership in consultation with the Director, Data Science and Analytics. Working within an AWS-hosted secure data platform established by WHI, you will lead the execution of analytical plans, generate data sets, and provide timely and high value products (e.g., reports, papers, visualizations, and dashboards). You will apply your knowledge and expertise to lead and/or support projects that leverage diverse healthcare data sources (e.g., clinical EMR data, healthcare claims data, and population-based survey data) and seek out new and novel approaches to interrogate, combine, and mine such data. As an expert in data analytics, you will actively contribute to the statistical analysis, interpretation of results and communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders. As Director, you will also serve as a thought leader and partner for c-suite leaders responsible for West Health’s Clinical, Strategy, and Policy initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Plan and oversee the data science team activities and budget based on strategic priorities.
Manage timelines, deliverables, and demonstrate value/impact for data science efforts.
Partner with internal teams to help develop and deliver on (data portion of) projects in a timely, impactful manner.
Work closely with the Institute Privacy Officer and Security Officer to ensure compliance with internal policies and all State / Federal laws governing data.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to leverage Data Science resources to maximize impact.
Advance a portfolio of Data Science technologies and products to provide new research directions and support existing projects.
Develop high value partnerships to drive innovation, maximize impact, and establish West Health as a leader.
Train and develop a team of data scientist, engineers, and analysts with modern data processing and analysis skills.
Maintain and expand successful data science Internship Program and partnerships with local universities.
Communicate effectively with executives, partners, and stakeholders.
Be a role model and maintain a positive atmosphere to foster team building, shared accountability, and success across a diverse team of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and engineers.
Actively manage and integrate third-party teams and consultants to gain maximum value from collaborations.
Requirements
Advanced degree in statistics, health services research, data science or related field
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a managerial role in healthcare (e.g. healthcare system, provider organization, health plan, state or federal healthcare entity, or healthcare research organization)
Must thrive in a fast paced and results driven environment.
Experience working with healthcare data sets; Commercial Insurance, Medicare and or Medicaid claims data, preferred.
Experience working with clinical / EMR data is a plus.
Mastery of statistical concepts and analytical methods
“Customer Service” mentality in leading data science team in meeting needs of internal/external partners.
Ability to communicate results to diverse set of stakeholders.
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Programming experience in Python, R, SQL, and Tableau a big plus
Familiarity with Linux and AWS, a plus
Must be up to date with COVID-19 Vaccinations and booster shots.
Compensation and benefits
The estimated compensation range for this position is $175,000 - $200,000.
We gladly offer:
An up to 10% Annual Performance Bonus
Hybrid work schedule
Robust Benefits Package including Medical, Dental, and Vision plans.
401K/403b Retirement Plan Match
Professional Reimbursements
Generous PTO and Paid Holidays
West Health Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against persons on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, marital status, age, disability, or veteran's status.

Title: Relationship Executive, Technology Group, Corporate Client Banking, Executive Director
Description: The position is a Relationship Management role in the Corporate Client Banking - Technology Group, with a heavy emphasis on client coverage, business…
Descriptions:
The position is a Relationship Management role in the Corporate Client Banking - Technology Group, with a heavy emphasis on client coverage, business development and deal execution.

This position requires an experienced, qualified relationship manager capable of driving business independently across the West Coast. The banker should have proven client relationship skills, an ability to call at the c-suite level, extensive credit and treasury services product knowledge, corporate finance expertise and strong transaction execution skills.

Job Responsibilities
Initiate and maintain strategic dialogue with clients and prospects to generate ongoing corporate finance, treasury services and credit opportunities
Manage complex, multi-product, client relationships
Coordinate the client coverage efforts of multiple internal business partners
Collaborate with credit and loan syndication teams on analysis, structuring, negotiation, documentation and distribution of loan origination
Strictly comply with all regulatory and J.P. Morgan rules, policies, and procedures

Required Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills
Minimum of 10 years of experience delivering and knowledge of corporate finance, treasury, investment banking, credit, and other banking products
Proven track record in business development and client management
Strong corporate finance, analytical, credit and problem-solving skills
Excellent oral and written communications abilities
Self-motivated, dependable and intelligent
Candidate must be a top individual contributor, with a strong performance track record
Completion of a recognized investment banking or credit training program
Possess (or will obtain within three months of hire) FINRA Series 79 and 63 securities licenses
Travel will be required
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.
As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans
Base Pay/Salary
San Francisco,CA $200,000.00 - $350,000.00 / year

Title: Director of Trading
Description: An effective client-facing leader who will own function-specific training and excellence standards, while also developing best practices and processes within…
Descriptions:
The Trade Desk is changing the way global brands and their agencies advertise to audiences around the world. How? With a media buying platform that helps brands deliver a more insightful and relevant ad experience for consumers – and sets a new standard for global reach, accuracy, and transparency. We are proud of the culture we have built. We value the unique experiences and perspectives that each person brings to The Trade Desk, and we are committed to fostering inclusive spaces where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work every day.
So, if you are talented, driven, creative, and eager to join a dynamic, globally-connected team, then we want to talk!
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
An effective client-facing leader who will own function-specific training and excellence standards, while also developing best practices and processes within the Trading function. We are looking for an individual possessing excellent communication, strategic and leadership skills to serve as a coach, functional manager, and senior advisor to the team.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
Manage a diverse, complex portfolio of business across all key clients in the LA area
Oversee a Trading team of people managers and individual contributors
Become a leader in RTB buying strategies, optimization algorithms, and data visualization
Become a leader in best practices for the The Trade Desk platform and offer insights on how to improve campaign effectiveness through the platform’s functionality. Mentor clients leveraging this expertise.
Combine data analysis and client feedback to consult on data, measurement, and optimization strategies and provide solutions for complex campaigns to meet client objectives
Help build our trading best practices, including creating training collateral and internal resources
Work closely with Product Management and other cross-functional teams to help define features and enhancements to improve the platform
Work closely with the client services team to develop and execute an onboarding plan that will make customers successful with our real time buying platform.
Understand and effectively communicate The Trade Desk’s value proposition, technology, processes, and partnerships, as they relate to growth of current client accounts
Help build the Client Services practice, including developing training material, customer facing assets, and internal resources for trading media through our platform
Develop local strategies to align company goals and vision with client goals to deepen partnerships and progress the programmatic industry
Shaping the future of TTD and programmatic though a vision of enhancing advertiser performance with a focus on better data and measurement
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:
5+ years of online ad operations experience required; 3+ years of client-facing experience
5+ year of senior managerial experience and proven ability to scale high performing teams.
Experience in working with ad exchanges, aggregators, ad servers, and other optimization platforms
Experience in trafficking and optimizing all digital media campaign KPI’s including branding, direct response, surveys, incrementally, and lift.
Expert experience in Excel including pivot tables, data visualization, and advanced manipulation of complex data sets
Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a get-it-done now start-up environment
Proven track record of growing accounts by forging a strong relationship with clients, understanding their objectives, and recommending best strategies
Effective time management skills – ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Self-starter – able to tackle new clients or territories with little guidance
Quick learner – able to rapidly grasp new technology and product changes
#LI-KS1
