Bachelor of Science in STEM field; MBA or Master of Science preferred.
10+ years of work experience in healthcare, preferably within or supporting provider networks or payers. The ideal candidate will fluently understand advanced healthcare concepts (payment integrity, for example) and Provider / Payer user persona requirements.
Experience with industry tools such as EHRs, practice management, policy management, accounts and operations, claims database systems, and advanced data analytics.
Experience working with claims automation, workforce and medical resource allocation, supply chain management, risk stratification, and treatment planning.
Proven organizational and coordination skills with the ability to multi-task across several initiatives.
Excellent presentation and written communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Outstanding team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with internal and cross-functional teams to discuss and define scope, objectives, project plans, and deliverables.
C3 AI provides excellent benefits and a competitive compensation package, which include:
Generous equity plan.
Salary range: $184,000 - $216,000 USD.
Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future company sponsorship.
C3 AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status.

Title: Sr. Director, Consumer Insights
Description: Business Line Ownership: Gain exposure outside business analytics as part of role involves oversight and management of the company’s paid subscription…
Descriptions:
Overview:
BJ’s is a $1 billion publicly traded (BJRI) restaurant company with over 200+ premium casual restaurants across the USA and a track record of fast growth, award winning menu and beverage innovations, and a culture of high energy entrepreneurialism. All of our restaurants are fully owned and operated (no franchisees), which offers this role an unparalleled opportunity to work only on critical, impactful and high stakes areas. At our restaurants, we serve our award-winning craft beer, a Southern California twist on deep dish pizza, the world-famous Pizookie® dessert, and much more. Our uncompromised quality standards offer guests a high-energy, premium, contemporary setting to enjoy special moments with gold standard service. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers a differentiated menu and experience to guests across the U.S.

Role Highlights:
Data Driven Culture: Be included and participate in critical decision and strategy meetings with company executive officers, as the owner of consumer insight and champion of making key business decisions through sound data backed analyses
Exposure: Reports directly into the Chief Growth & Innovation Officer, with regular meetings with C-suite executives
Business Line Ownership: Gain exposure outside business analytics as part of role involves oversight and management of the company’s paid subscription businesses
Grow and develop skills: Through exposure and a seat at the table, grow perspective beyond data analyses, and into well rounded business executive management
Responsibilities:
Data Analyses: Selectively conduct data analyses that underlie critical decisions in the company, in support of company growth initiatives, menu item development, new product innovation, new business growth areas, and loyalty & subscription programs. Example analyses include:
Post mortems of market tests and restaurant trials
Consumer surveys & research data analyses
Guest transactional, visit and order behavior
Drivers and correlation studies
Financial analyses
Competitor Benchmarks
Research: Lead and execute consumer research (direct or via agency) infusing best practice discipline into the process
Insights: Drive insights and “so-what’s” from data analyses, derive narrative and develop action plans out of the insights and narrative
Powerpoint: Develop communication materials (typically powerpoint) to present to and get alignment with key stakeholders
Executive Updates: Champion, develop and at times be willing to directly prepare dashboards and executive reporting documents
Subscription Business: Develop, oversee and manage paid subscription business line (e.g., Beer Club and other programs in development)
Hands On: Note that B.J.’s has a hands-on culture, and this role is expected also to take a rolled-up sleeves hands on approach – being willing and eager to dive into the details and conduct the work or analyses directly
Qualifications:
Strong quantitative skills including financial and big data analyses
High proficiency with Excel and Powerpoint
Understanding of research and analytical best practices
Bachelor’s degree from a top university
Ideally 4-6 years of management consulting experience with significant exposure to quantitative projects
People skills to work collaboratively across functions and department
Fit with the B.J.’s culture (“of service”, proactive, hands-on, rolled up sleeves, entrepreneurial, team oriented)

Salary: $130,000 - $200,000/year *commensurate with experience

Proof of eligibility to work in the U.S. required.

Equal Opportunity Employer
Pay Range: USD $130,000.00 - USD $200,000.00 /Yr.

Title: Senior Director of Engineering IT
Description: Lead a global team to gather requirements, research, evaluate, design, plan, deploy, and support MaxLinear’s global engineering IT infrastructure in support of…
Descriptions:
Responsibilities:
MaxLinear is seeking a Senior Director of Engineering IT to join our team. In this role, you will focus on the following:
Lead a global team to gather requirements, research, evaluate, design, plan, deploy, and support MaxLinear’s global engineering IT infrastructure in support of hardware and software engineers
Review, develop, and evaluate overall engineering IT strategy to ensure alignment with business needs and objectives while building and supporting resilient, high-performance, scalable, flexible, cost-effective, and secure solutions
Oversea and manage engineering IT budget and build and maintain vendor relationships
Lead team to maintain ongoing operation of Engineering IT data centers, high performance compute clusters, servers, storage, tools, and licenses at international locations
Lead the team to perform analysis, configuration, installation, upgrade, monitoring, maintenance, troubleshooting, patching, securing and repairing of Linux servers and storage in a heterogeneous environment
Lead the team that maintains configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, and Ansible) and custom scripts (in bash and Python) to automate repetitive tasks and improve consistency in operations and maintenance activities
Identify technology needs, keep current with changing technologies in the industry, and make recommendations to decision-makers
Plan, manage and lead the coordination and execution of upgrade/improvement projects within the Engineering IT team
Maintain integrity and security of systems by following established security protocols and practices
Direct, manage, and develop engineering IT staff
Compensation and Benefits:
MaxLinear has a Total Compensation philosophy which includes base salary and annual discretionary bonus eligibility and many positions also include stock-based compensation.

MaxLinear expects to offer a starting base salary within the range of: $176,400 to $273,815 Annually

We offer competitive benefits designed to support employee health, welfare, and retirement and some highlights are: health care benefits, 401k savings plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), paid time off, and a hybrid work schedule.

The actual starting base salary will be determined by the match to certain role-related criteria such as educational degree(s) or equivalent, relevant work experience, skillset needed for the role, and geographic location; this is not an all-inclusive list as some roles may require unique skills or experience.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
Qualifications:
Experience with engineering project management in a technology company
Experience with team management and cross-department project management
Success in deploying new technologies or workflows
Experience with the installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of physical and virtual CentOS, RHEL, or OEL servers
Experience with the installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of enterprise level storage environments using NetApp storage devices or equivalent
Experience with the installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of compute farm schedulers such as IBM LSF
Success in automating server builds, standardizing images, and managing Linux systems via central management tools such as Fog, Ansible, Satellite, Spacewalk, or Puppet
Experience with software tools such as Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, CI/CD pipelines, and build servers preferred
Proven ability to work in a dynamic team environment, collaboratively working to resolve tough technical issues spanning multiple disciplines
Ability to come up to speed quickly on complex systems, perform technical research, and thoroughly document findings
Self-starer, flexible, and able to plan, organize, prioritize, and complete work efficiently
BS in Computer Science or related + 15 years of experience, or MS + 12 years of experience
Company Overview:
MaxLinear is a global, NASDAQ-traded company (MXL) where the entrepreneurial spirit is alive and well. We are a fabless system-on-chip product company, striving to improve the world’s communication networks for everyone through our highly integrated radio-frequency (RF), analog, digital, and mixed-signal semiconductor solutions for access and connectivity, wired and wireless infrastructure, and industrial and multi-market applications.

We hire the best people in the industry and engage them in some of the most exciting opportunities that connect the world we live in today. Our growth has come from innovative, bold approaches to solving some of the world’s most challenging communication technology problems in the most efficient and effective manner.

MaxLinear began by developing the world’s first high-performance TV tuner chip using standard CMOS process technology. Others said we couldn’t achieve the extremely high-performance requirements using CMOS, but we proved them wrong and achieved enduring global market leadership with our designs. Since then, we’ve developed a full line of products that drive 4G and 5G infrastructure; enable data center, metro and long-haul optical interconnects; bring 10Gbit to the home; power the IoT revolution; and enable robust and reliable communication in harsh industrial environments. Over the years, we’ve expanded through organic growth and through several acquisitions that have perfectly complemented our existing portfolio and enabled us to deliver complete end-to-end solutions in our target markets. One such example was the acquisition of Intel’s Home Gateway Platform Division that added Wi-Fi, Ethernet, and Broadband Gateway Processor SoC technology to our connected home portfolio creating a complete and scalable platform of connectivity and access solutions to fully address our customers’ needs.

Our headquarters are in Carlsbad, near San Diego, California. We also have major design centers in Irvine and San Jose, California; Waltham, Massachusetts; Vancouver, Canada; Valencia, Spain; Bangalore and Chennai, India; Villach, Austria; Munich, Germany; Israel; and Singapore.

We have approximately 1,500 employees, a substantial majority of whom have engineering degrees and include masters and Ph.D. graduates from many of the premiere universities around the world. Our employees thrive on innovation, outstanding execution, outside-the-box thinking, nimbleness, and collaboration. Together, we form a high-energy business team that is focused on building the best and most innovative products on the market.

Title: Director of Human Resources
Description: The incumbent will use an analytical, data driven approach to implement people strategies that will nurture a mission focused culture, build high performing…
Descriptions:
Job Title: Director of Human Resources

Company: Food Allergy Institute

Location: Fully Onsite; The Hub; Long Beach, CA

Salary: $135,000 - $160,000 per year; Exempt

Who Are We?
Founded in 2015, the Food Allergy Institute (FAI) is a cutting-edge research and clinical care center revolutionizing food allergy treatment among the pediatric population. Our Tolerance Induction Program™ is the first of its kind, bringing patients to the point where they can eat whatever they want, whenever they want, without having to worry about any kind of reaction. The success of FAI is built on years of development involving proprietary biomarkers, data analytics and modeling systems which allow unique patient specific therapy to be deployed in the clinic setting and at home safely.

Why FAI?
The Food Allergy Institute is home to many innovative thinkers, problem solvers, and passionate leaders. The work we do is truly life-changing for our patients and their families; each member of our team will experience how their role supports our mission! FAI provides a challenging and rewarding environment where employees’ talents are leveraged, ideas are encouraged and growth is always inspired.

FAI currently employs over 170 employees! Our diverse team includes roles such as: Physicians in the specialties of Pediatrics, Pulmonary, Allergy, Emergency Medicine, and Immunology, as well as Nurse Practitioners and Physicians Assistants, and a PhD level research team. In the food allergy world, the growth of FAI is unique in reflecting the effectiveness of its treatment approach and the supportive environment fostered by its team of professionals.

Who Are We Looking For?
We are currently seeking a Director of Human Resources to lead all aspects of the HR function and build the infrastructure to support future growth and expansion. The incumbent will use an analytical, data driven approach to implement people strategies that will nurture a mission focused culture, build high performing/engaged teams, and attract and retain talent.

This role will coach and develop both the Human Resources team and organizational leaders to create and maintain an environment that will help promote employee engagement. This includes designing and implementing programs that inspire, motivate, and develop our employees.

Benefits:
Health Insurance
Vision
Insurance
Dental Insurance
PTO Days
Paid Holidays
401K Plan (matched)
Professional Development
Paid Training

Responsibilities (may include but not limited to):
Build a data-driven human resources organization that will support the company during a phase of
growth and expansion.
Formulate and execute the people strategy, including: recruiting, talent management, performance management, learning and development, employee engagement, compensation, benefits, retention, diversity and inclusion, compliance and culture initiatives.
Serve as a strategic business partner to the executive leadership team, department heads, and people managers; use data to provide insight, flexible and innovative solutions and best practices to help drive performance, growth and retention.
Oversee, grow and develop the HR team.
Coach and mentor organizational leaders and employees.
Implement HR technology and processes to support a complex and growing workforce.
Establish scalable leadership development solutions and develop programs that prepare high-potential employees for their next role.
Oversight of payroll and benefits administration.

Required Skills and Abilities:
Strong knowledge and experience in strategic Human Resources management.
Excellent project management skills with a proven ability to design and implement people strategies that drive business results.
Data-driven with the ability to master complex business problems.
Strong communicator with the ability to provide both strategic foresight and feedback.
Experience with compensation planning.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who proactively takes ownership to grow the organization.
Intellect and pragmatism to be able to effectively handle ambiguity and manage change.
Unquestioned integrity and the experience, confidence, and stature to effectively address sensitive HR and business issues.
Sensitive to and proactively works toward the cultural diversity and inclusion.
Highly ethical individual, strong level of confidentiality with a natural tendency toward discreteness.
Strong service orientation with commitment to providing an excellent employee experience.
Deep knowledge of legal HR compliance matters.
Knowledge of payroll and benefits administration.
Experience with HRIS systems; experience with NetSuite and BambooHR are a plus.
Proficient in Google Apps and MS Office

Education and Requirements:
Minimum BA/BS degree.
10+ years of experience in Human Resources, 3 to 5 years in a leadership capacity.
HR certification preferred.

Physical Requirements:
Office environment.
Some travel between sites required.

FAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. FAI is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified applicants, and employees with disabilities to ensure they enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities and benefits of employment as required by the Americans with Disabilities Act.

Title: Sr. Director, Revenue Operations
Description: Experience in architecting and managing Salesforce, as well as reporting, analytics, and development tools (Excel, Tableau, etc.).
Descriptions:
at Simpplr
Hybrid - Redwood City, CA, US

Who We Are
Simpplr is the leading AI-powered employee experience platform. Organizations use our forward-looking, adaptable products to deliver personalized experiences that inspire and engage their employees. Wherever people work, Simpplr enables them to flourish.
Trusted by more than 500+ leading brands, including Zoom, Snowflake, Moderna, Eurostar, and AAA, our customers are achieving measurable productivity gains, increased employee engagement, and accelerated business performance.
Simpplr is headquartered in Silicon Valley, CA with offices in the UK, Canada, and India, and is backed by Norwest Venture Partners, Salesforce Ventures, and Tola Capital.
The Opportunity
As the Senior Director, Revenue Operations at Simpplr, you will report directly to the CRO & partner closely with our GTM teams to determine strategy, implement performance metrics, and influence the alignment of all revenue operations. This role will drive revenue effectiveness by establishing measurable processes to improve sales & marketing efficiency and determine growth goals.
Your Job Responsibilities
What you will be doing:
Partner closely with Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing Operations leaders and their teams, serving as subject matter experts in revenue operations.
Partner with Marketing to monitor and report on the sales funnel from lead generation through to deal.
Integrate automated efficiencies where possible to maintain an agile and lean business.
Determine and direct operational priorities connected to new business and customer acquisition, growth, and customer success (retention) to effectively achieve revenue goals.
Establish high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in planning, forecasting, and budgeting approaches used by the sales, marketing, customer success, and finance organizations.
Implement operational processes and procedures to ensure data accuracy and reporting.
Incorporate early detection and identification into the process to ensure timely actions are taken.
Model and report on compensation, quota, and SPIFF attainment for our sales and BDR teams, as well as align with sales territories, to create an equitable, fair compensation structure that incentivizes our teams to overachieve on their targets.
Your Skillset
What makes you a great fit for the team:
Passion and proven success record for operational excellence.
Experience with working with a SaaS company; high growth startup experience a plus.
Strong analytical abilities with the ability to break down problems into logical steps towards a business objective and solution.
Experience in architecting and managing Salesforce, as well as reporting, analytics, and development tools (Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong oral and written communications with proven ability to develop and present data-driven findings in a succinct manner to support insights and recommendations.
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, with an ability to handle various priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to independently identify problems, propose solutions and execute on those solutions.
9+ years’ experience in Sales or Business Operations, experience at a fast-paced technology company preferred.
Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base pay for this role is between $200,000 - $220,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role is eligible for bonus, equity and benefits.
Simpplr is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or genetics.
#BI-Hybrid
Benefits:
Simpplr provides a competitive compensation package along with other benefits. We believe in work-life integration and offer a flexible work environment. These benefits, coupled with an amazing team who believes in our mission, and values transparency, autonomy, and inclusiveness, make Simpplr an incredible place to work.

Title: Associate Director, Market Access Operations Analytics
Description:
Minimum 5 yrs industry analytics experience required.
The Associate Director (AD), Market Access Operations Analytics will support and lead Continuous…
Descriptions:
Overview:
Jazz Pharmaceuticals plc (NASDAQ: JAZZ) is a global biopharmaceutical company whose purpose is to innovate to transform the lives of patients and their families. We are dedicated to developing life-changing medicines for people with serious diseases - often with limited or no therapeutic options. We have a diverse portfolio of marketed medicines and novel product candidates, from early- to late-stage development, in neuroscience and oncology. We actively explore new options for patients including novel compounds, small molecules and biologics, and through cannabinoid science and innovative delivery technologies. Jazz is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland and has employees around the globe, serving patients in nearly 75 countries. For more information, please visit www.jazzpharmaceuticals.com and follow @JazzPharma on Twitter.
Position Profile:
This Job Description provides a summary of the duties and/or characteristic of work performed and is not inclusive of every detail of the job for every individual assigned to the position. This description will be reviewed periodically and revised as duties and responsibilities change with business demands. Other duties not listed above may be assigned as needed.
Brief Description:
The Associate Director (AD), Market Access Operations Analytics will support and lead Continuous Improvement / Operational Excellence efforts to build and improve business processes in Market Access for Jazz Pharmaceuticals, primarily within the Oncology business. The AD must partner across Market Access and other data analyst functions to scope, prioritize, and deliver data analyses that inform process improvement decisions and ongoing process performance monitoring. Example Market Access business processes: patient services, channel distribution, payer contracting; some processes may impact other Jazz Business Units and products.
Essential Functions
Identify priority investments in Oncology Market Access systems, data, processes, and competencies that are necessary for Market Access functions to achieve and exceed business goals
Connect disparate data sources (e.g., claims, Specialty Distribution, shipments, and chargebacks) to uncover actionable Market Access opportunities and insights
Ensure alignment between Market Access, Business Operations and Analytics, and Information Services (IS) when gathering, prioritizing, delivering, and maintaining data and technology investments
Assess business process effectiveness by analyzing baseline performance data (e.g., KPIs and operational metrics); identify and implement improvement opportunities with a fail-fast approach towards innovation
Identify business requirements for performance dashboards and control charts as necessary to monitor process performance
Lead and collaborate with Market Access, Business Operations, Brand Marketing, Sales, and IS partner functions towards ongoing performance monitoring and improvement
Engage team members at all levels (individual contributor to senior leadership) in formal presentations, informal discussions, and workshops to deliver insights and recommend courses of action
Support accountable leaders in driving data-based decisions and discipline in project execution
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience in market access / managed care and related data, most importantly in the buy & bill space for both inpatient and outpatient administered products
Understanding of market access industry requirements and trends (pricing, reimbursement, patient support, contracting and payer policy)
Familiarity with data reporting and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Python, Tableau, Alteryx)
Experience with delivering innovative and out-of-the-box solutions with a fail-fast approach
Familiarity with Lean / Six Sigma analysis tools (e.g., control charts, variance analysis, hypothesis testing) preferred
Management/strategy consulting or similar experience preferred (i.e., experience with performing interviews, influencing decision-making, simplifying complex concepts)
Good communications skills (verbal and written) is a must
Experience in biotech, biopharma or pharmaceutical required
Minimum 5 yrs industry analytics experience required
Required/Preferred Education and Licenses
Bachelor's degree required
Master’s degree or MBA preferred
Six Sigma, PMP, and related certification preferred

Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.
FOR US-BASED CANDIDATES ONLY
Jazz Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices and we strive to provide employees with total compensation packages that are market competitive. For this role, the anticipated base pay range is $148,000-$194,250. The exact base pay offered for this role will depend on various factors, including but not limited to the candidate's qualifications, skills, and experience.
At Jazz, your base pay is only one part of your total compensation package. The successful candidate may also be eligible for a discretionary annual cash bonus or incentive compensation (depending on the role), in accordance with the terms of the Company's Global Cash Bonus Plan or Incentive Compensation Plan, as well as discretionary equity grants in accordance with Jazz's Long Term Equity Incentive Plan.
The successful candidate will also be eligible to participate in various benefits offerings, including, but not limited to, medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k retirement savings plan, and flexible paid vacation. For more information on our Benefits offerings please click here: https://careers.jazzpharma.com/benefits

Title: Director or Sr. Director, Social Media
Location: Hybrid remote in Los Angeles, CA
Description:
Curio will appeal to trend seekers who thrive discovering new intuitive designs and appreciate form and function.
Manage and lead Social Media in-house team.
Descriptions:
Who We Are
Munchkin is one of the most innovative and fast-growing consumer product companies in the world! With over 320+ patents under our belt, we continue to create solutions that leave our customers asking, "how did I ever live without this?" Recognized as #8 on America’s Most Innovative Companies list by Fortune Magazine, innovation is the core of our company DNA and has been driving our designs for 30 years!
After 30 years as the most loved baby lifestyle brand, Munchkin is growing up and launching a new home products line, Curio. With modern and cutting-edge design, Curio will turn products that consumers need into products that they love. Curio will appeal to trend seekers who thrive discovering new intuitive designs and appreciate form and function. Curio is a startup but will leverage Munchkin’s innovation, supply chain and brand design capabilities with an initial direct to consumer (DTC) launch.
What You'll Do
We are looking for an experienced and passionate content creator with proven innovative brand based social media skills to lead Munchkin and Curio Social Media teams. This is a unique opportunity to launch and build a new premium home goods brand from the ground up with the support of a leading consumer products company.
Reporting to the Chief Brand Officer, the Director of Social Media will be responsible for developing and overseeing innovative social media strategy and campaigns across all social channels to increase brand awareness and drive growth.
Social Media
Lead the overall management and growth of Curio and all Munchkin social media platforms globally
Help develop social media and content strategies that align with each individual company initiatives
Expand social media reach, maintain favorable consumer sentiment (views, engagement, impressions, sales)
Work closely with agency, Brand, and Marketing teams to support campaigns
Develop, implement, and manage innovative ideas/promotions to drive greater relevance, engagement, and grow external social media communities
Oversee content development, distribution, and community management across all major social media platforms including Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, TikTok and Pinterest
Oversee and lead editorial calendar that incorporates overall social media strategy
Stay current with social media trends and incorporate, as appropriate, to improve the customer experience, drive sales, and leverage ongoing customer involvement
Set goals, track, analyze and report performance, identifying and implementing recommendations for improvement and growth
Manage and lead Social Media in-house team
Agency Management
Working under the direction of the CBO, manage external agencies to assist in Social Media activities. Support decisions with ROI based analysis and KPI tracking.
Work in collaboration with other team members and agency partners to ensure initiatives have 360-degree support and alignment across all channels
Other duties as assigned
Bring it!
10-12 years of experience in successfully managing/launching social media programs for new and legacy brands. In-house Consumer Product Industry experience required.
Experience building and leading an award-winning team with demonstrated EQ and people management skills
Proven background in strategic planning within social and digital space and developing successful campaigns that have gained and maintained organic (versus paid for Followers) growth with proven sales results
Strong and proven business acumen
Expertise in social data analysis and measuring KPIs impactful to the business
Strong experience reporting ROI to senior leadership
Analytical skill and the ability to use digital tools to find actionable insights through data
A collaborative nature with finesse in developing relationships cross-functionally
Global experience is required
We Got You Covered!
As a Great Place to Work Certified™ company, we are committed to offering the best to our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, vision, dental, prescription drug coverage, life insurance, wellness benefits, generous employer-matched 401(k) plan, Paid Childcare Leave, among other benefit plans. Our total rewards are top of market and includes competitive salary, bonus and opportunities to earn equity. We focus on supporting employee development and growth.
We regularly hold social functions to foster a genuine camaraderie that enhances teamwork. At our company-wide award functions, we take time to recognize the talent and dedication of the people who make Munchkin the most loved baby lifestyle brand in the world.
To give our people flexibility, we offer hybrid work environment. Munchkin’s Hybrid Schedule is where an employee works in the office on Monday, Wednesday, and Thursdays, and Tuesday and Friday’s remotely from home.
We also provide annual weeklong global office closures giving our people a chance to recharge.
Salary range: $150,000 - $200,000 annually
To learn more, visit us at www.munchkin.com.
Munchkin welcomes and values what makes everyone unique. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All hires to our team are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We recruit, employ, train and promote regardless of race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other protected status.

Title: Director - Technology, Data Platforms
Description: Lead the design, development and implementation of data and analytics solutions in support of the DPEP data strategy and roadmap, leveraging cloud-native…
Descriptions:
Director, Technology – Data Platforms
Job ID: 10042398
Location: Remote and CA or FL
The Data Products and Platforms organization at Disney Parks, Experiences, and Products (DPEP) has end-to-end responsibility for building, enhancing, and maintaining the data, analytics, BI and machine learning ecosystem used by a large community of users (analysts, data scientists, technology partners, business/operations teams, etc.) within DPEP and across The Walt Disney Company (TWDC).
The Director, Technology – Data Platforms will be responsible for both the development and operations of the next generation data platform and toolsets. This highly technical role will require critical thinking and business acumen to make decisions that align to the strategic goals of the organization, navigating an environment with ambiguity and minimal direction. This role is expected to drive a data platform vision, leading a team of managers, architects, engineers and product managers with a span of influence across the portfolio.
Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development and implementation of data and analytics solutions in support of the DPEP data strategy and roadmap, leveraging cloud-native technology, in order to enable data and insights self-service and agile data management across the segment
Oversee the day-to-day operation of the platform, ensuring high availability, scalability and performance and a data-driven approach to continuous measurement and optimization
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders to ensure the platform and tools meet their requirements
Conduct market research and evaluation of COTS products in the big data ecosystem, and foster key industry and academic partnerships, to continuously evolve the data platform architecture to support the growing needs of the business
Prototype new technologies and implement innovative solutions that enable teams to consume and understand data faster, including best in class BI tooling
Pioneer technical solutions that advance data security, privacy, and access governance
Architect extensible technical architectures to deliver the latest in machine learning, AI, and other emerging technology solutions
Required Qualifications:
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, or related fields
10 years of relevant experience in Data Engineering and Data Platforms
Advanced knowledge of Data Architecture, Data Warehousing, Advanced Analytics, and Data Science implementations, including the latest research and industry trends
Experience across Data Warehouse platforms such as Snowflake and BigQuery, with expert level knowledge in the Snowflake Platform
Expertise with Data Lakehouse architectures and formats/standards, such as Parquet and Iceberg
Experience designing automated, highly available ETL/ELT big data pipelines at scale, leveraging technologies such as Kinesis, Kafka and Google Pub/Sub
Experience with data transformation leveraging tooling, specifically DBT
Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience with Query Federation solutions like Starburst Presto
Knowledge of data quality practice and tooling such as SODA, Datadog, Anomalo
Familiarity with data security and privacy regulations, including tooling such as Privacera and Apache Ranger
Experience with Enterprise Data Governance practice, and tools, specifically Alation
Experience with BI (Business Intelligence) consumption tools like Tableau, Business Objects, SAS, and MicroStrategy
Expert knowledge of big data architecture for AI/ML integration patterns
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions at scale
Deep experience with data science tools such as SageMaker, Jupyter Notebooks, StreamLit, Dataiku
Understanding of MLOps practice and tooling, including feature cache and model management, such as SageMaker, mlflow, Google Colab, Google Data Studio, etc.
Knowledge of trends and tools in data and ML version management
Knowledge of trends and tools in ML observability
Comfortable with both technical and business responsibilities, you will be working with engineers, data scientists, operations managers, and business masterminds to build products and solve complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication. Compelling storytelling and presentation skills.
A team player with vision, passion, discipline, and integrity
Demonstrated inclusive leadership that embraces diversity; ability to develop geographically and otherwise diverse highly technical teams
Proven ability to successfully operate in a highly matrix organizational system where partnership and influence are key drivers of success
Ability to work rapidly and efficiently in a fast paced and changing environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or related quantitative field
Proven leadership within a complex organization holding a high-profile global brand
This role can be fully remote or onsite in CA or FL.
The hiring range for this remote position is $198,932 to $266,860 per year, which factors in various geographic regions. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

Title: Director, Commercial Analytics
Description: Master's degree and 12+ years of experience OR bachelor's degree and 14+ years of experience in commercial analytics and operations (4+ years of experience in…
Descriptions:
Arcellx, Inc. (http://www.arcellx.com/) is a clinical-stage biotechnology company reimagining cell therapy by engineering innovative immunotherapies for patients with cancer and other incurable diseases. Arcellx believes that cell therapies are one of the forward pillars of medicine and our mission is to advance humanity by developing cell therapies that are safer, more effective, and more broadly accessible. Our offices are located in Gaithersburg, Maryland, and Redwood City, California.
Arcellx's lead product candidate, CART-ddBCMA, is being developed for the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma (r/r MM) in an ongoing Phase 1 study. CART-ddBCMA has been granted Fast Track, Orphan Drug, and Regenerative Medicine Advanced Therapy designations by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.
Arcellx is also advancing its dosable and controllable CAR-T therapy, ARC-SparX, through two programs: a Phase 1 study of ACLX-001 for r/r MM, initiated in the second quarter of 2022; and ACLX-002 in relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia and high-risk myelodysplastic syndrome, expected to enter the clinic in the second half of 2022.
We are seeking a talented and experienced commercial analytics expert to join our team as the Director, Commercial Analytics responsible for establishing foundational analytics and insights practices that will help enable the organization to make objective, informed decisions as we prepare for our first commercial launch of our lead candidate, CART-ddBCMA. This position requires a highly motivated individual who is seeking an opportunity to lead important initiatives for the brand in a fast-paced environment where you're often called upon to wear multiple hats. The successful candidate will have had experience working across multiple strategic responsibilities including forecasting, market sizing, primary and secondary market research, competitive intelligence, customer engagement strategy (e.g. field force sizing and mapping) and sales and marketing KPI development and reporting.
Key Responsibilities:
Partner with alliance counterparts to align on methodologies for forecasting, performance monitoring, and reporting.
Work collaboratively with key cross-functional partners (e.g., Marketing, Market Access, Medical, Sales) to align on analytics and research priorities.
Manage forecasting efforts ensuring cross-functional alignment on the commercial forecast.
Drive key quantitative studies including demand study and Awareness, Trial, & Usage (ATU) studies.
Lead foundational market research and insight generation for all key stakeholders (Hematology/Oncology, Patient/Caregiver, Nurse, Payers, etc.).
Develop platform for capturing competitive intelligence and timely reporting to impacted stakeholders.
Lead the development and ongoing refinement of customer targeting, segmentation, and future call planning initiatives.
Collaborate with commercial leadership and alliance partners on developing customer engagement strategies including field force sizing, territory mapping and call plan KPIs.
Lead the identification of sales and marketing performance metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and oversee the delivery of performance reports and sales dashboards.
Lead gathering of business requirements from the sales, marketing, and market access teams for the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool.
Work with the commercial IT team to develop CRM, Master Data Management, and Business Intelligence tools and systems including selection and oversight of vendor relationships in close collaboration with internal stakeholders.
Oversee any outsourced vendors and data partners.
Qualifications:
Master's degree and 12+ years of experience OR bachelor's degree and 14+ years of experience in commercial analytics and operations (4+ years of experience in sales analytics and operations).
Ability to travel domestically up to 20%.
Competencies:
Experience leading and executing critical workstreams including forecasting, qualitative and quantitative market research, performance measurement, and account planning.
Experience creating and defining new processes, teams and roles.
Experience in cell therapy, oncology, hematology, or rare diseases.
Exceptional influencing, partnership, and collaboration skills and ability to drive results within a matrix environment.
Excellent strategic thinking skills with the ability to formulate, develop and execute strategy.
Strong leadership and ability to drive influence across cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with commonly used secondary data sources in the pharma Commercial space such as claims, projected HCP and Account sales, formulary data, etc.
Able to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with colleagues.
Comfort with uncertainty and demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment under tight timelines and independently determine appropriate action where precedent may not exist.
Results-orientation with a bias for action, sense of urgency, and tangible results.
Strong understanding of legal and regulatory environment in pharmaceutical promotions, pharma industry guidelines, and other compliance-related issues.
Commitment to integrity and always doing what's right.
Self-motivated and able to work autonomously. Can produce top-quality work with little oversight.
Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
Direct and candid. Challenges the status quo.
Deep understanding of the design and operations of key field enablement resources (e.g., CRM, Tableau, etc.).
Salary Range: $220,000 - $280,000

Title: Associate Director, Competitive Intelligence – HIV
Location: Foster City, CA 94404 (Vintage Park area)+4 locations
Description: 8 years of experience in pharmaceutical industry, specifically competitive intelligence, consulting, marketing or analytics.
Descriptions:
For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please log onto your
Internal Career Site
to apply for this job.
At Gilead we believe every employee deserves a great leader. As a people leader now or in the future, we expect that you will model and create an environment of inclusion, be intentionally focused on the hiring, development, growth and retention of talent, and empower teams to align and achieve goals.

Job Description
Gilead Sciences, Inc. is a biopharmaceutical company that has pursued and achieved breakthroughs in medicine for more than three decades, with the goal of creating a healthier world for all people. The company is committed to advancing innovative medicines to prevent and treat life-threatening diseases, including HIV, viral hepatitis and cancer. Gilead operates in more than 35 countries worldwide, with headquarters in Foster City, California.
Associate Director, Competitive Intelligence – HIV
This is an on-site position based in Foster City, CA
Associate Director, Competitive Intelligence – HIV will support Competitive Intelligence activities across Gilead’s HIV organization. The role is focused on working with and collaborating with a broad cross-functional group of therapeutic area partners (including Commercial, Medical Affairs, Clinical, Research, Corporate Development, Regulatory, and Legal) as well as Senior Leadership. The Associate Director will be responsible for collecting, synthesizing, and delivering key insights and implications to our business on the competitive environment (related both to marketed products and pipeline assets). These activities are structured around key strategic business questions that the Associate Director will define in partnership with the Global CI Lead for HIV and relevant cross-functional stakeholders. Key focus for this role is HIV treatment and prevention, and includes monitoring of the strategies, programs, and capabilities of HIV competitors in both research, development and promotional areas, as well as overall industry trends. Competitive Intelligence is a key function within Gilead to support decision making, foster a competitive mindset and this role will have broad visibility across the organization. This role will report into the Global Competitive Intelligence Lead for HIV, Covid and Emerging Viruses and will be based in Foster City.
Essential Duties and Job Functions:
Gathering, summarizing, and reporting on competitive information
Providing context and objective analysis of competitive (commercial, clinical, and scientific) information to inform business decision-making
Leading core CI initiatives, including mapping and assessing competitive dynamics, monitoring/news updates and competitive workshops
Providing conference coverage and analysis of clinical data and commercial presence
Creating/updating content on competitor products, launch timings, and product profiles
Communicating key competitive information and potential implications to stakeholders and leadership throughout the organization
Supporting stakeholders in development of function-specific deliverables (ex: forecasts, market assessments, strategic brand plans)
Supporting external opportunities evaluations, as needed
Partnering with third party agencies to support CI projects
Following pre-defined standards to ensure legal and ethical approaches to CI, protecting business interests and confidentiality
Knowledge, Experience and Skills:
Strong relationship management skills including ability to adapt communication style, content, timing and tone to audience/stakeholder needs
Experience working in a highly matrixed environment with a strong commitment to work collaboratively in a fast pace organization
Strong oral and written communication, including history of effective written communication (including both PowerPoint and Word/email)
Proven ability to present at and facilitate small- and large-group meetings (with peers as well as leadership) to achieve pre-defined objectives
Ability to interpret and synthesize key data and identify broader implications
Experience with researching, developing, and delivering CI assessments from key data/information and strategic insights
Experience in use of online data sources and scientific/market databases (e.g., Pubmed, clinicaltrials.gov, TrialTrove, Evaluate Pharma, etc.)
Ability to be proactive and operate with incomplete information
Excellent task and time management skills (specifically project planning, prioritization, objective setting, meeting management and plan execution) are required
Aptitude for learning new scientific, business, and industry concepts and developing subject matter expertise in limited timeframes.
Team player who can fit seamlessly into diverse cross-functional settings, collaborate, and fulfill responsibilities in a timely manner.
Education and Experience:
8 years of experience in pharmaceutical industry, specifically competitive intelligence, consulting, marketing or analytics
BA/BS degree with 10 years of professional experience, Master's degree and 8 years of professional experience, OR PhD with 2 years of professional experience
Travel required based on business needs (conference coverage, internal workshops, ect.)
Experience and familiarity within HIV/virology (preferred but not required)

The salary range for this position is: $185,895.00 - $240,570.00. Gilead considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. This position may also be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, discretionary stock-based long-term incentives (eligibility may vary based on role), paid time off, and a benefits package. Title: Director, Content Acquisitions
Description: _Director, Content Acquisitions, will maintain and drive Anuvu’s licensing relationships with studios and content partners within their respective regions.
Descriptions:
About Anuvu
For over a decade, our clients in aviation and maritime have used our technology-driven products and services to keep their passengers entertained and connected to the things they love, from anywhere in the world. Brands such as Southwest Airlines, Norwegian Cruise Lines, Emirates, and Celebrity Cruises have trusted us to provide solutions from high-speed broadband internet to movies, television and games.
Our team of global experts takes pride in providing clients with what they need today while creating a strategic road map for tomorrow through reliable, scalable, and affordable content and connectivity solutions designed to meet the ever-changing technology needs of our clients' passengers and guests.
Be Part of the Movement
Anuvu is embarking on a new chapter with a new story to tell. As one of the leading providers of high-speed connectivity and entertainment solutions for worldwide mobility markets, we deliver what customers need today while remaining flexible and future-focused.
Role Summary
Director, Content Acquisitions, will maintain and drive Anuvu’s licensing relationships with studios and content partners within their respective regions. They will also be responsible for developing licensing strategies, securing new content and additional rights, and renewing existing deals. Management and leadership are key parts of the role and will require someone with a passion for people management.
The ideal candidate will have experience negotiating complex licensing agreements, developing new business models, and delivering results through a diverse team in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
In the U.S. it is Anuvu’s ambition to be a leading content distributor of Hollywood content in partnership with our trusted network of suppliers. This role is the critical component of that strategy and will lead the division to increase revenue and expand our library.
Location: Los Angeles, CA
Remote options: Remote with travel required
What You’ll Be Doing
A deep passion for content, seeking hidden gems and immerging trends
Working with other regional Content Acquisition Directors to develop the licensing strategy
Develop and maintain strong relationships with distributors, studios and content partners at the decision-making level
Negotiating license agreements with partners and expanding existing agreements as needed
Collaborating with the legal team to review contractual terms and conditions relating to content licensing agreements
Manage deal utilization and work with internal partners to ensure adherence across Media & Content
Performing content analysis to ensure our customers have a diverse selection of content available, regardless of region
Develop annual budget and quarterly forecast. Track actuals on a monthly basis to remediate or leverage any +/- variance.
Collaborating with marketing to drive customer and engagement growth.
Liaise with finance teams to ensure timely payment and improvement plans to become more efficient.
Manage the full partnership cycle: make introductory calls, assess business goals through qualification, work with stakeholders to onboard, and enable partners to reach a new audience or drive revenue growth.
Act as subject matter expert on solutions associated with the partnership, and articulate the customer, partner, and sales value propositions.
Lead the construction and closure of partnership agreements.
Own, track, and report on all metrics important to the partner relationship.
Inspect Partner engagements to ensure we are maximizing our revenue potential.
Recruit potential partners via research and real-world networking. Attending global events and festivals will be critical and travel is required. Events can include Cannes Film Festival, MIP, Sundance, Tribeca etc
Leadership
Exemplify the company's core values and behaviors.
Accountable for the departmental resource plan (people, finance and technology) and working with support departments to maximize efficiency
Ensure the team receives regular performance feedback, that managers understand their team's career goals and there are succession plans in place.
Create and communicate the departmental strategy and be accountable for delivering departmental outcomes that align with the business strategy.
Deliver continuous improvement efficiencies.
Coach and develop a diverse and inclusive team.
Provide general leadership support across your locations and the wider Media & Content team.
Ensure regular, relevant, and effective communication with key stakeholders, across the function, and throughout the department.
What We’re Looking For
Deep passion for content and an eye for what has global potential on airlines
Experience working in broadcast, media, or other related digital content acquisition roles
Substantial relevant business development or content acquisition experience
Track record of negotiating complex licensing agreements
International and multicultural team management experience
MBA degree preferred
Ability to develop ideas independently and take them through to commercialisation
Identify emerging trends and seek out new content
This Might Be the Right Place if You….
Independent worker who can work remotely whilst maintaining and building relationships
Are a team fit; can help advance our global, inclusive culture
Are self-starter who likes to roll up your sleeves and take initiative with minimal direction
Can think about tomorrow, while getting your work done today
Are a collaborative team player; primary audience will be internal teams
Are curious and open to learning and finding new solutions
Are able to provide and accept feedback in a constructive manner
Are organized, have strong communication skills, and do whatever it takes to get things done
The Benefits of Working Here
A career with Anuvu is a unique opportunity to grow your knowledge and skills within a culture that thrives on collaboration and innovation. In addition, we offer competitive medical, dental, and vision programs for you and your eligible dependents, as well as the below programs and benefits to our employees, as we acknowledge everyone is different and has varying needs:
Generous 401(k) Matching
Company Paid Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Company Paid Life/AD&D Insurance
Company Paid Wellness Programs
Company Health Savings Account Contributions
Employee Assistance Program
Flexible Spending Accounts for Dependent Care, Medical & Transit
Paid Parental Leave and more!
Discover how our departments rate Anuvu's Leadership, Compensation, Team, Environment & Outlook, check the following link: Anuvu Company Culture | Comparablyhttps://www.comparably.com/companies/anuvu
The anticipated starting salary range for individuals expressing interest in this position is $140,000- $150,000. Actual compensation will depend on factors such as location, experience, skills, certifications…etc.
Advanced | Agile | Applied

Title: Director of IT
Description: Natural curiosity and drive to improve the current state of analytics and support data-based decision making across the organization.
Descriptions:
Organization
For over 30 years Abbyson has taken great pride in being a family-based home furnishings brand that continually redefines itself through modern-day living. Our strategically aligned, full-spectrum business model and operations allows us to fully service major online furniture retailers and the core audience that is driving today's market.
We understand the modern furniture buyer and consumer on a deeper level as well as have a keen eye on the popular trends that are driving online traffic and furniture sales. That's why our mission has always been to help them bring their homes to life with quality furniture at unbeatable prices.
We believe that talent is defined by the collective behavior of each and every individual that makes this company great. Abbyson takes pride in hiring world-class, diverse talent and offering competitive total compensation packages. Compensation includes, but is not limited to, cash compensation through annual bonus structure, comprehensive medical benefits, employer-sponsored retirement plans, generous time off and fun cultural activities throughout the year.
Description
Abbyson is looking for a dynamic individual to join as the IT Director within our Technology department to manage daily IT-related functions. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter individual and lead the Analytics team to identify areas of opportunity for automation and implement changes to drive efficiencies. This role supports Executive Leadership to ensure IT Project Management initiatives are organized, structured, defined and delivered within specified time frames. The IT Director requires interfacing with multiple departments and translating business requirements into technical specifications necessary for development resources for any system or functional delivery.
Core Responsibilities
Cross-Functional Communication and Collaboration
IT Project Management
Facilitate Project’s Scope, Goals and Deliverables
Promote and Develop Positive Leadership
Implement Automation Techniques
Identify and Provide Solutions to Reduce Outsourcing Costs
Essential Functions
Communicate cross-functionally with Executive Leadership to define the project's objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle.
Initiate, plan, execute, control and close projects to ensure project meets or exceeds timeline, budget and quality expectations.
Identify risks, opportunities, and provide solutions whenever an obstacle is encountered.
Reduce outsourcing costs from third-party GreatPlains vendor(s) by 25-35%.
Review existing technology for the enterprise and design, propose and develop solutions for automation and efficiency.
Manage application of project management, tools and templates to successfully manage medium to large scale projects.
Ensures that appropriate project documentation and deliverables are clearly defined and delivered.
Consistently monitor and report on progress and risks of the project to all stakeholders.
Provide weekly status updates on all projects in the pipeline to internal partners and Executive Leadership.
Develop and plan for all direct reports and cross training exceptions to ensure an internal bench within IT.
Implement IT projects as laid out on the IT roadmap provided by Executive Leadership.
Develop and train internal team members to perform functions that were previously outsourced.
Qualifications and Desired Experience:
7-10 years’ experience in program/project management and business analysis required.
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics ERP – GreatPlains & SalesPad
Experience leading cross-functional projects with applications such as MS Dynamics GreatPlains (preferred).
Advanced Microsoft Excel (Macros developer, complex formula writing).
Hands on exposure to cloud technologies a plus.
Experience implementing and driving integrations.
Experience working with implementation partners, system integrators or managed service providers.
Strong project budget and analytical skills, ability to manage priorities and meet deadlines.
Experience using Business Intelligence and Warehouse Management Software.
Strong work ethic, sense of accountability and responsibility.
Proactive and self-driven work habits with demonstrated ability to lead change and improve processes.
Natural curiosity and drive to improve the current state of analytics and support data-based decision making across the organization.

Title: Director of R&D - Polymer Materials
Description: The Director of R&D leads a team of scientists, engineers, and support staff responsible for projects and initiatives with broad scope and high impact to the…
Descriptions:
About Straumann Group
Headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, the Straumann Groupis a global leader in tooth replacement and orthodontic solutions that creates smiles and restores confidence. For more than six decades, we have been stretching the limits, entering new fields, and creating opportunities to make patients’ lives better. We are the leading independent player in our industry. From the first Dental Implant in 1974 to the latest Digital Solution – we do things different than others.
We deliver innovation based on evidence. This is part of our employer cultureas well as an exceptional team spirit that truly encourages diversityand a powerful “can-do” attitude.
#WeChangeDentistry every day – and want you to be a part of it!
Summary of Position
The Director of R&D leads a team of scientists, engineers, and support staff responsible for projects and initiatives with broad scope and high impact to the business and is a recognized expert in polymer and materials science, product development, and the launch of new products in the medical device industry. In this role you will be responsible for major and complex project conception and execution with long-term business implications that directly support creation of new products to meet market needs and the creation and protection of core intellectual property. Additionally, this position is responsible for managing product scale up internally and with third party vendors and the qualification of new materials and vendors. As a member of the Bay Materials Management Team, this position manages timelines and budgets for new product development and commercialization, field trials, and oversees the generation of mechanical, chemical, and biocompatibility data for regulatory submissions.
Essential Functions and Duties
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Prepares and manages technical plans to create and commercialize new products
Manages creation and support of intellectual property (patents and trade secrets) to protect current IP and new materials, products, and processes
Manages stage gate process for new product, new vendor qualification and product scale up with third party vendors
Plans and conducts feasibility studies on new materials, products and systems and works with marketing to advance selected programs from feasibility to commercial launch
Works with other areas of the company to assist in the development of documented testing, verification, and validation methods to assure system and product quality
Recruits, hires, and manages domain experts in the areas of polymer synthesis, product development, polymer processing, analytical testing, and product testing
Provides technical expertise and assistance by answering questions and requests from other areas of the company
Engages company personnel at all levels, including soliciting observations from engineering, marketing, and manufacturing
Contributes to team efforts by accomplishing project objectives on or ahead of schedule
Complies with company policies and applicable regulations
Non-essential functions and duties
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, networking, and participating in professional societies
Other duties may be assigned, directed, or requested
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual performs each essential duty satisfactorily. The list below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities. A reasonable accommodation may be made to ensure individuals with disabilities are able to perform the essential functions of the role.
Advanced (MS or Ph.D.) Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Polymer Science/Technology, or related field
15+ years’ experience in research and development of advanced materials and medical devices
Intermediate or advanced skills in project management, statistics, and stage gate development process in a regulated industry
Familiarity with sheet and film extrusion, plastics formulating and compounding, and thermoforming processes
Fundamental understanding of the chemistry and structure/property relationships for a range of polymer types: thermoplastic and reactive or thermoset
Familiarity with and ability to interpret results of a broad range of polymer testing and analysis including mechanical testing, DSC, TGA, TMA, viscometry, FTIR and GPC
Working knowledge of standard office software, project planning software, collaborative platforms, and communication tools
Key Attributes
Straumann Group has been inspired to make people’s lives better, improve oral health and restore people’s self-esteem and driving the company’s purpose to unlock the potential of people’s lives. Culture has always been the foundation of our success, guided by our beliefs: customer obsession, entrepreneurial mindset, agility & decisiveness, ownership, passion for learning, psychological safety, and driving engagement. Additional qualities of the successful candidate include the following:
Resourceful and Hands-on: An energetic, resourceful, agile, and hands-on executive who operates effectively with minimum direction and pursues objectives and works to deliver against goals relentlessly; able to get to the heart of issues rapidly and act decisively
Team Player: From a basis of strong self-awareness, excellent interpersonal skills; fosters team-first mentality and shares wins and successes; creates an open and transparent environment in which individuals can team together to drive optimal outcomes
Results-driven: Brings a fire in the belly and is counted on to meet or exceed commitments on time, every time; has a genuine passion for patient outcomes and quality
Collaborative Relationship-builder: Able to build deep relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, and work closely with/ and earn the respect and trust of other teams
Integrity: Possesses unquestionable integrity and is intellectually curious; is known as an honest, trustworthy, ethical, and straightforward individual, capable of presenting the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner
Straumann Group prides itself on employee’s embracing the player/learner mindset that embodies a high-performance culture and learning organization
Physical Attributes
The physical attributes described here are representative of an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee:
Observe and hear warning signs and signals within all areas of the company
Operate standard computer systems
Wear synthetic gloves for hygiene reasons
Wear protective eye wear
Wear protective hearing gear
Language skills
Ability to read, comprehend, and interpret training documents, safety rules, operating manuals, maintenance instructions, procedural documents, technical documents, and engineering drawings in English.
Mathematical skills
College level engineering math, basic statistics, and interpretation of graphical data. Familiarity with NPV, IRR and other standard business metrics.
Reasoning ability
Ability to reason abstractly, understand complex multi-variable interaction. Create testable hypothesis based on limited experimental results. Experienced in complex information searching of both the technical and patent literature.
Required reporting
This position is responsible for reporting of the following metrics on a regular basis:
Project plans and timelines
Annual expense and CAPEX budget
Work environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job:
Work is performed primarily in office and laboratory environments
The employee may occasionally be exposed to dust, noise, odors, and hazardous chemicals
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate
The employee will be working in a fast-paced, team environment and meet timelines and goals that may require significant amounts of overtime and be able willing to travel up to 20%.
Salary: $150,000 - $160,000/Annually. The final pay for this position will vary based on geographic location and candidate experience relative to what the company reasonably anticipates for this position.

Job Overview:
The Director, Commercial FP&A role is a leader on the Commercial FP&A team, supporting business leaders in understanding and driving financial performance associated with the Wholesale Platform. The scope includes leadership of forecasting, budgeting, internal management reporting, analytics, and long-range-planning. This role has accountability for communication and deliverables to both Commercial Leaders and UNFI’s Senior Leadership Team.
Job Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Business Partnership (50%):
Provides strategic business partnership and thought leadership to Executive level leaders.
Interacts with key stakeholders to effectively communicate results and coordinate changes in process based on evolving business needs and changes.
Partner with other Finance leaders to effectively manage resource time to assist in the completion of key project-related deliverables.
Explore new functionality and provide recommendations to Accounting and Finance leadership for opportunities to enhance the collective processes and procedures.
Process Ownership (50%):
Responsible for oversight of key budgeting, forecasting, reporting and structured analytics processes.
Leads and motivates teams to drive efficiencies within owned processes while also improving value of work.

Ability to multi-task and balance a fast-paced, evolving business that is change-oriented and focused on growth initiatives.
Purpose-driven leader focused on efficient processes and execution to drive sustainable productivity and value to the broader organization.
Dynamic leader who invests in the development and mentorship of staff to enhance the collective talent of the organization.
Ability to lead through a complex and challenging technology transformation to improve scale and efficiencies across the organization.
