Title: Director, Data Products
Description:
Significant experience and a track record in building successful data and analytic products.
Some prior direct experience solving business problems using data…
Descriptions:
About Us:
ShareThis is a leader in behavioral data products. From a continuously refreshed, broadly representative, and privacy-compliant selection of digital behavioral data, ShareThis derives insights into the interests of consumers and businesspeople. These insights are delivered as data products used by enterprise technology platforms to drive better business decisions and outcomes.
Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for leading the creation and management of ShareThis data products that solve enterprise business problems in areas such as marketing, analytics, consumer research, and demand forecasting.
Understand and document business needs for which ShareThis data is well-suited to provide solutions
Structure a ShareThis data solution to address each need, using existing tools and off-the-shelf data component products, plus data science and engineering
Design and oversee development of user interfaces and experiences to explore and access ShareThis data solutions, via standalone software interfaces or, as appropriate, via partner solutions
Work with marketing, ops and sales to structure go-to-market offerings
Requirements:
Significant experience and a track record in building successful data and analytic products
An understanding of how data is used in enterprise environments to drive business processes, especially those related to marketing and sales
Deep experience in one or more of the industries where ShareThis operates, such as consumer products and retail, financial services, health and pharma, or B2B software
Strength and familiarity with designing UI and UX solutions for data and analytic products and solutions
Strong understanding of and experience with Agile methodologies
Understanding of Web and API architecture
Hands-on ability to work with big data, e.g. querying, structuring, and generating insight via mainstream tools
Knowledge and experience using statistics in a data context
Nice to Have:
Prior work experience in a high performing product organization, accompanied by an interest in and ability to propose and help implement effective practices from the product management discipline
Some prior direct experience solving business problems using data and analytics, in an enterprise or service provider setting

The range of base salary for the position is between $130,000-$160,000, plus bonus, equity, and benefits. Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary and may be outside of this range depending on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, experience, and work location.

This is a remote position.

Title: Senior Director, SMB Programs
Location: Hybrid remote in Los Angeles, CA
Description: Formulate and define analytics solution objectives and technical requirements based on user needs, an understanding of business processes, and advanced analytic…
Descriptions:
Apply now for a career that puts wellbeing first!
GET TO KNOW US
Gympass is a corporate wellness platform that connects you to thousands of fitness & wellness partners, all with one simple monthly membership. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 offices around the world. At Gympass, you not only have the opportunity to build a career in a fast-paced global environment - but you'll make wellbeing universal, so everyone can be happy and healthy.
THE OPPORTUNITY
We are hiring a Senior Director, SMB Programs to our Client Sales team in the US!
You will support our B2B SMB hyper-growth journey which has reached more than 10 countries and over 4,000 cities - and is close to 30% of our revenues. This mission critical position reports directly to the Global Vice President of SMB, works closely with cross functional business partners and will play a pivotal global role in continuing the acceleration of our SMB business through driving innovation with data insights, transforming operational processes, and orchestrating strategic initiatives across product, marketing and sales.
YOUR IMPACT
Maximize the Lifetime Value and Optimize our Customer Acquisition Cost for the SMB business globally across the end-to-end journey of the B2B sales and expansion funnel. This role will have a unique position in the organization - developing a strategic, holistic view of the entire process of generating business with SMB accounts around the world. You will:
Lead the interface with marketing to optimize the generation of qualified leads (definition of Ideal Customer profile - ICP, conversions, ROI, etc)
Optimize the entire net new sales funnel (from online buy flow conversion to direct and indirect sales cycles, team productivity, pricing, GTM by region / industry, etc.)
Accelerate results in the expansion and retention funnel of existing customers (Achieving first value after sale, optimizing revenue via upsell, expansion & cross sell and reducing churn).
Partner with sales leadership to develop the team's business plan, business insights, process improvement and go-to-market strategy, becoming the trusted strategic advisor to management.
Participate in and help steer global initiatives as needed and ensure that they are rolled out effectively to the sales and success teams globally.
Lead and project-manage global projects within and across teams to maximize SMB enterprise revenue including but not limited to special offers, pricing & discounting strategies
Drive operational improvements for the team, including optimizing resource allocation across Sales teams, measuring progress against goals, and facilitating management discussions and decisions.
Design, conduct, and analyze experiments to quantify the impact of product and operation changes
Formulate and define analytics solution objectives and technical requirements based on user needs, an understanding of business processes, and advanced analytic models
Summarizes complex ideas by developing visual models to display insights to simplify user experience and communicate the analytics solution to the appropriate stakeholders
Apply statistical, machine learning and econometric models on datasets to: i) measure results and outcomes of our current models and product strategies, ii) optimize user experience while minimizing fraud/risks
Partner closely with Commercial teams globally (Client Sales and Client Success), Product, Engineering, UX Research, Marketing, Sales, Finance and Analytics teams to shape product strategy and to drive initiatives to maximize total lifetime value of our SMB B2B contracts
Develop metrics to guide product development, and create dashboards for key performance indicators and deep dive to understand the drivers
WHO YOU ARE
6+ years of extensive experience in a high paced environment (management consulting, high-growth startups, global b2b companies) driving topline and/or profitability initiatives at scale
Demonstrated success in managing cross functional project through to execution with demonstrable KPIs
Proven track record of driving insights and making decisions based on data
Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis
The skill to distill and summarize complex ideas succinctly in verbal and written communication
Ability to manage multiple streams, handle pressure and meet targets in a hyper-growth environment, while having a keen eye for detail
Experience working with international teams, presenting to executive leadership, building business cases and proving out the results
WHAT WE OFFER YOU
We want Gympassers to live healthier and happier lives, both in and out of work. That's why we have a comprehensive Total Rewards approach that encompasses benefits, compensation and personal growth opportunities within a high-performance, inclusive, and supportive environment.

In New York, California, Colorado, Massachusetts, and Washington, the annual base salary range for this role is USD $158,413 - $198,000. The base salary range for other locations may vary. Actual base salary will be dependent on geographic location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications and/or other job-related factors. In addition to base salary, this role is eligible to participate in our annual bonus plan, and our performance-based stock option program.

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and wellbeing of our employees. Our benefits include:
WELLNESS: health, dental, vision, and life insurance
FLEXIBLE WORK: Choose when and where you work. For most, this will be a hybrid office/remote structure but can vary depending on the needs of the role and employee preferences. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to help cover the costs of working from home.
Our offices are in New York, LA, and Houston. You can work from any office or remotely based in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, North Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Missouri, New Hampshire, Texas, Tennessee, Illinois, California, Colorado, Utah, Washington, or California.
FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We give our employees some flexibility to adjust their working hours, letting them adjust their starting time within a range of 3 hours.
GYMPASS: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to find their passion too. Access onsite gyms and fitness studios, digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. You will receive the Gold plan at no cost, and other premium plans will be significantly discounted.
PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is to take time away from work to recharge. Employees receive a minimum of 25 days PTO per year with an additional day for each year of tenure (up to 5) in addition to annual holidays (including an extra holiday on your birthday!)
PAID PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family. 100% paid parental leave of 12 weeks to all new parents, of both biological and adopted children, regardless of gender and parent's relationship with the co-parent
CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.
CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world! You'll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day. Find more info on our careers page!
Click here for descriptions of our Gympass US benefits!
And to get a glimpse of Life at Gympass… Follow us on Instagram @gympasscareers and LinkedIn!
Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Gympass
We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong.
Gympass is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Title: VP and Head of Product (Film, Television, and Streaming)
Description:
Vice President and Head of Product, FTVS.
The Vice President and Head of Product Strategy will be responsible for growing our suite of digital products and…
Descriptions:
At Cast & Crew, we've empowered creativity and supported the global entertainment industry for decades.
We grew from a modest small business in 1976 to be the premiere provider of entertainment technology and solutions, staying true to our mission of modernizing content production and leading the digital transformation within the industry. With a global workforce across a host of storied brands, our cloud-based technology and industry expertise span all areas of produced and live entertainment, from film, television, streaming, to advertising, live events, and short-form.
Together with our family of brands - Backstage, CAPS, Checks & Balances, Final Draft, Media Services, Sargent-Disc, and The TEAM Companies – we operate as a combined entertainment technology and services provider offering industry standard screenwriting accounting software, digital payroll products, data & reporting, and a host of creative tools. The industry continues to move faster than ever, and the need for our expertise, our technology, and our people has never been greater. We are a production's best ally every step of the way. #OneCastOneCrew
Vice President and Head of Product, FTVS
Position Overview
The Vice President and Head of Product Strategy will be responsible for growing our suite of digital products and ensure best-in-class services for our Film, TV & Streaming clients. This is a proven leader who can create strategic vision for our product lines by defining product roadmap and driving product strategy for a portfolio of products. This position partners with Engineering, Sales, Operations, amongst other leadership and stakeholders to accelerate market traction, develop and execute product vision, and drive business growth for current and future next-generation products.
Core Responsibilities
Develop corporate strategy, budgeting, and revenue modeling develop and manage a long-term product growth strategy
Own product requirements, strategy, and roadmaps for the entire product line, including new products and enhancements to our existing products to meet changing market and competitive need
Empower the Product Management teams as thought leadership in market trends to identify and anticipate user, platform, and infrastructure need and create a culture of agility
Manage objectives, key business metrics, product outcomes and multiple execution processes with varying levels of risk and visibility at the Executive level
Actively assist with daily allocation of resources and coordinate activities across concurrent work streams
Drive development of models that drive client acquisition, engagement, retention, and referrals Drive holistic user-centered product development balancing consumer, internal stakeholder, and business needs
Develop data-driven models and analytical approaches to determine business performance, growth and emerging opportunities
Influence our product partners internally and externally with technical insights to deliver platform offerings and implementation guidance and guardrails to ensure long-term performance and sustainability
Gathers feedback from sales, payroll operations, marketing, and customers to set the strategic vision for our existing products
Monitors the status of new product development, enhancements, or iterations, ensuring milestones, communications, and deliverables are current
Leverage data collected via growth-oriented KPIs and experiments to influence product roadmap and business strategy
Evangelize the software product to internal and external stakeholders
Key Qualifications
Minimum 5 years' experience as a (B2B) product leader, with experience scaling products and managing cross-functional teams
At least 7-10 years of product development/management experience.
Proven experience in strategy development, opportunity identification, and execution of product and corporate growth strategy
Experience with enterprise product launches, including establishing and executing processes and building stakeholder buy-in
Confident and engaging leadership style; ability to interface with business decisionmakers, teams, and clients at a wide variety of levels
Experience with leading competitive research, customer research and business analysis and methodologies Present strategies and analysis to the Executives and other leadership or stakeholders
Track record of making data-driven decisions and ability to balance priorities based on team-consensus; ability to track and communicate effects of changing priorities.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred (MBA a plus)
Experience developing API-based solutions, specifically for fin-tech or comparable financial systems
Solid knowledge of the entertainment payroll industry
Special Work Conditions
Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.
Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs. Compensation range for candidates in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location.
The compensation range for this position is:
$180,000—$220,000 USD
Benefits
Cast & Crew provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits including: Medical, Dental, Life/AD&D; LTD, additional voluntary benefits such as STD, Vision, paid vacation, holidays, and sick pay; 401(k) and employer match, Additional Life Insurance, health and wellness programs, employee discounts, and other perks!
Note: Cast & Crew benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.
Due to the high volume of applicants, it is likely that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Candidates must be currently authorized to work in the U.S.

CA residents: Your personal information may be collected in connection with certain services provided by Cast & Crew or its affiliated companies. A summary of your California privacy rights can be found at: https://www.castandcrew.com/privacy-policy/
Cast & Crew is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

Title: Director, IT Product Freight Forwarding
Description:
Collaborate with other product directors to ensure reuse of common solutions.
Leverage data and analytics to validate trends and opportunities created with new…
Descriptions:
See yourself at Odyssey.

Join the team as our new Director, IT Product Freight Forwarding!

Who We Are & Why We’re Hiring

Odyssey Logistics & Technology Corporation (Odyssey) is a global logistics provider Our adaptive approach to solving modern logistics challenges differentiates us in the markets we serve. Odyssey Logistics & Technology’s specialized multimodal expertise is the strategic foundation that provides clients with a full-service offering across our four operating divisions including intermodal, freight forwarding, transport & warehousing, and managed services. Odyssey’s multimodal services offer cost-effective, end-to-end freight solutions equipped to deliver on evolving customer requirements. Combined, Odyssey delivers innovative, high-value logistics services & technology solutions to support diverse customer requirements. In addition to being certified by the American Chemistry Council as a Responsible Care® partner company we consistently exceed customer expectations by integrating analytics, carrier relationships, specialized assets, sustainability strategies and deep international expertise. Our unique approach ensures that customer shipments keep moving at full speed, even in the face of ever-changing market headwinds.

Based in vibrant Fullerton, CA, Odyssey is on a journey to constantly innovate logistics. We’re actively recruiting for this key, high profile role in the company because we have experienced tremendous growth and would love for you to join us!

Visit us at: www.OdysseyLogistics.com/careers

About the Job:
The Product Director, Freight Forwarding drives the identification, requirement gathering, selection and implementation of a product suite to support a growing freight forwarding logistics division. The leader is responsible for creating strong working relationships & influence across executive leadership, product management, engineering, and other functional groups to execute the product strategy across the businesses, partners, and customers.

In This Role, You Will:
Drive vision & strategy, roadmap, and product lifecycle for the Freight Forwarding division’s product footprint
Work cross functionally across engineering, marketing, sales, internal and external customers, and senior management teams to formulate and execute the strategy
Leverage data and analytics to validate trends and opportunities created with new products
Translate complicated customer & business process requirements into defined configurations to reduce customizations and support scalable growth
Proactively drive portfolio and investment decision to balance customer needs, address technical debt and provide long-term enterprise differentiation
Develop training and roll out plans to ensure high adoption of new products
Mentor and assist team members on defining work efforts to hand over to the engineering teams
Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to identify new opportunities for Odyssey Logistics
Build scalable solutions that minimize technical debt
Collaborate with other product directors to ensure reuse of common solutions
Qualifications

We recognize not all applicants have every skill or qualification to match a job description exactly. Odyssey values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets most required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!

Required:
5-7 years of product management experience in the logistics industry. This includes working knowledge of Ports, Trucking, Drayage, and International Freight operations.
2-5 years managing product owners and/or product managers
Strong business analysis, problem solving, and strategy development skills
Grit and determination to deliver on time
Location:
This is an in-office role based in Fullerton, CA.

As required by applicable Pay Transparency laws, Odyssey provides a range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in locations under these requirements. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include a wide array of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic location, or other relevant factors. The salary range for this position may be lower or higher in different markets.

The base pay range for this position is $180,000 per year.

This position is eligible for potential bonuses of up to 20%

We offer a generous compensation and benefits package including:
Choice of medical plans with FSA, HRA and HSA options.
Vision insurance;
Company-paid dental and life/disability Plans;
401K with company match;
Preferred vendor discounts;
Competitive Paid Time Off.
No relocation allowance will be considered unless specifically addressed. All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.

Odyssey is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified Applicants are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other classification protected under applicable Federal, State or Local law.

Title: Senior Director of UX (Employee Experiences)
Description: This person will report to the VP of Experience Design within the Digital Experience & Customer Empowerment (DXC) organization.
Descriptions:
Job Requisition ID #
23WD67617
Position Overview
We are looking to hire a Sr Director of UX for our Employee Experience Team. This person will report to the VP of Experience Design within the Digital Experience & Customer Empowerment (DXC) organization. The DXC team is responsible for ensuring delivery of a seamless experience across the full customer life cycle from discovery to onboarding to using our products. Our Experience team partners with marketing, sales, employee experience, customer success, legal, engineering, product management and others to achieve success.
This role will be responsible for the experience vision and design strategy of the employee experience at Autodesk. Through vision, strategy, and execution the Employee Experience team will enable employees to deliver great customer experiences across the business. This work is across the employee life-cycle from on-boarding, customer engagement platforms, navigation of revenue, to transactional tools across the business.
Candidates need to demonstrate a successful history of challenging the status quo, driving team collaboration across organizational boundaries, developing experience strategy and realization plans, meeting facilitation, and staff development. The key objective of this role is to create a seamless and efficient employee experience as our employees navigate the internal experience across tools and resources at Autodesk.
Preference for candidates in the US based in San Francisco, Portland, Atlanta or Boston.
Responsibilities
Design, champion and execute the vision and strategy for the Employee Experience team
Lead the Employee Experience team through execution on deliverables within the strategic roadmap
Engage, inspire and develop a global distributed team
Work cross-functionally throughout the business with SMEs to understand tools and platforms and the employee experience within those resources
Define and implement cohesive research plan in partnership with research team to better understand employee experiences, pain points, usage and feedback to help define the experience strategy
Represent employee feedback at a variety of levels within the org to better improve processes and influence for maximum outcomes
Evaluate tools and platforms consistently for changes in usage, sentiments, value and experience
Engage with senior leadership across the business to collaborate on needs and roadmap, keeping channels open for communication and continuous feedback
Partner closely with VP Product & VP of Eng to have regular interlocks with executive stakeholders by business function including Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Partner, Finance and HR
Work across teams and functions to identify strategic opportunities to improve team processes, optimize productivity and advance the employee experience
Plan ahead and anticipate changes in the business or industry to ensure company ability to pivot as needed for the employee experience
Develop communication plans and strategies in a fast moving environment
Minimum Qualifications
15+ years of enterprise-wide complex strategic leadership experience in UX design
Experience working in service design a bonus
Deep knowledge and experience working within the design of internal employee experiences
Demonstrated prior experience leading and scaling global teams to land quantifiable business impact in partnership with product and engineering teams
Ability to build and maintain relationships across multiple business units and functions
Proven record managing diverse and complex tasks: Works on issues of diverse scope where analysis of situation requires evaluation of a variety of factors, blending strategic policies with an understanding of current business trends with implications to the design organization
High degree of influencing skills to manage through complex work, varying needs, and concerns
Excellent written and verbal communication with a keen sense of simplifying the complex in a relatable manner to a variety of levels within the organization
Well-practiced in holding discovery sessions, conducting research, and creating an action plan from the results
Enterprise domain experience in Marketing technology, Core Sales Automation, Customer Success Management, Partner Automation, Core Finance, and Human Capital Management
Experience with and knowledge of platforms such as Salesforce and Workday
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
Enterprise experience within similar structured organizations, preferably within tech

Title: Director of Pricing Algorithms & Data Science
Description: Leverage data analytics to develop insights to drive our pricing strategy and algorithms and evaluate their impact on the performance of the retail business.
Descriptions:
C ome work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!
Job Description
The Director of Pricing Algorithms and Data Science will play an impactful role on Petco's mission to improve the lives of pets, pet parents and our own Petco partners. This Director will lead a team of advanced data scientists and economists to develop the pricing & promotions algorithms that fuel the next stages of our omni-channel strategy, drive results and win customer trust. In this role, you will:
Leverage data analytics to develop insights to drive our pricing strategy and algorithms and evaluate their impact on the performance of the retail business
Identify business opportunities and mobilize eCommerce and Store merchant organizations and senior management to implement new strategies.
Work closely with our Product and Data Science teams to ideate, scope out, and bring to market new algorithms and features.
Continuously evaluate the performance of our pricing strategy by designing, building and maintaining scalable solutions for monitoring, reporting, and optimizing prices both online and in-store.
Write & productionize efficient code, consistently identify opportunities for optimization, detect patterns and outliers, analyze key performance metrics, design and drive experiments via A/B testing and other methods.
Develop a team of data scientists & economists to develop new algorithms, tools, and production code. You will prioritize sprints, design and execute a multiyear pricing roadmap.
Education/Experience
7+ years of experience in a highly analytical business role, including (but not limited to) consulting, finance, technology, retail or e-commerce; including at least 4 years in a people manager role.
Expert knowledge of SQL, Python, R or other relational database query languages
Demonstrated experience operationalizing data science models into production systems
Bachelor's degree from a rigorous undergraduate program with demonstrated high academic achievement Economics, Statistics, Computer Science preferred; Advanced degree a plus but not required
Ability to work independently and manage multiple, time-sensitive deliverables and competing priorities Strong communication skills and highly effective in cross-functional environments

Provides overall management and strategic direction for the end to end procurement operations and payment reconciliation teams within the Supply Chain Department. This role is a key member of the Supply Chain Leadership team responsible for all aspects of supply, service and capital procurement. Is responsible for leading the regions Annual SOX compliance efforts in partnership with other supply chain leadership team members. ) Manages the OneLink financial system to include ongoing module deployments and upgrades that relate to procurement activities; 4) Collaborates with regional and national functions to achieve process standardization and efficiencies within supply chain.

Essential Responsibilities:
Leads end to end procurement operations for the Procurement function.
Examines operational processes, established performance metrics, and develops and implements recommendations for supply chain management performance improvement in partnership with other Supply Chain leadership team members.
Partners with Inventory Operations Manager to implement national and local Supply Chain improvement initiatives.
Leads national effort to implement and maintain OneLink modules and upgrades which impact procurement operations.
Leads national effort to implement and maintain SOX remediation activities which impact procurement operations.
Develops and implements policies, procedures, and training protocols to ensure the integrity of the regional procurement processes.
Develops and maintains a competent, professional staff, supervises and assists staff with meeting and exceeding appropriate and developmental performance goals; and manages performance of staff by providing feedback and developing and implementing development/corrective action plans.
Serves as the primary liaison with the Accounting and Accounts Payable functions to ensure the timely and accurate payment of invoices, and to monitor and report match exception thresholds.
Leads projects related to cost reduction, improved efficiencies, contract and product implementation and support, and overall supply chain management performance improvement.

Strong relationship management skills with the ability to gain buy-in from employees not directly under his/her span of control.
Strong leadership abilities coupled with excellent interpersonal skills.
Conscientious attitude with an attention to detail.
Excellent communication, presentation, analytical and report writing skills.

Title: Associate Director, Market Intelligence (Zepzelca)
Description: The Associate Director will propose and execute a market research and advanced analytics plan and inform the team of the key conclusions and suggested…
Descriptions:
Overview:
Jazz Pharmaceuticals plc (NASDAQ: JAZZ) is a global biopharmaceutical company whose purpose is to innovate to transform the lives of patients and their families. We are dedicated to developing life-changing medicines for people with serious diseases - often with limited or no therapeutic options. We have a diverse portfolio of marketed medicines and novel product candidates, from early- to late-stage development, in neuroscience and oncology. We actively explore new options for patients including novel compounds, small molecules and biologics, and through cannabinoid science and innovative delivery technologies. Jazz is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland and has employees around the globe, serving patients in nearly 75 countries. For more information, please visit www.jazzpharmaceuticals.com and follow @JazzPharma on Twitter.
Position Profile:
The Associate Director of Market Intelligence at Jazz is a strategic thought partner, analytical expert who provides critical contributions to brand team, life-cycle planning, forecasting and senior management decisions requiring primary market research, secondary data analysis and/or competitive intelligence.
The Associate Director operates as the primary knowledge repository for primary and secondary data regarding the market and brand, planning research methodologies to meet defined business objectives, market research regarding products in development, and initiating and leading team activities to bring the entire team to a base level of knowledge regarding the market, product and market landscape. The Associate Director will propose and execute a market research and advanced analytics plan and inform the team of the key conclusions and suggested applications of study results, keeping the insights actionable and applicable to current business decisions. This role will also be responsible for monitoring development landscape for the franchise. The Associate Director must quickly establish credibility to collaborate with cross-functional teams including Marketing, Forecasting, Business Operations, Global Competitive Intelligence, Life Cycle Management leads, Medical Affairs, Investor Relations, Senior leadership, and others.
Essential Functions
Lead a comprehensive market intelligence process for Zepzelca (currently approved for SCLC) within the Oncology Business Unit and contribute to collaborative, strategic insights sharing across the Oncology franchise.
Initiate and facilitate activities that enhance the oncology brand teams’ knowledge regarding the product attitudes and usage, market dynamics, and competition
Strong understanding of secondary data sources including medical claims, EMR, GPO data and other secondary sources to put together an integrated analysis combining market research and secondary sources to address key business questions.
Select appropriate research methodology to address business objectives, design qualitative and quantitative research plans for existing brands and products in development
Develop and present timely final reports and actionable recommendations to key stakeholders, focusing on key findings and relevant implications to each stakeholder group, and to Jazz in general
Represent the voice of the customer (e.g., physicians, patients) to the organization by maintaining and communicating a holistic understanding of the marketplace synthesized from an array of primary and secondary sources
Communicate and align key internal stakeholders around market research objectives and outputs including qualifying the results based on the strength of the data and identifying any limitations and caveats
Propose and manage yearly Zepzelca A&I budgets, identifying efficiencies that can optimize our insights generation efforts across the portfolio, when appropriate
Collaborate with Global Competitive Intelligence team to develop a unified perspective on implications of market activities to the brand
Work with forecasting to provide input on key variables
Work with cross functional partners to support overall franchise strategy, which includes development and delivery of Situation Analysis to support annual brand planning cycle
Exemplify Jazz values
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Bachelor’s degree required. MBA highly preferred.
A minimum of 7 years of pharmaceutical or biotech industry experience conducting primary market research with physicians and/or patients.
Oncology drug experience and/or Orphan Drug experience highly preferred
Strong market research and advanced analytical skills.
Consulting experience preferred but not required
Demonstrated pro-active leadership of brand/project team activities regarding strategy and/or market research findings
Experience with new product, brand, advertising, and customer satisfaction research methodologies
Strong planning and organizational skills.
Demonstrable strong written and oral communication abilities; strong ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization (verbal, written and presentation skills).
Proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Tableau and Access
Familiarity with industry-standard resources for primary/secondary research and forecasting.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate and gain alignment across an organization
Expect travel ~25% to 40%
Strong interpersonal, managerial and leadership abilities.
Required/Preferred Education and Licenses
Bachelor’s degree required. MBA highly preferred.

Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.
FOR US-BASED CANDIDATES ONLY

The successful candidate will also be eligible to participate in various benefits offerings, including, but not limited to, medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k retirement savings plan, and flexible paid vacation. Title: Director, Talent Operations
Description:
Deep expertise in talent technology, especially Workday recruiting, CRM platforms and data analytics tools.
The Director, Talent Operations will be a critical…
Descriptions:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be with.
We connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.
eBay Inc. is a global commerce leader that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world. We enable economic opportunity for individuals, entrepreneurs, businesses and organizations of all sizes.
eBay’s strategic vision is to become the best global marketplace for enthusiast buyers and sellers. Looking for a passionate company that puts the customer at the heart of everything? A culture that encourages people to think big and be curious, to act with urgency and integrity and to be fearlessly inclusive? That’s who we are. If this sounds compelling, join eBay! For more information, visit www.ebayinc.com
The Director, Talent Operations will be a critical member of the Talent Leadership team and will evolve and optimize insights, programs, and technology, to set a new standard of operational excellence for the Talent team. The ideal candidate will lead positive change management and apply critical thinking to deliver solutions for complex problems, which will positively impact the Talent organization and eBay.
Key Responsibilities
Strategy: Oversee and drive strategy and implementation for analytics, operations and program management, and employer branding, with a pragmatic, customer-centric lens.
Data & Insights: Design, automate and communicate insights and decision support to recruitment delivery leaders. Partner closely with the People data team to ensure alignment and leveraging platforms such as Visier to provide user-friendly, accurate insights.
Process Optimization: Identifies inefficiencies and continuous improvement opportunities across the TA function.
Partnership: Engage and manage stakeholders across the global People, Talent and Finance functions; this role will lead large scale projects, change management efforts, vendor and system implementations as well as process improvement.
Technology: Ensure effective functioning and optimization of Workday recruiting platform, developing expertise on TA processes and leading testing efforts, change controls and releases as they relate to TA system functionality. Oversee all Talent Acquisition technology platforms including Phenom People, LinkedIn, and job boards.
Enablement: Drive improved approaches to business and candidate experience. Update and standardize onboarding, training, knowledge development and capability building across TA function.
People leadership: Lead, develop, and engage a team including management of performance and supporting their career development.
Planning: Support the VP, Talent to help with planning, tracking results and operational management of the Talent organization
Vendor Management: Manage TA business processes including vendors and suppliers and PO management, working closely with procurement and talent leadership.
Focus initially on Talent Acquisition operations, with the option to expand to lead operations for talent development and management in the future
Skills
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 10 years of operations experience within a talent acquisition team, ideally from a large, global, tech organization.
Extensive leadership experience of delivering on projects and programs, while leading complex day-to-day operations.
Deep expertise in talent technology, especially Workday recruiting, CRM platforms and data analytics tools.
Vendor management experience and ability to partner closely with Finance on workforce/hiring planning
People leadership experience (minimum 5 years)
Ensure compliance with EEO, FCC, and AAP programs and be the lead for compliance across Talent Acquisition
Ability to develop relationships and partnerships (internal/external) across all levels of the organization, exhibiting strong leadership and influencing skills.
Demonstrated analytical skills and an ability to make the complex simple
Bachelor's degree required
Expert consulting and presentation skills.
Exemplifies eBay’s DNA and Leadership Essentials.
Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.

So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking an Associate Director, Cloud Development to join our Digital Nexus organization. This is a remote work opportunity.
Responsibilities:
Manage a team of engineers; handle Performance Management for direct reports, including developing/mentoring employees to build high performing teams; function as a primary client contact responsible for fulfilling project requirements; coordinate activities with IT management
Be accountable for project planning, scheduling, status reporting and project budgets; establish and analyze staffing requirements within guidelines; be responsible for implementing projects consistent with long-range IT plans and installation standards
Act as the primary contact for Cloud DevOps team within the Cloud Delivery organization; drive solution discovery and construction of application deployments into public and private clouds and estimate scope and timelines, and partner with other teams to drive solutions over the line
Proactively work with the team to identify technical problems, perform root-cause analysis, formulate solutions, and execute on the plan
Create templates and code to automate solution delivery and deployment into public and private clouds for a wide range of technologies across Windows and Linux platforms
Manage competing priorities in a fast-moving enterprise and thrive in a complex environment; adapt to constant changing environment and maintain deep technical and business knowledge of industry directions and trends in agile system development

Excellent verbal/written communication, collaboration, analytical and presentation skills to lead an environment driven by customer service and teamwork; must be able to set goals and participate in strategic initiatives for a team; and foster the development of high-performance teams and interface with all levels of the organization; ability to participate in development of resource plans and structures and influence organizational priorities

Title: People Partner Director
Location: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Description:
Distinctive problem-solving skills and be adept in collaboration, business acumen and data analytics.
The People Partner Director is responsible for driving…
Descriptions:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly's edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers' applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly's customers include many of the world's most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.
We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.
People Partner Director
The People Partner Director is responsible for driving talent and business outcomes for the Product and Marketing organizations of Fastly. Reporting to the VP, People Partners, a successful People Partner Director proactively works with leaders to understand business objectives and challenges, collaborating closely with the People Team functions to deliver people-centered initiatives that positively impact the business and the employee experience.
What You'll Do
Partner with Product and Marketing leadership to help build teams that operate efficiently and maximizes the talent of its members
Leverage data and relationships throughout the business to proactively identify and address talent issues before they impact the business, including attrition risk
Own end-to-end change management process and planning associated with reorganizations, leadership and other transformational initiatives impacting the employee experience
Consult with business leaders and management on FY workforce plan and talent strategy, partnering closely with Recruitment team on hiring top talent for critical roles
Work with business leaders to identify learning opportunities, such as modifying curriculums and conducting needs assessment for specific departments
Consult with business and people leaders on talent management, such as succession planning and development of high potential talent
Provide ongoing guidance to managers, including performance management, compensation best practices, employee career pathing and development, and disciplinary actions
Work Hours: This position will require you to be available during core business hours.
What We're Looking For
Basic Qualifications:
12+ years of progressive experience in HR with at least 8 years in a HRBP role engaging with multiple levels within a company
Extensive generalist background with experience in talent and organizational development, employee relations, performance management, HR operations, compensation & benefits, and employment law
Highly skilled and experienced leading client groups through change
Excellent analytical skills; successfully uses data to extract insights and inform decision-making
Outstanding influencing, communication, and relationship-building skills
Distinctive problem-solving skills and be adept in collaboration, business acumen and data analytics
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior Experience supporting Product and/or Marketing teams in a HRBP capacity
Successfully establishes credibility and trust with diverse client groups
Works proactively and with a sense of urgency
Leads with integrity, objectivity, sensitivity, and courage
Solid knowledge of employment laws and regulations required; multi-national knowledge beneficial
Work Location(s) & Travel Requirements
Preferred locations for this position are:
San Francisco, CA
Denver, CO
Los Angeles, CA
Fastly currently embraces a largely hybrid model for most roles which allows employees flexibility to split their time between the office and home.
This position may require travel as required by your role or requested by your manager.
Salary
The estimated salary range for this position is $166,360 to $244,640.
Starting salary may vary based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as experience, skills, qualifications, and location.
This role may be eligible to participate in Fastly's equity and discretionary bonus programs.
Benefits
We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits that start on the first day of your employment with Fastly. Curious about our offerings?
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance. Family planning, mental health support along with Employee Assistance Program, Insurance (Life, Disability, and Accident), company paid holidays, paid time off and paid sick leave are there to help support our employees. We also offer 401(k) (including company match) and an Employee Stock Purchase Program.
Why Fastly?
We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
We love distributed teams. Fastly's home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe.
We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful - every day.
We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.
We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit please apply! A fully completed application and resume or CV are required when applying.

Title: Director of AI/ML - Insights & Measurement
Description: The team leverages advanced data science capabilities, working across CMG to develop strategic and enterprise solutions by identifying and leading innovative…
Descriptions:
The Position
Who We Are
Our Strategic Analytics & Intelligence (SAI) team isn’t just deciphering data. We’re here to help solve the world’s most complex healthcare challenges and improve the lives of patients.
With a mix of competitive intelligence, market research, data science, advanced analytics, access, and forecasting, SAI unlocks key insights for our internal partners that ultimately benefit healthcare providers and patients. Even if you’ve never worked in biotech, you’ll establish yourself as an expert alongside other specialists. Plus, you can gain new experiences across marketing disciplines, therapeutic areas, and commercial operations. The entire time, you’ll be surrounded by a diverse and inclusive team that aims to reflect the world we serve.
Within SAI, the Commercial Data Science Team (CDS) supports the CMG (Commercial, Medical and Government Affairs) vision by unlocking value from data quickly and effectively. As a Center of Excellence, the CDS team has three primary remits: 1- Owning Advanced Data Science Strategy and Innovation for SAI and CMG; 2- Application of Data Science to CMG enterprise priorities; and 3- Driving the Data Science Capability on behalf of the SAI department. The team leverages advanced data science capabilities, working across CMG to develop strategic and enterprise solutions by identifying and leading innovative analytics projects & pilots to enable Genentech to deliver for our customers and patients.
Who You Are
We are looking for an AI/ML Lead who can develop and own the roadmap of our M Systems with focus on Natural Language Processing and Measurement (attribution models, business impact prediction, omnichannel optimization etc..).
The ideal candidate for this role should have a strong background in machine learning, with experience in leading teams and developing solutions that provide measurable outcomes. They should be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders, including business leaders, technical teams, and external partners. Additionally, they should have excellent communication skills and be able to translate technical concepts into business terms that are easily understood.

Job Responsibilities
Managing and leading a team of data scientists to ensure the insights and measurement team is operating efficiently and effectively.
Developing and implementing machine learning models to support various business functions, such as customer engagement for both field commercial and field medical, marketing, finance and contracting.
Collaborating with business stakeholders to identify areas where AI and machine learning can improve business outcomes, and working with the team to develop and implement solutions.
Overseeing the data pipeline and ensuring data quality and integrity, and managing data governance policies.
Conducting analysis and using machine learning algorithms to provide insights and recommendations for key performance metrics, such as revenue growth, and operational efficiency.
Communicating insights and outcomes to stakeholders in a clear and understandable way, and working with them to drive adoption of the solutions.
Ensuring that AI and machine learning models are continuously monitored and updated to reflect changes in the business environment and to maintain accuracy.
Developing and maintaining relationships with external vendors and partners to stay up to date on new developments in AI and machine learning.
Qualifications
A minimum of Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a relevant field such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, data science, or a related field.
10+ years of experience in designing and developing machine learning models for solving complex business problems, and a strong understanding of various machine learning techniques and algorithms.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and Java, and familiarity with relevant libraries and frameworks such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Strong analytical and data analysis skills, including experience in data visualization, statistical analysis, and data manipulation using tools such as SQL and Tableau.
5+ years of experience leading a team of data scientists and analysts to deliver business solutions, including setting priorities, managing deliverables, and providing guidance and mentorship.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts in simple terms to stakeholders with varying levels of technical expertise.
Strong business acumen and ability to understand the impact of AI and machine learning solutions on business outcomes, including revenue growth, customer engagement, and operational efficiency.
A passion for staying up-to-date with the latest AI and machine learning techniques, trends, and tools, and a drive to continue learning and improving skills.

Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis

Support the SVP in the preparation of board of directors’ reports.
The position will report to the Senior Vice President of Finance and Administration and can…
Descriptions:
Viamericas is a #1 ranked and licensed money transmitter offering international money transfer, bill payment, check processing and a variety of other services at thousands of agent locations across the United States, and over 100,000 locations in 50 countries.
