Title: Assistant Director of Prospect Analytics (6794U) University Development and Alumni Relations - 40300
Description: University Development and Alumni Relations (UDAR) strengthens Berkeley's excellence through engagement with alumni, parents, undergraduate and graduate…
Descriptions:
Assistant Director of Prospect Analytics (6794U) University Development and Alumni Relations - 40300 About Berkeley

At the University of California, Berkeley, we are committed to creating a community that fosters equity of experience and opportunity, and ensures that students, faculty, and staff of all backgrounds feel safe, welcome and included. Our culture of openness, freedom and belonging make it a special place for students, faculty and staff.

The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world's leading institutions of higher education, distinguished by its combination of internationally recognized academic and research excellence; the transformative opportunity it provides to a large and diverse student body; its public mission and commitment to equity and social justice; and its roots in the California experience, animated by such values as innovation, questioning the status quo, and respect for the environment and nature. Since its founding in 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world.

We are looking for equity-minded applicants who represent the full diversity of California and who demonstrate a sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and ethnic backgrounds present in our community. When you join the team at Berkeley, you can expect to be part of an inclusive, innovative and equity-focused community that approaches higher education as a matter of social justice that requires broad collaboration among faculty, staff, students and community partners. In deciding whether to apply for a position at Berkeley, you are strongly encouraged to consider whether your values align with our Guiding Values and Principles , our Principles of Community , and our Strategic Plan .

Departmental Overview

University Development and Alumni Relations (UDAR) strengthens Berkeley's excellence through engagement with alumni, parents, undergraduate and graduate students and friends of the university, raising public awareness about Berkeley and increasing private philanthropy. UDAR provides overall direction for the campus's philanthropic advancement strategies and works to strengthen development with campus fundraisers.

Prospect Development Overview

Prospect Development supports fundraising efforts at UC Berkeley by providing customized information and analyses that contribute to building and maintaining donor relationships and strengthening connections to the University.

Position Overview

The Assistant Director of Prospect Analytics is a technical leader with a high degree of knowledge in the overall field and recognized expertise in specific areas; problem-solving frequently requires analysis of unique issues / problems without precedent and / or structure. May manage programs that include formulating strategies and administering policies, processes, and resources; functions with a high degree of autonomy.

The Assistant Director of Prospect Analytics applies extensive knowledge data mining, descriptive, and predictive statistical modeling strategies to segment, analyze, and rank prospect pools, and to answer specific business questions that create fundraising efficiencies and improve fundraising effectiveness. Uses a comprehensive understanding of the fundraising process and how prospect development services support the business functions and needs of Cal's development programs. Evaluates new tools, technologies, and data sources, and incorporates pertinent data in database by matching to prospect records. Results have major impact on campus-wide fundraising programs, resource planning, and fundraising decisions. Attends meetings and serves on internal/external committees as a campus representative and subject-matter expert.

Responsibilities

Functions as a lead and advises prospect development staff to oversee multiple analysis initiatives of high visibility and impact. Develops processes and methodologies to carry out complex analysis projects. Based on strong relationships with campus fundraising partners, as well as expert unit content knowledge, provides highly specialized analyses and reports using a variety of sources and strategies, and synthesizes large amounts of data for development planning and decision making.

Develops solutions to analytical problems involving the use of computer systems, information flow and architecture, creating specifications for complex prospect and donor reports to meet requirements.

Writes programs and reports in SQL and R, designing related databases to manipulate and transform data for statistical modeling, designing interfaces and content to aid with efficient gathering and reporting of data from/to fundraising staff.

Analyzes prospective donor information according to established statistical methods and presents results as reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids.

Recommends and implements improvements to documentation to continually enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of analytics work.

Ensures integrity of prospect data maintained in donor database. Develops and manages data quality measure. Serves as a resource to research teams for data quality related queries. Serves as consultant and trainer for effective use of the data and compliance with campus prospect management policies and procedures.

Required Qualifications

Advanced knowledge in prospect analytics. Demonstrated ability to apply knowledge and skills to recommend innovative improvements to highly complex and impactful initiatives.

Advanced skills in statistical analysis, predictive, and descriptive modeling.

Advanced skills in R, Excel, Access, and SQL.

Project management skills to lead a team, prioritize personal and team tasks and see projects through from inception to completion on schedule. Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility to effectively handle change.

Interpersonal skills to work collaboratively, coordinate, and integrate with others throughout the organization. Maintains rapport and professional relationships with peers, peers in the industry, multidisciplinary team members, and management.

Advanced verbal and written communication skills, including political acumen, to effectively communicate through all mediums and with all groups. Ability to listen actively, understand varying viewpoints and receive feedback. Skills to tactfully articulate reasoning behind own opinions and change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from others.

Advanced skill to meet predetermined goals and objectives through effective program/project planning, organization, execution and evaluation.

Strong client service orientation, organization, and follow-through.

Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines.

Demonstrates problem solving skills.

Education/Training:
Bachelor's degree in a related area and/or equivalent experience/training

Salary & Benefits
This is an exempt, monthly paid position, eligible for UC benefits. This is a hybrid remote-friendly position up to 100%.
For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University, please visit this UCOP link .

Under California law, the University of California, Berkeley is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role and should not offer a salary outside of the range posted in this job announcement. This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, analysis of internal equity, and other business and organizational needs. It is not typical for an individual to be offered a salary at or near the top of the range for a position. Salary offers are determined based on final candidate qualifications and experience.

The budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position is $91,400-$111,250.

Title: Associate Director
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA 94105
Description:
Your impact as a Contracts Associate Director.
As part of our Aon Benfield team, you will be responsible for preparing, reviewing and finalizing formal…
Descriptions:
Aon is looking for a Contracts Associate Director - San Francisco, CA

Your impact as a Contracts Associate Director
As part of our Aon Benfield team, you will be responsible for preparing, reviewing and finalizing formal documentation memorializing terms and conditions applicable to treaty reinsurance arrangements. You will be challenged to learn and remain well informed of industry terms and jargon, as well as trends and regulations to remain competitive.

Available Locations:
San Francisco, CA

This is a hybrid role with the flexibility to work both from home and your aligned office.
Recently voted one of the Best Employer for New Grads by Forbes, we are a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, reinsurance, health and wealth solutions to our clients. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Aon is in the business of better decisions
At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.

What the day will look like
Draft, review and edit reinsurance contracts, attending documentation, and related correspondence
Assist brokers, clients, and markets in resolving issues related to contract wording
Draft, revise and endorse documentation for the London Market (London Slips)
Draft and update Reinsurance Intermediary Agreements (Broker Authorization Contracts)
Review expiring wording and new contract documents for completeness, accuracy, and consistency
Participate in marketing presentations to prospective and existing clients
Coordinate with broker colleagues to review reinsurance agreement terms
Contribute to maintenance of library of clauses
Monitor statutory positions, regulatory guidelines, judicial decrees, current wording issues and industry trends affecting reinsurance contracts
Ensure that general processing and quality of assigned accounts complies with team guidelines
Share industry knowledge by participating in training and mentoring early career colleagues
Peer review simple revisions to contract documentation
Perform other related duties as assigned

Minimum qualifications and requirements
Minimum of 5 years' experience in reinsurance contract wording, or equivalent experience in reinsurance industry, with proven knowledge of reinsurance and insurance practices
ARe or successful completion of Aon’s Fundamentals Reinsurance Training program or equivalent reinsurance training program
Corporate/business/legal/paralegal experience in contracts preferred.
Excellent written communication skills, including demonstrated/advanced competence in all facets of reading, writing, communicating in English
Strategic and analytical thinker, including basic math proficiency and proven problem solving
Detail oriented
Proficient with MS Office. Adaptable to other proprietary systems/applications as demonstrated by previous experience with other platforms
Nominal travel may be required

Education: Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) with majors in English, Accounting, Business, Risk Management, Insurance but open to all majors. (Advanced degree or industry-related professional designation a plus)

How we support our colleagues
In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.
Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer. People with criminal histories are encouraged to apply.

We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com
Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Pay Transparency Laws:
The salary range for this position is $85,000 - $120,000. annually. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location.

Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; consideration for long-term incentive awards at Aon’s discretion; medical, dental and vision insurance, various types of leaves of absence, paid time off, including 12 paid holidays throughout the calendar year, 15 days of paid vacation per year, paid sick leave as provided under state and local paid sick leave laws, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, health savings account, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, employee and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; optional personal insurance policies, adoption assistance, tuition assistance, commuter benefits, and an employee assistance p rogram that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits is governed by the applicable plan documents and policies.

Descriptions:
You'll be able to reimagine aspects of healthcare as a science and business, work across computer, data, and life sciences, and innovate into a new frontier designed to enhance human life. Your work will have meaning.

Director of Machine Learning
General Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
5+ years of industry (post academic) experience in a machine learning based computer vision development environment and has successfully building and shipping commercial-grade products
Experience in leading and coaching machine learning engineers

Strong experience in version control and test-driven development: reviewing team members’ git commits, pushes, and branch merges, resolving conflicts, and approving pull requests, maintaining version releases and performing unit testing
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous start-up experience and execution mentality
A master’s degree in computer science or a related field
7+ years of computer vision and machine learning experience
Expertise in Computer Vision techniques: feature/color spaces, and a wide range of algorithms, features (SIFT, SURF), filters, non-linear optimization, custom layer and loss function design, and etc.
Experience in training process optimization and distributive training

Experience in reviewing and writing technical documents
Previous technical publications and open-source contribution

Design and implement algorithms for feature extraction, signal processing, classification from optically generated image and video data
Develop advanced computer vision & AI techniques for use in feature engineering and extraction of key phenotypic features from image and video data generated by consumer smart device optical-modality hardware
Acquire ground truth metrics to cross-validate, analyze, and evaluate models
Build and lead a team of computer vision engineers, while motivating and monitoring them to ensure deadlines and milestones are met successfully
Support CEO/CTO with R&D, novel discoveries, training data for BioEngine4D
Work with our UI/UX developer team building a consumer iOS application
And much more across the domains of computer vision, optics, and physiology

Title: Head of Data Platform, Ventures
Description:
Experience with event tracking and analytics tools such as Segment, Google Analytics, etc.
This role will be responsible for building a data foundation to…
Descriptions:
Head of Data Platforms, Ventures
United Talent Agency, a leading talent agency based in Beverly Hills, CA, is seeking a Head of Data Platforms for our UTA Ventures group. The Head of Data Platforms is a hands-on role that will work with the broader UTA Ventures, Technology and Data Science teams and is responsible for defining products, analyzing the competitive landscape, and providing data insights along with supportive data to business teams across UTA Ventures to help shape our strategic investments across our venture, private equity and brand investments and develop a world class data pipeline for platform level data analytics to support our investments and brands
The salary range for this role is $225,000 to $250,000 commensurate with experience and skills.
What You Will Do
Translate Key Goals into Actionable Products: Understand key focus areas of UTA Ventures and work collaboratively with stakeholders to build products and reports that provide actionable insights. This role will be responsible for building a data foundation to perform data analytics and insight for new brand development opportunities through the UTA Ventures team and identify high value datasets for finding and evaluating investments across venture, private equity and incubations.
Conduct Research & Analysis. Understand key industry sectors, trends and news within specific categories identified by the UTA Ventures team to identify high value datasets; ingest and modeling of data sources acquired through third party APIs, web crawlers and flat files to collect differentiated data

Develop and Maintain Reporting Systems: Design and develop data models and produce ongoing and recurring reports for internal use by business teams including dashboards, ML and reporting
Data Ownership: Own the Ventures data platform through partnership with technology and data science. This could include research tools and licensed data sources and first-party data from our portfolio companies, social media, and other sources. Design processes and write code to ingest, extract, transform and load (ETL) data into a data repository. Contribute to the development of data and ML frameworks, tools, skills and culture
Set and Manage Benchmarks: Working closely with Ventures team to define key deliverables, benchmarks and evolve the platform over time. The ideal candidate will understand industry benchmarks and monitor data pipeline to ensure data quality.
Analysis & Storytelling. Translates complex data into insights and compelling stories and cross-references data sets to offer comprehensive insights and analyses, providing practical, business-oriented, and actionable findings and recommendations.
Prepare Material and Presentations. Create and communicate presentations and other materials related to key strategic initiatives and industry trends.
What you Need
Grit. A self-starter who loves what they do. They never give up. They can think creatively about market opportunities and push hard to achieve their goals.
Passion. A love for media, culture, and talent. They follow creators on social media, consume the latest brands and movies, and are naturally curious.
Strong Verbal and Written Communication Skills. Can effectively communicate an opportunity or position to a wide variety of stakeholders including executives, agents, talent, managers, and lawyers.
Detailed and organized. Effectively tracks and follows-up on all facets of the role including key projects.
B.S./B.A. Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or related field, or equivalent practical experience. Master’s degree is preferred
5 - 6+ years experience and proficiency in Python, SQL, batch ETL, data modeling
Familiarity with data analysis and machine learning (such as with R, Python) writing, managing and deploying code
Familiarity with Apache Airflow
Familiarity with REST, web services, and cloud environments (AWS/Azure)
Experience in areas like Operations Analytics, Supply Chain Analytics and Marketing Analytics
Experience working with unstructured and ambiguous datasets
Experience in data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Experience in SQL for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting data
Comfort with high volumes of unstructured and structured data, with the ability to leverage multiple datasets to draw both granular and big picture conclusions
Comfortable working with multiple stakeholders across the organization to define and build actionable products
Experience in summarizing analysis into succinct written briefs/presentations
Knowledge of and ability to stay current on industry and technology trends along with the ability to quickly learn new tools and software.
Experience with event tracking and analytics tools such as Segment, Google Analytics, etc.
Knowledge of venture capital, private equity, media, culture, and start-ups
Excellent academic track record from top-tier university
Team player, proactive, results-oriented, problem-solver, strategic thinker, highly organized, flexible, strong analytical skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to engage with clients, agents, management, legal and senior leadership
Strong passion for entrepreneurship
What You Will Get
The unique and exciting opportunity to work at one of the leading talent agencies and venture funds
Access to the tools, leadership, and resources you will need to create and drive a center of excellence
The opportunity to do the best work of your career
Work in an inclusive and diverse company culture
Competitive benefits and programs to support your well-being
Collaborative colleagues who are focused on making an impact
About UTA
UTA unites ideas, opportunities and talent. The company represents some of the world's most iconic, barrier-breaking artists, creators and changemakers—from actors, athletes and musicians to writers, gamers and digital influencers. One of the most influential companies in global entertainment, UTA's business spans talent representation, content production, as well as strategic advisory and marketing work with some of the world's biggest brands. Affiliated companies include Digital Brand Architects, KLUTCH Sports Group, Curtis Brown Group, and MediaLink. UTA is headquartered in Los Angeles with offices in Atlanta, Chicago, Nashville, New York and London.
For more information:
https://www.unitedtalent.com/about/
UTA and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities.

Title: Director of Data & Analytics
Description: Manage the Data Integration Group (DIG) which includes the systems manager, director of digital engagement, director of membership, and representatives from…
Descriptions:
Reports to: VP, Communications, Branding & Marketing
Direct Reports: Systems Manager
Location: Oakland, CA or Remote
Salary Range: 120K - 140K, based on Oakland's cost of living; the range is adjusted for location

Agency Overview
Dream.org closes prison doors and opens doors of opportunity. We bring people together across racial, social, and partisan lines to create a future with freedom and dignity for all. We are working to build a future wherein "we the people" means all of us.

Program Overviews
Dream.org JUSTICE is a bipartisan effort to cut crime and incarceration across all 50 states. We bring together leaders impacted by the criminal justice system with unlikely allies spanning the political divide to push for criminal justice solutions.

Dream.org Green For All fights for a world that is green for all, not green for some. We work at the intersection of environmental, economic, and racial justice movements to advance solutions to poverty and pollution.

Dream.org TECH cultivates future leaders and entrepreneurs from underrepresented backgrounds across the country. We are creating a pipeline of diverse talent that will shift the culture of the tech sector.

Purpose
Establish a comprehensive organization-wide strategy when it comes to data, technology, and system needs for the Fundraising, Engagement, and Communications plus the JUSTICE, Green For All, and TECH teams. As part of the leadership team, this position will be a key decision maker to ensure both short-term and long-term needs of staff are being met from a systems perspective. Dream.org uses two main databases - ActionKit (AMS), and Salesforce NPSP (CRM) to track most of the data sets for the organization. As the organization quickly grows and pivots, we need to map out and evaluate the success of these databases to hold the organizations data and how our software and tools need to integrate with each other.

Responsibilities:
Vision, Goals, and Strategy
Develop long-term vision with goals that lead to a culture of data and reporting within the organization (long-term vision/goals)
Design a 2022 annual plan for the department - includes goals, strategy, and tactics that build towards the long-term vision (mid-term goals/strategy)
Identify high priority/urgent projects and set strategy and tactics (short-term strategy)

Project Management and Accountability
Supervise projects owned by the systems manager and provide support as needed
Hold Dream.org programs and department teams accountable to data and technology related processes and procedures
Establish a consistent reporting system and schedule that is shared with the department, leadership team, and all staff on data/technology progress, wins, and opportunities. These reports will help track progress towards program team’s and department’s annual plans/long term goals
Be the key decision maker of existing and new tools and platforms that support program, communication, engagement, and development teams
Manage and supervise external contractors
Oversee licensing budget and tracking for program/department tools

Data Integration Group (DIG)
Manage the Data Integration Group (DIG) which includes the systems manager, director of digital engagement, director of membership, and representatives from fundraising and communications
Collaborate and sync on cross-departmental projects, strategies, and processes as it relates to data and tools needs
Ensure the group serves as a center-of-excellence to provide support as a centralized resource for program and department staff

Leadership Team
Work with other members of the Leadership Team to ensure that all work done across the organization is integrated and driven by one strategy
Participate in strategic planning at the Dream.org
The mindset of our staff impacts our work. Possession of the following attributes will help you be successful on our team: flexibility, honesty, humor, inclusivity, and open-mindedness. We work hard and are action oriented in our approach to solutions
Ability to connect with people from diverse backgrounds and life experience is essential
Care deeply about getting results and you do what it takes to get them, including paying attention to small details, anticipating problems, offering creative solutions, driving work forward, and course-correcting when needed
Take the time to teach and offer useful and actionable feedback, make sure that people feel their efforts are appreciated, and expect that people will make mistakes and see those as opportunities for learning


Minimum Job Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years of Manager or Director level professional experience in data/technology/systems field
Proven commitment and/or deep understanding of centering equity in data practices
Experience establishing a company-wide culture of tracking and reporting
Cross departmental collaboration
Building systems and procedures from the ground up
Experience integrating systems or building APIs
CRM and/or AMS software administration experience
Familiarity or understanding of programming languages
Eagerness to explore limitations and seek out feedback and opportunities for growth
Proclivity towards coaching and mentoring
Ability to work independently, while simultaneously acting as a leader and participant in complex collaborative processes
Flexible work style and interest in being part of a dynamic, evolving team and organization
Openness to working with “unlikely allies”

Preferred Education/Skills/Experience:
Proficiency with Salesforce/Salesforce NPSP CRM, ActionKit AMS, Pardot, Google Analytics
Proficiency in HTML, SQL, SOQL, CSS, Javascript
Experience managing external contractors or stakeholders

Travel:
Must be willing and able to travel occasionally, including for in-person staff meetings and retreats

Note: This position will be reviewed beginning March 31st until filled.

Employee Benefits
All full-time employees receive Medical, Dental & Vision coverage. Dream.org pays 100% of premiums for employees, spouses and dependents. Part-time employees receive 50% coverage. After a 6 month waiting period, employees can contribute to our retirement plan. Currently, Dream.org offers up to a 5% match. We also offer a flexible spending, pre-tax program for medical expenses, dependent care expenses, transit expenses and parking expenses. All full-time Dream.org employees accrue 4 weeks of vacation time off and 12 days of sick time off over the first year of employment. Part-time employees accrue time off on a prorated basis. In addition to 10 paid holidays, Dream.org also provides paid time off from December 24th through January 1st each year.

Dream.org is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and encourages applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, sex, gender identity, age, disability, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status or record of arrest or conviction. We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and strive for a workforce that reflects the populations that we serve. Additionally, upon job offer, each candidate is required to provide evidence of your eligibility to work in the United States.

Title: Associate Director - Technology Risk
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA 94104
Description: Identify opportunities to leverage data analytics and automation technologies to drive efficiencies and add value to client engagements.
Descriptions:
CrossCountry Consulting’s Risk and Compliance practice is rapidly growing and looking for technology risk professionals. Our Technology Risk Advisory services include IT strategy and governance, IT risk assessment, IT audit, cybersecurity, cloud security, privacy and data protection, systems pre-and post-implementation controls evaluation and advisory, systems development life cycle controls assessment, data governance & analytics, RPA (robotics process automation), disaster recovery, SOX and IT project risk management.

We are looking for an Associate Director to join our growing West Coast Region. This is an exciting opportunity to work closely with leadership, benefit from a hands-on coach, work with a team of talented SME's and support the growth of the business. You can find out more about our award-winning firm (growth and best place to work Glassdoor) at www.crosscountry-consulting.com.

What you'll do
Lead the development and delivery of Information Technology Risk Advisory services
Identify opportunities to leverage data analytics and automation technologies to drive efficiencies and add value to client engagements
Serve as a key leader in our practice by:
Providing input on strategic direction
Recruiting and cultivating talent
Guiding the use of methodologies and frameworks
Supporting business development efforts in new and existing clients
Plan and lead client engagements by:
Understanding the client’s needs
Developing a corresponding scope and approach
Organizing and providing oversight of a team
Leading fieldwork and reporting
Providing quality assurance for deliverables
Manage the operational aspects of ongoing projects, including planning engagements, developing budgets, monitoring against progress, performing quality control of deliverables, and delivering on schedule
Develop and manage client relationships by understanding their business, listening to their needs, and ensuring responsive service and exceptional quality
Manage teams by guiding performance against objectives, creating an atmosphere of trust and collaboration, modeling leadership behaviors, and encouraging continuous improvement and innovation
Special projects focused on developing the firm and Risk practice, such as recruiting, business development, marketing, and knowledge sharing
Who you are
10+ years of external consulting or corporate experience performing and managing IT audits, information security assessments, or other IT advisory/consulting projects for Commercial clients
Professional certifications such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, CIA or the ability to demonstrate progress towards achieving certification
Expertise working with risks and internal controls, including IT audit, IT compliance, and IT consulting
Technical knowledge of IT systems, including servers, databases, applications, and networks
Consistent success in building and developing strong client relationships
Strong networking skills and experience with business development
Leadership skills with the ability to foster collaboration and excellence
An entrepreneurial spirit
Great sense of humor!
For applicants in California, CrossCountry Consulting must include an estimate of the compensation range for this role. The following range takes into account a wide range of factors, including but not limited to, skills, experience, education, licenses, certifications, business needs, and internal equity. An estimate of the current range is $177,000 - $285,000 + annual bonus + additional benefits.
#LI-OC1
#LI-Hybrid

CrossCountry Consulting provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants and believes that respect and fair treatment are critical to creating a productive, diverse, and inclusive workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, CrossCountry is fully committed to comply with all federal, state, and local laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, pregnancy, genetics, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, gender identity or expression or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Head of Data
Description:
10+ years experience in data science, data analytics, and machine learning.
Making effective and innovative use of our data is a fundamental pillar of our…
Descriptions:
About Us
Founded in 2017, Coalition combines cybersecurity and insurance to help organizations prevent digital risk before it strikes. Coalition's Active Insurance policies combine traditional coverage with a digital risk assessment and monitoring technology to help small and medium-sized businesses protect themselves in today's hyper-connected world.

The team at Coalition is made up of cybersecurity and technology experts, as well insurance industry veterans. Our secret sauce is bringing this expertise together to create a world-class organization with a massive technological advantage. Coalition is also backed by leading global insurers like Allianz, Arch Insurance, Lloyd's of London, Swiss Re and Zurich North America. Today, Coalition is one of the world's largest commercial insurtech serving over 160,000 customers.

In June 2022, Coalition closed an additional $250 million in Series F Funding to accelerate its rapid growth at a time when many other companies struggled to find funding. This latest funding validated that Coalition is building a long-term business that can deliver profitable growth with a clear strategic advantage.

Coalition has experienced tremendous growth by helping organizations of all sizes solve real-world problems and by remaining true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity and inclusion. We are proud to have been named among Inc.'s Best Workplaces of 2021 and one of Fast Company's most innovative companies for 2022.
About the Role
Coalition's mission is to protect the unprotected. To do this, we are reinventing an experience for organizations that helps them be secure in the uncertain world of digital risks. This means providing security at multiple levels: cyber, financial, and emotional through our innovative, end-to-end product suite. This product suite enables a new category that we are pioneering called Active Insurance. As the Head of Data Science at Coalition you will own our entire data platform and all of the ways that we derive value from it including analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Making effective and innovative use of our data is a fundamental pillar of our Active Insurance Strategy. Your organization will drive innovative end-to-end solutions from understanding our business requirements and historical data in the areas such as risk assessment, underwriting, and classification. You will collaborate closely with both engineering peers and business stakeholders. We are a human centric organization that is building for the long-term. We celebrate diversity and work hard to build a culture that is inclusive for all. Our culture is built around humility, purpose, authenticity, and responsibility. We have embraced distributed and remote work and our product and engineering teams are clustered in California, Washington, Colorado, Texas, and Portugal. Our ideal candidate will form insights and find innovative ways to meet current and evolving customer needs. We are looking for an experienced leader with a track record of successfully leading and growing a world-class data science and analytics organization.
Responsibilities
Build a world-class team. Hire excellent data scientists, machine learning engineers, and engineering managers. Mentor them and lay a clear growth path for your team
Develop our data science strategy and vision. Your goal is to drive impact across different aspects of our business through innovative use of data science and machine learning
Follow and share industry trends in data science and machine learning engineering
Deliver machine learning models into production. Operate your services at scale with high operational rigor
Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation for all aspects of our data platform. Use this to drive engagement in the organization
Work with executive stakeholders across the company to help incorporate company goals and initiatives into the vision and plans for your area
Make Coalition a better place by modeling our cultural values and taking on the unseen, unforeseen, and important items that come up along the way
Skills and Qualifications
Computer Science or Engineering degree, or a related technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
10+ years experience in data science, data analytics, and machine learning
5+ years management experience and must have led a multi-team data science or machine learning engineering organization
Demonstrated success delivering and operating machine learning capabilities in production
Bonus Points
Prior fintech or insuretech experience

Coalition's individual pay is determined on several factors, including but not limited to, location, level, skills and experience. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. The US base salary range for this full-time position is $170,000 - $270,000, and your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process.
#LI-Remote
Why Coalition?
We're a highly fulfilling, mission-driven team who is committed to building a more diverse and inclusive culture. We want to work with people of all different backgrounds and paths in life, and we trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership and put in the work, no matter how small the task. We are always looking for collaborative, inquisitive and dedicated individuals to join #OurCoalition and help us on our mission to solve digital risk.
Recent press releases:
To learn more, check out our featured press releases:
Coalition Closes $250 Million in Series F Funding, Valuing the Cyber Insurance Provider at $5 Billion
Coalition Named to Fast Company's Annual List of of the World's Most Innovative Companies for 2022
Coalition Launches Active Insurance, Reaches $650M Run Rate GWP
Coalition launches tech-powered executive risks products with personalized risk assessment for all US small-businesses
Coalition's very foundation is built on respecting and encouraging diversity and inclusion across the organization. Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
For CA residents, please view important privacy information here. For EU residents, you can view GDPR information here. For any questions regarding CCPA or GDPR, please contact us at privacy@coalitioninc.com.

Title: Director Of Information Technology
Location: Hybrid remote in Culver City, CA 90232
Description: From our CEO to the front-line staff, Servicon embodies our vision of creating healthy environments for people to thrive.
Descriptions:
WHO WE ARE:
We are women-owned and operated, with nearly 50 years of expertise as a leading environmental solutions provider, focused on infection prevention for complex facilities. As a local, privately held company, we are agile and can maneuver quickly to support the needs of our people and clients.
Our goal is to become a trusted partner, not outsourced vendor.

One of our greatest strengths is our Culture of Caring. From our CEO to the front-line staff, Servicon embodies our vision of creating healthy environments for people to thrive. This results in greater client satisfaction and healthier outcomes. Meticulous adherence to infection prevention standards interwoven with compassionate service delivery is the key to success.

Servicon focuses on three essential elements for establishing a Culture of Caring and Excellence: People, Programs, and Performance. These components represent our strong value alignment, positively impacting patient care, infection prevention, and throughput.
THE ROLE:
The Director of IT is responsible for the direction, evolution, and elevation of the entire technology infrastructure at Servicon, including client-facing and back-office, and everything in between to identify solutions. This includes security, innovation, support, and data (among others). You will lead through demonstrated capabilities of:
Innovation: while not expected to directly invent solutions, they must facilitate smart, focused, novel solutions to problems facing our customers, operations leaders, and our industry
Strategy: align the critical business goals with the components and services of the IT infrastructure and software solutions delivered to clients and our Operations team
Service/Solution Design and System Architecture: the IT services that the IT systems offer to support the business’s operations and ensuring they fit into an intentional, well-architected whole
IT Systems: the internal IT methods, policies, and procedures for transitioning new technological solutions to customers (internal or external), maintaining consistent, integrated, high performance of those technologies, and ensuring continuous improvement of technologies.
Thought Leadership: consistently demonstration of deep curiosity, empathy, and understanding of our internal and external customer experiences and needs.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Find the simplest solutions to solve problems in novel and/or creative ways. Not necessarily using the latest “whiz-bang” tech idea to come into vogue, but thoughtful, client/customer-oriented problem solving. “Clever” is not necessarily innovative
Understand the difference between what a customer asks for and what they require. With a demonstrate capability to translate the end-users ask into a solution
Foster an environment of creative problem solving and divergent thinking. Knows when to shift to convergent thinking to make decisions and execute.
Ensure our data management and reporting is thoughtful, responsive, and resilient
Connect/Integrate Servicon’s systems of record and all new IT solutions with seamless workflow automation, data aggregation, and reporting/analysis. Major projects:
HRIS/Workforce-management technology selection and implementation
Company ERP selection and implementation
Establish roadmap for the digital transformation of Servicon’s IT systems towards the 3 to 5 yr. vision
Determine the roles and relationships between IT and departments for administration of IT systems (e.g., HRIS in HR, Planful in FP&A, SAP by Design in Accounting, etc.)
Create a world class network of technology and systems experts for Servicon to adopt the best technology for our needs and/or build solutions unique to our Client Experience Program
Establish an IT organization that both embodies the best of Servicon’s culture and positions Servicon for long-term success in technology innovations, support, and information security for our people and our clients
WHAT YOU WILL NEED:
10+ years of experience with increasing responsibility in managing an IT department including knowledge of the latest technology to build a cohesive infrastructure
Bachelor’s degree in computer science required; master’s degree or MBA preferred.
Demonstrated ability to strategically lead a segment or multiple segments of business
Familiar with technology and timekeeping systems, proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite
Demonstrated analytical skills, ability to run relevant data and derive relevant inferences
Demonstrated experience in both small and medium sized organizations within a start-up, seasoned and/or large enterprise
Exceptional verbal and written communication
WHY YOU WILL LOVE IT HERE:
Hybrid work environment, where applicable
A friendly, respectful, energetic corporate culture that will allow you to thrive
Work in an environment where you can see the difference you make daily!
Competitive base salary
Incentive and annual performance-based bonuses, where applicable
Safe harbor 401(k) with company matching
Paid time off including vacation, sick, holidays, bereavement, jury duty
Exceptional health benefits with low costs (medical/dental/vision)
Employee Referral Program
Tuition Assistance Program
Life, accident, and disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Employee discounts to theme parks, theatres, sporting events, movies and more

Title: Associate Director, Genomic Assay Research and Development
Description: Based in San Diego and reporting to the Senior Director of Genomic Applications department, the ideal candidate will lead scientists to develop cutting edge NGS…
Descriptions:
Join a team of dreamers and revolutionaries who are focused on democratizing access to genetic analysis, thereby accelerating the pace of scientific discovery. We are redefining an industry and the possibilities are endless.
We have built a highly efficient product-driven organization where employees can learn, grow and thrive in a challenging but encouraging environment. We are committed to scientific integrity, collegiality, honesty, objectivity, and openness. We value Grit, Learning Agility, Customer obsession and Teamwork.
If this sounds like you, we are looking for a highly motivated Associate Director – Genomic Assay R&D to join the Genomic Application team. Based in San Diego and reporting to the Senior Director of Genomic Applications department, the ideal candidate will lead scientists to develop cutting edge NGS and other genomic assay products to accelerate scientific discovery.
The Role:
Keep current with the field of genomics, especially NGS methodologies and IP landscape.
Lead the NGS research studies and technology innovations. Contribute to strategic genomic application roadmap.
Explore and test feasibility of novel methods to facilitate biological and genetic studies. Bring concept projects to full feasibility and/or through the complete product development phases in extremely short timeline.
Lead assay development and overcome technical difficulties with creative ideas. Guide scientists and research associates from cross functional groups. Fully involved in detailed experimental design, execution, data analysis/interpretation, and drawing comprehensive conclusions. Deliver multiple research and product development projects on time.
Provide strong technical leadership in cross-functional environment at the interfaces of life sciences, chemistry, biochemistry, system integration, operation/manufacturing, and engineering. Deeply involved in project planning and results tracking with details. Communicate complex development challenges in a clear and timely manner.
Generate high quality scientific data and reports. File IP applications and invention disclosure.
Live Company values. Grow a strong R&D team with the drive for excellence.
What you bring:
Ph.D. with 8+ years’ industry experience in molecular biology, biochemistry, genomics, chemistry, or related field. A minimum of 3 years in a leadership role managing scientists.
Demonstrated technical expertise and innovation via publications, IP filing, and product launch.
Extensive experience in nucleic acid process and manipulation, NGS library prep workflows, spatial genomics, proteomics, and NGS sequencing platforms, etc.
Experienced user in bioinformatics and data analysis tools, e.g. Python, R, ImageJ, JMP, etc.
Strong leadership capabilities and the ability to lead multiple projects through a complex development program in fast pace environments.
BASE COMPENSATION PAY RANGE: $144,500 - $178,500
In addition to base compensation, you will be eligible for stock options, discretionary annual bonus, no cost health insurance plans, 401k with company match, and flexible paid time off.
Please Note: Base compensation will depend on multiple factors, including geographic location, qualifications, and experience.
We foster an environment such that all people are afforded the freedom to pursue their passions without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Executive Director, Data Science
Description: Storytelling and visual display of analytic output: Develop consumer analytics dashboards in Tableau, R-Shiny or SAS Visual Analytics to help communicate…
Descriptions:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are…
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…
From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
Summary
The Executive Director, Data Science will be responsible for overseeing the Data Science team’s work developing models/conducting analyses using machine learning, regression modeling and time-series forecasting techniques. The team’s work will range from content forecasting, quantifying cross-channel impact on consumer demand, price elasticity analyses, and content price optimization. As team leader, the Executive Director will be responsible for connecting strategic business questions with the team’s analytical work. Furthermore, the Executive Director will help the team remove roadblocks in their analytical work, find alternative approaches to solving new problems, and mentor the individual team members in their professional development.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Data Analytics: Guide team’s work developing statistical models, conducting statistical analyses and performing database analytics with R, Python, and other statistical software to address internal business questions around cross channel interactions, impact of release strategy and windowing on content performance, price elasticity, merchandising and promotion effectiveness, etc. Must have strong knowledge of machine learning, regression and time series forecasting techniques to validate team’s work and to help team troubleshoot analytical roadblocks.
Storytelling and visual display of analytic output: Develop consumer analytics dashboards in Tableau, R-Shiny or SAS Visual Analytics to help communicate insights, track customer growth and engagement across partner platforms. Conduct ad hoc queries to help stakeholders better identify digital strategies that are contributing to growth and quantify impacts to multiple business interests. Combine first party anonymized customer data with 3rd party research reports to better understand customer base.
Team Leadership and Mentoring: Liaison with business stakeholders to support their analytical needs and create opportunities for the data science team to solve business problems. Proactively identify analytical questions and opportunities for the team. Validate team’s work is meeting business expectations and thoroughly support strategic needs. Finally, mentor team members in their individual professional development.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree in Statistics, Math or related field is required.
6 plus years of experience using data science modeling techniques (ie. regression analyses, machine learning, time-series forecasting) on large & small, user-level & market-level datasets to produce customer and marketing insights that have resulted in tangible business improvements.
Strong background in pricing analytics and model development, including experimental design experience.
Strong proficiency working in relational databases and big-data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for analysis.
Experience working with data visualization and reporting tools to display & communicate quantitative information and analytical output to non-technical stakeholders.
History of collaborating with business leaders and subject matter experts across all levels of the organization.
Proficient with big-data technology, enablement & analytic tools (including Relational Databases, R, Python, SQL, SAS).
Creative problem-solver who works well as part of a team.
Strong team focus with outstanding organizational and resource management skills.Assist the Executive Director with managing projects and team-members.
Ability to liaise & communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
How We Get Things Done…
This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
The Legal Bits…
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $83,090.00 - $154,310.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Title: Director, Direct to Consumer
Description:
Establish an analytics program to monitor and continuously optimize key metrics like LTV, CPA, conversion, and AOV.
Own data strategy for DTC.
Descriptions:
Job Description
Job Summary (General Responsibilities):
The Director, Direct to Consumer will be responsible for building the strategic direction for our Direct to Consumer business with direct control over promotional performance, site design and user experience, and ultimate P&L accountability for Belkin.com.
Specific responsibilities include:
Define the vision and strategy for Belkin’s DTC business
Champion the value proposition of DTC across Belkin and with cross-functional teams
Collaborate with other sales/channel leads to mitigate channel conflict
Oversee all aspects of the DTC business to drive significant growth in next 3-5 years.
Own and deliver the DTC P&L to drive significant and sustainable profitable growth for both new and existing products
Plan and manage pricing changes and promotional activity and closely monitor plan performance
Partner with Finance to forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales and margins and review performance
Work closely with Planning to manage inventory levels
Partner with Product Management teams to develop specific, data driven product assortment for Belkin.com
Ensure fulfillment processes meet consumer expectations for delivery times and when needed, identify options to scale existing operations
Collaborate with customer service team to understand and address customer inquiries
Develop marketing strategy to both attract new and retain existing consumers
Lead continuous improvement of site experience
Continuously optimize site experience to improve engagement and conversion, in partnership with IT team
Develop content calendar and partner with creative teams to develop compelling content and optimize over time
Guide “look and feel” of the site in line with brand guidelines
Lead an agile pod in developing a backlog of test ideas (e.g., across content, pricing, promo, and assortment) and executing ongoing tests to drive conversion and improve customer satisfaction
Own data strategy for DTC
Guide IT decisions on platforms, systems and features/tools to support efficient DTC growth
Lead, mentor, and retain a high-performing team of e-commerce and digital marketing professionals
Have strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally and influence others through data to grow the business
Be data-driven, capable of turning insights into clear and compelling action plans, aligning leaders and cross-functional teams
Establish an analytics program to monitor and continuously optimize key metrics like LTV, CPA, conversion, and AOV
Education and Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or other relevant discipline.
Minimum 7-10 years of e-Commerce strategy and planning experience with DTC platforms.
Experience managing functional sales disciplines with direct reporting lines and responsibilities.
Strong financial and strategic planning skills along with a high level of understanding of Internet marketing and overall business development.
Travel required, usually for one to three days per month.
What you’re getting into

We’ve got big collaborative spaces for your big ideas, so bring an open mind and leave your suit in the closet. We all are committed to creating unique and rewarding consumer experiences. Everyone is interested in succeeding – for the team, for themselves and for the business. Cross-functionally and across the company, everyone has common goals and aspires to be their best.

You will learn something new or at least look at things differently every day. There are so many smart and creative people around that you’ll be motivated to pursue the ideal.

Team spirit is infectious. Belkin is an extremely open workplace, where communication is essential. Not every idea will be accepted, but you’ll be asked for your point of view. Innovation thrives on multiple and varied levels. At Belkin we challenge conventional wisdom and refuse to accept that something cannot be done.

We are committed to diversity. Belkin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace.
All candidates applying for a job in the EMEA region, please review the Applicant Privacy notice
HERE
Location:
El Segundo, California
The starting base salary for this position is:
$156,129
Factors such as geographic location, academic credentials, relevant experience, and specific knowledge, skills and abilities will influence the actual salary offered. In addition to a competitive market-based salary, compensation also includes a performance-based bonus, and in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits.

Title: Director, People and Engagement Technology Management
Description: Provide reporting and updates to executives across enterprise, board of directors, and People & Engagement leadership.
Descriptions:
JOB DESCRIPTION
YOUR ROLE
The Director of People & Engagement Technology is a critical member of the People & Engagement ”P&E” (HR) organization and is responsible for providing overall technical and functional leadership for Blue Shield of California’s end-to-end technology roadmap. Provides comprehensive, and seamless set of People technology platforms, processes, and ecosystems to drive digital transformation, continuous improvement, integration automation, application security, regulatory compliance, and end-user support. The Director serves as the owner for People technology solutions, service delivery, and user experience.
The ideal candidate is a strategic People Technology leader that will cultivate relationships and work collaboratively with corporate IT, Data & Analytics, Finance, PMO, Procurement, People & Engagement Leadership, and HR Center of Excellence teams, to build service delivery scale, manage People Technology operations, support new and existing programs, and define, implement, and own systems implementations and vendor solutions. The Director of P&E Technology will report to the Vice President of Talent.
YOUR WORK
Provides senior leadership for all supporting functions of all people applications development and support, including solution delivery, incident and problem management, strategic planning, financial management, and human capital planning.
Partner with leaders to define the People Technology strategy and align strategy into Blue Shield of CA’s overall business strategy and technology roadmap, aligned with technology operating plan / SMART goals, budget, and human capital plan
Accountable as ‘quarterback’ for leading strategic and application development from concept to production, including oversight of end-to-end solution design, build, test, deployment for scope of applications, learning, change management and communications
Design and drive People & Engagement technology operating model, architecture, and operating model
Provide reporting and updates to executives across enterprise, board of directors, and People & Engagement leadership
Partner with business leaders to ensure that technology and talent operations is in place to support the work being executed
Develop and own the short-and-long range People Technology roadmap to deliver rapid business expansion and ensure efficient operating processes
Accountable to lead team responsible for application development, standardization, automation, and instrumentation
Lead the People Technology teams, including strategy, planning, growth, roadmap, talent management, enterprise reporting, compensation, time management, performance and execution.
Execute system, process, and ecosystem changes (updates, integrations, implementations)
Build and execute a resourcing strategy that balances full-time, contingent workers and agency support
Build, develop and lead a high performing team and culture
Establish overall vendor strategy, lead vendor assessments, and manage vendors to uphold service standards
Responsible for building high performing technical teams that provide strategic, functional, development, and execution expertise to deliver on SMART goals
Accountable for standing up Agile and SAFe and enabling movement to Value Streams
Responsible for building metrics and dashboard reporting to show progress, risks/opportunities, and results
Develop sustainable controls to ensure data reliability, audit compliance, and scalable reporting
Establish sound service level agreements and methodologies (i.e., SDLC, Agile) to achieve and exceed delivery standards

QUALIFICATIONS
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Ten (10) or more years of Technology experience
Strong leader, aligned with Blue Shield’s leadership model with seven (7) or more years of People Technology and people leadership
Four (4) or more years of hands-on experience with Agile techniques and tools (Scrum: Story development/pointing, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, etc.)
Proven understanding of Human Resources, Payroll, Finance, and IT business processes and how they impact HR systems
Critical thinker with ability to develop a long-range vision, multiyear technology roadmap, and innovative solutions
Demonstrated track record of building and leading high performing teams
Significant project/program management experience related to implementation of new systems
Excellent verbal/written communication, collaboration, analytical and presentation skills
Must be able to participate in development of strategic, functional, resource plans and organizational priorities
Ability to lead through influence and serve as a key stakeholder across enterprise projects
Knowledge in strategic solutions and delivery models to ensure products and/or services continue to innovate and drive continuous improvement
Customer-focused and have a track record of effective stakeholder management
Master’s degree preferred, preferably in Information Technology or Organizational Development
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Information Technology or Human Resources Management
Hands-on experience with Oracle HCM Cloud, JIRA, and other technologies such as UltiPro Payroll, ServiceNow
PMP, Lean or Scrum Master Certificate preferred
RANGE
The pay range for this role is: $ 161920.00 to $ 242880.00 for California.
NOTE
Please note that this range represents the pay range for this and many other positions at Blue Shield that fall into this pay grade. ABOUT US
At Blue Shield of California we are parents, leader, students, visionaries, heroes, and providers. Everyday we come together striving to fulfill our mission, to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality health care at a sustainably affordable price. For more than 80 years, Blue Shield of California has been dedicated to transforming health care by making it more accessible, cost-effective, and customer-centric. We are a not-for-profit, independent member of the Blue Cross Blue Shield Association with 6,800 employees, more than $20 billion in annual revenue and 4.3 million members. The company has contributed more than $500 million to Blue Shield of California Foundation since 2002 to have a positive impact on California communities. Blue Shield of California is headquartered in Oakland, California with 18 additional locations including Sacramento, Los Angeles, and San Diego. We're excited to share Blue Shield of California has received awards and recognition for LGBT diversity, quality improvement, most influential women in corporate America, Bay Area's top companies in volunteering & giving, and one of the world's most ethical companies. Here at Blue Shield of California, we're striving to make a positive change across our industry and the communities we live in , Join us!
ABOUT THE TEAM
Blue Shield of California’s mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality health care at a sustainably affordable price. We are transforming health care in a way that truly serves our nonprofit mission by lowering costs, improving quality, and enhancing the member and physician experience.
To fulfill our mission, we must ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and fully contribute to meet the needs of the multifaceted communities we serve. Our comprehensive approach to diversity, equity, and inclusion combines a focus on our people, processes, and systems with a deep commitment to promoting social justice and health equity through our products, business practices, and presence as a corporate citizen.
Blue Shield has received awards and recognition for being a certified Great Place to Work, best place to work for LGBTQ equality, leading disability employer, one of the best companies for women to advance, Bay Area’s top companies in volunteering & giving, and one of the world’s most ethical companies. Here at Blue Shield of California, we are striving to make a positive change across our industry and the communities we live in – join us!
Our Values:
Honest . We hold ourselves to the highest ethical and integrity standards. We build trust by doing what we say we're going to do and by acknowledging and correcting where we fall short.
Human . We strive to be our authentic selves, listening and communicating effectively, and showing empathy towards others by walking in their shoes.
Courageous . We stand up for what we believe in and are committed to the hard work necessary to achieve our ambitious goals.

From the earliest days of the pandemic, Blue Shield of California has been unyielding in our commitment to putting the health and safety of our people, our members and our communities first. Title: Director of Revenue Operations
Location: Hybrid remote in Palo Alto, CA 94306+1 location
Description:
Handle sales-based reporting and analytics to inform strategy across sales, marketing, and customer success via one source of truth.
Expert in ChurnZero a plus!
Descriptions:
Director of Revenue Operations
Palo Alto, California, United States
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF
Duda’s Director of Revenue Operations will play a proactive role in the growth of the Sales Teams and is a trusted advisor and business partner to the Sales Leaders. This role will add to and maintain the infrastructure, processes, and analytics of our sales tech stack to enable our Business Development, Sales, and Account Management Teams to drive predictable and rapid revenue growth.
You will build and optimize processes and structure to align key stakeholders to improve efficiency across the entire revenue cycle. Your direct and primary responsibilities will be to support the sales process and sales-to-account management handoff, while influencing and collaborating with MarketingOps on full-funnel lifecycle operations. In short, you’ll bring a data-driven strategy and expertise to make our global revenue teams as productive as possible.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Support all sales processes. Create and optimize infrastructure and processes in Salesforce and across the current and new tech stack (LeadiQ, Apollo, Gong, SalesLoft, LeanData, DocuSign) to build a scalable, repeatable, data driven sales machine
Build and manage Duda’s sales Revenue operations team
Drive strategy around achieving predictable revenue such as funnel management, forecasting and reporting
Connect tools and systems (CRM, marketing automation, scheduling, enrichment, enablement, etc) for optimal workflow and visibility
Handle sales-based reporting and analytics to inform strategy across sales, marketing, and customer success via one source of truth
Manage strategic projects with key stakeholders to create efficiencies and automation across functions
Build forecasts and models for various planning initiatives
Analyze data to inform sales targets, quotas, incentives, geos, verticals and commission structures
Handle Salesforce hygiene to ensure accurate data quality and accurate reporting
Create dashboards and reports for the customer journey (pre and post sales)
WHAT YOU WILL ADD TO DUDA
6+ years of experience in revenue and/or sales operations, including management responsibilities
Proven track record of building infrastructure for high-performing SaaS revenue teams from the ground up
Strong leadership and program management skills to lead organizational change to effectively prioritize projects and meet strategic and tactical goals
Expertise managing Salesforce, Hubspot, SalesLoft, LeanData, Gong, and/or equivalent tools
Salesforce Admin 201 Certification a plus!
Expert in ChurnZero a plus!
WHAT YOU WILL BRING
Process: Sees around corners in terms of process and builds infrastructure from scratch.
Ownership: Ability to execute on multiple projects at once, and generate measurable results.
Analytical skills: Ability to solve complex problems and identify opportunities by using data and public information
Stakeholder management: Works well with a variety of cross functional stakeholders
Technology expertise: Hands on experience owning, implementing, building and managing current tech stack
A strong bias toward action: Willing to roll up our sleeves to show how things are done while planning for the future and the inevitable expansion of the company and the Rev Ops role
WHAT YOU WILL LOVE WORKING FOR DUDA
A supportive, agile and creative work environment with phenomenal colleagues.
Competitive compensation, ongoing recognition, and an opportunity to develop new skills and fast-track your career.
Opportunity to join an explosive industry, a successful and growing organization, and a supportive leadership team who is passionate about the employee experience.
Unlimited PTO/vacation, top-tier health benefits, 401(k), dog-friendly offices, and in-office provided lunches.
Fun, snacks, jokes, space, and an environment to be your best self.
Want to learn more about Duda? Check us out here!
Lastly, we offer a competitive and comprehensive compensation package including base salary, quarterly variable commission earnings, and equity. We make sure there is equal pay for equal work and value diversity and inclusion. While compensation offers will ultimately be based on the candidate’s skills and experiences, the minimum of what you can expect for this position is $150,000. The actual offer will vary depending on the candidate's skills and competencies.
