Information about pay scale may change as market trends are analyzed and/or as applicants are evaluated throughout the hiring process.

Title: Director of eCommerce DTC Experience
Description:
Use analytics to troubleshoot and identify issues within the funnel to remove friction and aid purchase decision-making.
Bachelor's degree in related field.
Descriptions:
About Us
Nexus Brands Group (“Nexus”) is a family of leading brands and businesses that design, manufacture, market, and distribute furniture, equipment and supplies to professional customers serving the tattoo, pet grooming and spa/salon markets. Nexus businesses operate independently while working together to develop and innovate new products and receive support from the Nexus Brands Group office.

Position S ummary:
The Director eCommerce DTC Experience will be responsible for overseeing and enhancing the performance and user experience of the company's direct-to-consumer ecommerce platform. This includes creating and implementing effective online merchandising strategies, optimizing search and browse functionality, and establishing a cohesive visual merchandising approach. The Director will also ensure that site content is well-organized, optimized, and frequently updated to provide a smooth and seamless shopping experience for all customers. This role will also review inventory reports on a weekly basis to determine product prioritization strategies based on inventory levels, performance, and seasonal trends. They will also play a key role in shaping the A/B testing roadmap.

Responsibilities:
Oversee strategic eCommerce initiatives to achieve revenue and profit growth for the Site
Monitor and improve site health and performance through analyzing KPI’s across multiple sites
Identify, evaluate, and prioritize Site improvements to enhance engagement, conversion, and digital experiences
Develop analytical insights and business cases for Site improvements and contribute to eCommerce roadmap planning and prioritization
Collaborate with internal and external teams to execute Site improvements
Analyze eCommerce KPIs, Site health, and related data to identify opportunities for improvement
Partner with brand leaders to bring merchandising strategies to life with the goal of driving AOV and conversation via optimizing customer experience including functionality such as search and browse, visual merchandising strategy, site navigation, etc.
Scope technical improvements, new site features, and functionality with IT partners (internal and external) and develop a plan to execute upon them
Implement and lead A/B and multivariate testing to enhance digital experiences, increase conversion rates, and average order value
Align and execute Site experience improvements with ongoing traffic-driving activities such as email, SEM/SEO, social media, and other digital marketing initiatives
Use analytics to troubleshoot and identify issues within the funnel to remove friction and aid purchase decision-making
Serve as a subject matter expert on eCommerce and technology trends to ensure a competitive edge by delivering innovative and compelling Site experiences
Translate user research results and User Experience best practices into actionable insights and recommendations
Coordinate projects and updates for User Interface and User Experience for DTC Site
Recommend best-in-class Site functionality based on competitive analysis and iterative testing of Site experience

Skills:
Bachelor's degree in related field
10 years of relevant experience in DTC Site management plus 5-7 in a leadership role
Experience in an eCommerce or analytically focused digital environment that uses data to drive decisions
Strong technical experience with email service providers and email clients
Experience developing consumer/customer journey maps
Experience with Shopify and Magento eCommerce platforms
Strong project management and communication skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and teams effectively
Exceptional skills in prioritizing, problem-solving, and presenting concepts and ideas to others
Ability to prioritize goals and motivate a small team to execute flawlessly

What Will Help You Stand Out:
Deep understanding of technical SEO
Strong understanding of Agile Scrum project management

What’s in it for me?
We constantly strive to provide our team members with an optimal workplace. We believe that your work should be rewarding. Below are just a few of the benefits our Company offers our team members:
Friendly and supportive culture with team member appreciation events
Open-door policy
Health and welfare benefits
Pet discount program
Supplemental insurance options including long and short-term disability and EAP
401k with company match up to 4%
Paid time off in addition to paid holidays
Employee Referral Program
Continuous training and growth opportunities

If you require alternative methods of application or screening, please contact us directly.

We are a fair chance employer; prior backgrounds will not automatically disqualify you from employment with us.

We comply with the ADA and consider reasonable accommodation measures that may be necessary for eligible applicants/team members to perform essential functions of the job.

Nexus Brands Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, national origin, social origin, social condition, being perceived as a victim of domestic violence, sexual aggression or stalking, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, ancestry, veteran or military status, marital status, pregnancy (including u unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy or maternity leave), genetic information or another other characteristics protected by law. Native American receive preference in accordance with Tribal Law.

Title: Director - Global Pricing & Analytics Lead, Liver/Inflammation and Oncology
Description:
Pricing, financial, or statistical analytics.
The Global Pricing & Analytics function within Global Value & Access (GV&A) partners with cross-functional teams…
Descriptions:
For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please log onto your
Internal Career Site
to apply for this job.
At Gilead we believe every employee deserves a great leader. As a people leader now or in the future, we expect that you will model and create an environment of inclusion, be intentionally focused on the hiring, development, growth and retention of talent, and empower teams to align and achieve goals.

Job Description
Director - Global Pricing & Analytics Lead, Liver/Inflammation and Oncology
This is a Foster City, CA based position
At Gilead, we are driven to develop lifesaving products that make a difference for patients around the world. Every day, we transform the promise of science and technology into breakthrough, innovative therapies that have the power to cure, prevent or treat disease. As a research-based biopharmaceutical company, we are revolutionizing healthcare by bringing medicines to patients in the areas of unmet need including HIV, AIDS, liver diseases, hematology and oncology, and inflammation and respiratory diseases. When you join Gilead, you join our mission to change the world by enabling people to live healthier and more fulfilling lives.
The Global Pricing & Analytics function within Global Value & Access (GV&A) partners with cross-functional teams on brand-specific pricing strategies and leads operational pricing and analytics activities. This role works closely with internal stakeholders across GV&A, Local Value & Access, Finance, Legal, IT, Global Commercial Product Strategy (GCPS), Global Analytics & Insights, amongst others.
Executive Director of Global Pricing & Analytics and will work in alignment with Oncology Global Pricing & Analytics Lead. The role will work in close partnership with the Liver/Inflammation and Oncology GV&A Teams and with various Therapeutic Area Teams within GCSO. The broad therapeutic area scope enables this role to work in different stages of a product’s lifecycle: pipeline (oncology and inflammation), launch and growth. Both strategic and tactical decisions will be made based upon input and/or recommendations provided by the individual that is selected for this role.
As a Director in this role, your core job responsibilities will be:
Pricing Strategy for launch and pipeline assets
Scope covers the various products in the following portfolios:
Liver/Inflammation: in-line products as well as pipeline assets in inflammation and for HBV cure.
Oncology: pipeline assets in the ARCUS collaboration
Partner with GV&A in conducting relevant pricing secondary and primary market research activities, and pre-launch pricing studies to evaluate pricing potential based on unmet need/value, stakeholder expectations, competitive pricing landscape and pricing benchmarks
Lead Global Pricing & Analytics activities & deliverables (in partnership with GV&A, and other key stakeholders) such as: analyzing pricing intel from available sources, developing Global Pricing Policies, driving Launch Sequence Optimization and Reference Pricing analytics, developing Contracting guidance, and supporting strategies for ensuring value-based price negotiations and/or indication and combination pricing
Support GV&A with the 10-year long-range planning and bi-annual 2-year forecast process by developing pricing templates and capturing data to provide a roll up of the pricing assumptions in key countries – analyzing any list price changes, gross-to-net variances or pricing impacts that are inconsistent with pricing guidelines and commercial strategy
Operational Pricing
Responsible for monitoring and tracking price trends, country pricing needs and requests, and managing any relevant pricing requests, including guiding any reviews to be escalated for discussion with either the Global Pricing Committee or with Regional Commercial leads
Guide review of pricing proposals against Global Pricing Policies and Global Pricing Governance. Support GV&A therapeutic area leads and local affiliates in the preparation and review pricing business cases for timely and thorough decision-making
Support Executive Director of Global Pricing & Analytics to escalate prices to Global Price Committee decision-making as needed
Support local affiliates (particularly Core 10 markets) and GV&A with pricing operations i.e., price certifications, price evolution analysis, brand/indication-specific pricing implications, pricing policy and landscape changes, etc.
Pricing Analytics
Knowledgeable about pricing regulations, payer systems & archetypes in priority countries (and preferably across regions or the globe), including deep expertise in local pricing setting mechanisms
Track and assess implications from major changes to pricing regulations and mechanisms worldwide (i.e., pricing reform, change in pricing rules)
Develop pricing analytics unique to multi-indication Lifecycle Management, such as dynamic price access trade-off modelling, indication price optimization, combination regimen price management, manage entry agreements/IPM, landscape understanding, and tool development
Develop price modeling that incorporate international referencing pricing impact on revenues to support strategic pricing considerations, retrospective case reviews, price/volume tradeoffs, country supply, and policy impacts to inform key business decisions.
Build and employ advanced analytical tools (i.e. competitive and analog price intel, pricing performance KPIs, IRP impact sizing, etc.) to assist affiliates with monitoring price strategy and gross-to-net impacts
Act as subject matter expert to provide price intel leveraging available 3rd party secondary data resources i.e., NAVLIN, MIDAS, DRG, SSR, Analysource, and internal finance data to create pricing analogues analysis, competitive pricing reports, and ad-hoc analysis for Business Development opportunities
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree and Twelve Years’ Experience
OR
Masters' Degree and Ten Years’ Experience
OR
Ph.D. and Eight Years’ Experience
At least 5 years+ in market access, pricing, or related subject matter expertise (required)
At least 12 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or managed care, with a Bachelors or 10 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or managed care with a Master’s degree. Including in-depth understanding of pricing, access, health economics and commercialization strategy (required)
Bachelor's Degree (required)
General understanding of value-based pricing story needs, gaps and requirements to suit mark payer requirements in relevant markets (required)
Ability to communicate financial impact of pricing initiatives on overall business objectives (required)
Knowledge and hands-on experience in the following aspects (required):
Designing or implementing pricing strategies at country level
Financial planning, forecasting or demand planning
Pricing, financial, or statistical analytics
Ability to synthetize, critically analyze, efficiently communicate large volume of information, identify risks, and develop recommendations (required)
Analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills and strong Excel skills (required)
Ability to consistently provide clear and concise written and verbal communication; excellent presentation skills, excellent English communication skills both oral and written (required)
Demonstrated appropriate level of leadership experience. Requires high levels of competence, confidence, and credibility in engaging with senior leadership (required)
Demonstrated professional track record to Gilead Core Values: integrity, inclusion, teamwork, excellence, accountability (required)
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree in Finance, Actuarial Sciences, Statistics, Health Economics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Health Policy, or any other related quantitative field (strongly preferred)
Prior knowledge and experience in Liver Diseases, Oncology and/or orphan drugs (strongly preferred)
Knowledge of health care systems and pricing regulations in top key markets: US, EU5, Canada, Japan, China, and Australia (highly desirable)
Experience interacting with third party data tools like NAVLIN, MIDAS, and DRG (highly desirable)

Title: Director, Commercial Data Science & AI (3 roles)
Description: This responsibility involves working closely with cross-functional Science, Medical, and Business leaders to identify, prioritize, and develop Data Science, AI,…
Descriptions:
Make a greater impact on lives through a digitally-enabled enterprise
We are working towards our aspiration of shaping the future of Pharma. Backed by investment at every step, we harness the latest technology, data, and innovative ways of working to introduce new approaches that put Digital at AstraZeneca’s heart.

Be part of a chapter that’s still being written. Trusted and empowered to change the way things are done, with the tools and support to get you there. Here we are free to unleash our curiosity and turn thinking into reality where smart risks and quick decisions come together to power disruption and innovation.
Office Locations: This is an on-site - office-based role. Please consider the following AZ US HUB locations – Gaithersburg, MD/ Wilmington, DE/South San Francisco, CA
The Role:
The US - Director, Commercial Data Sciences & AI (3 roles) is a key leader in the Commercial Data Science & AI team whose mission is to take a patient-centric, data-driven approach to personalize and transform healthcare delivery to the millions of patients along with a multi-disciplinary team of physicians who care for them. This responsibility involves working closely with cross-functional Science, Medical, and Business leaders to identify, prioritize, and develop Data Science, AI, and Advanced Analytics Platforms & Products across AZ Oncology and Bio-pharma businesses. The scope of this role is Global with a focus on US markets where AstraZeneca’s life-changing medicines are approved to help patients live longer and realize AZ’s bold ambition of eliminating Cancer as a cause of death.
The team is responsible for value creation through innovation at a global scale. In addition to impeccable technical skills, the ability to communicate and influence a diverse stakeholder set is crucial. Not infrequently, the problems we solve are first identified by its senior members – introducing and gaining traction for these concepts requires tact and subtlety.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop a deep understanding of the business and its core markets.
Leverage AI/ML, mathematical programming, and statistical modeling to develop solutions that create a competitive advantage for our commercial organization.
Be responsible for the full solution architecture cycle: identification & definition of business questions/opportunities, data acquisition & preparation, model implementation & optimization, and method of deployment to the consuming system or team.
Collaborate with ML Ops to prepare and document Skunkworks solutions for transition to maturity/industrialization team.
Collaborate with matrix teams (sales, marketing, IT, external vendors, etc.) to ensure effective and efficient deployment of capabilities.
Actively seek out, develop, and share best practices.
Stay abreast of the evolving technical landscape, and remain current on the major data science libraries/stack
Incentivize and pursue continuous improvement of existing capabilities and skills.
Manage onshore and offshore external consultants.
Competencies
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree plus 5-7 years of progressive professional work experience in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences, or a quantitative discipline. * 7+ years of qualified professional experience can be substituted for Bachelor’s degree
Track record of Developing Data Science and AI products that have generated business value, and impact across multiple Industries.
In-depth experience with modern data science approaches, including unsupervised and supervised classification and regression algorithms such as k-means clustering, support vector machines, random forests, neural networks, and deep
8+ years of hands-on experience in the application of data science methods on large and disparate datasets, specifically:
Statistical Analysis and Modelling: (e.g. Design of Experiments, Time Series Analysis, Regression Analysis, Bayesian methods, etc),
Hands-on experience and theoretical expertise in modern deep learning (e.g. transformers).
Advanced software development skills in at least two of the standard data science languages (such as R, Julia, or Python) and familiarity with database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, graph)
Understanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling, and applications
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills
Proficiency in manipulating and utilizing large, longitudinal data sources, such as Claims, EMR, and other patient-level data sets.
Experience using complex, non-tabular data structures
Desirable Requirements
Quantitative Master’s or PhD degree from an accredited college or university is required in one of the following or related fields: Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science, or Operations Research.
Comfortable working in high-performance computing or cloud environment
Proven track record of publishing relevant predictive modeling results and tools in peer-reviewed journals, conferences, and other scientific proceedings.
Experience in understanding biomedical data sets and real-world data sets relevant to life sciences and healthcare
Experience in novel methods development and application, complex global organization, and people management
Experience in influencing and controlling budgets
Pharmaceutical domain knowledge.
Strong entrepreneurial drive to identify/pursue opportunities and take ownership of outcomes.
Mature leadership and interpersonal skills. Track record of working collaboratively with a significant number of leaders and building ambitious solutions in a matrix environment.
Strong organizational skills and time management
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience - it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity.
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

Title: (USA) Director, User Experience - Research
Description:
In addition to base salary, Walmart total compensation may also include bonus incentives, stock options, and more.
High energy and have a bias for action.
Descriptions:
In addition to base salary, Walmart total compensation may also include bonus incentives, stock options, and more.

Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Working at Walmart International Technology means a career without boundaries. There's always room to grow, to take on another challenge, to roll up your sleeves and contribute, and to find professional rewards for your hard work.Yes, we are a division of the Fortune #1 company, Walmart, Inc. But you'll quickly find that we're a company that wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world's most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores and clubs.

Join us and you'll discover why our company is a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you'll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.

As the Director of User Research for Walmart International , you will be responsible for building the User Research toolset, standards, ways of working (WoW), operational model, and quality for our User Research practice. User Research is one of the most important components to how we deliver for our Associates and Customers alike. As we move into a world of global platforms, balancing the needs for customization and enhancement for our markets with experience consistency is a significant challenge. We aim to practice "culturally sensitive" design while maintaining the momentum a global platform enables.

You will lead our User Research team at an international scale. You will hire, retain and grow UX Research professionals in our organization as well as partner with in-market user research staff. Your charge will be to own our User Research portfolio end-to-end. Our portfolio isn't exclusively e-commerce but includes many "operational capabilities" we support for the broader Walmart business (e.g. Sourcing, Seller Center/Marketplace, and other associate support tools).

You will partner within UX with our Inclusive Design/Accessibility Leader, the Content Strategy (and Localization) Team, and our Design Leaders and outside of our team, cross-functional partners - Product Management, Data Science, Product Engineering and other business leaders to ensure we maximize our opportunities for User Research.

What you'll do:


Lead a team of User Research professionals to conduct generative and evaluative research across the portfolio ensuring we are making data-centric decisions.
Chart out a path for the team to grow and prosper considering location strategy for talent, career training and individual enrichment culminating in a spirit of "it's worthwhile to invest my career in Walmart and with the International UX Org."

Mentor and coach your staff ensuring a sense of connection, support and accountability.
Partner with Inclusive Design/Accessibility to define learning objectives for research investments for maximum impact for inclusive design usability.
Evangelize and champion User Research processes, methods, insights and ways of working to bring the collective down the journey with you. Ensure UXR is factored and understood in our Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC).
Manage the "tools" portfolio for the UX Research practice (usertesting.com, User Zoom, Qualtrics, Pendo, etc.) - ensuring adequate budget and value derived for the tools.
Connect the broader stakeholder group with the on-going value being delivered by the UXR function.

Partner with the Data Science function to ensure UI metric capture, reporting and data insights are included in our overall evaluation of UX efficacy.
Build partnerships with CX Measurement leaders and teams in our various markets to gain efficiencies, shared areas of focus and sharing of methods/approaches/outcomes.

Who you are:
High energy and have a bias for action.

Passionate about practicing data-driven design (both qualitative and quantitative).
Enthusiastic and excited about our business, our Associates and our customers.
Assertive and understand that UX Leaders need to be visible, vocal and active.
Enjoy storytelling as a core part of your leadership approach and practice.

Your Qualifications:
12+ years leading User Research in a complex dynamic organization across both quantitative and qualitative methods as well as generative and evaluative insights to product teams. Leading research in retail/ecommerce environments a big plus.
Demonstrated ability to influence large and highly matrixed organizations through strong presentation and analytical skills.
Masters Degree or PhD in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, Interaction Design or related field (psychology, cognitive science, anthropology/sociology) preferred or a Bachelors Degree with 15+ years of total industry experience.

Excellent communication and presentation skills across multiple levels of an organization (from product team squads to senior executives).
Demonstrated ability to work in Agile application development environments in partnership with UX, Engineering and Product Management. Ability to revise methods and approaches based on individual team needs and timing.
Experience in A/B and or multivariate test implementation, analysis and business reviews.
Demonstrated experience leading geographically distributed teams across multiple timezones.
Demonstrated experience managing the prioritization of research investments and the necessary budgeting to support the function.

Now, imagine doing all the above for the world's largest retailer. That's the Walmart experience. Intrigued?

You'll really wow us if...
Your ability to rise above group think and see beyond the here and now is matched only by your intellectual curiosity.

You come to the table with a comprehensive knowledge of qualitative & quantitative processes, methods and tools for the UXR craft. You coach and advise us how to implement those methods into our ways of working.
You consider yourself to be a student of the world who thrives in an ever-changing environment that holds within it new challenges and chances to prove your expertise.
You level up when you have the opportunity to teach others and empower those around you to excel.

You'll make an impact by...
Effectively identifying and capitalizing on opportunities to maximize our User Research function integrating into project parameters while working with agility from cradle to grave.
Connecting with and enhancing the ITUX organization's relationship with US and other Design/UX teams. Delivering through those partnerships and helping Walmart raise it's user experience outcomes world-wide.
Encouraging the teams that you oversee to work collaboratively and to aim for insight-driven outcomes.
Building strong partnerships with members of our "extended team" (in-market researchers in Mexico and Chile primarily) to build a sense of connection, shared purpose and influence impact.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Travel

Traveling domestically or internationally may be necessary requiring consecutive overnight stays.

Benefits & Perks:
Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Equal Opportunity Employer
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J .

The annual salary range for this position is $192,000.00-$288,000.00

Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.

Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:

Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location)

Stock equity incentives

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in UI/UX design, graphic design, visual communication, product design, computer science, information technology, or related area and 6 years' experience in UI/UX, interactive and visual design, electronics art, multimedia design, or related area. Option 2: 8 years' experience in UI/UX, interactive and visual design, electronics art, multimedia design, or related area.
3 years' supervisory experience.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Design certification (for example, IDEOU - Foundations in Design Thinking Certificate), Driving product development in a user experience area, Master's degree in UI/UX Design, Interactive and Visual Design, Product Design, or related area, Related industry experience (for example, retail, supply chain, eCommerce, healthcare), UI/UX, Interactive and Visual Design, Electronics Art, Multimedia Design, or related area

Primary Location...
640 W California Avenue, Sunnyvale, CA 94086-4828, United States of America

Title: IT - Information Security - Director - Information Security
Description:
REPORTS TO: VP - Security, Technology Infrastructure & Facilities.
The Director – Information Security directs, coordinates, plans, and organizes information…
Descriptions:
TITLE: Director - Information Security
STATUS: Exempt
REPORTS TO: VP - Security, Technology Infrastructure & Facilities
DEPARTMENT: IT - Information Services
JOB CODE: 10051
PAY SCALE: $160,000.00 - $188,000.00 Annually

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The Director – Information Security directs, coordinates, plans, and organizes information security activities throughout Golden 1 Credit Union. This leadership role is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all Credit Union data as well as ensuring compliance with all information security laws, policies and best practices. Manages enterprise information security program, as well as evaluates, recommends, and drives improvements to enterprise security practices and processes within the Credit Union. The Director, Information Security works with a wide variety of employees and leaders from different organizational units, collaborating together to set up controls that reflect workable compromises as well as proactive responses to current and future information security risks.

In addition to delivering on our commitment to members and our community, we aspire to be the leading digital credit union in California, technology empowered, and able to pursue limitless member value. This Information Security leader, in conjunction with the credit union leadership team, will identify opportunities and drive the transformation needed to ensure we are able to achieve this outcome while safeguarding our brand, assets and member data.

TASKS, DUTIES, FUNCTIONS

1. Leads development of the Information Security strategic roadmap ensuring it is strategically aligned with the business to mitigate or lessen the impact of current and future security risks for Golden 1. Understand the dynamic threat landscape and strategically adjusts and aligns the roadmap on an ongoing basis to ensure it addresses the changing security risk environment.

2. Drive the information security roadmap and projects, removing roadblocks.

3. Serves as an internal Information Security expert to Golden 1 and champions the integration of security practices into all areas of the Credit Union.

4. Consult in major business initiatives to provide security-planning guidance and align security strategy with the business strategy.

5. Develops a culture of security through effective security awareness throughout all levels of the organization.

6. Develops and maintains an enterprise Information Security program to monitor and continuously improve Information Security controls, compliance, risk assessments, incident response, and all other associated services and practices.

7. Work with all parts of the organization to establish long-range corporate policies and protocols related to our company-wide security posture, including policies and procedures that protect the organization’s digital assets

8. Oversees the development of security requirements and ensures these requirements have been captured, designed, built and validated prior to deployment. Monitor ongoing compliance with these requirements through periodic testing.

9. Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position.

10. Foster a positive and engaging work environment for each team member by promoting skill development, coaching for improvement and growth, inspiring others through your words and actions, ensuring positive employee morale throughout Golden 1, and embracing our mission, vision and core values.

11. Develop and implement monitoring/testing program to support ongoing compliance with information security policies. Monitor management’s risk mitigation strategies; assess reasonableness of any residual risks.

12. Develop informative oversight reports for various levels of management, including oversight committees, as appropriate.

13. Asses current technologies, systems, processes and procedures and evaluates them against GLBA, federal and state information protection regulations, and other relevant regulations.

14. Keep management updated of Information Security matters by developing action plans, budgets, schedules, and reports to improve the Information Security program at Golden 1.

15. Work with outside consultants, as appropriate, for independent audits and assessments.

16. Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, and industry standards related to information security to proactively keep Golden 1 fully compliant in these new requirements.

17. Research emerging security technologies and practices for their application in Golden 1’s environment.

18. Develop and maintain an understanding of the pertinent regulatory requirements and risks inherent to job responsibilities, establish, and maintain control activities that mitigate those risks consistent with the Credit Union’s risk appetite, and ensure operational integrity and compliance with applicable regulations.

19. Handle other duties as may be assigned.

PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS

1. Effective oral and written communication skills to complete reports and analysis and to make oral presentations to the Board of Directors, supervisory committees, and management staff.

2. Carry and respond to a mobile device seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.

3. Requires occasional travel to develop and maintain technology competencies. Travel may be local, statewide, or national. Travel to Golden 1 branches throughout California may also be required.

ORGANIZATIONAL CONTACTS & RELATIONSHIPS

1. INTERNAL: Board of Directors, Supervisory Committee, CEO, Senior Management, and all levels of staff.

2. EXTERNAL: Vendors, suppliers, external auditors, and law enforcement agencies

QUALIFICATIONS

1. EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a Management Information Systems, Information Security, Information Technology/Computer Sciences field, or equivalent job experience preferred. Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Certified Internal Systems Auditor (CISA), preferred.

2. EXPERIENCE:
At least 10 years’ experience in Information Security and 5 years direct supervisory experience.
Experience developing and managing and enterprise wide information Security strategy and program.
Experience with information security technologies, markets, and vendors (firewall, intrusion detection, assessment tools, encryption, web/application security, etc.).
Experience directing Information Security Incident Response Teams and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders on information security practices, procedures, and policies.
3. KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:
Able to be think at an enterprise level, using creative and innovation solutions to advance member value.
In-depth understanding of financial services and high degree of business acumen.
Able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.
Effective leadership skills who can work at a high level with minimal direction.
Ability to remain organized and manage multiple projects in a timely manner.
Possess excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication and presentation skills with the ability to form good working relationships at all levels both internally and externally.
Must possess and be competent using a Personal Computer. Competency in this area must include applications such as Word Processing, Spreadsheets, and Presentation software.
In-depth knowledge of information security technology. Proficient in network security design and architecture, capacity planning, end-point protection, patch-management, vulnerability management, penetration testing, intrusion detection, risk management, mobile device management, identity and access management, and data loss prevention.
Strong knowledge of concepts and best practices including, but not limited to, security frameworks and guidelines established by the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC), National Institute on Standards in Technology (NIST), the International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium (ISC)², International Standards Organization (ISO), and the Control Objectives for Information Technology (COBIT) established by the Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA).
Current knowledge and experience in Information Security Risk Assessments, Security Assessments, and managing risk mitigations.
Demonstrated interest in and desire to stay up-to-date in a rapidly changing information security domain.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

1. Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility required.

2. Corrected vision within the normal range.

3. Hearing within normal range. A device to enhance hearing will be provided if needed.

4. Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc.

5. Unusually long work hours may be required to accomplish tasks.

LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

Information Security Certification preferred:
1) CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)

2) CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)

3) Certified Internal Systems Auditor (CISA)

THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN NO WAY STATES OR IMPLIES THAT THESE ARE THE ONLY DUTIES TO BE PERFORMED BY THIS EMPLOYEE. HE OR SHE WILL BE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW OTHER INSTRUCTIONS AND TO PERFORM OTHER DUTIES REQUESTED BY HIS OR HER SUPERVISOR THAT ARE WITHIN HIS / HER KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY AS WELL AS HIS / HER MENTAL AND PHYSICAL ABILITIES.

REV. 3/31/2023

Title: Director of Strategic Finance
Description:
You breathe operating models, cash flows, revenue operations, KPIs and financial statements.
You can also skillfully negotiate acquisition debt, financings, and…
Descriptions:
Verdigris is on a mission to sustain and enrich human life through responsive energy intelligence. Our AI sensors automate energy management and predict unseen equipment failures in mission-critical buildings. This is a critical step for autonomous, sustainable environments responsive to their inhabitants.

While the Covid19 crisis has been devastating for us all it presents opportunities for our mission. As a society we depend on critical building infrastructure. Our survival of this pandemic means even greater electrical energy challenges accelerating how we may shape human destiny on this planet.

Extraordinary outcomes need exceptional teams. As a company we value working together and continuously growing.

About you

As our new finance leader, you’ll refine and improve existing financial processes. You're also not afraid to redevelop, teardown, and/or redesign core finance and accounting functions for Verdigris.

You're thoughtful, detail-oriented and reflective. You take time to understand businesses deeply and observe context but are also not afraid of quick changes. You balance best practice with first principle design to launch from 0, but continuously are redesigning and improving financial processes.

You’re intimate with accounting and finance for many stages of tech companies from startups to IPOs. You breathe operating models, cash flows, revenue operations, KPIs and financial statements. You can also skillfully negotiate acquisition debt, financings, and securities instruments. You enjoy building external relationships with board members, vendors, strategic partners, bankers, and investors.

You are the rare individual with a passion for detailed numbers and the intuition for building robust businesses. You’re well-rounded, execution focused, transparent and collaborative.
You are a resilient operator even under the most resource-constrained and stressful conditions because you care deeply about our mission.

You’ll innovate new and efficient ways for Verdigris to grow beyond your job description. While you're an expert in your field, you hold a beginner's mindset with an attitude for continuous learning.

About Business Ops

Verdigris is constantly evolving. We’re currently organized as small agile teams, typically sized between 3-8 people and collocated. The Business Ops team (“Bops”) is the current operations arm for the company. You'll be coming in to help lead and upgrade the skills of this team. Today, we are a cross-functional team with broadly technical skillsets, working to build processes. Verdigrisians rely on us for strategy, planning, analysis, budgeting, forecasting, accounting, administration, cash management, investor relations, board meetings, policies, KPIs, OKRs, compensation, equity, and benefits, recruiting, financings (equity and debt), contract negotiation, performance reviews, financial auditing, IP strategy, facilities and IT. Phew! This means you’ll wear different hats at times and you will heavily impact our culture. As collaborators we pitch in when it’s all hands on deck, but also believe in individual accountability of result delivery.
Responsibilities
Partner with the founders, the Board of Directors, and our management, to help steer a financially-engineered growth/expansion strategy
Learn, optimize and run our financial operating plan
Evaluate financial and business performance against goal-driven metrics
Develop and maintain monthly, quarterly, and annual budgets and forecasts and share insights to the steering committee
Help develop and analyze new initiatives, offerings and product launches
Maintain cash flow planning and oversee our investment strategies
Manage liquidity and other key financial risks
Prepare company and materials for future equity financing
Collaborate, lead, and mentor your business ops teammates
Do whatever else Verdigris needs to ensure our success
Required Qualifications
You have expert qualifications in Finance, and/or Business Administration
You directly worked with and built operating models, revenue models and financial models for various technology products and software service businesses
You have strong working knowledge of US GAAP
You have demonstrated leadership ability
You have expert written and oral presentation skills adaptable across broad audience types
You have demonstrated broad operational capability
You are an expert with spreadsheets, forecasting and quantitative modeling
You are fluent in English and can travel in person to meet and build relationships with key stakeholders globally
Nice to Haves
You are a proficient coder in at least one function scripting or programming language
You are proficient and experienced in modern finance/accounting automation tools
You enjoy operating across functions within a team
You can perform advanced problem solving and root cause analysis and can effectively communicate from those analyses
You are an expert at telling stories with data
You've led the finance function at hardware-enabled software businesses
You're current on CFIUS requirements and Technology export process and practices
You're experienced with IP Strategy, Technology Licensing and Joint Ventures
You've successfully worked with foreign government entities on collaboration, subsidies, requirements (e.g., Taiwan, China, Korea, Hong Kong, or Japan)
You have an advanced degree or professional certification in a financial field (CPA, CFA, MBA, MS Finance, etc.) from a globally recognized graduate program
You're experienced in our current finance/accounting software tool stack: Bill.com, Xero, Expensify, Salesforce, Google Sheets
You're an expert in various cash securities, investment strategies and asset management
You have reported to or served on corporate for-profit boards
Applying to Verdigris is a chance to make an impact by joining a mission-driven startup. We’re aggressively innovating for the energy management industry hoping to affect climate change. Verdigrisians aim to be ego-free authorities in our fields. We take our work seriously and strive for an opportunity-filled environment supportive of curious minds.

You can expect thoughtful, hardworking and funny teammates. When we are not sheltering-in-place, you can usually find someone to tour our historic NASA campus or make empanadas from scratch. We value differing perspectives and embrace candid, direct, and constant feedback. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, orientation, age, or status.

Title: Director of Product Management
Description:
Informed decision-making skills based on best practices, analytics, industry / technology trends.
The ideal candidate will own the Content platform from start…
Descriptions:
Director of Product - Onsite(People Manager Role)
About Us

A online media company that is focused on bringing together TV, digital, D2C, social, and live events. We are looking to the future — reimagining entertainment for a broader, more diverse audience.


The Role

Job Summary & Responsibilities:

We are looking for a Director of Product to lead our Content Platform team .
You will over see the following areas- Content Platforms which houses our digital products across web, mobile apps, connected tv apps and more. We are on a mission to streamline our content publishing systems and workflow to make them easy to use, scalable and best in class.



The ideal candidate will own the Content platform from start-to-finish, developing product opportunities focused on driving improvements around CMS & video workflows, APIs, content, asset management, metadata, digital rights management, and transcoding.



Essential duties and responsibilities include but not limited to:


Own and drive the product roadmap for the evolution of our content platforms, with input from business stakeholders and editorial teams
Collaborate with the Engineering and Design team to enhance our publishing systems and build new capabilities
Review CMS & VMS users and analyze usage patterns to discover user interaction pain points
Assist with developing products and processes to create the most efficient workflow for content creation and publishing
Work with internal and external partners with providing the vision
Write detailed requirements for business stakeholders, Engineering and Infrastructure teams
Update documentation and contribute to training materials
Prioritize a backlog of bugs and feature enhancements
Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team's ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals
Supervisory Responsibility:
You will lead a team.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, User Experience or related discipline with a focus on digital media or digital product management
8-10 years digital media product management experience – conceptualizing, defining, and delivering products to targeted audiences
Digital technology experience in Product or Strategy role
Experience working with a range of stakeholders on production, editorial and engineering teams
Experience w/- Content Management Systems, Tagging/taxonomy
Experience with asset management and back-end APIs
Experience with video workflows, transcoding and digital rights management
Familiarity with ad technology and integrations (nice to have)
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Informed decision-making skills based on best practices, analytics, industry / technology trends
A demonstrated track record of successful product execution and leading cross-functional terms to deliver high-quality products
To be a team player with the flexibility to get things done in a fast-past editorial environment
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts and new features with technical team members
A love of documentation, details, and diving head-first into solving our business user problems
Proven track record of balancing multiple projects at once and delivery of projects successfully on time
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Highly detail oriented, strong technical intuition, organized and collaborative.
Flexible and adaptable to change
Equipment/Software Used:
Microsoft- Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Google Suite
Work Environment:
Work is performed in an office environment.

Title: Director of Property & Asset Management
Description: Direct Reports: 4 (Regional Housing Portfolio Manager, Housing Asset Manager, Housing Portfolio Coordinator, Maintenance Supervisor).
Descriptions:
Position Title: Director of Property & Asset Management
Compensation: $110,000 - $130,000 DOE/neg.
Locations: Chula Vista, CA
Reports To: Chief Operating Officer
Direct Reports: 4 (Regional Housing Portfolio Manager, Housing Asset Manager, Housing Portfolio Coordinator, Maintenance Supervisor)
OUR STORY
Since opening our doors in 1965, MAAC has focused on helping individuals and families create the lives they want and deserve. For more than five decades, MAAC has been a champion for underrepresented communities throughout San Diego County, providing families in need with resources to achieve self-sufficiency and improve their living conditions. While the organization first began in the southern region of San Diego, MAAC now operates 35 sites across the county, from San Ysidro to Fallbrook. With an annual operating budget of $46 million, MAAC employs nearly 500 staff who provide life-changing services to 70,000 individuals annually through programs in 5 core focus areas: Education, Economic Development, Health & Wellbeing, Housing, and Advocacy & Leadership Development. Through our wide array of programs, MAAC has grown to become one of the largest nonprofit social service organizations in the community. With regards to housing, MAAC is unique in that we bring together three different areas all under one organization:
Affordable housing developer
Property Manager
Provider of resident services (education, childcare, employment, financial literacy, etc.)
We feel this model enables us to provide a much higher level of service and benefit to the community, through increased accountability and coordination. More importantly, providing all three services enables MAAC to develop a deeper understanding of our resident’s needs through relationships. For more information, please visit: http://www.maacproject.org/
POSITION SUMMARY
MAAC has significantly expanded its affordable housing portfolio over the past few years, which now comprises 6 properties across San Diego County, totaling approximately 1,000 units. And over the next 3-4 years we anticipate adding additional properties in San Diego and Imperial Counties, adding another 1,000 units to our portfolio. Given the size and ongoing expansion of our programs, MAAC recently reorganized the Housing department into two new divisions: 1) Real Estate Development and 2) Property & Asset Management.
This Director of Property & Asset Management will oversee a department of approximately 30 staff, with teams of 4-7 based at each of MAAC’s affordable housing sites. We are looking for an experienced manager who can assess our current operations and practices, and drive efforts to modernize, upgrade and innovate. They will serve as a liaison to MAAC’s Real Estate Development and Client Services departments and work with government agencies including HUD, State of California Housing and Community Development, San Diego Housing Commission, San Diego Housing Federation and other State and local government agencies. This will require the new Director to maintain a solid understanding of low-income tax credits and governmental subsidies related to affordable housing, and a broad network of partner organizations in the local affordable housing sector.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES & FOCUS ALLOCATION
Operations -
Provide leadership to the Property Management Team through the development of systems and departmental goals, as well as coaching and mentoring for individual team members.
Supervise staff and review/monitor performance to ensure professional conduct with tenants, community members and other MAAC departments.
Coordinate effective communication with the Real Estate Development Director during submittal of housing development applications as related to operating budgets and proformas, rent restrictions, welfare tax exemptions, fair housing issues, and supportive service plans.
Interface with government agencies, maintaining effective working relations with representatives of city, state and federal entities, as well as other organizations within the affordable housing sector.
Develop and lead project-specific leasing strategies and improve exiting marketing and lease-up models.
(referenced in the Compliance section).
Develop annual budget recommendations according to established procedures; manage department budget and staffing plans.
Asset Management -
Manage the initial investor audit process and contract with audit consultants.
Establish procedures to maximize occupancy and regulatory compliance through the minimization of delinquent rent and vacancy loss.
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret complex business documents including leases, financial reports, contracts, loan documents and regulatory agreements.
Negotiate and monitor contracts including leases, management agreements, vendor contracts, utility contracts, etc. to protect ownership rights and ensure contract compliance.
Compliance -
Oversee the compliance team to ensure that ongoing vacancy, waitlist, and certification procedures comply with local, state, federal, lender, investor and regulatory requirements.
Submit reoccurring and special reports to support oversight and compliance with all regulatory, lender and investor requirements.
Establish strategies for the resolution of insurance claims and tenant legal proceedings related to non-payment, illegal, and fraudulent activity at the property and/or tenant level.
Manage all tenant legal matters.
Fiscal Oversight -
Plan, organize, and direct all budgetary aspects of MAAC’s current affordable housing portfolio.
Serve as the department’s fiscal agent, collecting and providing updated financial information as well as accounting for, safeguarding, and investing agency funds.
Conduct financial analysis and prepare management reports for the department.
ATTRIBUTES & WORK STYLE
Passionate: driven by MAAC’s mission to maximize self-sufficiency for families and individuals; keeps the wellbeing of those MAAC serves at the heart of all programmatic efforts.
Servant-Leader: preference for leading from the front, pitching in to assist at any level, as circumstances require.
Coaching and Mentoring: demonstrated ability to motivate and develop staff.
Team Player: fosters a respectful, transparent, and collaborative work environment.
Growth Mindset: says “yes” to appropriate, new opportunities and ideas for MAAC.
Analytical: ability to carefully study issues, identify trends and formulate new ideas.
Strategic: agile thinker who communicates a compelling vision for success.
Tact & Diplomacy: patient, willing and able to have the difficult conversations as required.
Positivity: charismatic, warm and welcoming; a true “people-person.”
Reflective: skilled at receiving and giving feedback and performance critiques.
Metrics-Driven: an innovative thinker, pairing ideas with solutions and measurable outcomes.
Perseverant: sees things through to completion; especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
Meticulous: superior attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Communicative: strong written and oral communication skills.
Planning and Process Management: exceptional mind for optimizing workflow and managing people, systems, procedures, and programs.
Community-minded: skilled at connecting with people across the community and possesses a high level of emotional intelligence.
Emotionally intelligent: sensitive to the needs of others; serious about leadership and continuing to develop their management capabilities.
Confident: demonstrates both executive presence and humility appropriately.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
4+ years in relevant leadership or senior management experience.
Demonstrated knowledge of affordable housing laws and regulations such as HUD, LIHTC, and AHP.
Track record of success with managing systems, operations and large teams.
Proven ability to effectively coach and mentor employees and teams.
Bilingual English / Spanish is highly desirable.
Experience with property management software (Yardi preferred)
Prior experience with staff unions and labor agreements a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or 6+ years of substantially similar experience are preferred.
VALUE-BASED BEHAVIORS
Listens attentively to others. Asks clarifying questions to gain a better understanding of the other person’s views and underlying assumptions
Works effectively in a team environment and actively participates in joint problem solving; willingly cooperates with co-workers
Identifies and takes advantage of opportunities for personal and professional development
Attends work consistently and punctually. Arrives to meetings prepared and on time; honors work commitments; follows through on what was agreed upon; meets deadlines
Honors the private and confidential matters of co-workers. Protects the proprietary information of MAAC systems
Follows rules, regulations, and policies; positively contributes to implementing changes
Deals with issues directly, in a respectful and timely manner. Focuses on resolving the issue while not criticizing the person. Follows rules, regulations, and policies; positively contributes to implementing changes
HEALTH STATUS
Must have a physical examination, TB clearance and a drug screen by a doctor/clinic designated by MAAC as well as immunization records for influenza*, pertussis and measles as required by state and federal regulations prior to the first day of employment.
PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS
The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this class. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Demands
While performing the duties of this class, an employee is regularly required to stand, walk and sit, talk or hear both in person and by telephone, uses hands to finger, handle or feel objects or controls, reach with hands and arms. An employee also is regularly required to stoop, kneel, bend, crouch or crawl, climb or balance and lift up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, color vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Mental Demands
While performing the duties of this class, the employee is regularly required to use written and oral communication skills; read and interpret information; analyze and solve problems; observe and interpret people and situations; use basic math; learn and apply new information or skills; work under intensive deadlines and interact with MAAC management, administrators, staff, teachers, parents, family members, children and others encountered in the course of work.
BACKGROUND CLEARANCE
All positions are subject to a background/education check, DMV check, NSOR, exclusion and debarment checks prior to hire and periodically throughout employment as required by various funding sources.
Note: California Start law requires background criminal checks on anyone who works in a licensed childcare facility who is not a client. Must have or obtain a current criminal background check clearance, signed criminal record statement, and signed Acknowledgement to Report Child Abuse form prior to the first day of employment.
TRANSPORTATION
Must have and maintain a valid California Driver’s License, daily use of a personal, insured vehicle, and have and maintain a motor vehicle driving record acceptable to MAAC’s insurance carrier. Incumbents will be enrolled in the California DMV Pull Program.
