Title: Director Business Informatics and Analysis
Description: This strategic leadership position over Business Informatics and Analysis reports to the UCSF VP & Associate CIO Enterprise Systems and is responsible for…
Descriptions:
This strategic leadership position over Business Informatics and Analysis reports to the UCSF VP & Associate CIO Enterprise Systems and is responsible for managing IT business operations for enterprise applications, driving business systems transformation transition to cloud strategy, I.T. quality assurance and providing business analysis. Works with the Associate Chief Information Officer and other UCSF leaders to implement strategic business priorities and is responsible for delivering modern cloud-based Administrative Systems ((i.e., ERP, HR, Supply Chain, Student Information, etc.), CRM, Service Management, and other business capabilities required for Campus and Health. Builds trusted relationships with business leaders on both campus and health side so that the enterprise application team serves as a responsive and reliable partner to meet business objectives. Acts as a liaison with other departments to identify the business system meets the enterprise’s needs and work with business system technology team on execution. Analyzes trends and uses complex data modeling to improve business performance. Directs staff and develops their skills/capabilities to meet the needs of UCSF.

This role is a critical component to the success of UCSF and requires an experienced IT leader with strong leadership, communications, and management expertise along with a strong contextual knowledge of how IT is used within the clinical, research and education enterprise. UCSF and the UC System are in a highly dynamic era with extraordinary demands for new IT services and this role is central to providing information and analysis that inform decision-making at all levels of UCSF IT and business leadership.

Represents the UCSF Campus and Health System in local and systemwide meetings as well as at the national level in appropriate forums. Recognized as an influential leader, providing leadership in the effective application of technology at the enterprise level. Makes final decisions for the organization and ensures achievement of objectives. More detailed scope definition follows.

Leadership
Lead and drive business digital transformation through process optimization and automation.
Robotic process automation, specialized cloud applications, and enterprise business systems platforms will be leveraged in a coordinated and integrated manner to achieve needed business transformation
Coach, mentor, empower, and develop staff. Leverage staff for cross-campus initiatives to improve efficiency across the enterprise.
Engage in and lead discussions in key UCSF and UCOP IT Governance committees.
Provide guiding principles and clear organizational direction in collaboration with the CIO, Associate CIOs for Education, Research, Health, Enterprise Systems, and Director peers. Provide the IT staff with the context they need to be empowered and make good decisions.
Identify opportunities to improve productivity, communications, and effectiveness.
Provide technology leadership and act as a trusted advisor to executives, staff, business operations and mission-based leaders.

Strategy & Planning
Responsible for driving the future cloud enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy and implementation efforts.
Develop and implement a strategy for reducing the complexity of Business systems in a cost-effective manner, for example by decreasing the number of applications or moving away from legacy systems.
Lead and drive business digital transformation through process optimization and automation. Robotic process automation, specialized cloud applications, and enterprise business systems platforms will be leveraged in a coordinated and integrated manner to achieve needed business transformation
Drive operating rhythm to review funneled projects and prioritize automation projects based on cost benefit analysis and hand-over for development to technical teams
Develop an internal quality assurance program leveraging key metrics that helps measure performance against SLA's, volumes, customer satisfaction & quality.
Set the method and standards for eliciting requirements, defining standards and quality targets whilst managing multiple stakeholder perspective and expectations
Support execution team with resolution of roadblocks and interdependencies. Partner with technical and operational teams external to the project to ensure their tasks are completed as required
Enable effective practices in data governance, business intelligence, and data analysis.
Leads Strategy and Roadmap development, Technology solution evaluation, execution of Sourcing processes (RFI, RFQ, RFP) and Financial/Cost Modeling for Technology solutions.

Team Management
Develops a diverse and resilient team ensuring high levels of employee engagement, operations performance excellence, and succession planning.
Manage and developing team of Business Analysts, Quality Analysts, Vendors, Contractors and foster a strong customer service mind set throughout the team, while championing thought leadership and partnership with the business
A Coach to direct reports as they build strategies and roadmaps.
Creates and fosters career development and growth paths for team members in alignment with company and personal objectives.
Assists direct reports with ongoing prioritization and resource allocation to ensure that the crucial business initiatives are delivered.
Utilizes leadership skills, problem solving and decision-making skills to facilitate and encourage participation of team members to meet objectives in congruence with approved standards and guidelines.
Establishes a mindset for delivering actionable insights and trusted information to business stakeholders.
Ensure quality of deliverables is verified and matching business expectations
To see the salary range for this position (we recommend that you make a note of the job code and use that to look up): TCS Non-Academic Titles Search (ucop.edu)
Please note: The compensation ranges listed online for roles not covered by a bargaining unit agreement are very wide, however a job offer will typically fall in the range of 80% - 120% of the established mid-point. An offer will take into consideration the experience of the final candidate AND the current salary level of individuals working at UCSF in a similar role.
For roles covered by a bargaining unit agreement, there will be specific rules about where a new hire would be placed on the range.
To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html
Department Description
The UCSF IT Department provides centralized IT services to all aspects of the UCSF mission including
patient care, research and education in addition to support for enterprise-wide administrative systems.
Additionally, UCSF IT works closely with a variety of more specialized departmentally based IT services to
provide common services, IT architectures and frameworks in the areas of infrastructure technology,
integration / interfaces, information management (e.g. master data management, clinical data
warehousing), security, enterprise systems of record and IT service management processes and tools.
Additionally, UCSF IT is actively engaged at the UC System level to identify and implement leveraged
solutions and services but also to leverage the experience and skillset across the UC system to meet the
rapidly escalating information technology needs of the institution. This offers employees the opportunity to
be exposed and engaged in a broad swath of the UC business and advanced technologies and
professionals within UCSF and the UC System.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.
Typically 10 years or more of experience managing an information technology organization.
Requires extensive and in-depth knowledge of Information Technology principles, theories, and concepts to manage functional area(s) and provide solutions.
Requires knowledge of policies and procedures and ability to determine a course of action based on these guidelines.
Clearly understands the needs and concerns of the user groups in the organization and applies knowledge to better meet those needs.
Requires the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from, others involving project work and initiatives. Comprehensive knowledge of subject area and broad knowledge of all IT areas sufficient for strategic planning, technology assessment and direction.
Thorough knowledge of supervisory and leadership techniques in managing technical staff.
Experience in the management of ongoing technology infrastructure acquisition and expansion, to include the identification and integration of suitable emerging technologies.
Thorough knowledge of technical concepts and basic operating principles of data communications, computer hardware, vendor IT products, and software.
Ability to understand the process involved to adapt, integrate, and modify existing programs or vendor-supplied products for use within a large and complex technical environment.
Experienced in leading change management activities and managing their impact across multiple organizations across division, college or institutional boundaries.
Demonstrated leadership experience in an executive position.
Demonstrated experience developing and analyzing corporate strategy.
Demonstrated experience with senior management planning and budgeting.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present technical topics to large groups and senior management with potentially varied levels of technical sophistication.
Prior experience overseeing the successful development and delivery of large systems projects, products, and services.
Strong business functions and operations knowledge of Finance, HR, Supply Chain, Grants, Student financials/administration.
Skilled in navigating complex organizational relationships and driving organizational cultural change. Politically astute; understands dynamics of relationships and will remain balanced and objective.
Business transformation/optimization experience and prior experience in ERP transformation and implementation at large, complex organizational entities such as a multi-location health system environment preferred.

Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree preferred.

#CPA #Finance

About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Title: Director, Business Intelligence
Description:
Experience with data science and AI/ML based predictive analytics is a plus.
Extensive experience and comprehensive working knowledge of business intelligence…
Descriptions:
Date posted: Mar 25, 2023
Location: Buena Park, CA, US, 90620
Company: Orora Group
At Orora, we believe our packaging touches lives and together, we, together as a team, deliver on the promise of what’s inside. From custom packaging design and packaging materials, to prototype development and manufacturing, packaging automation and equipment, kitting and fulfillment, global sourcing, and full service warehousing and logistics, our packaging consultants develop cutting-edge, innovative solutions that take a product from concept to consumer. It is with this passion and commitment to innovation, we believe in hiring and developing the very best talent by living our core values of Teamwork, Passion, Respect, and Integrity every day. These core values define who we are and how we operate. They shape the way we work with each other, with our customers, and with our communities. Every day, we deliver packaging solutions that exceed our customers’ expectations while solving complex problems as a team. We believe that all team members (irrespective of their role or level), should aspire to distinctive leadership behavior, as we continue to deliver on the promise for our customers, shareholders and each other. Leadership is not tied to a job title, i.e. you don’t need to be accountable for a team to be considered a leader.

The Role: Director – Business Intelligence
Summary of Role:
The Director, Business Intelligence is responsible for the development of the business intelligence gathering practices and management of data and information. This role will serve as a strategic partner to senior leadership by leading the design, development, implementation, and support of critical business intelligence initiatives and will contribute to strategic decision-making across the enterprise.
What You'll be Responsible For
Primary responsibilities
Provide vision and leadership to develop a mature business intelligence platform by acting as an intermediary between the business and IT groups, translating business desires into technical solutions and, conversely, technical constraints into business reality
Directs the strategic direction, design, delivery, and maintenance/support of the business intelligence program that will support business priorities
Defines, implements, and monitors operational policies, standards, guidelines and procedures
Oversees a team of BI analysts and the prioritization, project, and task assignments to meet committed deliverables and on-demand requirements
Lead analysis, interpretation and build of data models from business information based on a strong understanding of business processes, SAP and other ERP data and core business KPIs
Work with various departments such as Sales, Operations (Supply Chain and Procurement), Manufacturing, Finance, Quality and HR to understand needs, design data models, recommend KPIs and compelling data visualizations
Provide technical leadership in analytics, visualization, data warehousing, data modeling, ETL/ELT along with the use of business intelligence best practices and adherence to database and development standards
Ensures the reliability, security, and availability of systems for reporting, analysis, and data extracts
Lead quality assurance, validation, testing and user training activities related to BI projects
Develop and implement a robust governance framework across the BI landscape that ensures strong change management, excellent data quality and data confidence
Lead the development of security controls to ensure appropriate levels of data security
Hands-on involvement in various reporting activities by utilizing tools and technologies such as SAP HANA, SAP BW, SAP BPC, MS Power BI, SAP BOBJ etc.
Maintain up to date knowledge of emerging BI technologies and recommend solutions that drive innovation and business value
Mentor and develop the team while ensuring performance targets are achieved and maintained
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Computer Sciences, Information Systems or Engineering.
Extensive experience and comprehensive working knowledge of business intelligence systems architecture and data warehouse environments including system administration, database design, dimensional modelling, security, reporting and analytics
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills and ability to engage with stakeholders
Extensive knowledge of business analysis, business process re-engineering and information management practices and protocols including strategic planning processes and change management principles and practices.
Working knowledge of various enterprise systems such as SAP ECC, CRM, HANA, SQL etc.
Proven experience or certifications in MS Power BI, Tableau, SAP BI/BOBJ technologies
Experience with ETL process working with traditional business warehouse or HANA systems
Strong data modeling and visualization abilities
Very good analytical skills with an eye for attention to detail
Experience managing multiple initiatives and projects
Experience with methodologies of systems project lifecycle
Experience with cloud-based data warehouse technologies is a plus
Experience with data science and AI/ML based predictive analytics is a plus
8 or more years of experience in a similar role
Minimum of 3 years’ experience leading teams

Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Description: Provides strategic planning and sound analysis to management across all divisions and contracts for financial and operating decisions.
Descriptions:
SUMMARY
Provides strategic planning and sound analysis to management across all divisions and contracts for financial and operating decisions. Leads the organization’s budgeting process, fiscal compliance and ensures continued program viability through the development and analysis of program budgets.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Employees must spend over 50% of their time on these duties.
Provides financial reporting and schedules, analysis, and recommendations to support strategic planning and financial decisions. Generates financials in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
Leads the budget planning design and implementation process, ensuring that budgets are designed in a way that best supports sustainable program outcomes.
Maintains a good understanding of all federal, state, and local foundation contract/grant financial requirements and regulations for fiscal and programmatic compliance.
Administers the budgeting software and optimizes it to best improve the year-end budgeting process.
Works with CFO & Vice President of Finance to prepare multi-year and long-range planning budgets. Includes monthly and annual cash flow projections.
Conducts monthly performance reviews through liaising with program and department leaders. Analyzes spending patterns and develop long-term models for key activities.
Participates in the preparation and completion of the annual financial audit, annual single audit, funding agency oversight reviews, tax returns and other compliance/audit activities.
Ensures compliance with Uniform Guidance, Government auditing standards and CII’s fiscal policies.
Coordinates, directs, plans, and executes the financial reporting component of the external audit and internal audits.
Leads all financial research efforts. Analyzes, researches, and concludes on new and proposed accounting, reporting, and disclosure standards issued by the FASB and prepare memorandums and procedures regarding the organization’s position and impact on the organization.
Assists in developing and implementing continued training for professional accounting associates.
Assists with the development of budget scenarios for contract and grant funding, renewal and reapplication proposals.
Coordinates contract/grant fiscal monitoring audits/visits, as well as completing subrecipient monitoring visits and assists during internal audits.
Works directly with program managers and/or outside contract officials to address and resolve issues and problems regarding contract fiscal limitations, regulatory compliance, reporting/documentation support requirements, and audit preparation/corrective action.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES
Other duties and special projects as assigned.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Is responsible for the overall direction, and evaluation of the direct reports.
Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
This job supervises 5-7 staff
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
3-5 years of managerial, supervisory experience.
5-7 years of non-profit experience in finance/accounting.
3-5 years of non-profit budgeting experience.
Bachelor's degree in accounting, economics, or finance from a four-year university required.
Master’s degree in Business Administration preferred.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
Excellent attention to detail and a strong ability to manage the quality of one’s own work in addition to the work of others.
Strategic-minded with a focus on compliance and outcomes, while maintaining the flexibility to come up with unconventional, yet compliance-acceptable solutions.
Possesses strong financial, technical and budgeting expertise.
Possesses a valid driver's license and state-required auto insurance.
This position may require some travel.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to handle confidential information.
Maintains patient privacy, including protecting the confidentiality, safeguarding the integrity and availability, and limiting the use and disclosure of patient Protected Health Information (PHI) to authorized individuals and entities.
Participates in, conducts, and sustains performance quality improvement activities according to designated role and responsibilities.
Sensitivity to service population’s cultural and socioeconomic characteristics.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Punctual and dependable attendance.
Free from alcohol and drug abuse.
Understands CII’s basic philosophy and participates fully in carrying out its mission.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Certified Public Accountant preferred.
CONTINGENCIES:
Must be fully vaccinated to comply with the California Department of Public Health (CPHD) order issued on August 5, 2021.
COMPENSATION:
The salary range for this position is $130,000 to $145,000
In accordance with CA law, the expected pay range for this CA position is posted with this position. The actual compensation will be determined based on experience and other factors permitted by law.

Title: Director, Product Management
Location: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Description:
Experience with data-heavy products, machine learning, and/or analytics.
A global evangelist of the product, contributing to international conferences and…
Descriptions:
The Role:
We're looking for a Director of Product Management to lead Sift's team of PMs in developing the leading Digital Trust and Safety product. We aspire to help everyone trust the Internet - helping online businesses protect against fraud while ensuring the best, lowest friction user experiences. This is a high-impact role, demanding strategic thought and responsiveness to a massive, complex market.
We're seeking a passionate product leader to drive the strategy and execution across the Sift product portfolio. This person is a senior leader capable of handling the deepest technology decisions/discussions while also being able to sit in executive boardrooms showcasing C-Level business value propositions. A seasoned product leader understands "how" product is made and drives best practices. A global evangelist of the product, contributing to international conferences and thought leadership working groups. An internal evangelist, helping shape the vision of the comprehensive Sift platform, driving a strong (and differentiated) roadmap, and helping ensure product value is communicated and propagated across the company. A strong mentor, investing in other product managers, engineers, and other cross functional partners. Last but not least, a visionary driving compelling strategic messaging with the analyst community.
Responsibilities:
Product Management Leader: Lead a team of 10+ PMs in the US and Europe. Drive consistent product planning, feature release, and product management best practices. Work closely with designers, engineers, and data scientists, trust and safety architects, and go-to-market teams.
Roadmap Owner: Own the overall Sift product roadmap.
Measure Everything that Matters: Track the success of Sift products, evaluate new market opportunities. Bring both quantitative and qualitative ideas and insights back to the product team, the executive leadership team, and the broader company. Champion the deep understanding across Sift of what the future of Digital Trust and Safety looks like, and how Sift can add value.
Know our customers, protect our customer base: Stay close to our customers – both early and late adopters, both pre sales and post sales. Connect with as many real-world customers as is reasonable to have an authentic understanding of where the market is currently and where it is moving.
Understand digital trust and safety trends: Remain the foremost expert in all things related to digital trust and safety – past, present, and future.
Communicate value clearly: Team up with product marketing, sales, and technical services, ensure the value of Sift products are conveyed to sellers and buyers. Drive clarity and alignment around product vision, roadmap, and customer value.
Deliver Superb Customer/Problem Management: You will be in role to assist with deep customer challenges, architectures, and find creative workarounds – both in the sales cycle and post sales cycle.
Mentor others Foster a spirit of learning and growth throughout Sift. Invest in developing team members.

Required Skills & Qualifications:
10+ years of PM and/or combined PM & PMM experience
4+ years of management experience
Successful track record with technically complex, disruptive B2B products
Experience with data-heavy products, machine learning, and/or analytics
Experience in information security, fraud and/or risk products & industry
Intellectual curiosity, a comfort with ambiguity, and a knack for structured problem solving
History of working with SaaS products, platforms, and data-rich UIs is a plus
Passionate about delighting customers
Influential leader able to partner, energize and inspire
Demonstrated aptitude for learning new technologies and methods
Superb communication skills at all levels of the company
Creative thinker and problem solver
Demonstrated experience in assessing talent, handling performance and making tough decisions.
Excellent project management, organizational design, execution planning and control competency.
A little about us:
Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.
The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.
Benefits and Perks:
Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off
The anticipated starting on-target salary range for this role is $230,000 - $295,000. This role may also be eligible for equity and other benefits. Sift takes into account many factors in determining compensation, including level, location, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, and market demands. Therefore, the pay range / final offer may change or be modified in the future.
Let's Build It Together
At Sift, we are intentionally building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity drives innovation, equity is a fundamental right, and inclusion is a basic human need. We envision a place where all Sifties feel secure sharing their authentic selves and diverse experiences with their teams, their customers, and their community – ultimately using this empowerment and authenticity to build trust and create a safer Internet.
This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

Title: Internal Audit IT and Digital Services Audit Director
Description:
Working knowledge of analytics development life cycle.
Leading the development of digital analytics and automation as a core capability within the Internal…
Descriptions:
Job Description

Intel is a company of bold and curious inventors and problem solvers who create some of the most astounding technology advancements and experiences in the world. With a legacy of relentless innovation and a commitment to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth, our diverse and brilliant teams are continually searching for tomorrow's technology and revel in the challenge that changing the world for the better brings.
Intel Finance prides itself on creating an environment where you are challenged to become the most well rounded, effective finance professional you can be. When you join Intel Finance, you can expect to support both brilliant technologists and top finance leaders who are working to change the world by creating leading edge technology.
The Internal Audit team is responsible for delivering high quality audits, advisory, and consultative risk management services spanning the breadth of Intel Operations, including sales and marketing, business units, engineering, manufacturing, technology development, supply chain, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate functions such as Information Technology.
Internal Audit is seeking a Director with a strong track record of leadership, business partnership, innovation and driving significant positive change in an organization. The Director will lead a global IT & Digital Services audit team of 12, which includes the Information Technology audit function and Digital Analytics teams. The Director is responsible for delivering high quality audits, risk management & control services over the IT infrastructure, applications and processes which keep Intel's key systems, data centers and network running. This includes:
Leading a global team of IT auditors and digital analytics team.
Articulate IT coverage to non-technical executives and leverage external network to regularly benchmark IT coverage.
Creating a risk-based annual and quarterly audit plan, scope and objectives and driving execution of the plan through the team.
Producing impactful audit results through integrated audit teams ensuring highest level service quality and client satisfaction.
Leading the development of digital analytics and automation as a core capability within the Internal Audit team.
Working with and influencing IT Senior Management to mitigate risks identified.
Keeping abreast of the relevant business developments and evolving, IT risk areas and defining appropriate audit response.
Developing and providing training for Auditors to develop their technical skills.
Assistance in shaping the long-term strategic plans of the audit organization and leadership of the overall audit team.
Partnering with other assurance providers at Intel to scale risk and control impacts.
The successful candidate should demonstrate the following skills / traits:
IT Technical Acumen: has a wide knowledge of IT platforms, processes, systems and controls, including areas such as network security, logical access and change management controls at an infrastructure and application level, databases and systems maintenance etc.
Willing to define effective audit plans and effectively coach experienced IT auditors.
Working knowledge of analytics development life cycle.
Communicates and aligns well with key stakeholders: cultivates channels of communication (both written and verbal) to effectively influence at all levels of the organization, including communication and influencing with a CIO and their direct staff.
Risk & Control acumen: deep understanding of IT control objectives, able to link to business risk & impact and define effective assurance approaches.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity risks, external trends, and coverage.
Solid performance management by setting clear performance expectations that aligns with individual capabilities/development areas to drive increased results.
Creates a shared vision of purpose and success for the organization and direct work group.
Leverages a global perspective of industry trends and future oriented thinking to help develop priorities for the Audit organization.
Develops an effective organization by building effective teams via engaging people with different backgrounds and perspectives.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Qualifications:
BA with 10+ years of professional experience, including prior internal audit or Big 4 experience.
CPA (or international equivalent), CIA, CISA, CISSP and/or CFE preferred.
Preferred Qualifications:
MBA with 7+ years of professional experience, including prior internal audit or Big 4 experience.

Inside this Business Group

As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported.
Other Locations

US,AZ,Phoenix;US,CA,Folsom
Covid Statement

Intel strongly encourages employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Intel aligns to federal, state, and local laws and as a contractor to the U.S. Government is subject to government mandates that may be issued. Intel policies for COVID-19 including guidance about testing and vaccination are subject to change over time.
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/jobs/benefits.html

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in US, California: $147,030.00-$235,390.00
Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

Working Model

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

Position of Trust
This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter.

Hybrid

Title: Director of Product Management, Content Platforms
Description:
Informed decision-making skills based on best practices, analytics, industry / technology trends.
MotorTrend is looking for a Director of Product (full-time,…
Descriptions:
Machines that Move Us.
People who Inspire Us.
Stories that Drive Us.

About Us
MotorTrend Group is the largest automotive media company in the world. MotorTrend Group, a Warner Bros. Discovery company, is the largest automotive media company in the world, bringing together MotorTrend TV and a vast automotive digital, direct-to-consumer, social, and live event portfolio, including MOTORTREND, HOT ROD, ROADKILL, AUTOMOBILE and more than 20 other industry-leading brands. With a monthly audience of 26 million across web, TV and print, and 110 million social followers, culminating in 1.3 billion monthly impressions across all platforms, MotorTrend Group encompasses television's #1 network for automotive fans, a leading automotive YouTube Channel and MotorTrend+, the only subscription streaming service dedicated entirely to the motoring world. MotorTrend Group serves to embrace, entertain and empower the motoring world.
An institution in the automotive industry, we have been delivering premium content, in depth analysis, and culturally relevant material since 1949. We celebrate our heritage, while boldly looking to the future — reimagining motor entertainment for a broader, more diverse audience. MotorTrend Group has remained ahead of the automotive world and developed the single most relevant resource for any auto enthusiast and in-market shopper.

Have a look at what we do! https://bit.ly/motortrendintro

Our People
The people who work at MotorTrend embody the passion of our content, and wake up every day intent on embracing, entertaining, and empowering the motoring world.

The Role
Job Summary & Responsibilities:
MotorTrend is looking for a Director of Product (full-time, salaried, regular) to join our Content Platform team. The MotorTrend's Content Platforms powers our digital products across web, mobile apps, connected tv apps and more. We are on a mission to streamline our content publishing systems and workflow to make them easy to use, scalable and best in class.
The ideal candidate will own the Content platform from start-to-finish, developing product opportunities focused on driving improvements around CMS & Video workflows, APIs, content ingestion, asset management, metadata, digital rights management, CDN and transcoding.
Essential duties and responsibilities include but not limited to:
Own and drive the product roadmap for the evolution of our content platforms, with input from business stakeholders and editorial teams
Collaborate with the Engineering and Design team to enhance our publishing systems and build new capabilities
Shadow CMS & VMS users and analyze usage patterns to discover user interaction pain points
Assist with developing products and processes to create the most efficient workflow for content creation and publishing
Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
Write detailed requirements for business stakeholders, Engineering and Infrastructure teams
Update wiki documentation and contribute to training materials
Prioritize a backlog of bugs and feature enhancements
Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team's ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals
Supervisory Responsibility:
This position will include supervising one or more employees.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, User Experience or related discipline with a focus on digital media or digital product management
7-10 years digital media product management experience – conceptualizing, defining, and delivering products to targeted audiences
Digital technology experience in either a Product or Strategy role
Experience working with a range of stakeholders on production, editorial and engineering teams
Experience with CDNs, Content Management Systems and metadata tagging/taxonomy
Experience with asset management and back-end services/APIs
Experience with video workflows, transcoding and digital rights management
Knowledge of headless content management systems such as Contentful
Familiarity with ad technology and integrations (nice to have, but not a deal breaker)
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Informed decision-making skills based on best practices, analytics, industry / technology trends
A demonstrated track record of successful product execution and leading cross-functional terms to deliver high-quality products
To be a team player with the flexibility to get things done in a fast-past editorial environment
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts and new features with technical team members
A love of documentation, details, and diving head-first into solving our business user problems
Proven track record of balancing multiple projects at once and delivery of projects successfully on time
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Highly detail oriented, strong technical intuition, organized and collaborative.
Flexible and adaptable to change
Physical Requirements:
The ability to sit for prolonged period of time and view computer screen.
Equipment/Software Used:
Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Google Suite
Work Environment:
Work is performed in an office environment that is well lit and ventilated.

In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in California. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of MotorTrend's total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $129,500.00 - $240,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, MotorTrend provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
NOTE: This position description reflects management's assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict any other tasks that may be assigned.
*MotorTrend Group will never ask for sensitive personal information or fees as part of your application process*
*A warning about recruitment scams*
Unscrupulous individuals sometimes pose as MotorTrend Group recruiters and mislead jobseekers into providing sensitive personal information (such as social security numbers) or paying fees as a condition of submitting an application to MotorTrend Group or obtaining a job at MotorTrend Group. These individuals or entities posing as recruiters are not affiliated with MotorTrend Group and do not act on behalf of MotorTrend Group. Always utilize the MotorTrend Group Careers page https://boards.greenhouse.io/motortrendgroup to find available openings and whenever submitting a job application to MotorTrend Group, and know that MotorTrend Group will never ask for sensitive personal information or fees as part of your application.

Title: Financial, Planning and Analysis, Director
Description:
This is a key leadership role in the finance organization focused on forecasting, planning and analysis.
The role will lead the financial management process to…
Descriptions:
We are a fast-paced Series A startup growing our team of dynamic builders, tech-enthusiasts, and compassionate professionals on a mission to deploy AI-powered robotic solutions that make supply chain operations more human-friendly and efficient.

We are seeking a FP&A Director to join our team as we develop robots that empower people to handle more. This is a key leadership role in the finance organization focused on forecasting, planning and analysis. The role will lead the financial management process to optimize strategic and operational financial decisions across the various verticals of the company. The company is growing rapidly, the Director will need to look for ways to become more effective by improving the FPA process and implementing best practices.
In this role, you will:
Manage the forecasting, planning and budgeting process
Continuously improve and enhance the financial model
Manage key performance indicators and provide visibility to the company’s leadership team
Partner with business leaders to understand the business and model the financial implications
Perform ad hoc analysis as needed to assist in management decision making
Budget vs Actual analysis for current and prior year
Continuously improve business processes
You are a good fit if you have:
A degree in finance, accounting or a similar discipline
At least 6 years of relevant experience
CPA is a plus
Strong process and detail oriented
Eagerness to learn, solve challenging problems, and lead with curiosity
A desire for career growth and ownership of your work
Excitement about amplifying human potential with state-of-the-art robotics
Advanced financial modeling in Excel is a must, including balance sheet, income statement and cash flow
Strong financial and analytical background
Implementation of financial modeling tools is a nice to have
Strong experience working as a business partner in delivering better business decision support and enabling strategic initiatives
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer benefits such as:
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401k with 5% matching by Ambi
Unlimited PTO
Access to a full gym at HQ
Free parking on site at HQ
Free lunches 2x per week
Equity ownership
Salary range pertains to Bay Area applicants
Ambi Robotics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage and embrace applicants of all backgrounds to apply!

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Senior Director, Data & Analytics
Location: San Jose, CA 95134 (North San Jose area)
Description:
Core analytic system workloads and demonstrated experience optimizing performance.
This position will partner with our IT and business leadership to drive a…
Descriptions:
Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
The Senior Director of Data and Analytics will develop and build the team structure and support the high-performance data analytics for the company. This position will partner with our IT and business leadership to drive a robust data management and analytics program to consolidate business processes, migrate enterprise applications, and deliver a state-of-the-art analytic platform.
This is a rare, ground-floor opportunity to transform a global semi-conductor company into a data-driven enterprise. It requires deep business, technical, and leadership talents. It requires clear vision and a willingness to pursue change in the most collaborative way possible. It requires a unique talent who can bring people at all levels and across disciplines into the vision and inspire them to embrace the data strategy. Your goal is to use data to bring alignment to business data workflows across the company and throughout its decision processes.
Job scope:
Responsible for guiding the strategic product direction for Data Analytics Reporting for the company
Responsible for the strategy of data warehousing and analytics roadmap, development and implementation and rollout
Responsible for end-to-end product governance from concept to production of multiple initiatives at a global level
Drive alignment across multiple stakeholders and management levels into a singular strategy
Transform business decision workflows by delivering an enterprise data strategy and support data-driven business processes for all employees.
Define and execute data quality strategies across the enterprise.
Develop a mature, high-scaled technical framework that helps IT respond quickly to changing business analytic challenges.
Close the loop between business and data processes by defining the integration architecture.
Make systems and employees more efficient by delivering high-scale, high-performance data access solutions.
Accelerate and extend business visibility by designing agile data management processes.
Responsibilities:
Drive technology and platform decisions to improve current tools and automate business processes for tracking, organizing, and communicating information
Chair the analytics executive steering committee and deliver collaborative roadmaps.
Learn and possess a deep understanding of the company's business models, data sources, and system infrastructures to proficiently design the roadmap of business intelligence analytics
Direct projects and identify potential data source requirement to address business needs, data collection methods, attributing definitions, establishing data sample, transforming data usage, and mitigating potential sources of error.
Build strong relationships across the enterprise to understand their business needs, and develop a roadmap to new data requirements for business consumption
Market the enterprise data strategy outside IT and promote adoption.
Lead and mentor team of data engineers and analysts to support the business in driving continuous improvement
Align IT practices to drive analytic value into every IT application project.
Partner with the IT teams to ensure the data requirements for analytics are efficiently built and design of systems and processes
Qualifications
The ability to aggregate technical concepts, business information, and solutions is a core skill.
A firm grasp of enterprise architectures, and the relationship between business processes and IT application / data workflows. Deep knowledge in IT architecture, including applications, infrastructure, and data domains.
Intimate understanding of the nature of data behaviors. Able to explain data types and related characteristics, temporal data management strategies, and where to find value in data sets.
Articulate in data warehousing concepts and demonstrated, hands on design experience.
Understands how data modeling alternatives impact user experience.
A clear understanding of master data management strategies and how they relate to corporate decision processes.
Knowledge of integrations with key business applications such as SAP S4Hana, ModelN, MSD Dynamics and other enterprise applications
Technical knowledge of
Core analytic system workloads and demonstrated experience optimizing performance.
Hosting alternatives, dev ops, and change control in a high-volume agile development workflow.
Integrated, data-level security and compliance architectures.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written) with an emphasis presenting to executive leadership
Relational ability and data knowledge to connect with hands-on data analysts, department heads, and senior executives on their terms.
Ability to lead and direct a diverse workload and global team in a fast-paced environment
Bachelor's degree in Business or Information Systems; Master's preferred
Experience
Proven experience transforming decision workflows within a global, product-oriented enterprise. Prefer multiple experiences in a variety of settings.
Leadership in change management situations where overall business process change was an outcome.
Business experience in financial planning and analysis or similar analytic function (5+ years), including executive support. Operational analysis experience in a high-tech setting is a highly valued plus.
Technical data management experience, including data warehousing, data service bus, reporting, analyst enablement, and information security responsibilities (10+ years).
Experience implementing an enterprise-level data security strategy.
SQL database development and data visualization development experience.
15+ years minimum of related work experience with a progress job experience in increasing roles and responsibility.

Title: Director of B2B Product Management
Location: Hybrid remote in Sherman Oaks, CA 91403
Description:
Job Title*: Director of B2B Product Management.
We are seeking an exceptional, motivated Director of Product Management that is responsible for developing and…
Descriptions:
Company Overview:
Ideal Living is a profitable, privately held, purpose driven, consumer goods company founded in 1999 with over 80 employees based in Sherman Oaks, CA. We have a caring, family environment and a generous profit sharing plan. We are currently maintaining a hybrid work environment. Three days a week in office, two days remote.
We are people-caring, product-perfecting, science-driven stewards of a thriving life for all. We put our hearts--and our research--behind everything we do, creating the best, most accessible technology to build healthy home environments and deliver peace of mind. We are a diligent team looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, isn’t afraid to dive in, roll up their sleeves, and creatively solve any challenge that lies in front of them.
Job Title: Director of B2B Product Management
Position Summary:
We are seeking an exceptional, motivated Director of Product Management that is responsible for developing and executing product management and marketing strategies for Ideal Living’s Enterprise level water purifier and air purifier products. This role will focus specifically on Ideal Living’s AquaTru and AirDoctor brands marketed to B2B channels that supply products to education, healthcare, hospitality, office, government, and leisure market facilities. An exciting opportunity for broad thinker with general management aspirations to become Ideal Living’s universal expert on all things water delivery and air purification for facilities where people work and play.
Responsibilities:
· Leads all market intelligence efforts including industry trends, end-user needs, B2B customer buying behaviors, and competitive strategies and activities.
· Directs and coordinates the development of business plans, product roadmaps, and go-to-market strategies inclusive of launch, pricing, and promotional plans.
· Develops product design, performance, and feature specifications for existing and new products that differentiates Ideal Living amongst its competitors.
· Clearly communicates product plans and coordinates product development projects with Ideal Living’s engineering and operations teams.
· In collaboration with a talented marketing team and channel leads, co-develops and coordinates various marketing initiatives such as websites, emails, online advertising, product literature and marketing campaigns.
· Interfaces greatly with sales and customer service teams to support revenue-generating initiatives such as key customer presentations, influencing building project specifications, attending trade shows, etc.
· Utilizes financial acumen to implement pricing strategies and coordinate sales volume forecasts, cost targets, and other budgetary expenditures to achieve company financial goals.
· Demonstrates excellent analytical skills and judgement and is accountable for optimizing every aspect of the P&L and success metrics;
· Demonstrates outstanding management skills and judgement, works effectively cross functionally and is dedicated to the development of their team.
· Demonstrates a history of contribution margin achievement;
· Comfort in analysis across the P&L (revenue, contribution margin, net, etc.) and performing ad hoc quantitative analysis to measure programs and derive implications to ensure marketing programs/expenditures meet KPIs (CAC, CPA, ROAS, BE, etc.).
Qualifications:
· Bachelor degree in engineering, marketing, or business is required. An MBA is preferred.
· 10 to 15 years in marketing or engineering with at least 7+ years in product management.
· Effective communication skills with the ability to present facts, beliefs and recommendations to educate peers and influence decision-making.
· Demonstrated success in leading and collaborating with cross-functional teams in the development and launch of new products.
· Strong project management skills with adept capabilities in foreseeing and eliminating obstacles that hinder project goals and timelines.
· Strong analytical skills coupled with broad perspective thinking that drives growth, solves problems, and enables business success.
· Experience in developing, marketing and selling durable goods to enterprise customers (educational, healthcare, office, government, hospitality, or leisure facilities) a must.
· Strong passion, driven, high energy, and enthusiasm for growth.
· Experience and comfort working in a highly entrepreneurial environment.
· Strong Interpersonal skills with ability to interact at all levels and functions.

Descriptions:
Position: Director of Financial Planning & Analysis
Location: Woodland Hills, CA
FLSA Classification: Exempt, Full-Time
Compensation: $175,000 - 225,000
Organization
For over 30 years Abbyson has taken great pride in being a family-based home furnishings brand that continually redefines itself through modern-day living. Our strategically aligned, full-spectrum business model and operations allows us to fully service major online furniture retailers and the core audience that is driving today's market. We understand the modern furniture buyer and consumer on a deeper level as well as have a keen eye on the popular trends that are driving online traffic and furniture sales. That's why our mission has always been to help them bring their homes to life with quality furniture at unbeatable prices.

We believe that talent is defined by the collective behavior of each and every individual that makes this company great. Abbyson takes pride in hiring world-class, diverse talent and offering competitive total compensation packages. Compensation includes, but is not limited to, cash compensation through annual bonus structure, comprehensive medical benefits, employer-sponsored retirement plans, generous time off and fun cultural activities throughout the year.
Overview
Abbyson is seeking an experienced Director of Financial Planning Analysis to join our rapidly growing organization! This role is tasked with critical areas of operating the growing Supply Chain and E-Commerce Sales Operations divisions, including FP&A initiatives, project management of major business initiatives, effective communication and reporting across the organization, and implementing procedures and processes to help Abbyson run efficiently and at scale. The role is highly cross-functional involving coordination across a number of departments including New E-Commerce Customer Launches, Project Management and overall EDI support operations.
Reporting Structure
The Director of Financial Planning Analysis will work cross-functionally with Supply Chain Operations Teams and E-Commerce Sales Teams, under the guidance of the Executive Leadership. This position will report directly to the Vice President of Finance.
Core Responsibilities
Cross-functional Communication and Collaboration
Dashboard Reporting
FP&A Objectives
Business Intelligence Objectives
Project Management
Overall Supply Chain Operations & E-Commerce Sales Support
Essential Functions
Project & Process Management
Analyze quantitative & qualitative data to identify opportunities to improve our current e-commerce team operations.
Manage implementation, maintenance and improvement of projects across all digital channels.
Ideate and execute on ad-hoc initiatives, including new tools, workflows, product features, and product launches.
Identify and develop data collection strategies to support reporting on key performance indicators that directly measure e-commerce performance.
Supply Chain & Sales Operations Analysis
Understand, measure, and improve operational KPIs for the Supply Chain and E-Commerce Sales Teams.
Collaborate and support cross-functional teams including Supply Chain, Order Fulfillment, E-Commerce, EDI and IT operations.
Improve operational excellence through process root-cause analysis and execution of recommendations that create efficiencies, remove obstacles, and enhance operating productivity.
Define and manage operational and financial metrics across workflows.
Manage daily reporting including manipulating large data sets for the FP&A division while supporting other cross-functional teams.
Qualifications & Required Experience
Bachelor’s Degree required.
10+ years related experience in financial planning and analysis required.
Expert knowledge of Excel including manipulating large sets of data, VLOOKUP’s and Pivot Tables required.
Experience with Microsoft GreatPlains accounting software is a plus.
Attention to detail, time management and organizational skills.
Self-starter with high degree of problem-solving skills.
A positive attitude and is flexible and able to work as part of a team.

Title: IT Director
Description: Establishes a working relationship with other department directors and senior leaders, collaborating on new technology needs or expanded uses for existing…
Descriptions:
JOB SUMMARY:
The IT Director (ITD) is responsible for providing strategic leadership and technical expertise in overseeing AHS information technology and solution needs. ITD is also responsible for the IT department’s functions including network infrastructure and security, telecommunication and computer systems, and end-user training and support.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
1. Provides strategic and tactical planning, development, evaluation, and coordination of the information technology systems to facilitate the organization's meeting of its goals.
2. Drives the analysis and re-engineering of existing business processes, identifying and developing the capability to use new tools, reshaping the organization's infrastructure and practices, and identifying and exploiting the organization's knowledge resources.
3. Develop and execute IT security strategies that enhance and bolster the reliability and security of the IT infrastructure, systems, and projects.
4. Establishes a working relationship with other department directors and senior leaders, collaborating on new technology needs or expanded uses for existing technology to increase functionality, efficiency, and AHS staff satisfaction.
5. Responsible for HIPAA, county, state, and federal laws and policies as they apply to technology in community health centers.
6. Communicates IT plans, policies, and trends across the entire organization.
7. Oversee the planning and implementation of any required vulnerability audits, penetration tests, and forensic IT investigations; ensure outcomes of investigations improve overall IT cybersecurity across AHS.
8. Recommends the IT department budget to the Chief Deputy Administrator and ensures the function operates within fiscal guidelines.
9. Build, negotiate, and manage resource relationships with key external vendors.
10. Participates in committees and workgroups; may lead or participate in planning or focus groups; may represent the department; prepares comprehensive technical and statistical reports; maintains a variety of records and technical data.
11. Drives the solution selection process from idea to execution; Engages with executive leaders to define requirements, plan and lead implementations; Works with the chosen implementation partner to plan, staff and implement the selected solution; Develops a team to assist in implementation oversight, and sustaining solutions.
12. Provides general supervision of the IT department or function assigned; ensures the performance of direct report personnel, services, and/or technology; Conducts employee annual performance evaluations and staff supervision.
13. Confers others regarding project priorities and progress; participates in planning, progress, and design review meetings; provides technical assistance to resolve barriers to completion; negotiates contractor claims.
14. Develops, implements, and tests disaster recovery and backup procedures to enable business continuity.
15. Establishes strategies to optimize and improve operations and security functionality of existing
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Manages and ensures compliance with all IT policies, regulations, system standards, and operating procedures.
2. Manages high-level IT projects; Develops Total Cost of Ownership (TOC) and Return on Investment (ROI) analyses for proposed technology projects
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Bachelor’s degree in information systems or related and minimum 7 years of relevant information systems experience with at least five years in a leadership role providing strategic direction; or equivalent combination of a degree in progress and pertinent healthcare experience
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Healthcare background and knowledge of healthcare data privacy and security, especially in nonprofit community healthcare organizations.
2. Experience in providing strategic IT direction.
3. Experience performing analysis and/or design for specialized and complex healthcare applications that include clinical, financial, and/or administrative functionality.
4. Master’s Degree in a field appropriate for this position (MIS, IT, Computer Science, or related).
BENEFITS:
Medical, Dental, Vision premiums 100% paid by AHS
12 Vacation Days
12 Sick Days
11 Holidays and two Floating Holidays
3% 403B Employer Contributions and up to 2% Employee Match Contribution
Transportation Benefit Paid by AHS
FSA/Dependent Care Assistance
Long Term Disability

Title: Sr. Director, Digital Media Strategy and Operations
Description: Familiarity with digital media and marketing technologies and platforms, including social media, SEO, SEM, programmatic advertising, and data analytics.
Descriptions:
For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please log onto your
Internal Career Site
to apply for this job.
At Gilead we believe every employee deserves a great leader. As a people leader now or in the future, we expect that you will model and create an environment of inclusion, be intentionally focused on the hiring, development, growth and retention of talent, and empower teams to align and achieve goals.

Job Description
At Gilead, Digital Media Strategy and Operations play a critical role in U.S. digital transformation, a strategic partner to our brands, and focus on delivering a superior digital experience to our customers in the U.S. As a member of the Customer Experience, Digital and Media Strategy CoE, the Digital Media and Strategy team is the main group for developing Gilead U.S.'s digital media strategy, executing, measuring, and optimizing it with improved paid digital media quality and performance in alignment with the brand teams.
As the Sr Director, Digital Media Strategy and Operations reporting to the U.S. Head of Customer Experience, Digital, and Media Strategy, you will play a critical role in shaping and executing our U.S. Commercial digital media strategy. Your responsibilities will include leading the development, scale, delivery, measurement, and optimization of all paid media initiatives for our U.S. commercial brands while partnering with Procurement and enabling functions on media purchasing and capability design.
With your expertise in data-driven decision-making and understanding of various business perspectives, you will evaluate options and influence stakeholders to achieve optimal outcomes. Leading the U.S. Commercial Digital Media Strategy and Operations Team, you will manage people and agency relationships, coach and develop the team, and ensure organizational effectiveness.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and execute Gilead U.S.'s commercial digital media strategy, ensuring that it aligns with business goals and objectives and complies with applicable laws and regulations.
Act as the Business Partner (BP) to all Therapeutic Areas (T.A.s) and lead the development of media plans, budgets, and performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for optimizing digital media campaigns and improving ROI.
Collaborate with brand teams, cross-functional teams, and creative agencies to align digital media campaigns with business goals and objectives and oversee the development of audience targeting, media buying, and optimization strategies.
Manage relationships with media agencies, ensuring timely and compliant delivery of operational responsibilities in accordance with project milestones.
Serve as the subject matter expert for digital media best practices, internal processes, and systems related to digital media, and ensure continuous improvement on paid digital media quality.
Partner with U.S. brand marketers to understand brand strategy, tactical plans, campaign requirements, data needs, and operational support associated with their digital marketing efforts.
Project manage and deliver all operational aspects of digital media efforts assigned to the role. Ensure timely and compliant delivery of operational responsibilities in accordance with project milestones.
Foster strong cross-functional collaboration with brand marketers, Regulatory Affairs, Business Conduct, Data Privacy, Procurement, I.T. Business Engagement, and Global Digital teams.
Facilitate continued educational/training opportunities for internal marketing stakeholders and external agency teams.
Collaborate closely with the Digital Marketing Operations team on the build-out of capabilities/requirements SOPs, rollout, and training.
Establish key relationships with U.S. marketing brand teams and digital marketing operation teams.
Use expertise to identify strategic digital media opportunities and make recommendations to enhance brand awareness and growth.
Monitor and analyze digital media campaign performance data to identify trends, optimize campaigns, and make data-driven recommendations to brand teams.
Leadership Responsibilities
Lead/mentor the Digital Media Strategy and Operations team (3 direct reports) to deliver the portfolio of commercial digital media campaigns in support of therapeutic areas, working across multiple internal teams, external partners, and agencies.
Influence, collaborate, and interact effectively with multiple stakeholders at all levels across the Commercial Organization and company to align on operational objectives and provide consistent leadership and guidance to cross-functional teams managed.
Develop a team culture that emphasizes collaboration, innovation, impact, continuous improvement, employee development, and high performance.
Manage relationships and conduct overall project management with cross-functional partners: Gilead I.T., brand marketers, agencies/external vendors, and other commercial stakeholders across Commercial Operations.
Lead budget management, resource allocation, project prioritization, and scenario planning across the team.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree and Fourteen Years' Experience
OR
Masters' Degree and Twelve Years' Experience
OR
PhD and Twelve Years' Experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Biotech/Pharma experience of 14+ years; plus 3-5 years of agency experience is preferred.
Bachelor's degree in marketing or a related field minimum; MBA or other graduate degree is preferred.
Proven track record of steady career progression with increasing roles of responsibility.
Strong leadership and team management experience, including performance management and mentoring.
Project management skills, including navigating timelines, budgets, and problem-solving.
Media purchasing strategy, planning and execution experience in the U.S. market, in collaboration with Procurement and external functions.
Direct experience running marketing campaigns through a U.S. biotech/pharma regulatory review process is a plus.
Excellent strategic thinking skills with the ability to formulate, align stakeholders to, and execute strategy.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively tailor communication to a variety of groups and audiences.
Experience in working with and leading cross-functional teams and external agencies.
Demonstrated excellence in project management and proven track record of managing uniquely complex and/or multiple projects/priorities.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively navigate a matrixed organization, drive decisions and lead without direct authority when needed.
Familiarity with digital media and marketing technologies and platforms, including social media, SEO, SEM, programmatic advertising, and data analytics.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to U.S. pharmaceutical marketing, including FDA regulations and guidelines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to synthesize complex data and make strategic recommendations; provide solutions to complex and uniquely complex problems.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize competing demands and meet tight deadlines.
Operational KPIs
Digital media campaign ROI.
Campaign reach and engagement.
Conversion rate.
Ad placement accuracy.
Compliance.
Project delivery timeline.
Budget adherence.
Customer satisfaction.

The salary range for this position is: $230,860.00 - $298,760.00. Gilead considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. This position may also be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, discretionary stock-based long-term incentives (eligibility may vary based on role), paid time off, and a benefits package. Benefits include company-sponsored medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans*.
