Title: Senior Director, Marketing Operations
Description:
Manage and develop teams that specialize in automation, analytics and/or project management.
Prior experience leveraging Marketing operations / analytics /…
Descriptions:
Overview:
As the Senior Director, Marketing Operations you will govern the marketing infrastructure: technology, data, process, budget and processes to ensure the marketing functions work efficiently and collaboratively. Your big goal is to maximize the return of the marketing investment. You will work with your peer group (Marketing Leadership team) that own various specialties in Marketing and with the Marketing Executive Team to create a 360 degree view of our performance – from planning through results. Because we are an integrated marketing team, marketing operations is a force multiplier – your team is here to provide data to support proper planning, insights to adjust in execution and analysis to provide a complete picture of our results.
Responsibilities:
Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Manage teams that specialize in Automation, Analytics and Project Management – both execution/production and the strategic use of technology to support objectives
Develop and implement scalable marketing automation processes and integrated systems, providing a means for highly effective measurement, recommendations, trend reporting and accurate forecasting.
Govern and optimize the Marketing/Sales Funnel; partnering closely with Sales and Marketing leadership to build and sustain a scalable funnel, aligned to business need.
Partner with Marketing + Sales leadership and Finance / Strategy Operations to develop and execute on strategic initiatives, such as: campaign effectiveness, identify segments and audiences with biggest potential, lead scoring for SDR prioritization, lifecycle nurture effectiveness, increase stick rates for booked meetings, etc
Manage and develop teams that specialize in automation, analytics and/or project management
Maximize third party and/or agency resources to load balance, accelerate Marketo/tech maturity of the organization and identify projects centered around elevating tech to increase knowledge/intelligence to drive strategy
Qualifications:
To be considered for and to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Qualifications include:
7+years’ experience in Marketing Analytics / Operations; 5+ years in leading and managing a scaled and multifaceted team.
Proven experience leading a Marketing Operations / Analytics organization with direct involvement supporting marketing + sales strategy, and campaign performance management.
Google Analytics certification, HubSpot/Marketo experience, Leading and trailing trend analysis, channel forecasting, Salesforce certified and expert, data analysis and visualization expert.
Prior experience leveraging Marketing operations / analytics / services teams (e.g. IT, SFDC, BI, etc.) to scale and achieve goals
Strong analytical skills and ability to identify early signals/trends and quickly solution set / problem solve.
Exceptionally strong communication skills, including experience effectively communicating with executive leadership
Highly accountable self-starter that is able to work with little direct supervision.
A desire to work in a high growth and results-oriented team environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of and passion for marketing concepts, methods and techniques

Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability

Title: Director – Program Controls and Analytics
Description: With an emphasis on data analytics (data science) and innovation, leads change to processes, products, services, software, and hardware improving and adding…
Descriptions:
Employee-owned Kitchell seeks experienced and dedicated Director – Program Controls and Analytics to join our Northern California region in Sacramento and build a long-term career at one of the most innovative and growth-oriented Construction Services companies in the United States.

Overview
Through engagement with operational business leaders develops project control standards encompassing the methodical processes and discipline to support Kitchell’s project, and construction management consulting services division. With an emphasis on data analytics (data science) and innovation, leads change to processes, products, services, software, and hardware improving and adding value through efficiency and accuracy. Uses business data and statistical methods to provide insight into business performance and recommends areas and methods for improving operations.

Collaborate with internal departments to develop comprehensive processes and procedures for project execution and controls. Document, create templates, automate for consistent application, conduct lessons learned, and continuously improve to ensure alignment of company goals as set by senior management. Provide strategies, vision, and leadership for out-of-the-box solutions to support the operational teams in delivering an exceptional experience and value for both internal and external clients. Lead change for processes and procedures by developing and communicating new ideas, comprising all stages of the thought cycle from innovation to development through actualization.

Responsibilities
Through the application of scheduling, estimating, and project controls platforms, develops the ability to aggregate data and provides interactive interfaces, such as Power BI, for project teams to proactively identify and manage risk.
Engages with business leaders and users to understand how changes to process, products, services, software and hardware can improve efficiencies and add value.
Maintains well documented and high-quality standards, understands key process issues and ensures implementation of process improvements.
Must have the ability to manage multiple projects of varied complexity and work with teams of stakeholders to prioritize needs, ensuring all are satisfied with resulting products.
Proactive and competent in relaying information and instructing users on how best to interact with new and updated processes or applications they may not have familiarity with.
Lead and/or support the training of project staff on project controls on an ongoing basis and as required.
Contribute to business development efforts for assigned projects including the preparation of interview/RFQ response materials and presentations for new work.
Develop standard operating procedures and best practices including written protocols and guidance to the controls team, stakeholders, clients and end-users.
Develops standards and templates, building a library of program and project management tools and online systems.
Collaborates with all regions assisting in the implementation of cloud-based program and project management systems for new and prospective clients including the development and implementation of Dashboards.
Develops and implements company-wide training programs for program and project management teams.
Sets expectations and measurements of success (KPIs) for program and project management teams.
Manages scheduling and estimating departments for supporting internal and external clients.
Other duties as assigned
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, construction management or related field, or equivalent experience.
10 or more years of progressive and position related work experience in construction management and project controls management with experience managing high performance teams of five or more employees.
Successfully directed the work and managed financials of at least 3 substantial projects or programs simultaneously.
A Certified Construction Manager (CCM) credential is preferred.
Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or Program Management Professional (PgMP) credential is preferred.

Knowledge and Skills
Effective computer skills and proficient knowledge of project controls and scheduling platforms, as well as data interface platforms such as Procore, SharePoint, and Power BI is required.
Knowledge of the construction management, architectural and engineering industry including current conditions and industry network is required.
Effective verbal and written communication skills, including the advanced ability to foster and maintain effective interpersonal relationships.
Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality is required.
Ability to demonstrate and model the competencies of communication, conflict resolution and building teamwork.
Commitment to the values of Kitchell with attention to honesty and integrity, quality of work, customer satisfaction, people development, profitability and managing change is required.

Work Environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently inspects the project and may be exposed to ongoing construction and various weather conditions, while wearing personal protective equipment. The noise level in the work environment may range from moderate to loud. The worker is subject to both environmental conditions due to work activities occurring both inside and outside.

Physical Requirements
While performing the duties of this job, the position is moderately active and the employee is frequently standing, walking, reaching, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing. The position also may also be sitting for long periods of time. The employee may frequently lift and/or move items up to 50 pounds

Travel Requirement
Travel may be required more than 50% of the time. Valid Motor Vehicle Record with no restrictions or suspensions. Ability to drive a motorized vehicle is needed.

ABOUT OUR COMPANY
Kitchell is an employee-owned company founded in 1950. We provide general contracting, construction management, development, facilities management, engineering and architecture and myriad other services within the built environment. Our employee-owners manage projects from main offices in Arizona, California, and Texas. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that fosters personal and professional growth with in-house education programs, formal and informal mentoring, and cross-training opportunities. We prefer to grow from within, building careers and financial stability through long-term ownership. We are consistently ranked among the top places to work, attributable to our tenured staff and outstanding benefits including profit sharing, discretionary stock options, incentive bonuses, health and life insurance, health savings accounts (HSA) with wellness incentives, 401(k), college savings plans, business travel assistance and insurance, discounted auto and homeowner’s insurance, identity theft protection, rewards programs and much more.

Kitchell is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

The annual base salary range for this role is currently $165,000 - $180,000. The Company’s salary ranges are determined by role, level, location, and alignment with market data. Individual pay is determined through interviews and an assessment of various factors, including job-related skills, relevant education and experience, abilities of the applicant and equity with other team members. The annual base salary range listed here is subject to change at any time, in the Company’s discretion, and does not alter in any way the at-will nature of the employment relationship.

Title: Sr Director Qual Engineering
Location: Hybrid remote in El Segundo, CA 90245
Description:
We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play.
This role requires a leader who sets high standards for…
Descriptions:
CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.

The Opportunity:
Mattel is currently seeking a Senior Director of Quality Engineering, supporting our Mattel Brands including American Girl. Our environment is fast-paced, driven, pragmatic, and results-oriented. This role requires a leader who sets high standards for personal and team performance, moves quickly to assess the current situation, makes recommendations to executive leadership, and implements changes to support the business. Exceptional leadership and communications skills, and the ability to work cross-functionally, are key success factors for this role. Quality Engineering and Design Assurance principles are fundamental needs for the role. Additional experience in either Drones, Remote Control Vehicles, Digital Gaming, and the Toy industry is also a key factor for success in this role.
What Your Impact Will Be:
Own and drive the strategic vision and the technologies required to ensure industry-leading quality
Provide subject expertise on design and quality principles, software quality assurance, reliability and safety engineering, human factors and useability, and CAPA.
A solid understanding of electronics (drones, remote control vehicles, toy-robotics, etc.) and software quality assurance (digital games, metaverse, Web3 etc.)
Represent our QE practices and strategy in customer conversations and other stakeholder conversations
Lead (and recruit as needed) QE staff to deliver on business needs and strategic vision
Recommend tools and technologies to improve automation and regression testing; verification and validation, execute plans to modernize and scale with new solutions and innovative tools/approaches
Lead the implementation and rollout of QE processes and metrics, aligning them with business/customer needs and fast-paced company dynamic
Define key measurements/metrics to quantify and benchmark QE effectiveness, adjusting processes for continuous improvement
Establish strong working relationships with Product Development, Commercial Teams, and the Support organization to ensure quality is measured and maintained once product reaches production
Align with Product Management to understand business needs and ensure quality is cemented early in the product development life cycle
Serve as a subject matter expert in processes and methodologies with the ability to adapt and improvise in different situations
Partner with development managers to provide guidance using agile methodologies such as Test-Driven Development, Behavior Driven Development, etc. and other Agile techniques
Work side by side with engineering leaders to enforce manufacturability, testing efficiency and productivity, and ensure performance testing and security testing practices and methodologies

What We’re Looking For:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field preferred.
15+ years of experience leading quality engineering initiatives from product ideation to commercialization
Driven, and results-oriented with exceptional communications skills to influence and connect at an executive level
Demonstrated ability to define and implement design disciplines and test strategies that encompasses predictability, resources, cost, maturity, and time
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements with modern/industry-leading Test Automation Tools
Experience with a broad set of testing and analysis tools
Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Experience with leading globally distributed QA team
Ability to clearly convey deep technical concerns to a non-technical audience
Able to connect and articulate the links between technical capability and business need
Strong self-starter, strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines across a broad portfolio of projects
Ability to manage complex problems that cross departmental boundaries to resolve issues
Knowledge of the Identity Governance domain is a plus.

Don’t meet every single requirement? At Mattel we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

What It’s Like to Work Here:

We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors:
We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower.
We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking.
We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.
Our Approach to Hybrid Work
We embrace a hybrid work model to empower a culture of growth, optimism, and wellbeing, where everyone can deliver on our shared purpose and realize their full potential. Combining purposeful in-person collaboration with tech-enabled hybrid work, our focus is to provide flexibility while enabling collaboration for moments that matter.
Who We Are:
Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.
Mattel is recognized for the second year in a row as a Great Place to Work™ and as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators in 2022.

Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.

Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

Title: Director, Financial Planning and Analysis, Medical Financial Operations
Description: This includes directing and overseeing operational and financial reporting, analysis and consultation to drive organizational strategic goals; ensuring resource…
Descriptions:
Job Summary:


In addition to the responsibilities listed below, this director level position is also responsible for directing a team or teams of subject matter experts, operational consultants, and finance leaders with portfolios of medical center administrative, ancillary, inpatient, primary and/or specialty care departments. This includes directing and overseeing operational and financial reporting, analysis and consultation to drive organizational strategic goals; ensuring resource allocation support including business case development; and leveraging partnerships with senior clinical and/or administrative leadership across medical centers and/or portfolios to consistently drive operational excellence through influence, analysis, interpretation and data validation. This position is required to maintain and leverage a comprehensive understanding of health care operations and KPs integrated health care model at the clinical level. This may include interpreting large volumes of complex data (e.g., medical records, financials, etc.); ensuring detailed operational data is used to evaluate performance improvement initiatives; directing research efforts and business case development in partnership with senior department leaders. Finally, this position is also responsible for leveraging a breadth of operational knowledge to assess and evaluate department operations and workflows. This includes ensuring opportunities are identified to optimize efficiencies in regard to appointment supply and demand; applying data modeling concepts to financial and non-financial scenarios; and overseeing the development complex staffing models used for department and medical center operations.

Essential Responsibilities:


Prepares individuals for growth opportunities and advancement; builds internal collaborative networks for self and others. Solicits and acts on performance feedback; drives collaboration to set goals and provide open feedback and coaching to foster performance improvement. Demonstrates continuous learning; oversees the recruitment, selection, and development of talent; ensures performance management guidelines and expectations to achieve business needs. Stays up to date with organizational best practices, processes, benchmarks, and industry trends; shares best practices within and across teams. Motivates and empowers teams; maintains a highly skilled and engaged workforce by aligning resource plans with business objectives. Provides guidance when difficult decisions need to be made; creates opportunities for expanded scope of decision making and impact.
Oversees the operation of multiple units within a department by identifying member and operational needs; ensures the management of work assignment completion; translates business strategy into actionable business requirements; ensures products and/or services meet member requirements and expectations while aligning with organizational strategies. Gains cross-functional support for business plans and priorities; assumes responsibility for decision making; sets standards, measures progress, and fosters resolution of escalated issues. Communicates goals and objectives; analyzes resources, costs, and forecasts and incorporates them into business plans; prioritizes and distributes resources. Removes obstacles that impact performance; guides performance and develops contingency plans accordingly; ensures teams accomplish business objectives.
Directs internal audit process, reviews audit results, and engages with auditors to resolve complex issues, implement changes to internal controls and proactively assess high risk areas.
Ensures budgets and/or forecasts are developed in accordance with business strategic initiatives by overseeing budgeting trends; directing budget and forecasting; and overseeing development of department/regional budgets.
Advises region/business unit leaders on strategic fiscal matters by overseeing regular and special reports for both financial and statistical matters in order to facilitate financial management throughout the organization; leading regular meetings with leadership to review financial results for their areas; and overseeing advice given to the Kaiser Senior Management team on reading and interpreting financial results, analyzing variances, and improving performance.
Directs financial modeling by overseeing development and application of models; driving the optimization of risk alternatives; and overseeing development of what-if scenarios and forecasts.
Directs the business vision, objectives, and strategic initiatives by reviewing financial impact.
Directs costing activities by overseeing identification of cost avoidance and cost recovery opportunities and application of adequate solutions.
Oversees performance/operations/financial state by directing the use of templates (e.g., cash flow, RFA process, weekly unit case report) and computer applications; making decisions based on financial analyses and results (e.g., operating cash flow analyses, pro forma P&L, line item walk forwards, volume building blocks, NPV, IRR, Discounted Cash Flow, statistical analyses, economic analyses); and monitoring variance analysis and results (e.g., volume, P&L line item, cost of goods, rate).
Oversees reports of region/business unit financial information by directing use of financial trends, data analysis reports, and forecasts of income and expense; providing recommendations; monitoring assets, liabilities, revenues, and expenses; and directing the use of data/inputs from region/business unit systems to support analyses (e.g., membership and utilization reports, volume reporting, day sales inventory, analysis spreadsheets, investment schedules).
Ensures field operations are supported by overseeing their operational/financial performance; identifying areas of improvement and recommending complex solutions.
Directs Financial Statement Analysis of business partners (e.g., suppliers, customers, co-packers, acquisition targets) by overseeing information reported from software systems (Internet, Bloomberg, and D&B), annual reports, and/or interviews; ensuring that the financial status (viability) of business partners is adequate; and monitoring risk implications.
Drives financial performance by reviewing financial trends and results; and advises senior leadership on ways to improve performance.
Leads strategic financial planning by overseeing reporting of financial, utilization, and benchmark data.
Leads strategic financial planning by directing financial plans, acquisition activity, financial requirements, and operating forecasts; and driving development of financial concepts for financial planning and control.

Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum (6) years finance experience managing a portfolio of departments, business lines, and/or functional/service areas.
Minimum four (4) years supervisory experience.
Minimum three (3) years experience managing operational or project budgets.
Bachelors degree in finance, business, or related field and Minimum ten (10) years Financial Planning & Analysis experience, or directly related business experience. Additional equivalent work experience in a directly related field may be substituted for the degree requirement.

Preferred Qualifications:
Six (6) years finance experience working in a medical center or clinical setting.
Six (6) years experience consulting or working directly with clinical health care leadership.
Three (3) years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with executive leadership (e.g., Vice President level and above).
Five (5) years health care experience.
Five (5) years FP&A experience working for a health care organization.
Three (3) years construction and maintenance finance experience.
Masters degree finance, business, or related field.
Certified Public Accountant (CPA).
FP&A Certification.

Title: cxLoyalty Director, Knowledge Management
Description:
Provide relevant analytics, coaching, training, and support to champion a knowledge management culture.
The KM Lead will be a key asset to the Chase Travel…
Descriptions:
Job Summary: You will play a critical role in building and implanting knowledge management solutions and systems. The KM Lead will be a key asset to the Chase Travel serving as an in-house expert that will enable efficient and effective knowledge sharing across the business. where you will be accountable for organization-wide execution, stewardship, and improvement of the Chase Travel Knowledge Management Framework and its business process landscape.

Job Responsibilities:
Build a knowledge management function from the ground up, including scope, design, implementation, and maintenance as well building the team to grow the function.
Identify information needs; assess and fill knowledge gaps by soliciting and collecting high value, quality content.
Collaborate with leadership and staff to source, inventory, index and tag all current existing content.
Develop an approach for gathering content and creating a taxonomy for content and processes to collect and empower staff to leverage content.
Validate that the right explicit and/or tacit knowledge goes to the right people, and that this information is promptly applied to business activities.
Help capture new knowledge with the usage of a knowledge management system is fundamental to this position and monitoring progress by keeping track of engagement, value achievement, and other metrics.
Provide relevant analytics, coaching, training, and support to champion a knowledge management culture.
Support the education and training of our support team, from junior to the most senior practitioners, on how to leverage and contribute to KM to strengthen our business offerings.
Develop and implement project management capabilities to support the development and ongoing maintenance of KM repository.

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
6-10 years of experience in Knowledge Management
Proven experience bringing process improvement to a function or role.
An energetic leader with excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and a go-getter drive
Excellent analytical abilities and organizational skills
Provide ability to serve as a thought partner to the business leadership.
Interest and experience in building and leading an offshore team virtually.
Self-motivated and self-sufficient.
Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.
As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Title: Director of Finance
Description: Leverage data analytics, financial modeling, and problem-solving tools to empower other members of the leadership team through financial fluency to inspire…
Descriptions:
Description:
Company Profile:
Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning product manufacturing; distribution primarily in the United States with some Canadian presence.
Company Summary:
Managed through Riverbend Industries, Williams designs, markets, and manufactures quality heating, ventilation, and air conditioning products for residential and business applications. Beginning with gas furnaces in the early, 1900s, Williams has grown to dominate the gravity wall furnace market. The company acquired Hydro-Aire/LANCO, a major manufacturer of fan coils and air handlers, in 1986. As a result, Williams now offers more fan coil sizes and configurations than any other HVAC company in all of the United States; the product line was expanded in 1996 to include room console heaters.
Position Summary:
The Director of Finance is the senior finance and accounting leader within the Williams organization. Serving on the company’s senior leadership team, his person is responsible for all aspects of the Finance function to include budget setting, forecasting, strategic planning, financial reporting & analysis, compliance, risk management, and accounts payable/accounts receivable. This person will play a vital role in partnering with business unit leadership to formulate and execute the company’s strategic goals while providing all functions across the business the daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial data necessary to meet and exceed commercial, manufacturing, and human capital goals set by management. This person is a prime champion in motivating all levels of the organization to use good financial data rather than anecdotal evidence or “best guesses” to run the business. In addition, the Director will serve as a key business partner in owning and directing assorted projects related to Finance, continuous improvement, organizational optimization, and other critical business priorities.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead by example with a Safety First mindset in every task
Co-own the formulation, review, execution, and refinement of the business’s short- and long-term strategies through comprehensive mastery and utilization of financial, commercial, and operational knowledge
Leverage data analytics, financial modeling, and problem-solving tools to empower other members of the leadership team through financial fluency to inspire better business decisions and drive better business outcomes
Support the commercial aspects of the business to include product margin analysis, pricing analysis, make vs. buy decisions, product/asset rationalization, working capital management, capital projects, contractual arrangements, negotiations, etc.
Lead the budgeting and planning function to include consolidated roll-up of profit & loss statement, balance sheet, cash flow, capital spending, etc.
Lead Finance team to ensure:
o Timely and accurate month-end and quarter-end close processes
o Effective and efficient quarterly and year-end external audits
o Local policy alignment and adherence in line with portfolio standards
o Compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations
Develop and validate cost accounting methods, set standards, review BOMs, set backflush points, etc.
Direct preparation of financial analysis and variance reporting (e.g., current versus prior year and budget) to include meeting with portfolio leadership to discuss and review
Support selection, implementation, and organizational embrace of a new enterprise resource planning (ERP) system and serve as the main ERP champion by understanding and demonstrating its impact to the financial and operational performance
Oversee timely and accurate delivery of financial reports to include reviewing for appropriateness and accuracy while driving continual improvement of submission quality and a shortened close timeline
Possess direct responsibility for all facets of accounting and financial reporting
Analyze, consolidate, and direct all cost accounting procedures together with statistical and routine reports
Co-lead financial review meetings with portfolio leadership and stakeholders to include the Chief Financial Officer
Collaborate with portfolio leadership, including Information Technology, to continuously drive improvements in financial reporting processes
Lead simplification of the administrative tasks of the team such as payables and receivables management, reporting & consolidation, and general business processes Oversee preparation and review of monthly operating financial statements compared to forecasts and budget
Assist with due diligence, local special projects, and portfolio assignments as needed
Other duties as required by local or portfolio leadership
Requirements:
Education, Experience & Qualifications:
Minimum
o Bachelor of Arts/Science in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration
o At least ten years relevant finance experience in a substantially similar industry
o At least five years in a finance/accounting management role to include managing a team in a matrix organization
o At least three years cost accounting experience for a manufacturing firm
Preferred
o Master of Business Administration with a relevant concentration
o Current or recently lapse credentials as Certified Public Accountant
o Fifteen or more years relevant finance experience in discrete manufacturing
o Fifteen or more years relevant finance experience support multiple P&Ls
o Ten or more years managing a finance/accounting team within a portfolio of companies
Skills & Characteristics:
Comprehensive knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) to ensure financial statements, budgeting & forecasting, and internal controls are compliant with industry, company, and portfolio standards
Strong data analytical skills to include financial modeling and forecasting
Mastery of digital financial tools such as PowerBI, data warehouses, and financial consolidation tools
Ability to identify and articulate problems, collect data, recognize and communicate facts, and draw valid conclusions which drive business decisions and positive outcomes
Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and effectively manage in the face of multiple abstract and concrete variables
Mastery of articulating complex financial data in a manner than non-financial professional can understand, digest, and integrate into their wheelhouses
Comfort with reviewing for fit, selecting, implementing, and managing a comprehensive ERP
Excellent written, verbal, communication, and good interpersonal skills
Advanced user in Microsoft Office applications to include Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint, and Teams
o Strong abilities using XLOOKUP, pivot tables, and other spreadsheet functionality to manipulate, analyze, and take action on financial data
Competency Statements:
Accountability & Dependability – Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and achieves results with little oversight.
Adaptability & Flexibility – Adapts to changing business needs, conditions, and work responsibilities
Analysis/Reasoning – Examines data to grasp issues, draw conclusions, and solve problems.
Attention to Detail – Diligently attends to details and pursues quality in accomplishing tasks.
Business Alignment – Aligns the direction, products, services, and performance of a business line with the rest of the organization.
Fiscal Accountability – Follows fiscal guidelines, regulations, principles, and standards when committing fiscal resources or processing financial transactions.
Influencing Others – Influences others to be excited and committed to furthering the organization’s objectives.
Managing Projects or Programs – Structures and directs others’ work on projects or programs.
Mathematical Reasoning – Uses mathematical techniques to calculate data or solve practical problems.
Problem Solving - Resolves difficult or complicated challenges
Providing Consultation – Partners with clients to identify and resolve complex or sensitive issues.
Researching Information – Identifies, collects, and organizes data for analysis and decision-making.
Strategic Vision – Sees the big, long-range picture.
Stress Tolerance – Maintains composure in highly stressful or adverse situations.

Title: Director of Infrastructure (1070): Department of Technology
Description:
Alongside the District’s strategic plan, Transform Learning.
As a CORE district, SFUSD is also a leader in critical systems change for more comprehensive school…
Descriptions:
About
Job Class: 1070 IS Project Director
Salary Range: $127,301.36-$173,261.16/annually
Appointment Type: Permanent Exempt (what does this mean?)
Hours: Full Time
Who We Are
The San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, serving more than 57,000 students who speak more than 44 documented languages across 132 schools in the city of San Francisco every year. We aim for every student who attends SFUSD schools to discover his or her spark, along with a strong sense of self and purpose, and that all students graduate from high school ready for college and career, and equipped with the skills, capacities and dispositions outlined in SFUSD’s Graduate Profile. Every day in our quest to achieve this mission we provide each and every student the quality instruction and equitable support required to thrive in the 21st century.
What It Means to Work Here
The SFUSD community is unified by our Core Values:

Student-centered: We put students’ needs first
Fearless: We persist through challenges
United: We celebrate and build on each other’s strengths
Social Justice: We stand with those most vulnerable in our community
Diversity-driven: We respect and seek to understand each person

We are also inspired by Vision 2025, which captures our aspirations and vision for the future of public education in San Francisco. Alongside the District’s strategic plan, Transform Learning. Transform Lives. SFUSD is reimagining how public education will change over the next decade to meet the dynamic future of San Francisco. As a CORE district, SFUSD is also a leader in critical systems change for more comprehensive school accountability and innovations that help strengthen the instructional core, which is the foundation of our strategic plan and Vision 2025.
Who We Want
We want talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission steeped in equity, and who are motivated to unleash our children’s potential. We want people who are strong collaborators, skilled communicators, problem solvers, and who are comfortable in a community of continuous learning.

As the Director of Infrastructure for the Information Technology Department, you will serve as a senior staff member responsible for managing strategic projects and work streams, participating in planning and priority setting, and providing implementation support for key organizational initiatives to ensure their success. Under general direction, the Director of Infrastructure leads a team to ensure that the SFUSD’s network, server, and telecom infrastructure and services are always accessible, reliable, flexible, and secure. The infrastructure program provides robust access to technology for the SFUSD community in order to meet the teaching, learning, and operational needs of the district.

According to Civil Service Commission Rule 109, the duties specified below are representative of the range of duties assigned to this job code/class and are not intended to be an inclusive list.
Essential Duties Will Include:
Lead the design, implementation, and management of the district’s networks (WAN/LAN/WLAN, Intranet, Internet), server, and telecommunication infrastructure, including security, proactive monitoring/analysis, maintenance/troubleshooting, and documentation of these systems.
Manage short- and long-term projects, including Cyber Security initiatives, system migrations, and network and data center modernization projects.
Supervises SFUSD network infrastructure staff and operations; conducts technical assessments, designs, implementations and reviews, staff performance planning, evaluations, allocates and confirms task completion by the assigned staff
Engineer and design solutions for complex technology infrastructure challenges through detailed analysis, including automating network, server, and telecom administration tasks through the creation and maintenance of scripts and tools
Guide, implement, and manage security technologies, content filtering, adaptive access, and threat detection & response
Monitor, coordinate and assist in developing the work unit's budget as well as projections in collaboration with our Bond department on proposed initiatives.
Analyzes and recommends procedures consistent with departmental directives, policies, and regulations
Develops strategic plans to meet technology infrastructure needs; conducts capacity planning studies to project hardware and software needs
Supervise, assign, review and participate in the work of subordinates in the assigned unit
Provide and manage 24x7 support and diagnostics for large-scale network, server, and telecom events
Plans, develops, and implements backup and disaster recovery procedures
Other duties as assigned
Who We Want Continued
The Strongest Candidate Will Have:

Certification in one or more of the following areas: Cisco CCIE, Cisco CCNP
Experience with large-scale, multi-campus, dense wireless management and improvement,
Experience with enterprise-level network and server environments and associated technology
Ability to improve our network and server maintenance and monitoring tools to expedite our response time
Experience with Active Directory and Windows Server environments.
Knowledge of VoIP technologies and best practices
Experience with cloud migrations, and Cloud offerings including Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc.
Experience working in education and familiar with the related regulatory environments, C.I.P.A, E-Rate, etc.
Substantial background in troubleshooting and root cause analysis
Demonstrated ability to stay abreast of current technologies (access control, routing, switching, content filtering, wireless, data center, VoIP, security etc.)
Ability to work collaboratively and use technical skills and experience to determine the best, and cost-effective strategic direction for the SFUSD’s Infrastructure
Ability to initiate, drive, and/or support innovation and change
Ability to provide outstanding customer service to our external and internal customers
Ability to support a positive, professional, collaborative, and goal-oriented environment which includes working to improve morale
Experience with bond-funded technology modernization projects.
Strong project management, time management, and organizational skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Minimum Qualifications
Experience: Seven (7) years of experience in system administration, information systems development, maintenance and support, or information technology project management, including two (2) years of supervisory experience

Substitution: Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION:
Essential duties require the following physical skills and work requirements: May require sufficient strength and coordination for lifting, pushing, pulling and/or carrying the weight of computer equipment. Requires bending, stooping and/or crawling in order to install or repair computer or printer cables. Requires hand/eye coordination for semi-skilled movements, such as taking apart casings, installing parts and reconnecting computers, and keyboard use. Involves extensive VDT exposure.

This is not a remote or work-from-home position and requires on-site work in San Francisco, California.

What We Offer
SFUSD offers a competitive salary of $127,301.36-$173,261.16/annually commensurate with experience in a similar position. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan including dental and vision plans, a defined benefit pension plan, disability, life insurance, flexible spending account options and vacation time. We also offer an inclusive and equity-centered environment where we encourage staff to bring their whole selves to work.

Title: Director of Data Engineering
Description: Act as the Technical Product Owner and partner with Business Product Owners to define the technical strategy and solutions for our data and analytics products.
Descriptions:
Juvo+ (Juvo Plus, Inc.) is a leading developer and marketer of consumer products across eighteen brands, working with the largest marketplaces and retailers in the world. We create products that transform houses to homes, that celebrate the big and little moments in life, and that make everyday things more manageable. We constantly apply Retail Science™, our in-house approach to leveraging data, applying machine learning tools, and next-gen processes to continually expand our catalog, delighting our customers and swiftly moving to meet our mission of having at least one of our products in every home.
We're committed to building upon our success through the selection and development of outstanding people, with the understanding that as we grow, you grow. From top to bottom, our team fosters a collaborative environment where we drive results, optimize our efforts, and achieve amazing things – while having a great time and celebrating our successes along the way!
ABOUT THE POSITION:
We are looking for an experienced Director of Data Engineering who has demonstrated success in building and deploying a modern scalable data platform that enables both power and end users to effectively answer business questions, test hypotheses, and leverage the visualization layer without needing to be a SQL or schema expert.
In partnership with the cross-functional business owners, you will be responsible for owning data environments, integrating with new technologies, and overseeing the development of new processes that support teams across the global organization, to scale our capabilities in concert with the growth of the business and needs of our customers.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Act as the Technical Product Owner and partner with Business Product Owners to define the technical strategy and solutions for our data and analytics products. Own and define roadmaps, drive end-to-end execution of related technology projects, and drive operational excellence initiatives.
Responsible for enterprise-level center of excellence (CoE) best practices in standards, guidelines, principles & frameworks on data architecture, data engineering, and data analytics solutions for an ecommerce (I.e., supply chain, inventory, customer, marketing, and product) data planes.
Design and implement full data solutions which cover migration, change management, day-to-day execution
Create conceptual data models for business process improvements & data architecture
Collaborate and communicate effectively with Product, QA, Data and DevOps teams to release projects on time with high quality output.
Grow, lead, and mentor a team of global engineers and guide team to transform business requirements into technical architectures/specifications.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline. Additional professional work experience can be substituted on a year for year basis in lieu of a bachelor's degree.
8+ years of experience designing and building with the track record of building and delivering mission critical, production software systems.
5+ years leading global data/engineering teams and providing executive business insights & roadmaps.
A result-oriented data champion supporting strategic business initiatives, prioritizing key projects based on ROI, and promoting strong Data Governance.
Demonstrated experience mentoring data teams nurturing organizational data management culture.
Experience in ecommerce/retail environments with demonstrated understanding of key data elements, metrics, and requirements within the ecommerce/retail space (i.e., understands inventory, orders, segmentation, SEO/SEM, conversion).
Experience simplifying both processes and technical implementations.
Passionate about technology, sense of ownership with good team spirit under fast paced working environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English), strong business acumen, and an innate drive to deliver results.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Linux Environments.
REST Architecture, service-oriented architecture.
SQL, multi dimension data modeling, and ETL technologies
Amazon Web Services. Lambda, S3, EC2 (or similar cloud) environments.
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language, Python is preferred. Practical experience with a range of ML technologies is a plus.
NOTICE TO US APPLICANTS:

This job posting and the associated job description in no way states or implies that the duties and responsibilities listed herein are the only tasks to be performed by the incumbent employee in this job. Additionally, the benefits and perks outlined are provided at the sole discretion of Juvo Plus, Inc., and are subject to change with or without notice, unless otherwise provided or protected by law.
NOTICE TO CA APPLICANTS:
The compensation range for this position is USD $192,400.00 to $307,840 (PG16). However, our anticipated hiring range for this position is USD $192,400.00 to $250,120.00. Additionally, this role is eligible for incentive compensation above and beyond the range noted through participation in our Success Sharing Leadership Bonus Plan. Actual compensation will be based on a candidate's experience, education, final employment location, and alignment with the defined expectations and qualifications for the position.

We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law. Title: Director, Cloud Services
Location: Irvine, CA 92618 (Irvine Health and Science Complex area)
Description: The Director, Cloud Services will be responsible for running and continuing to build an organization that will balance the needs of Cloud Architecture, Cloud…
Descriptions:
Auction.com is the nation’s leading online real estate marketplace focused exclusively on the sale of residential bank-owned and foreclosure properties via online auctions and live trustee sale events. By offering access to exclusive properties and technology designed to seamlessly connect buyers and sellers, Auction.com empowers residential real estate investors and financial institutions to achieve optimal, mutually beneficial results – to go beyond the bid.

The Director, Cloud Services will be responsible for running and continuing to build an organization that will balance the needs of Cloud Architecture, Cloud Engineering, Cloud Governance, and Site Reliability Engineering. The ideal candidate will develop a strategic vision, strategy, and roadmap that guides the consumption of Cloud whether it be single or multi-tenant Cloud, IaaS, PaaS, Container as a Service, or Software as a Service in accordance with company standards, security architectures, and operational frameworks. The successful candidate will contribute to industry best practices and emerging technologies to support continuous improvement.
You will help oversee the operation of a complex global infrastructure with a wide range of responsibilities, whether it be improving our automation or monitoring systems, improving our delivery tooling, consulting with business partners on technical designs and operational best-practices, championing Cloud engineering, managing vendors and their associated costs, leading technical projects or partnering with architects and senior engineers to align on current and future strategy including security, cost, tools and platform selection.
In this role you will be a key figure and contributor to our Cloud journey and efforts to become a more efficient organization. The ideal candidate will have experience in migrations to and the ongoing globally dispersed operations of large-scale enterprise environments in the Cloud. He/she should have experience in delivering 99.99+% uptime.
Aside from having a strong technical background, the right candidate will have proven experience influencing the short term and long-term strategic direction and leading organizational transformation necessary to achieve greater velocity.
In this role you will
Provide thought leadership on our global cloud utilization and expertise on public cloud best practices and emerging trends
Provide a strong perspective that drives change and helps motivate Delivery teams to adopt technology and methodologies that drive towards simple, scalable, and cost-efficient solutions to difficult and complex problems
Bring a service-oriented approach, thinking about how your teams’ work makes our engineers’ lives easier.
Lead the design and build out of new infrastructure as code, applications, and services in Cloud
Manage alignment between Cloud Architecture, Cloud Engineering, Site Reliability Engineering and Product Delivery/Engineering teams to deliver the best outcomes.
Drive a Cloud excellence culture throughout the company with the simplification, automation, analysis, and evolution of our activities and processes.
Provide tooling, practices, documentation, automation and coaching so that it becomes easier for Delivery teams to build, test, ship and operate new or existing site features
Champion security and operational best practices while providing support to Delivery/Engineering teams with AWS services and liaison with the AWS support organization to facilitate resolution to complex problems
Provide guardrails for operating in AWS at scale, such as tagging policy management and enforcement mechanisms
Work closely with our Operations, Product Delivery, and Finance teams, to ensure we maintain our Cloud cost spend and environment stability through data analysis, consulting, accurate documentation, and creative problem-solving
Provide Cloud spend analysis and forecasts, while simultaneously driving optimization recommendations throughout the Technology organization.
Ensure the health of company services in meeting defined service level expectations
Participate in on-call rotations, including coordinating, and leading production troubleshooting efforts
Participate in incident management and communications, including follow-up with problem resolution post-mortem, and process improvements
Contribute to best practices with written documentation and in person coaching
Possess the ability to balance big-picture vision with an approach that is always process-oriented with detailed execution
Perform other duties and projects as assigned
You’ve got what it takes if you have
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent experience
4+ years of strong technical and people leadership at a Manager, Director or Senior Director level at a high growth, Cloud oriented company
8+ years of experience in senior global infrastructure roles, including experience in Cloud Services, Software Engineering, DevOps, SRE, Systems (compute/virtualization/storage) teams
4+ years of experience operating significant production workloads in a Cloud environment, specifically using AWS
Experience with best in breed systems and tooling such as, Datadog, New Relic, and Cloud Health
Strong technical acumen in areas of Engineering and Cloud Services (SDLC, change management, disaster recovery, and site reliability)

Title: Data Science Sr Director
Description:
Juniper’s enterprise business is looking for a Data Science lead to lead the Marvis data science team.
This role will be responsible for working with customers…
Descriptions:
Mist, a Juniper Company, is the first vendor to bring enterprise-grade Wi-Fi, BLE, and IoT together through a highly scalable cloud architecture. On top of this real-time cloud stack, we are building the first AI-empowered platform to troubleshoot and manage networks on par with human network domain experts. Mist’s Marvis AI/ML platform has become the new global standard for many fortune 500 companies and is the leader in Gartner’s wired / wireless MQ.
The mission of the Data Science team at Mist is to leverage state-of-art ML and AI technologies to build the next-generation self-driving network solution, which can take actions on behalf of or together with human experts to automatically monitor, detect and remediate common network issues. The team includes a group of experienced and talented data scientists and data science engineers and builds the end-to-end data analytics infrastructure and ML models of the product. The team is very focused on leveraging both ML and deep learning algorithms to solve real customer problems
Juniper’s enterprise business is looking for a Data Science lead to lead the Marvis data science team. This role will be responsible for working with customers and the data science team on delivering ML models into a multitenant cloud SaaS environment. Additionally, this role will need to be able to present the Marvis value proposition at customer, analyst, and industry events.
Educational Requirements
Masters or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Math, or equivalent fields with strong mathematical background
Experience
The ideal candidate for this position needs to have experience in the following areas:
Experience building data science-driven solutions in a cloud SaaS environment including data collection, feature selection, model training, post-deployment validation
Hands-on coding skills (preferably in Python) processing large-scale data set and developing machine learning models
Familiar with machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as Numpy, ScikitLearn, MLlib, Tensorflow, PyTorch
Experience in attracting data science talent and leading a data science team
It is also highly desirable to have experience in one or more of the following areas:
Early stage experience
Networking- WiFi / wireless, switch, route, data center
Required Skills
The candidate needs to have the following skills and a strong understanding in the areas of:
Languages: Python
Cloud Technology: Kafka, Spark
It is also highly desirable to have skills and a strong understanding in one or more of the areas:
Languages: GoLang, Java
Cloud Technology: Storm, Flink, Airflow
Responsibilities
Lead the Marvis data science team
Develop customer-impacting ML features
Collect and analyze system performance data
Evaluate and identify competitive technology
Assist in communicating the company’s technology strategy to customers and partners
Personal Attributes
An entrepreneurial Spirit
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Exceptionally self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.

Maximum Salary:$312,800.00
The pay range for this position is expected to be between $204,000.00 and $312,800.00/year; however, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Title: MIS Director

Descriptions:
The USC Mark and Mary Stevens Neuroimaging and Informatics Institute and Laboratory of Neuro Imaging (INI, www.ini.usc.edu) are world leaders in the development of advanced computational and scientific approaches for the comprehensive mapping of brain structure and function. LONI’s unique multidisciplinary environment and cutting edge resources allow for integration of clinical, psychological and genotypic information with neuroimaging phenotypes for research questions in neurology, psychiatry and developmental neurobiology.
We are currently seeking a Security/IT Director to join our program. This position is primarily responsible for managing information systems and cyber security for a research organization and works closely with the department administrator and director. This position is also responsible for overseeing technical staff and operations involved in research systems analysis and applications programming, systems programming, technical planning, data administration and security, hardware support, documentation, disaster recovery, client services and training, data center operations, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity.
