Title: Director of Information Technology
Description:
Had Enough of “Typical” Tech Jobs?
Drive Innovation and Feed America at a Fast-Growing Agribusiness!.
_Salary offer based on experience and other factors*_.
Descriptions:
Had Enough of “Typical” Tech Jobs? Drive Innovation and Feed America at a Fast-Growing Agribusiness!
APPLY NOW WWW.CORNBREADHUSTLE.COM
$115,000 - $140,000
Salary offer based on experience and other factors
Background-friendly!
Criminal record OK
FREE Lifetime Access to 12-Week Starting Over Program!
About This Job
Many IT jobs keep you chained to a desk. Are you looking for something that will get you out of the office, and keep you at the forefront of a changing industry? Get ready to apply for this opportunity!
As the Director of Information Technology, you will lead a California-based, family-owned agricultural company into the cutting edge of farming and food production. You will develop a Technology Master Plan designed to meet key strategic initiatives. Working closely with executive management, you will optimize networks and existing platforms, while looking for opportunities to embrace emerging technologies. Your goals will be to improve efficiency, reduce costs, enhance customer service, and increase productivity in all aspects of the business.
This is a high-level management position. The Director of IT must develop comprehensive policies and procedures to meet regulatory requirements and the needs of employees, vendors, and customers.
In this role, you will serve as a change agent across many teams within the company, promoting goal alignment, timely completion, and budget feasibility. This company places an emphasis on collaboration and teamwork, so you can expect to work closely with staff and management in all your duties. Attention to details, accuracy, team coordination, and customer service are essential to your success!
Note: this is not a remote job. Ideally, this position will be located on-site at the employer’s headquarters near El Centro, California. However, there may be an opportunity to work from the company’s offices in Salinas, California. You’ll be able to discuss these options with the employer once you get to the later interview stages.
Primary Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and manage network infrastructure, security, and operations of all technology platforms
Develop and maintain a structure and process for strategic decision-making
Oversee periodic review and updates of strategic priorities, and translate into actionable plans
Ensure that system and technology solutions are optimized and in alignment, and updated appropriately with current architectural and security standards
Work collaboratively with all internal teams and external partners to support IT and related initiatives
Develop and ensure adherence to company IT policies
Direct activities of the IT department and its programs
Develop an efficient organizational IT structure
Supervise IT employees: selection / hiring, training, education, correction, performance review, scheduling, growth, and other management initiatives
Assist in budget management
Communicate with individuals to understand user needs
Coordinate analysis of data and consider optimal solutions
Define and propose recommendations for technology improvements
Prepare and approve system configuration policies, standards, and direction
Communicate and collaborate with staff to understand user needs and respond appropriately
Design, procure, and implement advanced products and technologies
Initiate integration of available technologies across business operations
Provide mentoring and training to staff
Other duties as assigned in collaboration with executive management
Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
Outstanding knowledge of computer systems, networks, security, administration, databases, data storage, and telecom
Excellent leadership and decision-making skills
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with all teams
Strong understanding of project management principles
Requirements and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related field of study
At least seven years overall IT experience
At least three years management / supervisory experience in an IT role
Experience in deployment and management of technology systems, including: networks; service desks; telephones; staff supervision; policies and procedures development; change management; data analysis; project management
Strongly preferred: fluency in Spanish
Preferred: experience in multi-site / multi-environment IT management
Preferred: experience with agricultural technology platforms
Work Environment and Demands
This is an on-site job, based either in the Imperial Valley or Monterey Bay areas of California. You will spend time both in an office and outdoors at various large-scale farming operations. Some travel intra-state, out-of-state, and internationally may be required.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.
Benefits
401(k) retirement plan
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Paid time off
Relocation assistance may be available
About the Employer
This is a family-owned group of agricultural companies based in California. It employs workers at farms in six U.S. states and Mexico, and produces nearly a quarter of all salad lettuce consumed every day in America! The company is proud to hire thousands of international guest workers every year at its farms, and is one of the largest such employers in the vegetable and berry industries. It is currently projecting continued double-digit growth and expansion into new regions.
Cornbread Hustle recognizes the value of diversity in every workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at Cornbread Hustle in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship / alienage.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $115,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year
People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply
Work Location: One location

Title: Senior Manager/Director - Building Simulation & Energy Analysis Lead
Description:
Strong quantitative and data analytics skills.
Data analytics skills and experience with R or Python.
TRC Advanced Energy (TRC) is a nationally known energy…
Descriptions:
TRC Advanced Energy (TRC) is a nationally known energy efficiency consultancy. TRC collaborates with clients to develop and implement market transforming programs and initiatives that promote energy efficiency, renewable energy, and green building in multiple market sectors across the US and around the world. These initiatives reduce energy costs, improve the health and safety conditions of buildings, while also helping the environment by reducing greenhouse gas emissions. TRC acts nationally to address some of our country's most challenging problems: global climate change and energy independence.
TRC delivers advanced energy, decarbonization, and resiliency solutions through program management, research, and advisory services across the United States. TRC's Research and Technology Commercialization (RTC) team (within the Advanced Energy practice) is focused on developing and deploying decarbonization and energy efficiency solutions for our clients - utilities, non-profits, local governments, and state and federal agencies. We consult on policy research, building code development, program management, market assessments, technology research, and engineering analysis.
The RTC team is seeking a qualified individual to lead and oversee building simulation and energy analysis used to develop energy codes, decarbonization policy, and support emerging technology market adoption. Candidates must possess deep building simulation technical capabilities and knowledge of building science and building systems. Your role will include hands-on advanced building simulation analysis and oversight of a team of energy simulation analysts. No project is the same, and you'll get exposure to lots of different types of work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment. Projects will include analysis of energy efficiency, grid responsive buildings, decarbonization, distributed energy resources, human factors, and control systems.
An ideal candidate would be a building scientist or engineer with a minimum of 8 years of experience in building simulation analysis (experience can include graduate research using building simulation). The ideal candidate will be assertive, personable, and a self-starter, with the capacity to manage multiple tasks across multiple teams. This position requires the ability to communicate effectively and coordinate with internal technical team members and external customers.
Job Location – California location preferred. Remote positions anywhere in the continental United States will be considered.
Primary Work Area Responsibilities (75%)
This is a technical leadership position responsible for developing and delivering a wide variety of energy simulation studies, supported by a team of energy simulation analysts. This position requires exceptional technical and leadership skills that will be used to establish and maintain standards, support and review work of others, and solve emerging challenges on the fly. This position requires an individual who enjoys and can handle multiple projects covering multiple technical areas and multiple tasks.
This position will contribute to team management related to energy simulation including planning and supporting staff training and procuring and developing specialized simulation software tools.
The position will support a variety of projects including, but not limited to:
California Energy Code Development
Local Jurisdiction Reach/Stretch Code Development
National Model Code Development
Energy Policy Analysis and Advising
Emerging Technologies Research & Tech-to-Market services
Responsibilities include:
Establish and maintain building simulation and analysis framework.
Review simulation and analysis plans for all projects prior to implementation.
Support simulation and analysis team troubleshooting and develop solutions to complex energy simulation challenges.
Conduct final quality control on analysis prior to delivery to client.
Coordinate simulation and analysis staffing needs across projects.
Establish and maintains simulation and analysis training and ongoing education for team of analysts.
Conduct technical analysis in support of developing policy solutions such as building energy codes, local ordinances.
Translate results into actionable recommendations and communicate via written reports and graphically.
Conduct meetings and presentations.
Stay informed about building simulation and energy analysis issues and industry trends through regular technical reading and participation in local and national professional organizations.
Mentoring and Oversight Responsibility (25%)
Responsibilities include:
Review and develop training plan for a team of junior energy simulation analysts.
Mentor growth of junior staff including conducting training as necessary.
Develop QA/QC procedures for TRC's energy simulation and modeling protocols.
Review work of team to ensure quality and accuracy
Requirements:
Requirements
University degree in Engineering, Architecture, Building Science, Physics, or related discipline.
Minimum of six (6) years' experience in building simulation analysis (experience can include graduate research using building simulation). More experience is preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of building science and building systems, including envelope, HVAC, DHW, and control systems.
Demonstrated participation in industry organizations and actives related to building simulation and energy analysis such as IBPSA.
Deep understanding of the fundamentals of building simulation engines and underlying algorithms
Expert level skill with at least one simulation engine.
Demonstrated expertise with Energy Plus simulation engine.
Familiar with energy codes, (CA Title 24, ASHRAE 90.1, ICC, etc.)
Strong quantitative and data analytics skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects, set priorities, meet deadlines, work both independently and collaboratively, and communicate effectively.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong track record working with clients to communicate research methods and findings.
Desired Skills and Experience
Advanced degree in Engineering, Architecture, or Building Science.
Experience with multiple building simulation engines, user interfaces, and other third-party tools for optimization and parametric analysis.
Experience with large scale parametric building simulation.
Experience independently developing research plans and executing research related to building energy use, particularly using building energy simulation.
Authored published papers or articles, or presented conferences, on topics of building energy simulation.
Data analytics skills and experience with R or Python.
Experience with California compliance tools, CBECC-COM CBECC-RES
Experience with co-simulation
Experience with code development
Practical building industry experience, such as design engineering, product development, construction, or energy consulting.
Professional engineering license
Benefits
In accordance with local law, the following compensation range is applicable for the job and location associated with this requisition: $120,000 - $160,000. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, and other compensable factors.
Benefits: TRC offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:
Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
7 Paid Holidays per year, 1 Floating Holiday, and 15 Days Paid Time Off (PTO)
401(k) plan and contributions
Long-term/Short-term Disability
California location preferred. Remote positions anywhere in the continental United States will be considered.
TRC is an equal opportunity employer: disability/veteran. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Software Director
Description: Quadric is building a full-stack system that is designed to meet the requirements of next-generation edge & edge-cloud computing products.
Descriptions:
Quadric is building a full-stack system that is designed to meet the requirements of next-generation edge & edge-cloud computing products. In order to leverage the tsunami of data generated at the Edge, the next generation of computing innovation is happening outside the data center. Quadric has created a solution that is specifically optimized not only for Artificial Intelligence (AI) workloads, but also for Image Processing, Data Analytics, and more.
If making an impact and having a seat at the table is important to you, this is the opportunity for you. Join our small, rapidly-growing team at Quadric to develop supercomputer technology designed for the Edge. In this position, you will be a core member of our team, and will have an opportunity to grow in the company of expert technologists who also happen to be good people you’ll want to spend time with.

What We Value:
Integrity, Humility, Happiness

What We Expect:
Initiative, Collaboration, Completion
Role:
As a leader of our platform software engineering team, you will manage development of SDK front end APIs, and their use in NN libraries and hardware verification tests. You will collaborate with other teams to co-optimize across the hardware-software stack. As a key member of the product leadership team, you will contribute to planning and implementation of product roadmaps.
Responsibilities:
Own and deliver Quadric SDK per customer requirements.
Create development plans based on resource and schedule constraints
Drive implementation to ensure execution to plan
Keep broader team informed about execution progress
Deploy processes for SW development and validation that enable quality deliverables.
Contribute to the development of cutting edge deep neural networks, computer vision and DSP algorithms using Quadric’s technology
Collaborate with Scheduler, Compiler and Hardware teams to build best-in-class quadric ecosystem
Requirements
MS or Ph.D. in Electrical or Computer Science/Engineering with a minimum of ten years of experience in the industry
Demonstrated experience in successfully leading teams to deliver production SDKs
Proficiency in C++ >= 11
Background in NN frameworks such as Tensorflow, Caffe, etc.
Knowledge of both classical Computer Vision and Neural Network algorithms
Knowledge of end-to-end toolchain, including compilers, linkers & debuggers
Experience with programming in openCV and/or OpenCL/CUDA highly desirable
Benefits
Provide competitive salaries and meaningful equity
Provide a politics free community for the brilliant minds who want to make an immediate impact
Provide an opportunity for you to build long term career relationships
Foster an environment that allows for lasting personal relationships alongside professional one
